There's a Hillsong Young & Free vibe, with the opening lyrics "There's a song that cannot be contained, / There's a shout that breaks through every chain, / God, we won't be silent!" I really like the call to worship and find myself frequently singing the catchy chorus: "We lift our voices, lift our voices, make your praise so glorious, so glorious, we'll never stop singing." The song has a great melody, and I would love to sing it "louder" with fellow believers.Matt's update of the hymn "It is Well With My Soul" takes listeners on an emotional and spiritual journey. The Horatio Spafford-penned chorus is very stirring and convicting. Like Matt's classic song "Blessed Be Your Name," the hymn "It is Well with My Soul" is a reminder that our worship of God should not be based on our circumstances, but based on who God is. Commit your life to Jesus and offer Him your heart and your life as you sing along with this great song.I'm really engaged by the emotional vocals and the deep, prayerful lyrics throughout the album. "Unbroken Praise be Yours God forever, take this life, let it become Your home, unbroken praise be Yours" are the biblical cries of worship in the heartfelt and soul-stirring title track "Unbroken Praise.""Abide with Me" was co-written with Matt Maher and also appears on Saints and Sinners. The song is a powerful ballad, and I love the emotion and biblical truth that Matt brings to the song. The song features Redman's soothing vocals as he prayerfully sings "Abide with me, abide with me, don't let me fall, and don't let go, walk with me, and never leave, ever close God abide with me."I find myself singing along loudly with Matt in "King of My Soul" when he cries out "Forever You are seated on the Throne, / Forever You are good above it all, / King of My Soul." The song builds to an emotional crescendo in the bridge: "this will be our joyful surrender, this will be our anthem forever!" That's a wonderful truth that all followers of Jesus can adopt as their anthem of faith.Many of the songs are arranged in a very sing-able and catchy style, such as "No One like Our God," which is filled with great statements of faith proclaiming Him as the Lord of our lives: "There is no One like our God, never has there been, / never will there be a greater hope than this, there is no One like our God.""The Awesome God You Are" is yet another great song for the Church which I hope I'll be singing with fellow believers. The song has a great worshipful chorus with Redman singing "God let hope arise, and faith become the fortress of my heart, / I will lift my eyes, and see You as the awesome God You are, / Believe You as the awesome God You are, / King Jesus as the awesome God You are."Closing Thoughts (Staff Review, NewReleaseToday.com):The idea of an entire album filled with songs declaring our unbroken praise is a devotional challenge. What's especially cool about this new album is how every song is true to that biblical concept. These great new worship songs really set me in the proper mindset to praise God for loving me so much that He gave His life away for all that was lost. I really enjoy the exciting musical vibe of this album, and the melodies and lyrics on Unbroken Praise are all catchy and biblical, reflecting unashamed faith in Jesus. Don't miss out on this incredible worship album, one of the best of the year for sure.These are very passionate worship songs. There are several instantly sing-able and worshipful arrangements that you'll want to add to your Sunday morning set-list. I especially recommend "Louder," "It is Well with My Soul," "Unbroken Praise," "Abide with Me," "King of My Soul," "No One like Our God," "No Longer I," "Majesty of the Most High" and one of my top worship songs of the year, "The Awesome God You Are." Unbroken Praise is a must-have for your praise and worship collection. This is a truly fresh and catchy set of excellent songs for the Church, a foretaste of our eternal unbroken praise for followers of Jesus.

Update 11/4/2015Now these shoes are completely falling apart versus a month ago when they were just starting to fall apart. I attached some photos. Too bad because they are comfy.---------------------------------Update 9/29/15So, after TWO MONTHS they are falling apart1) the shoe is separating from the sole on both feet2) the suede looking strip around the shoe is rubbing offSo, in a nutshell these shoes are falling apart after two months. They were comfy. I had high hopes, but two months of NYC walking and they are almost done for. Contrast that to my sketchers Shape Up mary janes that looked like these shoes, but lasted for over 2 years of NYC walking. I am back to Skechers and Merrells. I cant deal with shoes that fall apart even if they are less expensive!!-------------------------------------------------------------------Original ReviewThese shoes are comfortable. No, you won't look like a fashion model in them. But, if comfort is your number one priority, these are a decently cute way to achieve that. I bought two pairs, the tan color and the grey.1) The look- they remind me of my old skechers shape up Mary Janes that I loved but that skechers discontinued. And if you know that shoe, these are very similar. They are a bit of a big, clunky looking shoe. There is no way around it. That said, I do still think they are cute. The Mary Jane style makes them fun looking and cute. They can go with jeans, khaki short and a blouse, etc. They are the type of shoe you could wear with a workout outfit or with a summer day outfit of khakis and a blouse, or jeans and a cute top.2) The fit- very true to size. They are not narrow, maybe run slightly wide. I am between a 9.5 and 10 and the 10 fit me perfectly. I ordered two pairs one in wide and one regular width. My foot leans toward the wider side but I usually just order medium width. Since these shoes are a bit wide I would have been fine with the medium width. Though the wide was not sloppy and I actually kept both pairs. The strap adjusts nicely for a secure fit. My foot was hugged nicely by the shoe and didn't slide around.3) The comfort - very comfortable. I could wear it for hours right out of the box on the first wear with no blisters at the end of the day. That is saying a lot for a new shoe. I had knee surgery so this comfortable shoe is already a go to shoe. I walk in NYC for hours most days and this shoe has been perfect. It is supportive and comfy.4) The colors- I bought grey and tan and like both. You can see the two colors in the attached photos.

Horshoe Hill Station is an awesome set! It comes with instructions on building different structures. My kids are 3.5 and 5 and they picked it up pretty quickly after I showed them how to build a house like structure. It comes with a cowboy and horse figure and my kids like sending them into and through their structures. The quality is great and the logs are real wood. If you loved Lincoln Logs as a kid like I did, take the plunge and buy them for your kids, you won't be disappointed!

This set is really cool. My kids like building different configurations with it. The pieces are real wood and the included figure is great. My kids are ages 3.5 and 5 and they enjoy playing with it together. I showed them how to build the houses the first time and now they can do it on their own. I enjoyed Lincoln Logs as a kid and it is great to see them be a hit for my own kids, as well!

This set is a really good quality. We like that it has pink doors and purple roof pieces which appeals to my daughter, but my son really likes playing with it too. My kids are of the preschool and kindergarten age and the set is perfect for them. My five year old can pretty quickly build great houses and structures after I showed him how to do it once. My three year old needs a bit of assistance from the five year old, but she loves putting the pieces together and especially loves constructing the roof.The little figure can be a man or a woman (the dress snaps off. The figure holds an umbrella and it is hard to keep the removable umbrella in the figure's hands when it is played with. My kids don't seem to car though. There is also a cute horse that comes with it. The figure can only go on the horse with the plastic skirt taken off.The logs are real wood and sturdy. I played with Lincoln Logs as a child and it is awesome to see my own kids play with them, too. The little figures included are fun for my kids to play with, as well.

So, I got this pillow to replace a few other toddler pillows I got for my kids. The other pillows were too tightly filled, with little give and had a slightly chemical smell to them. I had none of those problems with this pillow.1) Its organic- it is filled with a clustered fiber that non gmo, no insecticides used on the cotton etc. I figured that this is important since my kid's faces will be sleeping against this pillow every night.2) No chemical smell - the pillow smells fresh and not like it is treated with chemicals.3) It is very comfortable- this pillow gives enough to be comfortable for my kids yet still provides neck support. They have had no problems sleeping on it and easily transitioned to using it once we received the pillow.4) Well made- it has a 200 thread count and the stitching is sturdy and secure.5) It is made in the USA- it is nice to know that American quality control standards are in place during its manufacture.All in all, it is a great toddler pillow and I recommend it!

I had an old twin turbo that lasted 6 years until I accidentally got it wet (my fault). But then I bought this one and it broke after one year. All of the sudden I turned it on and I heard a pop, smelled some smoke and it died.DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!! This dryer is way too expensive to break after a year. And I did not use it but twice a week. It did not get daily use. Now I have to spend hundreds on another high powered dryer. Not happy!!

I have used this product all school year (going on nine months). Every day I pull my daughters hair back into several pony tails and I spray this Prevent spray on my daughter's head (the base of her hairlines especially). There was one incidence of lice in her small preschool class of 10 kids but my daughter did not get lice. So, I can say it worked through one lice outbreak in a small class of three year olds that put their heads together.The smell is very light and not overwhelming. It also dries on without leaving any sticky, flaky, or other residue. All it leaves is the scent. I highly recommend it!

My dino fanatic son was thrilled with this dino tooth collection. There are six teeth of various sizes and inside the box it shoes which teeth belong to which species of dino. The teeth are all painted in good detail and they are solid plastic. My five year old son loves carrying them around and discussing what their diets were (carnivore, omnivore or herbivore). He has so many dino figures that just having replicas of the teeth is an exciting addition to his dino collection.The top row of teeth is Albertosaurus, Triceratops, SpinosaurusThe bottom row of teeth is T-Rex, Tarbosaurus, CarcharodontosaurusKeep the box for easy reference of the teeth or there is a reference sheet inside of the box also.I included pics because it is hard to see the names of the dinosaurs that go with the teeth on the manufacturer's pictures.The pics I included:1) the black background pic is the inside of the box2) the orange background pic is the back of the box3) the green background pic is a photo of the actual teeth

My three year old was THRILLED to get this Peppa. It is the perfect size for her and the face is really cute. It is made of hard plastic. There are plush versions of Peppa on amazon but my daughter likes plastic versions for pretend play, so this is perfect.I gave it four stars only because Peppa's outfit is a bit tricky to put on. Even my five year old asked for help to put it on. But after a few times he got it on by himself, though my 3 year old continues to need help with putting it on.1) the opening for the arms in the rain jacket is small so you sort of have to angle Peppa's fingers into the arm holes to get the jacket on.2) the hat sits on Peppa's ears but falls off when the kids play with it.3) the boots have to be pulled on at a certain angle that is too tricky for my three year old. My five year old can almost get the boots on but Peppa's legs swing back and forth when he tries to get the boots on making it difficult.All of that said, would I buy this Peppa doll again? YES! There is not much for Peppa on the market in terms of plastic figurines and this doll is nice because it isn't a miniature size. So my daughter enjoys carrying it around. I wish the other characters came in this size. All in all, it is a very cute doll!

Update 7/2015 regarding durability of design on frontI probably have 10 of these Funtainers in all different designs (frozen, hello kitty, spiderman, batman, etc etc). I send them with the kids to school often and have used them for 8 months. I haven not had one design scratch off or peel. I use hot soapy water to hand wash them. I do only use them as water bottles so I am not constantly washing them. But they have been washed repeatedly and the designs on mine still look great with no scratches or peeling. These are still the only water bottles we use for my 3 and 5 year old that don't leak and that the kids can easily close. All the kids in our neighborhood love these bottles and use them!-------------------------------------------------------------------------Original reviewThis cup is perfect! So, last summer I sent my three and four year old to camp and I needed to send them with a reusable water bottle. I tried regular water bottles with a screw on lid but my kids couldn't get it on right and threw the water bottle in their camp bag still open. Water soaked EVERYTHING! I couldn't send the kids with a sippy cup because they were beyond that. Every other thermos or portable cup I tried, my preschoolers either couldn't open it by themselves or they couldn't figure out how to close it so there was a water leaking mess.This cup solved all of those problems!! It is so easy. The kids push the button to open it. They drink from the flexible straw spout and then just press the lid closed. A two year old could do it. Finally, I had a portable thermos I could send them to camp or school with that did not leak from not being closed properly.We use this cup all of the time. And I have bought tons of these cups now with different characters on them. The quality is great. I hand wash and have had no problem with the outside graphics peeling off. I have these sticky name labels that are water proof from a company called Mabels Labels that I use to identify my children's funtainers because now all of the kids at their school have them.They are perfect for little kids past the sippy cup age that need an easy to open and close thermos for school. Though they are also great for older kids too. Highly recommend!I am attaching photos so you can see how the cup looks on the inside as the photos I see for the product only show the outside. There are easy to clean parts.

Dr. Scholl's did not let me down as these are very comfortable shoes. Usually, when I put on any new shoes for the first time something on the inside of the shoe will slightly bother me. But, not with this shoe. Everything felt great from the first time I put them on. I am a size 9.5 to 10 with average width feet. I got the 9.5 and they fit like a glove. So, they run exactly true to size.The inside has a super comfy, blanket like lining that feels like a dream. The only reason I am not giving them five stars is because my heel feels very slightly loose in them when I walk. Since these shoes don't have an adjustable strap I think it's just the elastic strap has a little bit of give when I walk. It is only a bit of give and I can walk comfortably in them. I am obsessed with comfortable Mary Jane style shoes and I can say I do prefer an adjustable strap to get the ultimate comfort and secure feeling. I walk all day in NYC carrying a baby so I need comfort and a securely fitting shoe. Anyhow, the heel is only a tiny bit loose so I am going to keep these shoes. They are perfect for slipping on quickly to run outside and the comfort can't be beat. I am attaching some pics of them.

I really enjoyed seeing this movie. This book tells the story simply, to the point and the pictures are very captivating. The book is great if your child loved the movie and wants to talk about the movie and the story. When I read this to my kids, they talk about each scene and what Cinderella does in her journey for true love and courage. Here are some photos of the pages. Highly recommend!

I have a lot of skechers shoes and these are so comfortable and did not disappoint! The cushy insoles make walking in them all day so comfy. I usually wear between and 9.5 and a 10 in shoes. I got these in a 9.5 and at first I thought they were way too small. I had to really pull them on me the first time, and initially I assumed I had to return them for a size 10. But once I put them on, they fit like a glove and the 9.5 was perfect.If you go between two half sizes just keep in mind that they may be slightly snug in the lower size. If you like to slip on a shoe very easily then go for the half size larger. Obviously, this is only if you fit between two half sizes (ie 9.5 and 10).  You do NOT need to size up a full size on this shoe. It does run true to size. I was just giving info for people who debate between two half sizes.There is not much more I can say about these shoes except to say that they keep my feet happy all day. They do look a bit clunky. Obviously, this is more of a no frills functional shoe. If you want a more feminine shoe, check out some of skechers other go walk shoes that have splashes of other color. But if you want comfort and simplicity, then I highly recommend this shoe!

These are adorable slippers. Here you can see them on with Cinderella's wedding dress. The detailing on the butterfly that is on the front of the shoe is really pretty and it is affixed on there securely. My daughter's feet did bother her a bit the first time she wore them so I just put tights on her the next time and they didn't bother her at all. She does have narrow/petite feet and they were big on her but I ordered up a size.And we love that they light up. They really do look like glass slippers.
Beautiful! Here you can see it on with Cinderella's wedding dress. It is so pretty and the perfect accessory for any of Cinderella's dresses. Here it is on a four year old. I love it!

Final Update-I have had to update this review now for the third time! When I reviewed this product, the picture the seller included was stolen from Disney's official Cinderella dress. The seller here used that exact picture and the title said they were selling the Cinderella live action dress. I had the official, beautiful Cinderella dress made from Disney so I made a review of it and included a picture so people could see how beautiful the official disney Cinderella dress is. However, I later saw from other reviews that the dress sent to customers was not the official disney Cinderella dress but a cheap knockoff probably from China. However, the seller kept the photos of the official Disney Cinderella dress up with the product, confusing customers. I guess enough people complained about false advertising because  finally the seller has pictures of the knockoff dress they are selling. In my opinion the photos of this knockoff dress look nothing like the official Disney Cinderella wedding dress. Do yourself a favor and buy the real official Disney Cinderella wedding dress because it is so beautiful and well made. You can find it on the Disney store website.Update- review changed to one starThe first two pictures posted for this product are from the actual Disney Cinderella wedding dress, which is shown in the picture I included. When I reviewed the item this only picture for the product was of the Cinderella Disney store dress so I wanted to show how beautiful it is. We have that Disney store dress and love the quality as you can see in my photo. However, I just checked this review today and saw the seller put other pictures of a knock off dress up. This knockoff dress is not the same as the first two pictures the seller has up which are of the official Disney store dress (which you see in my photo). So, I am changing my review to one star. Go to the Disney store to get the real dress.----------------Original Review 5 stars (for the product I thought was the official Disney Cinderella dress)------------------------------------------------This dress is super pretty in person. I don't even think the photos do it justice!! It looks well made and expensive. The details on the bottom of the dress are really pretty and the shimmery arms and top of the bodice makes it look really elegant. Here it is on a four year old that wears 5T top and the 5/6 fit perfectly. She has received a lot of compliments on it! She is also wearing the cute Cinderella butterfly slippers that you can also find on amazon (note that the necklace doesn't come with the dress though). Overall, it is darling and great for little fans that are in love with the new Cinderella movie!

This is a nice adjustable strap sandal that is comfortable and can be worn all day. I like it because my daughter can run and jump in these sandals and they have good support. The sole also has good traction and she doesn't slip around in water puddles in these shoes. Also, they are made of a comfortable material that doesn't give her blisters or discomfort. Five stars for being affordable, comfortable and sturdy sandals!

These shoes are comfy and easy to slip on. These shoes are perfect for when you are on the go and need to throw on a pair of shoes to let the dog out or take out the trash, etc, and you don't want to take the time to deal with adjusting velcro straps or tying laces. They are also good for putting on if you only have one hand free, which is helpful if you are holding a baby or something else. The straps are elastic so you can just slide your foot right in. Though elastic, the straps are not uncomfortable yet they securely hold my foot in the shoe.The shoe is also sturdy. It has a good traction to it so you don't slip around. The sole is as good with traction as any sneaker. The chocolate color is very attractive and doesn't show dirt, which is a bonus since I am always chasing the kids and dog around at parks etc. It is also quite cushy inside and I could walk around all day in these shoes.The fit is great - the shoe runs true to size and is roomy enough in the toe box and not too narrow. Great shoe!

I have had three kids and I can say that this stuff works miracles to prevent and treat diaper rash. I have tried other stuff (butt paste, aquafor, triple paste etc) and nothing works like desitin in the purple box. I use it if I notice even slight redness when I change my baby's diaper and by the next diaper change the redness is usually gone (this is when redness is very light/just beginning).My kids have very rarely had a diaper rash but when they do I do lots of warm soaks in the bath, pat and air dry, and then slather this stuff on before I diaper them and it has almost always taken care of the rash (except for once when my daughter had a yeasty type rash that needed a prescription). But for use for three kids, this has worked all but once. I highly recommend it!

We just saw the premier of the Cinderella movie the other day and my kids loved it, so of course, this doll of Cinderella in the wedding dress was a must have. The one thing that impressed me the most was that the doll's face really does look a lot like the actress in the Cinderella movie. So many of the Disney dolls have futuristic looking faces.Beyond the doll's beautiful face and expression, her dress stunning and is intricately designed in a beautiful ivory. The detailing on the bottom and top of dress is also gorgeous, as is her blonde hair in the updo and her delicate veil. I even like how the doll's hands and arms are positioned. The Cinderella doll is simply captivating and a must have for any young fan of the new Cinderella movie!My only complaint is the packaging of the doll. She is attached to a plastic backing with many plastic ties on the back of her head and it is really hard to cut them off because they are so tight to the plastic backing (little room between the ties and the plastic to fit scissors). Plus, while doing this you don't want to mess up her updo hairstyle. Also, attached under her dress is tissue paper that has plastic ties that you have to cut off from inside the dress. They use it to make the dress seem to puff out in the package. The ties leave tiny holes in the dress. They aren't that noticeable but still annoying to have her pretty dress punctured by little holes. I attached pictures so you could see.However, even though the packaging isn't ideal she is still a beautiful doll and her intricate details make her a joy to have!

Ugh! This pistachio blend was horrible. I took a handful and ate it and could not believe how bland and stale it tasted. It just tasted really expired and old. I checked the sell by date and it is 8 months away (bought in Feb 2015 and expires Oct 2015). Then I checked to see if this was an extra dry roasted variety and it is not.It tastes like cocktails nuts left out in a dish on a bar for weeks on end, i.e., dry, and old. Even the pistachios are flavorless. I have been eating pistachios all of my life and I have never tasted one this bad that wasn't rotten. I am considering calling the company about it. If you look at the photo I provided you can see how old looking the pistachios look. They really are an off color (they are the three nuts in the middle of the cashew and peanut pile). And, again, the other nuts tasted and look just as old as the pistachios. In other words, avoid, avoid, avoid!

Great wipes for freshening up. You don't need the Cottonelle dispenser because if you have any spare baby wipes dispenser, it will work (these wipes will fit in there. They are a bit smaller than standard sized baby wipes but still work if you buy a cheap Huggies box of wipes with a plastic container and just use that dispenser for the Cottonelle wipes).My big word of warning is that if you use these a lot they can clog the toilet if you have a finicky septic system. I use them sparingly and have not had a problem. My sister in law has a more finicky septic system and she used these wipes nonstop for all of her "wiping needs" (for lack of a better term) and clogged up her system and had to call a plumber, who said she had a pile of wipes caught in there that weren't dissolved and caused the problem.Overall, they have worked fine for my needs. No itching or other problems from using them. I used to use baby wipes and toss them in the trash so it is nice to have a flushable option.

We used this for my son's dino party. It is sturdy and good quality and the graphic is bright and clear. You can't see the whole cup from the vendor photo so I attached a photo of the other side of the cup. Basically it is like the dino is holding the cup. So, on one side you see the three dino fingers/claw and on the other side it looks like a dino thumb (for lack of a better word). So, when twisting the cup its as if you see the din's entire claw wrapped around the cup. It is pretty awesome and the boys (age 5) loved it.

First, make sure you look closely and realize that you are getting tiny tins of play doh with this set. I looked quickly when buying and thought it came with full sized play dohs. In the picture I provide you can see the size of the small container v. the big regular sized play dough containers. This set only has the small containers which are half (or less than half of the size of the normal sized play doh containers). I didn't even know play doh made such small containers of play doh before getting this set. So, the photo is for size comparison of how small these containers are v. the standard sized containers. You can also see the letters.Secondly, my kids (3 and 5) have a hard time getting the letters out of the molds. If they are lucky, they get half the letter out. Usually, I have to help them with each letter to get it out which is hard because I have an infant and no free hands to constantly pull letters out of molds. Also, often I end up ripping the letters when getting the play doh out of the mold even when I am trying to be careful.I did give it two stars because my kids still like to play with the letters, tell me the sounds they make, and try to get the play doh out of the letter molds. I think if the letter molds were bigger it would be easier for the kids to get out. I would probably not recommend it.

So, I have a lot of skechers shoes and I love the fit. I also usually get a Mary Jane style. I get them because I need extra comfy shoes for walking around NYC. I also carry my baby in a carrier on me, so I need shoes that are completely supportive. At first when I tried these shoes on and stood up they were so comfortable. The memory foam feels amazing, they run true to size and just felt great.Then...I started walking around in them. My heel kept slipping up when I walked. I tried tightening the strap as far as it would go, but still, my heel slipped up in them. The rest of my foot was secure but my heel was loose and slack. Now, I have a foot a bit on the wider side, so the slack heel is not due to having narrow feet. Plus, I know how skechers usually fit me, especially mary jane skechers, which are one of my go to shoes, and I have never had this problem. I think the issue is on the placement of the strap. If it was a little higher up on my foot or a little thicker, maybe that would have helped.Anyway, I am so disappointed. These shoes are perfect otherwise. They are a mesh, breathable style, which would be perfect for the summer. Since they have free returns they are worth trying on. Maybe they would work for your foot? But for me, the issue was not discomfort and the size was correct, it was just being slack in the heel that made me decide to return them. I attached a photo so you can see how they fit on me and so you can see how the mesh type of shoe looks when worn.

This is a great on the go powder formula dispenser. It has three compartments and I measure out the amount of formula that I need for each feed (so I fill each compartment with pre measured formula). Right now I only do three scoops of formula per compartment for a six ounce feed and there is plenty of room (I think each compartment holds 9 oz of formula). When I am ready to do a feed I just open the lid over a compartment with formula in it and dump it into the bottle. The lid can be moved around (twisted) so that the part with the hole on the top can be moved from compartment to compartment.I have had no problems with leaks even though I throw it in my diaper bag. If you want to be extra cautious you could put the container in a large ziplock baggie, but there is probably no need as the lid clicks on securely. When I want to wash it I just throw it in the dishwasher. It is perfect for on the go. I also take a bottle of bottled water with me, the bottles and nipples in my diaper bag and I am ready to feed my baby anywhere with this product.

We used these for a dino party and the kids fought over who got to take them home. We had no problems with leaks and they stayed inflated for several days. They look really awesome and big blown up. The graphic looks amazing and the quality is good. I would definitely buy them again!

I am a fan of John Frieda products, especially their Frizz Ease line. So, I was excited to try this product because my hair does best if I air dry my curly/wavy hair (blowdrying can make it frizz out badly, unless I decide to straighten it). Anyhow, this product worked well. To compare, I air dried my hair without this product a few days before trying the product. Without the Dream Curls product my hair air dried in uneven, sort of frizzy waves/curls. It also felt dry.When I used the Dream curls on my hair, after air drying it a few days later, it really produced a much better result. My hair looked smoother and not frizzy. The waves/curls laid well and yet I still had good movement with my hair (i.e., it did not clump together like it does with some other conditioning/taming products). The product did enhance my waves/curls and my hair did not feel as dry as it does when I air dry it without this product. I would buy it again.

Normally I would not rate a product by its packaging. But I wanted to put the review here so people don't bother ordering it. All of the cans arrived dented and unusable. Since the top of the can is pull top, the dented cans mean that the seal could have been ever so slightly broken and the food unsafe for consumption. I could not believe that every can had a dent! I waited for the order in my monthly subscription and planned a meal around it that I cannot make.Read the other 1 star reviews and most of them surround all of the dented cans. Do yourself a favor and do not bother ordering these dented cans!

These cheese itz have an extra layer of flavor which makes them more cheddar jack. You know how the original cheez it is feels dry when you touch it? Well, it's as it you dipped this cracker in a seasoning. So, your fingers have this coating of the seasoning on it and you do need to wash your hands after eating it, just like you would after eating Cheetos. And the flavor is more intense. My toddlers like the regular cheese itz that have more of a mild flavor. This cheddar jack flavor is more suited to an adult or older kid. Some younger kids may gobble them up but if you have little kids who are used to more mild tasting things, they may not like them.Personally, I find them irresistible. The coating of seasoning on them gives me just the right amount of kick that makes me want to devour the whole bag and before I know it its gone and I have consumed like 800 plus calories. So watch out for that. They are addictive.

Works exactly the same as the remote that came with my blu ray and it looks identical to it. I got it because we lost the original remote. I literally popped two batteries in it and it worked perfectly with my panasonic blu ray. I am sure I will be buying more knowing our tendency to lose remote controls.Shipping was fast.

The quality is pretty good. It is pretty cute and we used it for fourth of july. The headband fits an adult and even fit my toddler's small heads. The letters do bounce around with the coils, which they are supposed to do. The challenge was keeping the letters somewhat straight. The letters had a tendency to go askew, and sometimes the "S" letter would go behind the "A" letter, etc. So, I was readjusting them occasionally. Still, it was only a minor inconvenience and these headbands were fun. We got some nice pictures wearing them and people complimented us on the headbands.

I really like this swing. I like that it can rock the baby from side to side or from head to toe, depending on the baby's preference. The seat also has a recline option. My old fisher price swing ran on batteries, so it is great that this swing has a plug in option.The baby also really likes looking up at the mirror. The nature sounds are soothing and there are a lot of different nature sound options to choose from.  I really like that it has secure 5 point straps to make sure the baby doesn't slip out of the swing. In 2010, I had a fisher price swing with just a lap belt and my son almost completely fell out of the side of it. So, I am glad that this swing, has a secure body harness so I don't have to worry about that.The swing can fold up for storage and the swing fabric is machine washable and easy to remove, wash and replace.The swing also looks really cute with the puppy design and I have received compliments on it. It is perfect when wanting to lull the baby to sleep and the speeds are relaxing and not too fast. I would recommend it.

You will gobble it up like a monster. You will try to have one bowl, and you will have three. Limit the amount you buy because you won't be able to stop yourself from having, yet, another bowl.It tastes like cinnamon toast only ten times more sweeter. Like you took regular cinnamon toast and dipped it in a vat of sugar. It is so good. I buy a box occasionally because I can't help myself. If I bought it all the time, I would be rolling myself to fat camp each summer. You have been warned. Now enjoy!

I love coke zero. It doesn't have the slightly chemical taste of Diet Coke. Instead, it tastes like a close alternative to regular coke. It has a smoother and sweeter taste than diet coke. It doesn't taste as sweet as regular Coke, but it comes pretty close.Now, for the Diet Coke fans, don't think I am hating on Diet Coke. I actually love the taste of Diet Coke too. It has a distinctive taste that I am hooked on. Whether I choose Diet Coke or Coke Zero just depends on what I am craving because the two tastes are very distinctive.So, f you are looking for the closest taste you can get to regular coke then choose Coke Zero. If you like the traditional taste of diet sodas then go with Diet Coke. Both are good.

I am a Sketchers Go Walk fan. I have worn the first pair that I got about a year ago so often that they look a bit beat up. But they still fit well and actually don't look that bad considering all of the wear and tear that I have put on them (Manhattan city streets).But, I decided to add this pair of Go Walks to my collection. They are wonderful. They are so light, and when they go on, they feel like a slipper. They run true to size and they hug your foot. But they are not uncomfortable. I have tried some other slip on shoes that are either to loose so my foot slides around or are so tight that the material cuts into the top of my foot. That is not the case here. These shoes are formfitting and secure, which allows you to walk comfortably with no foot sliding, whatsoever.Also, since they are lightweight, you feel almost like you aren't wearing shoes at all. Also, the sole has good traction, the shoes have good flex and they breathe well, even in the summer. I had knee surgery, so I can only wear supportive shoes. I have several pairs of Merrells that I love, but they can be a bit heavy and bulky. With these Sketchers I can walk for miles, and have no knee pain, which is amazing to me seeing as this is a lightweight slip on shoe.Finally, these shoes, slip on your foot very easily. Nothing is worse to me than a slip on that you have to spend 5 minutes cramming your foot into in order to wear it. Nope, instead, these Go Walks slip on quickly like a dream. I love them and see many more pairs in my future!

Huggies are our go to swim diaper. They basically prevent poop accidents in a pool by containing it in the diaper. They don't absorb pee so you have to put them on right before you get in the water or else pee will run down your child's legs if they are standing around in a dry swim diaper for awhile. My other advice is to change your child right away if they do poop because though the diaper contains it, it can leak if poop is left in there too long.Also, they say 32lb + but fit my 37 lb 2.5 year old fine. They have elastic waist and elastic leg holes so they stretch to fit. Beyond that, the characters on these pants (Winne the Pooh) are cute too.

I was dubious that a toy like Sophie the Giraffe that cost around $20 would be worth it but I because so many people raved about it, I tried it. And of course, it became my daughter's go to teether. She loved the sweet face, squeezing the squeaky body and gnawing on Sophie's legs and nose. It really seemed to ease her teething discomfort.So, when looking for a gift for my friend's baby I was so excited to see a new version of this teether. I watch my friends baby a few times a week and she absolutely loves her Fanfan the Fawn. She loves to squeeze it and chew on its soft body. It is one of her favorite things to hold. I am pregnant now and plan to also buy Fanfan for my next child.My only recommendation is to buy a leash for Fanfan. You can find them on websites like Etsy. My daughter used to love to throw her Sophie teether out of the stroller and at $20 a pop, replacing it got costly. So, I went on Etsy and bought a Sophie the Giraffe leash to tether it to my daughter's shirt. After that, we didn't lose anymore teethers and I am sure that a leash will also work for Fanfan (it loops around its neck).Anyhow, even though the price is steep for a teether, you won't be disappointed. Your baby will love Fanfan.

This book was so disappointing. I loved the first two Bridget Jones books, especially her romance with Mark Darcy. If you were looking for that in this book, you can forget it. The description states that she is dealing with "loss and single motherhood". So, it should not be a spoiler that Mark is not involved in the story. Instead, Bridget is middle aged, boy crazy and obsessed with Twitter.The book is silly and ridiculous, which are the things I loved the most about Bridget in the other two books. But, in the other two books Bridget also had profoundly deep moments, and her love affair with Mark was so real, raw, and captivating. I found none of that here. Her interactions with the guys she is interested in seem superficial and completely lacking substance. Her children and her past relationship with Mark seem like an afterthought.I gave it two stars because you will still find the silly Bridget in this book. I think readers who haven't read the other two books may enjoy this book more because they won't be so disappointed at how Mark's absence was dealt with, since they would not be attached to his character. What I wish, was that this book focused on Bridget's newlywed life with Mark and how they came to have their kids. Bridget bumbling around as a newlywed and first time mom, peppered with romance with Mark, would have been so fun.Instead, I felt that the idea of jumping from a young Bridget who is starting a new life married to Mark (in the last book) to a middle aged woman after younger men (in this book), was just flat out disappointing. And that is how this book left me...feeling disappointed and wanting more closure regarding Bridget's life with Mark.

First, I should mention that I love pumpkin pancakes. I have bought many pumpkin pancake brands looking for the perfect pumpkin pancake. If a pumpkin flavor is what you are after, then pass on this pancake. But, if you can do without much pumpkin flavor and just want a good tasting pancake then buy this mix.It really does have a pleasing taste. It tastes like a pancake with just the right hint of chocolate from the chocolate chips. The chocolate flavor is complimentary and does not overwhelm the pancake, which I like. To make it, you just add an egg and some melted butter.I would purchase them again if I wanted more chocolate chip pancakes, but if I crave pumpkin pancakes I would try another brand. Sometimes we add a can of pumpkin to our pumpkin pancakes, but I have not tried that with this mix yet. That could help the flavor be more pumpkin like.

My two year old has this shoe and normally wears about a size 9, and the size 9 in these water sandals fit true to size. The soles prevent her from slipping, even though she runs around in the sprinkler parks, which can be slippery. The velcro closure is sturdy and stays closed. I like it that water can flow easily out of the side of the shoes so as not to waterlog the shoe down with excess water. The shoe is well made and I would purchase them again

I bought this pair in pure white for my husband. The shoe fit was very good and he says the shoe is comfortable when walking. It's an attractive looking shoe and even looks better in person than in the pictures. I'll probably get him another pair in black.

These spoons are such a great idea. The tip of the spoon turns white when dipped into food that is too hot for baby. I tested it out and it worked well, with the color turning to white right away on hot food. It's nice not to have to taste the food myself for temperature. The spoons are dishwasher safe and the plastic coating is very gentle on baby's gums. The spoons are also BPA free.

I read some of the other reviews about receiving expired or stale bars and that was not the case for the shipment I received. All of the bars we got were fresh and chewy. I also only received the peanut butter chocolate chip, and not a variety pack as someone else mentioned that they received.Even though the bars are reduced sugar, they still tasted great. In fact, the peanut butter chocolate chip flavor had just the right amount of sweetness and peanut butter flavor, without being overwhelming. These granola bars are easy to throw in a bag as a snack on the go. I would purchase them again.

The shirt looks exactly like the picture. The color is a pleasing pink and the graphic that says Big Sister is bright and not faded. The fit is as expected. My daughter wears size 4T and we ordered that and it fit as it should. I am using the shirt for a pregnancy announcement picture on Facebook and the photos I have taken of my daughter in the shirt have come out nicely. I would recommend it!

I got these dolls for my two year old and she really likes them. The outfits are cute, with nice detail and they appear to be well made. I wanted to get her a more toddler version of the doll because I didn't feel that she was ready for the Barbie type Anna and Elsa dolls.My only complaint is that when she removes the crown (it is held on by plastic rubber bands which toddlers remove) the dolls have this sort of short hair around the head that has the texture as if it has been hair sprayed (I am not saying it was hair sprayed, it jsut has a tough texture compared to the rest of the hair). And this short hair around the head sticks up in all sort of crazy directions when the crown is off. Without the plastic rubber band holding the crown on it does not stay on. So the dolls sort of look weird with this hair sticking up around the top of their heads. That said, I just try to sort of smooth it back and figure that if my daughter loves the doll, crazy hair and all, then that is what matters.Also, my kids really liked the plastic Olaf. They can manipulate him to bounce around and it is a cute addition to the set.

I am not sure why amazon prices this so high. You can find it elsewhere (like Sam's Club) for around $30. Or, if you buy it in a store like target you can call Similac for $5 off coupons that stack well when it goes on sale.Now, I have used Similac for both of my kids. The Go and Grow worked well. The powder is cheaper than the ready to feed bottles. My kids loved the flavor. I actually tasted it out of curiosity and it is a bit sweeter than some other formula brands (for example, it is sweeter tasting than Enfamil). Maybe it is the sweeter taste, but I have heard from other breast feeding moms that had to supplement that their baby took to Similac over some of the other brands because it is more similar to the sweetness of breast milk.Over all, Similac has been our first choice in formula. Hopefully amazon can bring the price down but if you are in a pinch and can't get out then it is nice to have the option to order it through amazon and have it shipped to your door.

I was relatively new to coconut water when I ordered this product. I had tried one other brand that I found to be too bitter so I was looking for a different coconut water with a less intense flavor. I saw people recommend this product on one of the online groups that I am in. Several people recommended the C20 brand of coconut water over the competitors for flavor and natural ingredients. When it arrived I was not disappointed. It has a light and refreshing flavor. The coconut flavor is not overly sweet, but has enough sweetness to be enjoyable. And it did not have a bad aftertaste, like some of the other coconut waters that I tried. I enjoy having it after a long walk or when I need a pick-me-up at 3pm when I tend to get tired. I just drink the coconut water and feel a bit more refreshed and energized. I plan on ordering more.

My skin can be a nightmare in the winter. It gets red, dry, but yet is prone to break out. And some face washes will really cause it to flare up. My dermatologist recommended Cetaphil Gentle Skin Cleanser and I have been very happy with it. I have combination skin, even though it tends toward the drier side in the winter. My husband has oily skin. This product advertises that it is for all skin types and I agree. It is clean and soothing on my dry skin and also soothes and helps my husband's oily skin. It is also gentle enough and non scented so I can use it on my kids.I have tried other sensitive skin cleansers when they have been on sale but I keep going back to Cetaphil because it leaves my skin feeling so soft. It keeps me from having skin flareups and it is a staple in our house.

I just recently tried these shakes. I used to only do slim fast shakes. I find these shakes to have a much smoother taste. The chocolate is delicious with no bad aftertaste. The 10g of protein and 5 grams of fiber really fill me up.The bigger plus for me was that they have less saturated fat than Slimfast:Kelloggs- 0.5g saturated fat  3% of Daily Value  5g  total fatSlimfast -2 g saturated fat  10% of Daily Value  6g  total fatThat is a big difference in the amount of saturated fat with the Kellogg's shakes the better choice.On other nutritional levels Slimfast and Kellogg's are very similar. For example, for protein and fiber:Kelloggs-  5 g fiber  20% of Daily ValueKelloggs-  5 g Protein  20% of Daily ValueKelloggs-  18g SugarSlimfast - 5 g fiber  20% of Daily ValueSlimfast - 5 g Protein  20% of Daily ValueSlimfast-  18g SugarI am using them to replace two meals per day (breakfast and lunch) and they really do satisfy me until the next meal. If I feel hungry in between I have a few nuts and a piece of fruit. I have already lost 3 lbs in the first week of using them to replace two meals. I got mine at Costco. I hope that Amazon provides a more competitive price in the future.

After a failed marriage and separation from his adopted son, forty-year-old Nick Hansen lives alone with his rescue dog Riley and still hasn’t come to terms with the death of his college sweetheart some twenty years earlier. His world was shattered in an instant when Marissa Minor, the love of his life, died along with others in a house fire at her campus residence.  Her death has never made sense to Hansen and he has carried the torch (no pun intended) for all these years.Now two decades later while on a mundane trip to the grocery store he thinks he sees Marissa again, just as she looked before the fateful fire.  When he approaches the girl to speak to her, she bolts from the store.  Was what he saw some ghostly apparition or someone who looks amazingly like his lost love?A visit from a local police Detective the following day produces a startling revelation that Marissa’s “dead ringer” is indeed dead and the cops are looking for answers as to why the victim had Nicks name and address in her pocket. What then unfolds in this tense drama is a replay of Nick’s memories of the months preceding Marissa’s death coupled with a lot of suspense as Nick becomes fanatically obsessed with finding answers not only to what happened to Marissa and her room-mates but also discovering what caused the ostensibly motiveless murder of her look-alike.With SOMEBODY I USED TO KNOW, author David Bell proves that he is a natural story teller gifted in moving the plot along.  This is a fine showcase for his talent and will present readers with plenty to think about with its diverse cast of flawed characters and themes of murder, survival, betrayal, and love. While Nick seems to be suffering from OCD when it comes to Marissa and the ending is somewhat predictable and a touch cheesy, overall it is still a pretty good read.

Those who like nothing better that to curl up with a good read that keeps their grey matter engaged will find Robert Goddard's LONG TIME COMING their kind of book.  It has all the necessary ingredients - a riveting plot and a well drawn cast of characters interwoven with historical figures that combine in just the right way to provide literate entertainment as he deftly mixes politics, corruption, and a maze of scandalous circumstances in a diabolical plot.Each Goddard work that I read just gets better and better and in each an every instance his mastery of suspense, combined with writing that is clear and tight, yields a story that flows smoothly and logically to the finish.  This is definitely another winner from the master of the thought provoking read.

Sort of a Death Wish by proxy, KILL THE MONEY LENDERS tells of a relatively nice, normal guy devolving into violence of a particularly gruesome nature when his home is repossessed and his wife leaves him.The tone of KILL is insistent as it almost demands that we focus our attention on the banks and mortgage companies and their corrupt methods of controlling the availability of money creating the financial meltdown that confronts most countries today.  Mike Cuggy's well researched observations also help to justify the vigilante mentality of his protagonist as we see the money lenders prosper while their customers flounder in a sea of uncontrollable debt with governments removing more and more individual liberties with promises of keeping us safe and protecting us from the threats that they themselves have been instrumental in creating.KILL THE MONEY LENDERS is a morality tale of sorts that takes a frightening look at the precarious financial status of monetary systems around the world and it's tone of impending doom coupled with the insane acts of Charlie Nobbs ( a Charles Bronson doppelganger)  is enough to guarantee a loss of sleep for the reader.

Have you ever read a novel and felt that you had “been there, done that” before?  That is the feeling I had while reading Alan Winter’s ISLAND BLUFFS.  The story of forensic dentist Carly Mason and her husband Gabe Berk who, having exhausted innumerable tries to have a baby, relocate from Manhattan to Island Bluffs at the direction of a eccentric scientist/fertility doctor named Teplitsky, a man who guarantees them not one child but twins.  Desperate to conceive, Carly will do almost anything to have a child of her own - - even if it means agreeing to the crazy conditions set forth by the doctor.Island Bluffs itself is an insular town peppered with some unusual yet likable characters, like BUCK, the local handyman. The town and its residents all have their stories and a heretofore undisclosed history.  Even the house purchased by the Berks holds secrets.On the readability meter you will find ISLAND BLUFFS to be a trip to the dark side of human nature that is reminiscent of Ira Levin novels such as  ROSEMARY’S BABY, THE STEPFORD WIVES, AND THE BOYS FROM BRAZIL with Alan Folsom’s THE DAY AFTER TOMORROW and a touch of FAUST thrown in for good measure.3 1/2 stars

If you’ve been craving a little something that’s different, look no further than ONE STEP TOO FAR by Tina Seskis.  In it you will meet a most unusual and dysfunctional family.  Francis Brown is the mother of “the twins” Caroline and Emily, sisters who couldn’t be more different.  Caroline, is pretty and seemingly outgoing but is really a jealous, seething outsider.  Emily is sweet and smart and mom’s favorite.  Dad, Andrew, is a piece of work who will bed anyone he can.  The girls grow up in this chaotic environment and Emily later marries safe and sane Ben. One fine day she decides to leave her marriage, for reasons not divulged to the reader and begin life anew as a woman named Cat - - and thus the quiet wife with the haunting secret reinvents herself as a hard drinking, drug user who is not above a bit of “sticky fingers” activity.Author Seskis takes us from Emily’s departure in the opening pages, back to her early life and then forward to her present incarnation as Cat.  Similar to viewing a CD, she moves us through Emily’s life as she leaves the present to show us Emily’s past then rewinds the years and picks up where she left off.  The picture she paints with her words is substantial and brings us into the lives of complex characters with intertwining back stories that keep the reader thoroughly enmeshed in the lives of Cat, Angel, Caroline, Ben and the entire crew.Of course the reader has to abandon a certain amount of logic in this post 9-11 world to accept the ease with which Emily disappears and then reappears as Cat with nary a problem.  It seems that it should be a little more difficult for a woman with no criminal connections to have all the appropriate documentation to carry off this caper.  That complaint aside, you could do worse than take this journey into the sometimes amusing, often traumatic aspects of one woman’s life.

TRUST NO ONE by Paul Cleave is one of those novels that offer no middle ground.  You will either love it or hate it. Jerry Grey, a writer of crime novels, is cast as the unreliable narrator of this saga. Why is Jerry unreliable?  Well, seems he is suffering from early onset Alzheimer’s and can’t seem to distinguish fact from the murderous fiction he created in the dozen of thrillers he wrote under the pseudonym Henry Cutter.The novel ping pongs back and forth between the past and present with the past being visited via Jerry's "Madness Journal" that he began keeping when he realized that ultimately his memory would fail.  His wife, Sandra and daughter initially provide a great support system but Jerry becomes unruly and combative with neighbors.  Subsequently, when bodies start piling up a confused Jerry starts confessing – even though he is currently residing in a nursing home and couldn’t have left the premises……..or could he?  The cops think it’s a definite possibility and a confused Jerry, who at this stage of the game doesn’t recognize most of his family or friends, develops a case of galloping paranoia and begins to suspect everyone of the murders, including himself.A cat and mouse game ensues and while the book holds your interest right up to the bitter end, the conclusion is not all that satisfying.  Of course, how many happy endings can you expect for a 49 year old suffering from Alzheimer’s disease.?

THE BOYS IN THE BOAT BY Daniel James Brown is as much an inspiring story of the eight young rowers at the University of Washington during the Depression Era, as it is a good look at the events surrounding the rise in Germany of Adolph Hitler and the Nazi Party and the propaganda efforts behind the games.For Hitler, the 1936 Olympics were an opportunity to present The Third Reich as the symbol of “the grandest civilization of all” but even putting the German and Italian boats in the most favored lanes did nothing to hinder the gold medal winning US teammates from victory as they edged out both Italian and German teams by six tenths or a second and one second, respectively.Interspersing stories of the rowers lives and the challenges faced by the team during the Depression Era as they literally had to pass the hat throughout Seattle to come up with the money to take the team to Berlin; we meet committed young men like coxswain Bobby Moch, coach Al Ulbrickson and peerless boat builder, yeoman George Pocock, whose shop produced seventeen of the eighteen shells used in qualifying for the Olympic games. All are unlikely sports heroes but the primary focus of Brown’s tale is the rower in seat two Joe Rantz.  Joe’s is an “up by the bootstraps” success story that will bring a swell of pride to your chest and a lump to your throat.If a story of underdogs with a tenacious capacity to win is your cup of tea then THE BOYS IN THE BOAT is surely your type of read.

“Grief—is the most painful and universal of emotions.  No one can live untouched by it, yet all experience it in profoundly different ways”.  Welcome to SECOND LIFE where even the darkest secrets can’t stay buried forever and the past can rear its ugly head at the most inopportune time.Julia, the protagonist of Second Life is a woman who is tough to like, but we become riveted by her questionable character: her lack of strength and common sense coupled with her lack of clarity of mind as she deals with past problems and addictions while searching for her younger sister’s murderer. Comparable to Gone Girl and Before I Go to Sleep, Watson’s book dissects the effects of Julia’s dysfunctional childhood and obvious lack of a moral compass on her seemingly happy marriage with drastic results.Her husband, Hugh, is a relative zero in the sex and romance department and she finds herself drawn to Lukas, a guy she meets on-line while searching for clues to her sisters’ murder while at the same time mooning over her lost love, Marcus.  Then there’s Anna, her sisters Paris room-mate whose support and guidance she seeks more and more, to the exclusion of her long time friends - - and let’s not forget Julia’s adopted son Connor – a typical 14 year old (which means he’s obstinate).  Overall, I cannot name one admirable or relatable character in this tome (except perhaps Julia’s friend Adrienne).  Everyone in this convoluted narrative has some sort of “axe to grind”.  You can choose your poison, so to speak, from among this potpourri of bored adulterers looking for some extra-curricular sex, sociopaths, self-involved schemers, and implacable vengeance seeking betrayers.This is a bottomless pit of coincidences peppered with a plethora of needy characters whose motives and excuses will leave the reader wondering “What are the odds of so many unsavory, screwed up people coming together” - - - but then again we have to remember that this is just the product of one writers vivid imagination and does not have to be grounded in an sort of reality.The bottom line is this - - if you choose to abandon all logic and can become invested in characters possessing few redeeming qualities – you may enjoy S. J. Watson’s second offering in thrillers featuring a troupe of psychologically and emotionally impaired miscreants.

Desolation Sound is a captivating mystery based on a true story that is just crying to be made into a movie.  The novel itself reads like a movie script and is a graphic look at the dark side of human nature. Masterfully rendered by authors Fraser Heston and Heather McAdams the narrative takes the reader to a fog shrouded Pacific Northwest island where over a dozen running shoe clad severed feet have turned up at various intervals over the past eight years and the Mounties don’t seem to see it as the work of a deranged and brutal serial killer but as multiple “suicides”.  (Sort of like being shot in the head multiple times and having your death declared a suicide).For those who enjoy a trip to the dark side, these authors pull no punches fashioning a thriller that doesn’t let up until its gripping resolution. Crime scenes and situations are graphic with the complex cast of players offering a number of possibilities as to the identity of the killer, the terror is tangible and the motives unusual.Now on to the prospect of a movie based on the book.  I see Damian Lewis as the determined, alcohol soaked former American cop Jack Harris, Ray Liotta as Knifeblade Bob, James Marsden or Rupert Friend as William Timmons,  Michael Biehn as Frank Richards, Sarah Michelle Geller or Claire Danes as Liz MacDonald,  and Ryan Phillippe as Doug Fouche.  The book is a taut thriller that is a quick and captivating read so it should take you no time at all to gobble it up and see if you agree with my casting choices.

Author, Anne-Laure Thieblemont, is herself an art reporter and trained gem specialists, known for her investigations into stolen art and gem trafficking. Is it any wonder that with THE COLLECTOR she has given us a brilliant novel that combines intrigue, action, suspense and more than a smattering of art history. Her descriptions of various art and gem pieces competently guide even the most unfamiliar or untrained reader through an appreciation of what it takes to authenticate art pieces.Her protagonist, Marion Spicer is an expert in eighteenth century art working for a Paris art house who suddenly inherits an estate including a large, prestigious and tremendously valuable collection of pre-Columbian art from a father whom, for the past thirty-three years, she believed was dead. Wow, Marion is an heiress with a potential fortune, but as with all things that seem to be too good to be true, so it is with this windfall. First, there are the stipulations set forth in her fathers will stating that she is to locate and recover three priceless sculptures before she can inherit so, of course, she sets out to do just that. Second, are any number of individuals, from her father’s assistant to his mistress to other collectors with voracious appetites for acquiring beauty who stand in her way and some of these folks are not above committing murder to achieve their ends.With scenes from Marion’s personal life neatly interwoven into the mystery the tale becomes a measured, slow burning read with compelling characters and secrets that reveal themselves slowly proving that in literature, as in life, not all is what it seems and we must always expect the unexpected.

HOUSE OF ECHOS is presented more as a gothic mystery than a straight-up horror novel.  It describes the events surrounding a writer named Ben, his wife Caroline who has lost her lucrative banking job and their two sons Charlie and Bub as they leave Manhattan and relocate to the country where they hope to open a B&B and Ben can hopefully overcome his writer’s block and continue to pursue his writing career.They purchase The Crofts, a four story sixty five room Castle like structure on the edge of the Drop, overlooking the village of Swannhaven and begin the gargantuan task of renovating their new home.  Ben and Caroline have suffered some past marital difficulties due to Caroline apparent post partum depression brought on by the birth of their last child, Bub.  Coupled with the difficulties and bullying Charlie has experienced at school, their decision to relocate from the big city to a small village where his “gram” once resided seems like an ideal solution to their various problems.  Surrounding their “castle on the hill” is a forest which, to their son Charlie, is a precious world apart; its familiarity and sameness offering him a sort of comfort helping him cope with the changes in his life outside of its bounds.The villagers of Swannhaven, a town that appears to be caught in a time warp, present a strange and often weird collection of individual personalities whose family histories and beliefs seem to be a strange melding of Christian and pagan observances stemming from a two hundred year old community event called the Winter Siege. Ben’s ultimate discovery of the secrets the town has been hiding results in the unraveling of the very foundation of everything he knows about himself and his family and culminates in dangerous and life threatening events for he and his family.This novel is reminiscent of Tom Tyron’s 70’s tome HARVEST HOME and Robert Marasco’s BURNT OFFERINGS with touches of Stephen King and Shirley Jackson thrown in for good measure.  It is sure to appeal to readers of the aforementioned authors as well as lovers of cult horror movies like THE WICKER MAN.

I listened to THE DARK TIDE by Andrew Gross on a cross country trip, so one could say I was a captive audience since it was either the book on CD or listening to talk radio or some inane hip hop music station (and no, I don’t have Sirius radio). At any rate, the book began with an interesting premise and could have been fairly compelling read (or listen) had it not been for some of the following:  (1) the author repeated the same information over and over again as I trying to fill up pages (maybe he gets paid by the word), (2) the antics and downright stupidity of the “betrayed” wife began to wear on me about half way through the story as did her redundant and numerous inner dialogs and couldn’t or refused to see what was right in front of her face, (3) the  “romance” between Karen and Detective Ty Hauck was at  best improbable and at worst unbelievable, (4) as a seasoned Detective, Hauck’s behavior as he investigated was more in line with what readers came to expect from a 30’s or 40’s noir novel where the “hero” did whatever it took , B&E to murder, to apprehend the bad guys (rules, ethics and legalities be damned) (4) the inconsistencies in the story were myriad and I found myself listening just to have yet another “aha, gotcha” moment when the ages of children changed or a character’s hair or eye differed from one chapter to another.I could go on ad nauseam (as does the novel) with my observations but suffice to say that unless you are stranded on a desert island and  THE DARK TIDE is the “only game in town”, you would be best served to move on to something that is worth the time and energy you have expended.

Annie Barrows spins an excellent yarn about a Southern Community and provides her readers with a very human context for the larger event that was The Great Depression. As a young woman, Layla Beck, a Senator’s daughter and Washington socialite finds herself exiled (in a manner of speaking) to Macedonia West Virginia after angering her father by refusing to marry his choice of husband and finds herself living as a boarder in the home of one Jottie Romeyn.After having been unwillingly hired as part of the Federal Writers Project sponsored by the WPA, Layla has been somewhat is commissioned to gather background information and write the history of Macedonia.  Of course, everyone she interviews has their own version of the town’s history and their family’s place in it which they are eager to share. Independent Layla, however, prefers to conduct her own investigation and is instrumental in digging up the true history, romance, deception and family tragedies of years gone by.While Layla investigates the town’s history, twelve year old Willa Romeyn has a mission of her own that involves some investigating (or spying if you prefer) on various family and community members in an attempt to discover secrets long held by her father Felix and his sister Jottie.  Her junior Sherlock Holmes persona is equal parts endearing and annoying.Overall, Annie Barrows tells an engaging tale rooted in real life with a handful of characters, some personable and others repellent with some prone to selfish and self-serving actions while others are selfless and noble.Nothing beats a books’ power to transport us to a different place and time and until we master time travel, books like THE TRUTH ACCORDING TO US are a great way to explore and understand a different era in our countries history.  It also provides an inside look at the inner workings and eccentricities of life in a small southern town.

First W. Bruce Cameron gave us A DOG'S PURPOSE, a story that vibrated with its own special magic as it told the story of a dog who never truly died but returned again and again in many incarnations as it sought to fulfill what it saw as it's purpose.  The story now continues with the sequel, A DOG'S JOURNEY which, while poignant in places, doesn't quite live up to the first book as it continues the spiritual journey of Buddy/Molly, Max, et al as he/she relentlessly helps a young woman to chart a course through her abysmal childhood and adolescence and directs her toward a promising future.Once again Cameron, via his four legged protagonist, teaches lessons in perseverance, trust, unconditional love and second chances.  While this second offering is a bit more melodramatic than the first it does serve to illustrate two important things - (1) that dogs tend to bring out the best in most of us and (2) that those we love are never truly gone since they continue to live on as long as there is someone who remembers them.

Peter Bragg is a guy who gave up his job on a San Francisco newspaper and is now pursuing his career as a private detective.  Suddenly his past has caught up with him and now Marianne, a woman he once saved from a dive off the Golden Gate Bridge, is calling to request his help.  She has discovered she has a “gift” and is now working as a psychic consultant.  Recently she has had a vision of the hillside burial site of victims of violent unsolved crimes.  The only problem is that in that same vision she has also seen her own future as it relates to this case and that future is pretty grim.  Marianne is not really sure of where the bodies are buried but has a general "feel" for the area.  With the help of Sonoma County Sheriff’s Detective Barry Smith, Bragg sets out to discover the elusive burial site and when they do what they discover is nothing short of mind boggling.This is an above average tale featuring an old school detective.  While the damsel in distress story line is familiar, author Jack Lynch has managed to give it a new spin and make it new utilizing equal parts imagination and forceful literary skills.  To reveal more would be a crime but for lovers of the books of Dashiell Hammitt and James M. Cain this is a perfect page turner to start your summer.

Horace Torrington, once owner of an 18th century manor house called Sterne, is dead and his widow Charlotte and their children now occupy the house.  Charlotte, much to the chagrin of her children, has now married Edward Swift who, as the story opens, is departing the estate in hopes of acquiring a loan to save the family manor.Set in England in 1912 the Torrington-Swift family is preparing to celebrate the 20th birthday of middle daughter Emerald.  Even though the family is in dire need of funds and obviously living far beyond their means, an over the top celebration has been orchestrated with family and friends invited to the festivities. Plans go awry when a train accident occurs nearby and some of the individuals involved, most of whom were “third-class” travelers, arrive at the estate seeking assistance and disrupting the flavor of Emerald’s special evening.  Among the uninvited guests is Charlie Traversham-Beechers, a malevolent character from Charlotte’s rather questionable past who shows up claiming to be a survivor from first class.An ensuing storm, uncooperative guests and an unusual parlor game add tension and threaten the evening in this tome that takes extreme delight in dissecting the pretension and stagnant social mores prevalent in Edwardian England.While Sadie Jones writing is descriptive and delves into the minutia of everything from the servants to the preparation of the dinner being served, it is also much in keeping with the behavior of the residents of Sterne and overall tone of the story – stuffy.

I received one of the nickel lined copper mugs in return for an honest review and here it is.On the plus side, these are a nice weight and the hammered look is aesthetically appealing. These would be a great eye-appealing addition to use and display, if you have a formal bar area in your home. The mug is also ideal for hot summer days when you are looking for something cold and refreshing to quench your thirst since it keeps your drink icy cold for hours.  One small problem is the bottom, which is not completely flat.  I’m not saying it rolls around like a child’s “tippy” cup but it does rock ever so slightly.Be sure to use this cup for cold items only because, just as the copper keeps things very cold, it also keeps them very hot.  Do not make the mistake, as my husband did, of pouring a cup of coffee into this cup.  Not only does the surface of the cup stay hot, hot, hot – so does the handle. (ouch!)No dishwasher for these babies either.  Only hand wash and (excuse me if I’m stating the obvious) don’t use any abrasive cleaners or you may cause some permanent damage to the beauty of the copper.Overall, I was pleased with this product and I would say these cups would be an appropriate wedding, anniversary or birthday gift for friends or the perfect addition to your own home.

There is a great tradition of mental illness in fiction.  We all remember books like Jane Eyre with the crazed Mrs. Rochester neatly tucked away in the attic.  The last few decades have brought improvement in the way mental illness is treated and the way it is portrayed in literature and more recent works like Wally Lamb’s She’s Come Undone or Judith Guests Ordinary People have attempted to more realistically portray mental illness.In ANOTHER NIGHT, ANOTHER DAY by Sarah Rayner the common thread of mental health issues confronting both male and female characters are examined with sympathy and insight.  Initially focusing on three characters, Karen, a woman attempting to come to terms with the deaths of her husband and her father; Michael, a man dealing with the failure of his life’s work, and Abby, mother of an autistic child whose husband has basically washed his hands of the situation and left her to cope with their child on her own.  All these lives intersect at the Moreland Psychiatric Clinic where each has come seeking help in dealing with various emotional issues ranging from panic attacks to anxiety and depression.  There is also a supporting cast whose back-stories, illnesses and coping mechanisms are almost as compelling as those of the central characters with each individual’s reaction to their circumstances molding them into who they are.At times I found the book unnerving and even a bit depressing, but ultimately came to the conclusion that this novel is attempting to warn each of us that we should never judge another's actions or motives nor assume that we know what is going on in someone else’s life.

Deftly weaving dual narratives, exploring the complicated emotions of grief, anger, sadness, duplicity, even joy, THE LOST GARDEN features interchangeable tales of two women who have both suffered loss and seek solace by undertaking the restoration of a walled garden.In the present day, Marin Ellis and her fifteen year old half sister Rebecca need a new beginning following a family tragedy so they leave their home in Hampshire for a charming village on the Cumbrian Coast where they purchase Bower House, a cottage on the grounds of the local church. After discovering a locked garden on their property and becoming intrigued by a photo of the garden in its previous incarnation, Marin engages the services of Joss Fowler, a local gardener to assist with investigation and restoration.Ninety years earlier Eleanor Sanderson, a vicar's daughter, is mourning the wartime death of her brother and seeks comfort in creating a memorial garden. She is assisted in her endeavor by an itinerant gardener hired by her father. While Jack Taylor, is more than willing to assist Eleanor and share his knowledge of horticulture, he is less inclined to share any information about his past.
