Richard Arum notes that there has been significant grade inflation.  Good marks are no longer meaningful except in the hard sciences.  Attracting and retaining a diverse student body is a higher goal than maintaining academic rigor.  The book "Mismatch" describes how this hurts minority students.  In fact, the push for diversity also dilutes the validity of the certificate: employers rely more on other criteria, such as recommendations from current employees, SAT scores, and outside references.The book is full of self-awareness and self-improvement checklists. The self-improvement tips are generally fairly obvious, but nonetheless useful. Get up early in the morning. Keep a notebook - write things down. Keep a list of things to do. Keep a list of things to learn. Make a practice of returning calls. Stretch yourself. One list that I love is a challenge to ask questions that are certain to be answered with a "No." His examples include asking people on the street for $100 and asking random girls for a date. His point is absolutely valid. A young person is vastly ahead of the game once he has learned not to be afraid of being turned down, governed only by other people's opinions. Other people will surely lead you to mediocrity.The book is tremendously rich in ideas on how to make things happen. Keep it by your bedside: if ever comes a morning that you don't know what to do, turn to a random page and you'll find some useful advice on how to improve your life. The only caveat is that it invariably takes some mixture of chutzpah and hard work. He has some great advice on how to hack the business of making contacts. How to crash conferences, college courses, and other gatherings of people who are likely to be helpful to you. He tells you how to hack emails - how to get in touch with people who can be useful to you, and how to write an email that will get an answer. He made me feel good. I sent him a cold email asking for a copy of this book to review, and this is the result. Useful for both of us, the way things should be.I found the self-awareness checklists to be harder. He asks "What Is the Purpose of Life?" This is a difficult question for any person of any age. Stephens is relentlessly secular. He offers only one answer, essentially that of the Enlightenment philosophers. We are here to maximize our human potential, our personal satisfaction, or our happiness depending on which philosophe you choose. I think the list needs more options. Religious people believe we are here to serve God and to raise the next generation of believers. Traditionalists, often religious, believe that we have a responsibility to pass on the culture which we have inherited, again usually through our children. Conversely, Charles Murray is right when he writes about the Europe Syndrome in "Coming Apart." Many moderns' attitude is that "The purpose of life is to while away the time between birth and death as pleasantly as possible." In the end, I believe that most kids won't have an answer to this most basic question which Stephens poses.The book proceeds by a series of anecdotes chronicling the success of a number of bright, driven people whom the author has known in his life. By being willing to reach out, to make contact with people who might be able to help him, he has developed an extensive network of extremely competent people. They have fascinating stories to tell. However, these are far from ordinary people. They would not have come to Stephens' attention if they were. The message of the book is cast as "You might be able to do this." Let's not kid ourselves; very few readers will be able to emulate the success of his examples. Every reader, even those who will find no role in Stephens' universe can, however, benefit by applying the lessons of self-discipline which he advocates.Two examples come to mind. The first was the viral Youtube of Doctor Ben Carson lecturing President Obama at the National Prayer Breakfast in February of 2013. The message was that Carson had overcome the handicap of poverty, a bad attitude, and a single-parent home to become the head of pediatric oncology at Johns Hopkins. Therefore, he implies, there is hope for everybody. Joanne Calderwood writing in "The Self-Propelled Advantage"describes how her homeschooling regime produced four kids in a row who attended college on scholarships, including one who aced the SATs with a 1600. In both cases, rather like Stephens, determination and self discipline were essential. In all cases, however, the kids could not have succeeded without native intelligence, any more than my native talent would get me into the NBA.  The genetic stuff just isn't there. To pretend otherwise is simply naïve, inclined to raise false hope in kids without the right stuff.  On the other hand, we all can improve.  One of Stephens' better examples is a study that shows how much more successful it is to praise children for work rather than high intelligence. Hard work is something they know how to reproduce; intelligence is a fragile judgment that they may be scared to defend. The value of his book, then, is more in the instruction which anybody can follow than the examples which very few could emulate.Interesting for a man who got involved in a gubernatorial campaign as a teenager, Stephens assiduously avoids any political discussion. Cynics say that student loans result from collusion between Wall Street and Washington: financial institutions are able to profit from guaranteed loans, and the government is able to keep young people off of the unemployment rolls and at the same time buy their votes with the appearance of doing something to help them.  Another reason to avoid the traditional path is that a modern college education amounts to a four-year brainwashing in contemporary progressive thought - read David Gelernter's "America Lite."  College is absolutely not the place to learn how to think independently. Stephens does go so far as to call the student loan game a "bubble" but doesn't find it necessary to name any villains. He is an optimist; much as he certainly appreciates why these things have come to be, he keeps relentlessly focused on the positive - what to do with your own life.Stephens' bibliography, though well-chosen, is rather thin. He is young and has been doing other things with his life than read. He references "Academically Adrift" by Richard Arum, "Teach Your Own" by John Holt, and "The Underground History of American Education" by John Gatto, all of which I review favorably.I'll close this review by taking advantage of the fact that I have your attention to push my own agenda. I got divorced and moved to Kiev to start a new life five years ago, about the time I started Social Security. I have learned Russian, gotten married, fathered a son, built a house and almost completed a book on my plans to homeschool him.Life should change dramatically when we moved to the new place. I had already resolved to follow one piece of Stephens' advice: start a salon. I am adding four to do's to to my list after having read this book. First, as I write speeches in Russian to present at Toastmasters, I will think of other places that I might deliver them and work hard to get on the agenda of conferences and to speak at universities. Secondly, I will pepper Kiev with emails, looking for more information about homeschooling and looking for contact with other parents who are interested. I have already written that collaborative teaching and learning will be an essential part of my son's homeschooling experience. This book gave me some concrete ideas about how to make it happen. Third, I will volunteer my skills as a writer, translator, editor and programmer to people who are doing interesting work on education in Kiev. Lastly, I'll make a point of making coffee dates to get myself out of the house and involved. Please write me if any of you readers have suggestions to contribute in the way of homeschooling my son, or other books you would recommend that I read.

Short books have their virtues.  They get right to the point, and you have finished before you even ask the question of whether or not to keep going.  Salman has a number of good suggestions on getting audience attention and keeping it.The advice is well suited towards his profession, technical and sales presentations in a business setting.  I can envision other approaches being useful in other realms of public speaking, and some of the things he proposes, such as giving the audience get-acquainted assignments, only work with enough time and under the right circumstance.Most significantly, his suggestions left my mind begging for examples.  Actual speeches would be useful both to make the point and to increase the bulk of a 38-page book.

The most relevant question is "Support in what style?"  The Earth could support vastly more people living like they do in rural India than in modern America.We see what has happened to India and China in the years since publication.  They are getting richer; automobile use is exploding.  Therefore, the lower end of his estimates, five billion, appears more likely.A trend which Cohen certainly didn't predict is that vast decrease in fertility. It is below the replacement rate (2.1 children per woman) in countries accounting for the majority of the world population.  It is vastly below replacement in every country dominated by whites and north Asians, the peoples who are driving the world economy.  There has been an abrupt cultural shift in those places.  Having children is not valued or supported by the society.  Individuals are not encouraged (much) to marry and have children.  Conversely, lifestyles / sexuality decisions inconsistent with having kids are gaining recognition everywhere.Cohen's groundwork is an essential support for analyzing more recent trends.

Running, swimmming and cycling, the big three.  Raise your heart rate to the target zone and keep it there long enough to do some good - twenty minutes or more.I started when the book came out in 1968. I initially ran a mile, then worked up to four miles a day.  What the book didn't tell you is that eventually it takes a toll on your knees.  It may be better now, with well-engineered running shoes to absorb some of the impact, but after about twenty years my knees couldn't take the strain.  Arthroscopic surgery, and then a switch to bicycling and a bike machine.And... I still spend thirty minutes a day simulating 18 mph on the exercise bike, and do a lot of real bicycling and swimming in the summer.  Cooper's work was with young people.  My observation is that the age-based formulas for target heart rate are too conservative.  Though the charts indicate a maximum just over 160 and a workout target under 130 for a guy of 65, I kept the exercise heart rate of 140-145 for decades; I never felt like I was straining myself.  I conclude that the body can maintain an accustomed rate of exertion to a greater age than experts would project.A Soviet-style joke (this will cost me "helpful" votes, but I'll live dangerously).  Last summer I cycled across Kiev to a Democrats Abroad picnic.  Several of the old war horses, progressives who had progressed past Social Security age, remarked on the fact that I had come ten miles by cycle.  I told them to think nothing of it.  Another four years of socialist progress under Obama and we will all be riding bicycles.Absolutely five stars. This was a seminal book.

I brought my Presto cooker from the United States when I moved to Ukraine five years ago.  I guard it jealously, making sure that I always know where the weight and the trivet are.My new wife had never seen one before, but it took her about a nanosecond to figure out that it is the best thing imaginable for making Ukraine's signature dish, borscht.  Fast, energy-efficient, easy to clean, unbreakable.  A great product.A piece of advice.  When the weight starts to dance, turn the fire down to the point that you barely hear steam escaping.  Just as you can't heat water higher than boiling, 212 degrees (100 C) by adding more heat, you can't push a pressure cooker at 15 PSI (pressure with the normal weight) past 250 degrees (121 C) by making the weight bounce more.  All you do is use more heat and boil away the water faster, risking burning your meal.

I was prepared not to like these very much, because so much bluetooth stuff is junk.However, I have to admit that these are not bad headphones at all. Not only do they have a built-in rechargeable battery, but they can also answer calls if paired to your bluetooth capable mobile phone, with controls on the actual earpieces.Operation is easy and intuitive, and I had no trouble at all using them with very little recourse to the documentation. They charge from the USB port on a computer, or a USB wall adapter.While I generally prefer standard, replaceable batteries (you can always use rechargeables), I am getting used to always having to carry around a USB charging device of one sort or another.The fidelity is nice although not outstanding. One huge plus for me was that the designers had the intelligence to include a wired 3.5 mm stereo audio jack so you can use these are regular, non-powered headphones. Hooray! That is the kind of thoughtful and multifunction design that I like to see. If the battery dies, you can always switch to the wired jack and keep on rocking. Brilliant - well done!While not the smalles headphones, they are light and comfortable, and not distressing to wear for long periods of time.Signal reception seems good, and I was able to walk into another room, with a flat screen TV and a wall between the headphones and my cell (playing music) with no loss of signal.They include a USB charging cable and a male to male 3.5 mm stereo audio cable, but no USB to wall plug adapter.I hesitate to only give 4 stars, as they are close to 5, but the fidelity department and lack of a wall adapter are not quite up to the rest of the design quality and thoughtfulness. I only want to take 1/2 a star for that, so they really are 4.5 stars in my book.Good job, Panasonic.Well worth a look and a listen. I am quite happy with them.

Ordered the 36, 69, and 58 calibers. Shipped fast, count was accurate, and I loved the little smiley face on the bags.Haven't used them yet, but have measured with calipers and scale, and they seem accurate and consistent.Will update after I have tested them on the range.

Pretty much Mackie’s answer to the Behringer Xenyx 1202FX mixer. They are extremely similar in function, channels, layout, etc., with only a few parameters like EQ frequencies being different, as well as being a bit larger.One wonders if Behringer is OEM-ing these for Mackie, they are so alike.Sound quality is good, fit and finish are good, except for a sharp edge on each side of the mixer, where the side pieces come up above the main board level. The Behringer version has a better fit and finish - no sharp edges. A small nitpick, but could be important to some.The special effects (mostly reverb, with some chorus and flanging) are pretty much par for the course for a small mixer like this, and I assume they all use the same DSP chip for that. Not super studio high end effects, but usable for many tasks.The connectors are all tight, the slider moves well and seems good quality, all the pots and controls seem to work well, and there is not a lot of noise. This is a very nice little mixer, and I think you would not go wrong if with it if you are in the market for this kind of mixer.These small mixers won’t cut the mustard for your new hit release, but they are great for podcasts, small PA setups, and various other small mixing uses, even computer audio systems. I use a great many of these kind of mixers in my “day job,” and they are great.Now that Mackie has thrown their hat in the ring in this small mixer market, those who are brand loyal can have a nice Mackie branded small mixer to do all those small to medium mixing tasks. I have had to access Mackie customer service directly once in the past due to a reseller’s intransigence, and the regional rep was instantly in touch and fixed the problem immediately without hesitation. That quality of customer service can be worth a lot.A bit more expensive than a Behringer, but then there are a lot of people who feel that the Mackie brand name on an item is worth it. In any case, this is a nice little mixer, and I will not hesitate to put it to work on any number of audio projects.Recommended. Definitely give this beastie a look.

This is quite simply one of the best camera packs I have seen.It is a very well made, solid, and versatile way to carry camera (or other) gear.From the solid base (which it stand on quite well) all the way to the top handle, it demonstrates a high level of quality.The interior can be accessed either from the back through a dual zippered flap, or the top. The zippers seem solid and strong.Inside, there is a lime green lining with matching lime green padded dividers which can be moved around and arranged to fit your particular collection of gear. The padded panels attach with hook and loop flaps and can be moved around to fit your needs.There is a strange (but useful) detachable strap designed to support your DSLR hanging in the top part of the pack.There are a couple of extra zippered pockets, one on top, one on the back, which allow more gear to be carried, and which have smaller pockets sewn into them.There are two side straps above mesh external pockets and some reasonably well done shoulder straps for carrying as a back pack.There is also another large compartment on the back where the straps attach, which runs nearly the entire height of the pack, and has an internal, padded pocket.The quality of construction, versatility, and light weight make this a great choice for carrying camera (or other) gear.

This messenger bag turned out to be a bit larger than I expected, but that is not a problem for me. I am constantly on the lookout for good carry gear, and this bag is great.It is solid and well made - I could find no badly done seams or joints anywhere. The material of the main part of the bag is like a vinyl version of ballistic nylon, but seems strong and sturdy. I haven't used it extensively yet, but have been pretty happy with what it can hold and how solid it feels.It is easily large enough for a 17" laptop, and I have actually carried a VHS/DVD combo player in it, and, although I couldn't close the cover flap, it still transported the player safely. This is a big bag.The interior can be accessed either by opening the flap, or alternatively by un-zipping a zipper on top - an ingenious design which I quite liked. The interior has many, many pockets of various sizes (none really large, though).The very back storage space (for a really big laptop, let's say) is lined in a soft red material, and has some stiffening material to provide a certain amount of protection. The next largest space, also lined, would hold a 13" laptop or smaller tablet easily. It also has some stiffening material in the walls to provide a bit of protection to the contents.The area at the front of the bag is the largest, and is lined in the same material as the outside of the bag. This is where you will find the various pockets for separating smaller items.There is a handle on top, but it is not centered with the bag's center of gravity, being situated toward the back, which throws off the symmetry and center of gravity when being carried by the handle. The handle itself is 1.5 inch nylon webbing with a leather (or leather-like) handle cover, and is stiched into a row of 2 inch wide nylon webbing running across the back of the bag. This all seems quite well done and very solid.The shoulder strap is 2 inch nylon webbing with a movable shoulder pad, and while sturdy, is a little bit off to my mind. It rests a bit funny against my body, and I think I just have not quite figured out the best way to carry it.All in all, a great messenger bag with considerable potential.If you are looking for a big messenger bag that is also well made, I recommend you give this serious consideration.

It really does work. It can be difficult to handle, but I did a few experiments in direct sun on a 95 degree day, and I could feel a pronounced difference when I moved my hand from direct sunlight to behind the film (and it is not that dark, so it wasn't just shading my hand).Applying it to a window, on the other hand, can be difficult. You need ot clean the window thoroughly, and it certianly helps to have more than one person to apply it. Imagine trying to use the worst cellophane wrap and a long string of tape to attach to an irregular surface, and you get the idea. I had the film tear on me because the backing would not let go, it kept folding where I wanted to keep it straight, and I didn't have enought hands to hold the edges straight and pull off the backing at the same time.It is stiff on the clear backing, and the backing does not want to come off. The film also wants to stick to everything, flop around, get misaligned, and so on. You need plenty of room and an extra pair of hands to get it to behave. If you are careful and have help, I think you will be pleased.The film is not very dark at all, so if you are looking for something to darken windows, this isn't it. It is pretty uniform and does not introduce distortions to the window if you apply it correctly. (A squeegee-like tool is included to help flatten it out on the window.)I have not had it long enough to know how well it ages, but it is plastic, so there will be limits. It may also off-gas VOCs, if you are someone sensitive to that.If you need to block UV and some IR (heat) form direct sunlight, I would definitely give this serious thought. Just remember to give yourself enough time and resources to apply it correctly.

What a nice surprise. When I first opened the package, I was struck by how cheap and plasticy they looked.I have been using Leight Impacts for some time, and like them a lot. I have to say that  active ear protection has many advantages. On the other hand, you have batteries to buy, etc., and those little orange foam things can work pretty well, too.I was a bit put off by the volume knob, which is smooth and seemed like adjusting it in the field would be a problem. Such was not the case, however. I found them more comfortable on my ears and head than the Impacts, and the volume knob was not at all a problem (I don't get sweaty hands, though, so it may be an issue if you do).The ear seal worked better than the Impacts, at least on my head, and  the Peltors were more comfortable to wear over a long period of time ( I sometimes shoot for 2 or 3 hours). The audio range was similar to the Impacts, but the mics did seem to pick up more wind noise thant the Impacts do. I found them light weight and not at all distracting - they were not burdensome, heavy, or awkward to wear at all.They were a pleasure to use, and I could almost say a delight. I was surprised and very pleased with these. I have not had time to judge battery life or durability, but so far I like them a lot.If you want to try active ear protection, you would not go wrong to start here. (Of course, I still keep a bunch of those orange foam things around anyway - pays to have backup, they are cheap, and they work.)

Tomahawks (or "hawks," to the in-crowd) have been popular in certain crowds for hundreds, if not thousands, of years. While primarily a weapon historically, they can also function as a light duty hatchet, among other tools.Popularized by movies and TV for their use in the American frontier as a Native American weapon, they are a variation of the war club, war hammer, truncheon, or similar weapon, which goes back thousands of years. In trained hands, they are pretty effective.Which brings us to this particular beastie.It came with a reasonably sharp (and slightly protected) main blade (sorry if I don't know all the correct "hawk-speak"). The handle is not as long as most hawks these days, and it is intended as a light weight, light duty device. It is assembled in parts, with the plastic handle piece held in place by a metal collar, 4 securlty screws in the head (star pattern), and two different security screws (hex pattern) in the pommel. It comes with a heavy ballistic nylon cover, which has a 2 inch belt loop out of nylon webbing. The cover has a plastic snap closure.I'm not a trained user of this thing as a weapon, but I did try some wood chopping and digging kinds of things, and it worked pretty well for being so light. With such a light head, chopping wood will be quite a bit more work, but it will also make this hawk easier to carry. The sharpened blade bit nicely into the wood I tested it on, and I was able to chop out a small piece in a short time. With more weight in the head, it would be easier to split wood.I would think that much throwing would stress the head attachment, which does not seem to be reinforced, but rather a simple extension down from the head which fits between two flanges of the plastic from the handle shroud. The metal may extend the entire length of the hawk, but short of taking it apart or contacting the manufacturer, it is hard to tell. I will leave it to others who might put it through more vigorous tests to let you know how it holds up. It seems pretty sturdy to me, and I would trust it for my uses, but those inclined to throwing hawks could tell you much more about how it will hold up to that.As long as you keep in mind its limitations, I think you will find it is a good value. As a light weight, combination weapon/camp hatchet, I would certainly feel reasonably well equipped for many small camp chores with this along.

This kind of curtain ring is very useful for hanging heavy curtains, as they handle weight well and roll easily on most curtain rods.I have used these kinds of rings for many years and prefer them for most uses.That said, they do have a few drawbacks - they are metal, and if that doesn’t fit with your decor or you are concerned about rust and such, they may not be for you.Also if you do not have a very heavy curtain, they can flip over, as the metal ball bearings are the heaviest part of the ring, and can rotate if there is not enough weight from the curtain to hold them in place vertically.Those are the only drawbacks I have found, and do like them for most uses.This set seems quite well made, with the rings being “staked” (the metal flattened slightly) to hold the bearings in place. The bearings roll easily, and the finish seems good - no flakes, marred spots, etc.I would definitely consider these again if I needed more curtain rings.

I wanted to test this bag, as I am something of a carry gear freak. While I have no use for any child care products of any kind, often one can find some very interesting value in bags designed for a different purpose than what one wants.Hence, I have looked at bags like this for cameras, computers, and other tech carry, and I would even consider it for concealed carry, if I did that.The bag is sturdy, strong, and has several useful compartments. I am not sure how I would re-purpose the removable changing pad, but it could serve to protect a tablet or small computer.It is not heavy, and has quite a bit of carry capacity. It is somewhat narrow, and so would not work for more bulky items. It is very much like a regular messenger bag, and would certainly work for that.There is one large main compartment with two narrow pockets attached to the back of the inside of the bag. These pockets would probably just fit a tablet ( I will find one to test), and would almost fit a netbook.There are two similar pockets on the out side, and some bottle-holding type pockets on either end of the bag. Under the flap, there is the detachable pad and two zippered net pockets.Inside the main compartment on either end are two straps with plastic buckles.A very useful bag for many reasons. If you are looking for a bag to covertly carry something other than baby supplies, this bag would work nicely.Well made and good quality carry gear.

Very cool. Reasonably thick plastic body with coin slot and writing on top, and an access slot with a plug on the bottom. The bottom also has soft rubber feet which conceal screws, which presumably allow one to remove the bottom for better access to the inside.I filled mine nickels for weight to use as a prop, and it feels heavy and solid in one's hand.Nicely made and finished. A great coin bank. All kind of uses for this!

I have been studying self-help material for many decades, and by now, most of it is simply recycled from the past.This book is different. While the author draws on the past, she also draws on recent research, and packages the material in a fresh manner.While much of the information is already familiar to me, some of it wasn't, and the author's point of view made several things clearer than books I had read before.In fact, in the first 1/3 of the book, I had two major insights simply because of her method of explaining things.She creates her own system and terminology, but I found it useful and beneficial, rather than silly and vain as with most authors who attempt this.Her treatment of the nature of habits and many different techniques for controlling them blend nicely with her description of human emotions and mental function, which were just detailed enough to be helpful - not overwhelming and complex.I can't imagine someone not coming away from this book without gaining something useful. If you don't, it's most likely your own fault.Recommended.

I don't do a lot of blending as it usually takes so long to clean blenders after use.This blender, although pretty limited in quantity and only one speed, did a fair job on the few tasks I have set for it, and cleanup was easier than on other blenders I have used.My main test was making whipped cream flavored with chocolate sauce, and it did an admirable job. It was difficult to get everything out of the jar due to the small neck, but an appropriately sized spatula helped.If I was into making green drinks and that sort of thing, I imagine I would use this a lot. I intend to try it on more projects as I do more mixed kinds of liquids in my diet, and will see if I have anything to add after that.The first time I used it, there was a strong "new motor" smell. That should go away as the unit is broken in over time. It seemed quite stable on the counter, and seems pretty strong and well made.It would be nice if there more speeds, but I will see what I can do with the single speed.

Good combination of thyroid support supplements similar to a much more expensive brand sold through practitioners.Works well for me with raw glandular supplements to avoid using toxic synthetics from the Pharmaceutical-industrial complex.

An outstanding book to read, especially for those who insist that UFOs never show any signs of hostility.Many cases, some involving death, of hostile UFO encounters are covered in detail, with good references. Some cases people will try to explain away with "simple" answers, but the destruction of people and property is simply not benign, no matter how one tries to twist it.If you are tired of the droning on by people who insist all "space brothers" are harmless, sweet little angels, then read this book and get a more balanced view.That book they carry may just be a cookbook . . . .(obscure TV reference for those in the know).

Absolutely amazing.As Truman said, the only new thing is the history you don't know. New things reside in this text.I started reading Crowley in high school, along with other authors in many different areas of the metaphysical arena. While I knew that he never wrote anything directly or openly in his works, I didn't realize just how convoluted and contrived it all was.Rumors persisted about his work for British Intelligence, but the degree and extent of his involvement are amazing. In fact, as I read this book and others, like Bosley's Empire of the Wheel, and McGowan's Weird Scenes Inside The Canyon, I can't help but call into question the extent of secret societies' and intelligence agencies' deep involvement in manipulating popular culture. It makes me feel like the last century was one big lab experiment for some sick elite (which, of course, it was).The author details Crowley's travels, referencing his own work, the writings of others, interviews, official records, and so on, linking him to various schemes and spy missions. It becomes clear that much of Crowley's public persona (personas, actually; he was a man of many natures) was a cover for his intelligence activity, and that at least some of his "magickal workings" were simply diversions, deceptions, or covers for his real missions. His involvement in the sinking of the Lusitania is a perfect example of this.He may have been the mystic he tried to convince everyone he was, but given the light shed upon his intelligence activities and how much of his "mystical" behavior was a front to infiltrate secret groups and create doubt of his sanity and loyality to the Crown, I am left with large questions about just how much of his supposed mystical achievements were real at all.That he was extremely well educated in many forms of mysticism, magick, religion, Asian culture, etc., is not in question. In fact, his intense study of such things would be a requirement for being able to infiltrate secret societies of all kinds and maintain his cover. He obviously had great aptitude for such things, and probably no small talent at them either. However, the reality of his true powers only he could say (and never would).He does appear to have been one heck of a good spy, though, with many people never dreaming what he was really up to.Recommended reading if you have ever been interested in Crowley, Jack Parsons, the OTO, "New Age" counter-culture stuff or even the history of spying. Well worth reading even if you just want to see the extent any country will go to spy on or manipulate an "ally." It will shed some light on current events and make you look twice at "celebrities" and their political and other involvements.

A great introduction to the current situation in blogging and other online writing. Daniel is a savvy marketing professional, and the information and advice in this small book is well worth reading.His views on content, communication, and SEO (Search Engine Optimization) are honest and insightful.Highly recommended.

A great size for measuring liquid supplements and mixing herbal drops in water. I also use them for measuring doses of Aloe juice and other liquids.Sturdy and a good size. I have 5 and will probably get more. Good small beverage glass as well.

I was very pleased with these. Taste and texture are good, and nutritional content is great. It is hard to find good keto/paleo snacks or emergency rations, and these would work well for both. I could stand a bit less pepper in them, but that isn't a deal breaker for me.These combined with some good coconut oil would make the best emergency rations you could want - high saturated fat for extended energy, MCTs for health, and protein from these sticks would make for some pretty healthy rations - the closest thing to real pemmican you could find without making your own. (If you don't know why pemmican is the ideal emergency ration, then you need to do some research - start with the Hudson Bay Company dietary requirements for fur trappers in near arctic climes).They don't need refrigeration, and the ones I got had a one year shelf life remaining - short for rations but doable.Recommended.

Pretty good stuff.There is a bit of "liverwurst" taste to it, and if that bothers you, then you might want something else.I happen to like liverwurst, so that is no problem for me. With a bit of mustard, these are great.It is difficult to find high quality keto/paleo snacks or protein sources which do not need refrigeration, but these work well, at least as far as I have tested them. The addition of organ meats makes them that much more nutritious.These would make great "bug out" or emergency rations, along with some good coconut oil for calories - much better than the high-carb, sugary bars and junk that are usually recommended. Shelf life on the ones I received was around 2 years, and I don't know how long they were stored before I got them. Anything over a year works for me, especially if they are high quality protein.recommended.

This is the first time I've seen a spray conditioner to go with a dry shampoo spray. I am in love with so many of the Luseta products, they feel and perform like a salon quality product. I never had much luck with dry shampoos, the white powdery look wasn't for me. To use this product, you really have to shake it to combine before spraying and you must hold the can a good 10 inches from your hair. It still left a little white on my hair but a quick brush through made it less noticeable.The conditioner is what sets this product apart, it totally eliminates the whiteness and dullness left my the shampoo. It's pretty amazing. You don't need much, just a quick shot and then finger or brush it through your hair.These two products combined are a great thing and can be a real lifesaver on a bad hair day. I had to dock one point for the overpowering scent. It knocked me back a bit, reminded me of Aqua Net in the 70s....I don't know if that's needed as part of the process that makes it work but try not to use this in a closed area...I still recommend highly, it's my WOW product of the week.I received a sample of the product for testing and review.  After reviewing many items from this company, I really think they should be used in salons, they're that good.

I ship 6 days a week and have a reliable postal scale I've used for about 8 years.  The Accuteck All in One Digital Scale has a few features missing in my first.  I like the flip top for large envelopes or overnight pouches and I also like the ample base and the view of the digital readout. When I place a large box on it, I can easily see the weight as oppose to contorting myself and bending sideways. I also like the plug option for when I forget to buy batteries and  still have to have my shipments ready for pickup. The weights are accurate and exact. It's a great scale and an excellent value.I received the item for testing, evaluating, and review...It passed with flying colors Recommended

When I took my acne prone teenage daughter to the dermatologist, he explained how even oily skin (especially) needed to use a moisturizer. In teens, the body goes into overdrive producing oil when the skin is too dry. She started using an oil cleaner and never had a bad acne breakout again. Hydrated skin does not need to produce more oil, simple.I have been using one brand or another ever since I saw it work so well on my daughter. You absolutely can use coconut or olive oil but you will be left with that oily coat on your skin. This Beauty Oil is formulated to foam with water and that is what washes the oil from your skin. I'm not sure which ingredient it is, the label is very tiny.To use, take one or two drops of the Thermale Beauty Cleanser and massage in in, I even used it on my eyes to remove mascara. It totally dissolved all make up and dirt! After you're done, add a few drops of water to your hands and massage it intot he oil on your skin. It emulsifies and gets creamy, the final step in removing the oil from your face. I suggest you wipe off with a washcloth and not too much water.It left my skin so soft, no residue, no dryness at all. It has a slight scent but nothing too heavy.If you use this, you do not need a separate makeup remover. Recommended!

The Professional Digital Scale is very slim and very easy to store.  It has a Tare feature so the lack of accompanying bowl doesn't matter. You can use any bowl or plate and just reset it to zero to weigh the contents. You can switch to metric with a push of the button. I compared weights with two other scales and the Famili was right on the money. The readout is large and bright and the surface is easy to clean. This really is a beautiful scale that can be tucked away alongside your cookbooks or in a drawer, it's very low profile.I received the item free for testing, evaluation, and review. I found nothing but positive features and recommend. Great product

Argan Oil is usually sold heavily scented and although I like the scent, at some point, all these products start fighting each other and my perfume. InstaNatural's Argan Oil is unscented and a little on the thinner side than some I am used to. This is wonderful for my fine hair, less greasy and absorbs really well.I made a wonderful hand scrub with this oil, InstaNatural Emu, the Vitamin C Serum, Hyaluronic Acid and some nice pink sea salt.  I make about a week's worth at a time to keep the ingredient fresh and to keep it all from separating.  The Emu helps transport the Vitamin C into the layers of skin and the Argan and Hyaluruonic Acid combined with the salt scrubs away dead skin and infuses it with moisture and softness you;ll have to experience to believe. I love this line, everything so far has been excellent, generous in size, effective, and very affordable.I received products for free to test, evaluate, and review. Really Good Stuff, recommended

I never heard of Hyaluronic Acid until I was given a free sample bottle to try. I was four days post a TCA hand peel and my skin was looking like crepe paper. I used the serum just once and it immediately changed the appearance and lessened the old lady look I was going to have to sport for at least a week. I think it actually helped the peeling process by keeping my hands so moisturized, almost like what happens when you soak a blister.I use it twice a day with some added InstaNatural Emu oil. Emu should really be mixed with all creams, lotions, and serums as it helps transport the good stuff through the layers of skin.It is very thin, spreads evenly and quickly, and I didn't experience any irritation at all. It's a pretty big bottle and a little goes a long way.I received this for free for testing, evaluation, and review but will be buying more when it runs out. I haven't tried on my face yet but from the results I see on my hands, I can't wait.

Cailler Makes wonderful Swiss Chocolate and this assortment showcases some of their very best. My first taste of Cailler was from my niece's trip to Broc where she toured the facilities. She sent me some of the most delicious chocolates I have ever tasted. They are quite comparable to ZChocolates without the extra hefty price tag. This assortment is milk chocolate and when it comes to Swiss, you really want the milk vs dark. Switzerland's milk makes all the difference and it's not to be underestimated when added to the other fine ingredients.Note that the word Praline is used here, meaning the Swiss/French ground nuts, not the Southern caramel delicacies.The box arrived in excellent condition, packed beautifully in a double box, perfect for direct shipping as a gift.I am so glad other reviewers posted pictures of the actual content, my box disappeared within minutes of me opening it and I never got the chance to photograph it. They really are that good

I like the look of the Crenova WIFI Camera. It's a simple disk vs the usual bulky surveillance cameras. It very light, almost too light but that makes it easier to mount. It just doesn't feel very substantial. The trim is all painted plastic, not metal so that does make it lighter. This is a stationary camera, you can not control its movement through the app. You can swivel it away from it's base and move it manually though. The video was exceptionally clear and easy to see a birthmark on a face some feet away.  The app is easy to install and set up, I had everything running in minutes.I suggest this camera is good for specific surveillance like your front door or out in a barn to keep on eye on tools and or animals. It's not meant to be monitored as some of the others where you can follow the person around.The camera does everything it claims with one drawback. The video is instant unless you have the sound on. With the sound, the camera lags by about 7 seconds. This is not a WIFI issue as it works perfectly without the mic on.I plan on using it for Amazon review videos where a demonstration takes two hands.I received item free for testing, evaluation, and review. I recommend if you need a low profile camera for single areas or one that can be tucked out of the way when you don't need it.

This is an incredibly useful thermometer if you have a sick child. It's not meant to just do a quick temp check if you think your child is getting sick. It's designed to be worn over a period of time. It's an unobtrusive way to monitor without having to wake them up, and you for that matter. You can preset it to be warned when their fever rises or reaches the point you need to intervene. That means better rest for both child and parent.The battery life is good for continuous use for a year  but obviously,  it should last longer since you won't be leaving it on. The app was easy to install and use, the Bluetooth connected easily to the Galaxy S4.The medical tape bit comes with to secure the thermometer removes without pulling delicate skin but stays in place to do its job.The readings were very accurate, I compared to a forehead, ear, and digital oral to receive the same result as the Temp Sitter. I received this free to test, evaluate, and review. .and will be adding this to new mommy and baby gifts for showers and births. It's excellent, innovative,  functional,  and comes packaged nicely for giving. Recommended!

It seems to take a lot of serum to cover my face, one little pump does not spread. It feels just like a thick moisturizer, not anything close to what I believe a serum should be. My skin felt like it would had I used a lotion, nothing dramatic, nothing special. It's also very heavily scented.

This scent of the Keratin Shampoo and Conditioner needs to be made into a perfume. It is so fresh and delicious, I hate to rinse it off. The scent lasts on my hair all day...something to think about if you're sensitive to perfumes. This is a smoothing treatment for your hair and excellent if you straighten with a flat ion. I couldn't believe how the hair just glides through the iron, totally protected from the heat...and no frizz or scorched ends.This is a little too much conditioner for my fine hair so I avoid my scalp and only use on the ends, every other shampoo. It's wonderful...I haven't tried a Luseta product yet that wasn't.I received item free for evaluation, testing, and review.

Compared to the popular, high priced life case, this case is not only better but easier to use and still completely waterproof. I tested with cardboard before putting my phone in and it was completely dry. I do suggest you always do that first, just to be safe.This case is lighter, better looking, and also has easier access to buttons, all without that annoying muffled voice sound. The screen is very responsive and you get a headphone cord extender so you can still use the jack in wet conditions. It also allows easy charging if you use the Apple lightening cord. If you have an after market cord that has a metal jacket or thick rubber casing around the plug, it might not work.This is an excellent product at an excellent price..I wouldn't hesitate to order more at full price and would love one for the Galaxy lineItem received free for testing and review

Another great addition to the Luseta line, the Macadamia Hair Oil Treatment is a must for color treated or overly dry hair. I use it just on my ends because I have fine hair and my daughter uses it all over on her curly mane. This is what I consider a dry oil, it absorbs beautifully, it doesn't lay on your hair. When used on curly hair, it helps define each wave and adds so much shine without weighing it down.  On my fine, straight hair, using it on my ends stops the fly aways and brittleness that always occurs after blow drying. This stuff is a keeper. I received free for testing and review...Highly recommend, especially for curly hair.

This is the first time I am trying Vichy products and I think they now have a new fan. This Hydration Cream is thick and rich but not greasy at all. Every bit of it absorbed into my skin and it really feels soft. I could do without the fragrance in a face cream but it is a nice scent.I always test products on my hands first, never knowing how my face will react.  My hands have been in and out of water all day yet still feel soft. I don't feel the need to reapply.  The jar is a little small for the price but you really need just a small amount and it lasts so long. Recommended

This is the third of this type shirt received from this seller. It is a well made, very comfortable, baggy shirt. It can be worn over leggings or even as a warm and cozy night shirt. The Mickey Mouse print is true to the famous guy, all the colors are vivid and even. The arms are snug fitting, not loose and floppy which makes it nice for smaller sizes to wear. The neckline is also smaller to it won't drop off the shoulder. My size 6 daughter looked great in this over black leggings and my friend who is between a large and extra large found it a very comfortable sweater. I like this a lot and wouldn't hesitate to buy other patterns as they are released. I received at a discount for evaluation and review.

I got these shirts in three patterns, the giraffe, the newsprint, and the Micky Mouse. All three were made beautifully and very comfortable.  The newsprint one is adorable and very soft.  As for the print itself, the headlines are real words and the text is random letters. All the stitching is even and neat, the sleeves long and snug. As with the others, it can be worn over leggings as a dress/long top for size smalls or as a nice sweater for larger sizes. The snug sleeves and smaller neckline makes it very versatile.I would suggest hand washing. Very nice.I received at a discount for evaluation and review.

For this book review,  I sought the help of a friend who is a high school ASL teacher/friend.The book aims to teach not only sign language but also the respectful etiquette for communication, such as proper eye contact when signing. The book has a lot of signing basics like introductions, colors and some elementary vocabulary.It also touches on the  way the deaf communicate using a TeleTypewriter (TTY).I find Tree Wise to be more an an introduction to the deaf culture than an actual learning  tool. Unless the reader has the guidance of a person  already knowledgeable in ASL, the illustrations of signing would too difficult for a child to on their own but all the signs are accurate.The illustrations were cute and also very basic, the tree being the best by far. I found the storytelling lacking and maybe having the tree drop apples on the kids' heads was not the best choice, especially since the age group this is geared towards take things so literal and like to imitate.It can be a helpful tool to reinforce sign language basics but I don't see any child learning just by reading this book.I received a free copy of this book for evaluation and review

My favorite source of protein now that I am full time, low to no carb. They're delicious, portable, and stop my hunger dead in its tracks. I've been eating these for a few months now. I'm glad Amazon is selling them, I can just add them to an order now. Locally, they are never in stock when I want them. Delicious fast energy with just the right amount of flavor. Not too smokey, just right

I chose this sweater in khaki and it's really adorable. It is very soft, very loose fitting and comfortable. The stitching  is neat and looks more expensive than it is. It is one size fits all, like a sweater on  a girl who wears size large to a slouchy dress on a girl who wears a size small. The giraffe print is fun but definitely not childish,  especially in the darker colors. I received  at a discount to evaluate and review and recommend it highly for fun, value, and quality.

I really like these reusable ice cubes. They arrived in a nice box as well as a plastic freezer storage case with a cute set of tongs. They are small, which for me, works very well for use in my homemade Bailey's. They were perfectly finished, no chips or scratches and were ready in a little over an hour. I poured room temperature Bailey's and they really did chill my drink to a perfect temperature.  It's not a drink I enjoy warm and ice just dilutes it. These worked out perfectly. I can see them used in wine as well, for those of us that like it cold. It made a really nice, small gift set and would be a fantastic addition to a gift basket or housewarming gift (along with some alcohol)They would also be wonderful for baking, when you have to cool a liquid before adding eggs and ice would only ruin the mix. I used to use a baggie with ice and that was a mess. I will always keep a few sets of these in my freezer!Item received free for evaluation, testing, and review...recommended for quality and function, purchasing two more sets!

I am not exaggerating when I say, I want to wear this as a perfume. The scent is absolutely heavenly. I have fine hair and this is one Argan Oil product that didn't weigh my hair down or leave it greasy. There are no sulfates either and that's helps to keep curls bouncy as well. For a product that is so oil rich, it did not leave my hair greasy at all. It's jam packed with goodness, protein, keratin, sunflower, and Argania Spinosa Oil.  It was excellent on my color treated hair and will be a part of my hair care routine. I will not hesitate to purchase when the generous sample jar if finished.Item received free for testing, evaluation, and review

I chose these glasses to review because I find Wayfarer the most generic design, looking good on everyone and easy to buy sight unseen. What arrived exceeded my expectations and also proves my point. I had to pry them out of my 21 year old son's hands long enough to give them a once over and check them out. That lasted all of five minutes and they've been in his grip ever since. He loves them and says they're very comfortable and the lenses are clear to see from. I found them really comfortable as well , the arms open and close very smoothly and fit perfectly over my ears.  I too find the lens clear and distortion free, easy to wear with contacts. I have trouble finding sunglasses because of this reason, something about my RX and cheap tinted lenses don't mix. . The case adds a nice level to the glasses, it's leather and smart looking. I felt, just for those 5 minutes I actually had these glasses, lol, a little fancy.  I received these free for evaluation and review and will be buying another pair to keep for myself. Recommended

I wanted to like this smart watch, especially since it was so affordable. The description clearly states you will need a SIM in order to use the features so I didn't take off any stars for that. The problem is the features you get without are not so great. I had to try three times before the watch paired with my Samsung. It was set to visible and yet remain obscure until I was almost ready to give up. The calculator works but the keys were unresponsive , everything on this watch requires do overs. The keyboard requires multiple tapping to find the letter, like a phone dating back to 2005. Once paired, it was able to play music from my phone but was so scratch and muffled, I can't imaging why anyone would use it with their phone right there.I don't want to pan the entire watch while admitting not being able to test the entire watch. I was willing to purchase a card to use the phone but once I went through the features and options, I decided against putting any money into it. I don't care for it at all. Kids may find it cool if they're at the pre-phone age.Item receive free for evaluation, testing, and review

I've been reading about Va Va Ajvar in a few cooking magazines and had to try it. People were saying they bought it by the case, it was impossible to find on the shelves. I now know why. It is absolutely delicious. The jar I received was different from the one displayed on the listing and it was bigger, 420 Grams, not 300. The ingredient list is impressive, just red pepper, eggplant, salt, and sunflower oil. It's 100% natural, no GMOs, low in carbs and fat. It seems like an easy spread to make but getting the perfect balance like Va Va did will be more difficult. I ate it straight from the jar but it can be used on anything, the flavor is so mild and complementary. Now, I have to look for a good deal on a case, this jar won't last long. So good, good for you, and..did I mention...SO GOOD!

My order (from Amazon) did not include any chalk, just the eight pieces of vinyl chalkboard paper. Four of the eight had damaged ends, peeled away and curled. They're only good for cutting into labels now, they're useless as intended, to make a big board. I think you get what you pay for. I wouldn't recommend. Item received free for testing, evaluation, and review

The Pixnor Facial Brush is a very small, very lightweight battery operated facial brush. It actually feels a little cheap, IMO. It comes with7 options and even one for pedicures. There's no comparison to the sonic or high end facial brushes but it does do what it say. For the price, it's much better than a washcloth and the sloughing stone option gives this brush more versatility. Please note, it does not come with batteries. Item received free for testing, evaluation, and review

Arrived fully charges and ready to go. The indicator lights are very low key which I like. It has dual ports so you can charge two phones at a time and it has the power to charge them quickly. The Power Bank took an I Phone 6 from dead to full in about an hour and 30 minutes. This is the same time as from a wall charger. The indicator lights only decreased by one at the end of the phone's charging. There's plenty of juice left to charge the phone at least 5 more times. Excellent!It's lightweight compared to some of the other higher capacity external batteries but still is heavy compared to last year's lipstick chargers, that didn't work.These external batteries have come a long, long way and this is a really good one. I really haven't come across a bad one yet, after testing quite a few. I feel the technology is excellent.Item received free for evaluation, testing, and review

I use coconut oil sparingly because it's expensive and I can only get small sizes locally. This was an offer I was so glad to try, a huge jug of my favorite cooking,wearing oil!. It arrived completely melted, as coconut oil does in the heat. It was crystal clear and the fresh coconut aroma was strong and delicious. The taste is impeccable, it's really just wonderful on everything. When ordering any oil through the mail, freshness is a concern. The company sent product with a date code a year away so no worries about quality or freshness. I don't think you can beat the value of this Cold-pressed, Unrefined, organic, virgin coconut oil. My local big name health food store is about 4 times the price. EXCELLENT!Item received free for testing, evaluation, and review...now a customer!

I received a sampling of a variety of these bulbs through international shipping and every single one arrived intact and in perfect shape. I know what a feat that is because I can't get a four pack home from the local W Mart without losing at least one.Kingso makes some beautiful bulbs. I received this styles as well as a few others. As I opened each box, my kids and I let out audible "ooohs." The best I can describe them is they're beautiful works of art. All the bulbs I received have the same base but the filaments!! Oh the filaments! Each one is designed differently to give off a showy, lighted display. There are coils, loops, multiple straight strands, and curly loops all encased in a beautiful amber glass. Thee are leaps and bounds ahead of a typical incandescent bulb and there's just no comparison to the sanitary look and feel of the new LED bulbs. The Vintage Edison Bulbs will add that final touch of class to any fixture. I am really in love. Item received free for testing, evaluation, and review. GORGEOUS!

These were my ABSOLUTE FAVORITE. I received a sampling of a variety of these bulbs through international shipping and every single one arrived intact and in perfect shape. I know what a feat that is because I can't get a four pack home from the local W Mart without losing at least one.Kingso makes some beautiful bulbs. I received this styles as well as a few others. This was the first lower priced instant thermometer I have sampled that was as accurate as my professional ones. I am so impressed. There is a release button the bounces the probe from its resting position and, of course, your choice of either Celsius or Fahrenheit. The process is simple, poke your food and read the temperature, it's that easy. It can determine the rising temperature and then lock in the final within six seconds.The value is incredible and the quality is right up there with the big boys. Highly recommended, especially if you live in fear of misplacing your pro version costing 5 times more. Good Stuff, great deal

I have been using one brand or another of Cedarwood oil for about three years now. Simply Earth's Cedarwood is a good product in comparison and an excellent value. This oil did not irritate my skin or cause any issues whatsoever. It has a woody yet slightly citrus scent and it is very mild. If you use it on your skin, no worries of smelling like a lumber jack. It's actually a very pleasant scent.I mix three drops of the Cedarwood with about three tablespoons of coconut oil and store it for use as a scalp treatment, bug repellent, and if I have cough or congestion, I add a few more drops and apply to my chest.I love it and find it one of the more useful essential oils, it's versatile and a good value. Recommended.This bottle came with a protective seal and was very well protected.Item received free for testing and review

The Smart Weigh Scale is low profile, the bowl stores upside down over the scale for compact storage. Its blue black light is sharp and adds a bit of pop to a usually boring kitchen tool. You can use any bowl you like with its extra wide base, all you need to do is hit the on button again to return to zero. I compared the weight to two other kitchen scales I have and it is very accurate.To bake properly and have better results, I always weigh my dry ingredients vs using "a cup of flour."  A kitchen scale is essential for this and this one gets the job done and is an excellent value. Nice!Item received free for evaluation, testing, and review.

The Aukey Charger arrived fully charged and ready to go. This one has a lot of batter power but slimmer than most, making it easy to carry. It fits in the cell phone pocket of my purse. The bigger the external battery, the heavier they become so be aware, it's no lightweight. I recharged an RCA Tablet from 25% to 100 in a little over an hour. My Galaxy went to 100% from 50% in 39 minutes. It has dual ports so you can charge two devices at a time, expect it to take a little longer if you do. Recommended.Item received free for evaluation, testing, and review.

This is a pretty, two toned, geometric  shape necklace. It has a decent clasp and a medium  weight chain. It's a nice change for signet jewelry, very modern and different.Item received for free for evaluation  and review

Lancaster Soft Cremes Assorted Tin comes packed for giving. My first impression was these would be wonderful to send as a corporate gift or food gifts to family. The presentation is excellent and I wouldn't hesitate to ship them directly. Please note, even though they are called "Lancaster" and are inspired by Hershey's recipes, they are really a product of CANADA, just distributed by Hershey's in Pa. That said, I don't think that's necessarily a bad thing, but if you're looking for a traditional gift or product from Hershey, Pa, this isn't going to be the one to choose.The caramels are made from a lot of ingredients I never put in mine but some are necessary for stabilization and storage of a mass produced item.They taste good, there's nothing inherently wrong with them but they don't taste "traditional" or homemade. They're still better than the bag of Kraft's you find in the grocery candy isle but nothing like some of the homemade types you will find around the holidays from the big cooking store or other vendors. I think if you're looking for a gift to send out to 50 employees for the holidays and want to stay away from the catalogs that sell food sized to fit in a miniature dollhouse, these are a fantastic alternative. They're great for around the house or to serve as well, all individually wrapped and the tin is really nice and sturdy.

In my experience, De'Longhi is one of the better appliance companies for quality and customer service. I own a few different products and they have all been top quality in their price range. Their 15 Bar Pump Espresso and Cappuccino maker does an excellent job keeping me highly caffeinated. It's a simple plug in, rinse, and prime setup, the same as any other coffee maker. It comes with three grind baskets for your choice of single or double as well as one for espresso pods. I used Lavazza Italian espresso exclusively as it the best I have ever tasted.The handle is a tight fit which is very important if you want to avoid splatters, burns, and decreased pressure. You don't have to work that hard to secure it in place, another plus.I pulled my first cup and was pretty pleased with the crema from such an inexpensive machine. I know the coffee itself has a lot to do with it but I have used Lavazza on inferior machines and it produced an inferior cup. The espresso was steaming hot and delicious. I don't think you really need an expensive machine for excellent results.Using the milk steamer/frother takes a little practice if you've never done it before but it's really simple. Just take care not to burn yourself. I both steamed and frothed two batches of milk and the machine performed flawlessly. My preference is steamed and it was the perfect temperature, not too cool as to ruin the espresso in the cup. Another trick that you can use is to steam your milk first and pull your espresso over it. It keep the coffee from cooling while you work the milk.I feel you have to have both, an excellent coffee and a quality machine or the end result will be disappointing. If you try this machine with a bargain espresso at a few bucks a bag, you'll get a cup of the same value. I also use boxed, shelf stable milk, ALWAYS. It's a trick I picked up from a European barista and it also makes a big difference, to me.I love this machine and recommend, for the value and the quality of the espresso it produces. It's great. This is De Longhi's all stainless steel version, the operating and features are identical to the black and stainless model, differences are all cosmetic.

These are the softest washcloths I have ever tried. They feels super soft and luxurious. They are chemical and dye free so they are safe for babies but they're also perfect for adults. I gave myself a facial and finished off with a steamed Motherhood washcloth. It felt softer wet and I'll apologize ahead of time to the baby that won't be getting these, I'm keeping them for myself. hey come packaged for giving which is nice and with six in a pack, you get a great value. I received the item free for testing and review...and I love them

I usually use an electric sharpener but I end up with dull knives because I'm too lazy or forget to do it before actually needing the knives. I love the ease of this sharpener, no plug needed so I can keep it right where I need it. I sharpened my Wufstof knives and they were sharp in an instant. This also has a three stage system to finely tune how you like your knives. Be careful, they will be sharp.It is weighted so you only need one hand to steady it on the space provided, far enough away from your knife blade for safety. It's a brushed stainless with black trim and fits beautifully on my knife drawer. I really like it a lot. EXCELLENTItem received free for evaluation and review.

An excellent Vitamin C Face serum that smells like a fresh cut orange. It is non irritating and felt just wonderful on my skin. After using it nightly,  for a week, I feel it has really improved the look of my skin. I use it along with the http://www.amazon.com/Retinol-Cream-2-5%25-Moisturizer-Face/dp/B00Q5ERAWQ/ref=sr_1_7?s=hpc&ie=UTF8&qid=1442262523&sr=1-7&keywords=instanatural every other day and in between, I use the http://www.amazon.com/Night-Cream-Moisturizer-Face-Niacinamide/dp/B00OHXPMCM/ref=sr_1_5?s=hpc&ie=UTF8&qid=1442262523&sr=1-5&keywords=instanatural. I break it up to give my skin a break and this routine has really worked. The Retinol Moisturizer goes on smooth and just like the Vitamin C Serum, it did not irritate my skin yet seems to be smoothing and clearing up the dark spots. The Night Cream moisturizer applied after a hot shower just sinks into my skin and absorbs very quickly. These are excellent products, some of the very best I've tried. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND, this is a great line!Item received free for evaluation and review.
