This RFID Blocking wallet is a classic men's wallet, made from real leather. You can smell the familiar scent as you open it, it's not the creatively named fake leather being passed off these days. It is big enough to hold all your cards and cash, yet appropriately sized to be comfortable in your pocket. The RDIF flap protects your identity from electronic stealing. It's very nice and packed in a great box for gift giving. RecommendedItem received free for evaluation and review.

The fragrance is wonderful, it's the first thing I noticed as a little leaked in the box. Nexxus Emergencee is wonderful on curly hair but not so great on my fine hair. It weighed it sown and left me greasy looking.  My daughter used it and it tamed her full head of curls and reduced the look of split ends. If used on the right hair, it can be really great. There's no mention on the bottle for hair types though.

1:37 MinsAs you can see from my short video, these phone cases are waterproof as described. I tested them with some brown paper so any water leakage would be clearly visible. The paper remained perfectly dry both under water and with the faucet running on the case and latch. The clear part is very thick and I would not hesitate to use with my phone after seeing the interior remain dry. I would have been happy to use my phone for part of the video but I would have no way to record it. They would be great for the beach, water-parks, in the rain, or boating. I recommend for quality, durability, and price. It's a good deal...and they float too. Item received free for evaluation and review.

No product can work if you can't get it past your mouth. I am usually able to give anything a try even if I don't use it again, I'm not that sensitive to bad tastes. This made me gag and I ran to  the sink to spit it out. I can't imagine anyone being able to swallow this stuff. I think it needs to go back to the drawing board.

I purchased this for my business and the cover is absolutely adorable.  I couldn't imagine a more perfect cover for our point of sale tablets. There is a shine to the cover which gives it a bit of pizzazz. The four corners are elastic so they're easy to slip on and off if you need to remove the tablet from the cover. The interior is a suede like material, soft and very gentle on your screen. It's also very lightweight, it won't add much to the total weight you're carrying around. For price and quality, as well as instant branding for my FragrantAgent-Pink Zebra business, it's a steal.  I can see this being a big hit with teens or college students as well, it's fun and really looks great. I love mine.

This TENS unit is an excellent unit at an excellent price. We just had to return one prescribed by the doctor or we were free to pay thesix hundred dollar, insurance buy out. I laughed and put it in the provided envelope which was promptly returned. There is no discernible difference between this ChoiceMMed and the fancy priced one. You have the option of stimulation or massage, it's about the size of a thin remote so no bulky pack to walk around with and most importantly, it is FDA approved. You have choices too. You can adjust stimulation, intensity, and speed. You can also choose from multiple preset programs to find what makes you feel the best.  It comes with just four pads so you may want to order some at the same time. The enclosed pads are good for 80 or more uses though, depending on how well you take care to keep them clean and how well you store them. This is a good find, recommended for value and effectiveness. Item received free for evaluation and review.

Set up was easy. The two pieces zipped together without issue. My bigger worry would be how well this held up to being punched. The top part is very light foam. Having access to a wavemaster xxl at work and reading some of the reviews about this one going over easily I was a bit worried.I am 6'3" 215. I don't think I am a strong puncher but can bench 315 and so far have had no issues with this bag. Where with the wavemaster xxl I can go pretty much all out, here I need to back down a bit, but not as much as I thought, and mostly just on straight punches near the top. You can hammer fist on it, put it on the ground, knee strike it, kick it, etc....... Jabs will rock it back and forth, but get into a nice rhythm and you can hit it pretty hard on the return. Hits to the body area work well and there is not a lot of slide to it. Yeah if you deck it with a full force punch or kick, you will really flop it, but I almost never find myself doing that. I really went back and forth on this for a few weeks before pulling the trigger, mostly worried it would be to little for my needs,but I am very glad I did get it as it was exactly what I was hoping for.Other benefits are that it takes up very little space, is easy to move around, and seems very well built. The top handles are nice to hold onto for certain strikes and you can do sit ups into strikes on it as well. It also looks great.

Very heavy duty, good value for price. Shipped quickly and arrived before estimated delivery date. A little stiff starting out but that only enhances the workout. Should last a long time in most settings. I am using mine in the yard and using a kettle bell for an anchor point. 6'3" 215 and this rope will give you a great workout.

Great bench. Ordered with prime and came in two days. Box was solid and no damage or issues. Pad is double boxed as are nuts and bolts, so even if outer box takes a hit, the inside stuff should stay safe. Set up was easy and they include two basic wrenches if you are with out tools. I used a socket set but you could put it together just with what they send you.Bench is very sturdy once up. I set it up and tightened the bolts once level and it is stable. No issues. Pad is thick, firm, and seems of decent quality. Steel is of normal thickness and welds looked good to my eye. The pad measures 12" across, which was my primary reason to go to this even though my older body solid bench still looks brand new. The body solid pad is 9.5" across. I am 6'3" 215ish and having been able to use a wider bench outside my home, I think it supports my shoulders more when benching heavy, as well as supports my body better. Having looked around this seemed liked one of the better bangs for your buck out there and I appreciate the reviewers before me giving their feedback. I am happy with it and was what I was looking for.

I went back up to a 28 ounce after swinging a 26 for years. I usually pick up a new bat each season and have been fond of Demarinis and Miken. My only Easton was the original connexion. Although now in my 40's I can still hit for power at 6'3" 215ish. This bat was surprising good out of the wrapper. I don't know if it was the end load or the extra 2 ounces (or a combination) but I have hit this for more power with the newer ASA balls than anything in recent years. Feels good on contact and has both a large sweet spot and pop. I would think the 26 and 27 ounce bats would be equally good and more useable for a team bat. I love mine though and have been very happy with the purchase.

These taste good, getting a thumbs up from all 4 members of our household who tried them. 180 per container with 6 making a serving. Good mix of vitamins and minerals. 110% of recommended folate plus 455mg of fish oil.

This is a very nice looking knife. I have a set of kitchen aid ceramic knifes so I am familiar with them. This chef knife is slightly longer than my others which is nice for larger items. My other ceramics have held up well and other then avoiding bones, frozen stuff, etc... I pretty much use and abuse them, plus toss them in the sink/ dishwasher. I will have to see if this one does as well, but no reason to suspect it won't. I like the ceramics as they are very sharp and really work great on fruits/ veggies. If the length isn't an issue I generally will grab my ceramics over my metal knifes (shuns).

Like the red rooibos offered by this brand, you get a lot for a decent price. I like green tea and red rooibos. The green rooibos I would probably rate as better tasting than green tea. Wasn't sure what to expect but I liked it a lot.

Got these for softball. Very comfortable to wear. Good clarity. No issues with them slipping while running or anything. Pretty much forget they are on. Also are very study and compare well to my Native and Nike sunglasses. I like the optic yellow and at least feel I can see the ball better. Even on a cloudy day or at twilight the optic yellow can be worn and seems bright. It is however a very different shade then most may be used to and might not appeal to everyone.
Quite a bit here for a decent price. When I consistently use it, I feel I do lift more total weight and more weight in later sets, with fatigue setting in later. I would buy again when I run out.

Packaged well and comes with a little scoop. Also with a piece of paper telling you about how many mg the scoop holds. Includes a data sheet saying what it is and what the batch testing was. 200 grams is a lot. If you don't need it in pill form and trust it is what it says it is, then this blows pills out of the water in so far as bang for your buck. I just add a scoop to my coffee or tea. 2-4 per day. No negatives noted. I think this will a year or more.

This is a nice basic charger. Long cords and you can hang it on the wall. Build quality seems to be good. I usually remove my batteries when charging so this set up is fine for me. Price is good and small size make it easily packable.

Delivery was via truck. They called a few days ahead to set up a day and approx. time. They also set up a call for the delivery day to give me at least a half hour to get home. Everything went well, I got the call, and they hit their delivery window. Comes in a big box sealed securely and no issues with damage or anything like that. Easy to move despite it size as the weight isn't bad on it.The chair is large but light enough for one person to move it. The wicker is very thick, much thicker than cheaper sets. Color on the wicker is deep and dark. The pillows are also very well made with good material, density, and color. The small back pillow has a nice color and design to it. This is a high end chair with good build quality. It also looks great in person with the colors. I am impressed. If going outdoors it is always tough to gauge how long something will hold up, but I would think this would outlast lower end store bought stuff by quite a bit. On a 3 season porch or something similar, this should hold up for a long long time.

These are a good lower level paper towel. The texture is a bit rough but it has good raised patterning to help with scrubbing and liquid absorption. It is also pretty strong both wet and dry for a basic paper towel. It is not their top end product but to me it feels a notch up from the uber cheap stuff and store brand basics that are out there. I don't feel I need the top notch ones for most of my uses anyways so these basics work great for us. If I could change one thing, it would only be to add the half perforations to the towels as sometimes it is nice just to use part of one vs. a whole one.

I had a DC07 for a number of years and replaced it with a DC50 6-8 months ago. This VU3000 by Samsung is very similar in size/shape/weight to the DC50. What I liked about the VU3000 and why I gave it 5 stars.1.) Build quality is good. Equal to the Dyson from what I could tell. Nice heavy plastics. Hose cord uses thicker rubber between "slinky" segments which seem to be equal to the Dyson and I think it will hold up fine. MSRP is pretty good for what you are getting here. 5 year warranty posted on the box.2.) Took me just a few minutes to unboxed it, snap a few parts together easily, and start to go. Everything was well marked and intuitive.3.) Cord is longer than the DC50, I can reach my whole floor from a central jack, can't do that with the DC50.4.) Suction is better then the DC50. Both are very low slung in so far as the pick-up head goes and create a nice suction to the floor. With the VU3000 I have to open the "back off the thrust" hole in the handle in a lot of places like large throw rugs, etc.....as it really wants to suck down on some surfaces in its full mode. Doing that is easy as there is a small twist in the handle that opens a dime size whole to take suction out of the system when you are getting to much. Backing down suction is always better then not having enough. Take the handle out and I thought the VU3000 was offering some really nice suction at the nozzle, especially with the narrowing attachment on.5.) I like the handle/hose design. I am taller at 6'2" and I can pull the handle out and hold onto it while the straight piece runs along the floor, etc...You can also remove just the smaller handle.6.) Turning it into a canister vac of sorts is also very easy and works well. Drops the brush head for weight savings and better clearance as you tote it around. Good design, and like all the other snap together areas, it removes/goes together easily but when together is locked in tight. Combine that with the handle design I like in #5 and I like it even more.7.) Canister dump is easy.8.) Came with extra small spinning brush head.The build, suction, and price on this unit it great. I like the Dyson ball feature and if you could incorporate that into the VU3000 it would be about perfect. Even so the VU3000 "drives" fine just not quite like the ball. The DC50 also seems to shed hair off the brushes better (actual awesome in this regard, I have two in my house with long hair and the DC50 brushes have stayed spotless). The ergo handle is the same height and style as on the DC50 so they are equal there. Both heads are very slim and fit under a lot of furniture a few more inches than my DC07 ever did. The canister dump is also a bit tight just like on the DC50. My DC07 had more clearance between the center and sides, so everything slid out easily. As the manufacturers have condensed the vacs into smaller/lighter units that distance has closed enough that the picked up material kind of sticks in there and you need to gently pull it out at times. Both the VU3000 and DC50 do it and it is just a trade off for the small size.Last year I gave the nod to the DC50 over my DC07 despite some trade offs in suction, canister dumping, and shorter cord as I liked the lighter weight, slimmer head, hair shedding from brushes, and ball maneuvering. I am going to lose the ball and hair shedding with the VU3000 but keep the light weight, slim head while gaining back suction, longer cord, better stick functioning, and canister mode. It is a close contest but the VU3000 is going to become my main vac.

Set up took about 5 minutes and was pretty easy and straight forward. Decent weight to it and it tears into the ground without issue. I previously had a small gas one about the same size that just didn't want to start after a few years and started leaking around the seals. With electric I am hoping for longer life and less mess. So far so good. Matches the gas for power with less noise and no odor. Only draw back is the cord limits how far from the house you can use this. I used a heavier gage cord just to be on the safe side.

Put it on around the first of April in MN as directed via spreader. Smaller granules than most, with-in a rain I was not seeing them in the yard anymore like I do with some of the bigger ones which can take a few rains to soak in. 18 days later grass is starting to take off due to rain and temps and has a darker shade of green then my neighbors lawn. I would use this product again.

Even though there are hundreds of reviews I will still chip in. I am in my 40's, non smoker, 1-3 cups coffee or tea a day drinker. Teeth were getting a bit stained.I used the tooth paste along with the mouth wash from the same line. Cost about 12 bucks total. I used a sonic care tooth brush and brushed/ rinsed twice a day. Took about a week before I really noticed it and at 14 days I am comfortable saying that it without a doubt whitened my teeth. They are not TV anchor white, but much better than before. For the price and convenience it is five stars.  Mild peroxide sensitivy for me, but that was from the mouth wash. Beats strips, gels, etc.... though for me hands down and I am pleased with it.

My son has all the other Skylander games including swap force for the wii. He wanted this one as the story is different from the wii version and it has different characters in the bundle. He spent his own money to get it and loves it. No issues for him with the software or hardware.

I am going to lean toward these working for overnight BPH. They are horse size pills so I try to take them on a empty stomach to enhance there break down. I take one in the morning and one at bedtime. You can also take them pre meal if you are looking to reduce cholesterol. Both the cholesterol lowering and BPH treatment seems legit based on what research I could find online. I know for me the need to go in the overnight period or that 2-3 hour period before you wake up has been significantly reduced. The price on this brand is pretty good as well.
I got the rain forest blend. Works great, no residue. Taste is fantastic. Price was very tough to beat. Bio degradability is a plus. I will be ordering these again.

I was pleasantly surprised by the natural flavor. It is a greenish powder that mixes completely with just a spoon or knife. Liquid is green and looks like it will taste nasty. It actually isn't bad. Pea protein is the main component but that taste is hidden ok. Don't get me wrong it isn't double chocolate fudge tasting by any means but I can drink it normally without having to chug it or plug the nose, so kudos to the manufacturer. Second surprise was that it is very easy on the stomach. I even did two drinks with-in 3 hours with an hour of volleyball in between just to test it and nothing. No stomach discomfort, no gas, and no runs. Plenty of energy during volleyball as well. Again kudos. This is a pricey but good choice to maybe avoid whey, get some vitamins/probiotics in a natural formula. I have tried several of this brands products now and have been impressed with the taste, quality, and consistency of the products.

Great fit and comfort. No leakage. Prefer over goggles or a full mask. This is my second one. Only got another as my first pair (still good after 5 years) is clear and I wanted a smoked lens for bright days at the pool. Have had this brand (different size/style) for the kids for about 5 years as well and they have been faves. Again due to the comfort, ease of adjustment, and they keep the water out.

When this drops in price every so often I grab a bag as it is the best deal I have found on muscle milk. I usually just drink plain whey protein more than this but muscle milk is by far the best tasting product I have found. This is something I actually look forward to drinking for the taste alone.  I like the blend of nutrients and usually have this at work as more of a meal replacement when time is an issue or the hunger pangs hit and do whey at home for adding protein. No digestive issues for me with. I would recommend it.

I am 6'3" 215ish, older but in OK shape. I found the chute to offer a decent amount of resistance but not overpowering. I think that is mostly due to my size (and probably my inability to run as fast as I once did). The quicker you can go the more resistance I found. I prefer the light resistance vs. something that would feel like someone holding a rope behind me.Build wise I thought it was fine for the price. Straps were good, not overly robust but just fine for personal use. The chute itself feels like a thin windbreaker material. Very kite like feel. It comes with a storage bag. I don't anticipate any issues with it in my normal personal setting, but I take good care of my items. It was actually a bit bigger unfurled than I thought it would be. I think a smaller runner or youth runner who could generate some speed would get very good resistance out of the chute. As it is I think I will get some use out of it this summer or give it to my wife who coaches girls track in a few weeks here. If I go that route I will update this review with her thoughts as well as how it holds up it that setting.If you are like me and don't have any hills nearby or want to add add some resistance to a gentle slope this is perfect. Although to avoid looking like a dork I will probably limit my use to a grass infield/park or track. Gives you enough resistance to be noticed without impacting your stride. Good tool.

Good starter set. This went to my 8 year old daughter. She has one prior latch hook set, and she picked up the concept quite quickly. A lot of color choices here, instructional book, and a single large white piece of backing you can cut or shape. Color in the backing to create your design. Hook and latch is good for crafty kids who have some patience as the process takes sometime to complete.

I have the Orange/bronze. Adult male large head and they fit fine meaning they are comfortable even after a few hours of wear. Although plastic, it is a heavy duty type and the glasses have a nice solid feel to them. Lens clarity is very good. Comes with a case. Retro look but not over the top and they look good when on. The color I got doesn't go with everything but orange and bright orange is fairly common in athletic gear these days, especially running atire, so they do go with a lot, plus the glasses are subdued enough they don't stand out that much.

I previously had the rigid Sklz ladder which you could raise the rungs up a couple of inches. I far prefer this flat version which is now replacing it for me. It is easier to store, quicker to set up, and more robust as there is not any plastic to plastic joints. It sets up, takes down in seconds at home or at the gym. I combine ladder work with jumping rope and box jumps a few times a week. Lifting and running were ok for me but as I age those activities weren't translating as much to the few sports I still play like volleyball and softball. Adding some ladder work, etc... Just a few times a week has been noticeable for me. I like this ladder from Sklz.

I have run this for a week now, with doses between 1-3 pills per day. General mood doesn't seem changed but I might lean toward saying it has improved but to tough to say for sure. Sleep patterns as monitored via flash braclet also same as before dosing. I have noticed more intense dream activity and dream subjects from longer ago in my lifetime then I experienced before. No negatives noticed either with mood, sleep, or stomach. I will update again after a longer period of time has gone by.

The twin mattress comes compressed wrapped in heavy plastic and a thinner outer "canvas" shipping shell. Not to heavy and easy to move inside. Unlike an all foam mattress this one is not vacuumed seal. Hence it doesn't slowly return to shaped but "springs" into pretty much instantly when you get the tough plastic off it. I measured it with-in a minute of unwrapping and found it to be pretty much right at 8". Having been rolled up it isn't quite flat right away, but that goes away quickly. There is a slight "new" odor to the mattress but not too bad and less than this brands full foam offering, one of which I have.The mattress is very comfortable. I got this and a 6" full foam one at the same time. The foam version is firm where this is a bit plusher and more normal feeling. I am 215 and when backed with something firm, this mattress holds my weight quite nicely. Build quality seems to be good for this made in China offering. The outer shell is nice, it is a normal twin length, lightweight for moving. It is one sided. Price is very fair for what you get delivered to your door. Great mattress for a kid, guest bed, and likely an adults everyday bed although I can't comment yet an how it will hold up overtime with that kind of weight on it.

We went with the tablet version over the wii version due to poor reviews on the wii. Glad we did as the tablet version was cheaper, looks great on the ipad mini, comes with the same figures, and my 10 year old loves it. Portal also holds the tablet up for viewing. The controller works good and we are still on the original batteries. The portal works just as well but eats batteries. While we are on set one in the controller we are on set 4 in the portal ( went and got rechargeables after set 2). Plus it travels easily. I would recommend this version.
The interface is way too cumbersome and CPU intensive for a simple thing like listening to music. It's like having a vending machine in your computer. Everything costs.

It works well for allowing two people to listen to the same iPod simultaneously, like on a flight. Good for connecting two sets of speakers to a PC. Not shielded well enough for microphone use in heavy RF environments.

This allows you to control your Roku using a tablet, which is redundant of a remote control Good if you lost or broke the original remote, but only works with Roku devices that have wifi connection, and will not work through those with only infrared connection. Keypad entry offers some additional convenience.
It makes a reliable, solid connection at both ends. Construction quality is high, and these feel quite solid as opposed to some of the cheaper cables that feel flimsy or don't make solid connections.

This latest batch of Sony disks is defective. On six different recorders, one duplicator and three PC based systems, these Sony branded disks failed to record past about 94 minutes. Shorter than that, the recordings came out fine, but after  a 94 minute time, nearly 100 percent of the disks failed to continue recording, and would not finalize or play on any other device other than the device that recorded it. The problem stems from a faulty indication of recording time remaining, which is a status track on the disk that reads back to the recorder. This leads me to believe that these Sony disks are Chinese knockoffs and not really Sony disks at all. I had a similar type problem with some Sony branded memory sticks a few years ago, which turned out to be cheap Chinese knockoffs. It would not surprise me if this was the case again.

Bang for the buck is about as good as it gets. At only twenty dollars, this model does exactly what most home users need; it broadcasts wi-fi throughout an entire house, plus it can connect up to four wired in devices as well.First time setup is a little different form other brands in that it doesn't default automatically to a working, unsecured connection when first powered up. You need to look at the bottom of the unit for the factory default security password, or you won't be able to connect to the internet. The instructions are not immediately clear about doing this. Once learned, however, the operation of the device is simple and flawless, with numerous options for those who understand the depths of such settings.

The first thing to notice is the quality feel of these bulbs. You can see and feel how well they are assembled.The size is the same as conventional bulbs, so these fit in any fixture that had the older incandescent bulbs. Other brands have odd shaped mounts that don't allow a fit in some cans.Most users know the power benefits of LED bulbs. Much better than even the CF bulbs, and they produce almost no heat when lit. The light is diffused in a manner that illuminates the intended area evenly with no hot spots and no sharp cutoff. They produce just a bit more light than the similar dimmable model, but of course, without the dimming function.The 4000K color temperature is a matter of choice, but suffice it to say it's whiter than the 2700K of incandescent and warmer in tone than 5600K outdoor light. It's a nice even blend with daylight coming through a window, and doesn't look too bluish at night. For indie filmmakers these bulbs produce smooth, even lighting and are perfect for use in mixed lighting conditions.

This needs to be authorized by the cable provider to get all the programming, and it doesn't recognize Comcast or Xfinity as a valid cable provider.  A&E does work with some of the shows even without the authorization, but it's ridiculous not to recognize the largest cable providers in the Country.

Useless because it needs to be authorized by the cable provider, and it does not recognize Comcast or Xfinity as a cable provider, even though I get the channel on Comcast. If you're going to promote and advertise this, then make sure it works on the nation's most widely used cable provider.

Everyone knows how well Apple products are made, and this is no exception. It works flawlessly as designed with many usable apps included. The battery lasts for several hours, depending upon what you are using. Turning off wi-fi or Bluetooth when not in use extends battery life, as does lowering the screen intensity when using indoors. My only pet peeves with Apple are their proprietary power/USB connection and their proprietary means of transferring files back and forth to a computer.

Solidly constructed of anodized aluminum, this tiny fist sized light is the most powerful beacon that runs on one single AA battery that slips in without needing any caddy. This means less electrical points of contact as opposed to cheaper lights that use 3 AAA cells in a caddy, resulting in a solid contact and no flickering from loose contacts.The lens moves in and out to focus the round, spotlight beam. You can remove the lens for a 170 degree, soft pattern of light. The pushbutton switch is rear mounted so it won't get bumped in your pocket. It unscrews so it can be replaced if you ever need to.

It's much smaller than expected, but it is built exceptionally well for a toy. It's a self contained submersible power plant for the Playmobil series of toy boats, but it works with anything you make within size limits, of course. Yes, it will pull you in the pool, but barely perceptible speed if you're an adult. Of course, it was designed to propel a half pound boat, not a 200 pound human. Still, it's fun and as well made as the toys I remember as a child. Not your typical made in China crap. See a video clip. https://youtu.be/3qkQazVWIyc

Frankly, I'm amazed these can be sold for four bucks, including shipping. Cree is a major brand name in LED lighting. The small palm sized flashlight light is made from machined, anodized aluminum. It is precision constructed and feels solid as if it was made in the States thirty years ago. While most of these small lights use a 3-pack of tiny AAA batteries mounted in a carrier, the Cree uses a single AA battery that requires no carrier. Less battery cost and less mechanical contacts to make, so electrical connection is solid and there is no flickering. Rather than several dim LEDs on the front, the Cree uses one powerful LED recessed within the frame and focussed by a lens. The result is a bright, even, circular pattern of light that is more usable in more situations. The light is quite bluish in tint as compared to standard bulbs, but on par with LED lights. The rear pushbutton switch clicks solidly on-off with no in between blink settings. It is recessed to avoid accidental power-up in your pocket.The only disadvantage is it takes a few weeks to come over from China, but it's well worth the wait if you don't need it immediately.

If you use 'Square' as your credit card acceptance service, the Square Stand takes you to the next level of professionalism. It is especially useful for your store location, or if you set up a kiosk for the day at a local event. The device itself is quite heavy in order to keep the unit stable while you use it and when the client signs it.The entire unit faces you to enter the information and then rotates 180 degrees and locks in place to face your client to swipe their card and sign the screen with a finger. The device can swipe a card in either direction, as there are two sensor heads, one on each side of the card slot. The card slot is much easier to use and reads more reliably than the small square device made for phones.The power cord cleverly mounts flush under the base and faces either right or left, depending upon your choice. It stays in place as the base rotates. The charger keeps the iPad trickle charged to 100 percent and also acts as the main power source when plugged in, saving your battery.The iPad app has additional customization settings that I didn't notice on the phone app. The larger screen makes setting up your account and using the service much more user friendly. And if you decide you want to pull the iPad out and use it as a portable device, you can do that too.
A predictable single game for someone who only wants one game. It works well, but it's pretty much dated in today's digital world.

This BluRay disk brings modern day sharpness and color to a classic film. Of course, if you prefer it in Black and White, it has that version as well. You've never seen this film in as good a format unless you saw it in the theatre when it was released.
Rarely do off brand batteries measure up, but these fit well and last nearly as long as the original Sony batteries.

This doesn't have the solid feel or nice texture as the original Sony handle, nor does it have all the control features. It's a lot less expensive and works as it should, making it a great bargain for someone who needs extra power, the flexibility and professional look this device adds to your Sony DSLR.

This is the story of the original Sea Venture that came ashore Bermuda and led to its discovery hundreds of years ago as a place of beauty as opposed to the treacherous island it was once thought to be. My wife and I met on a more modern Sea Venture in the 1970s en route to Bermuda, and so this story resonates with us even more.
It works with my Sony A6000 and one of my Alpha 77 mark 2. The other A77 Mark 2 doesn't recognize it even though both cameras are the same model and set up the same way.
It doesn't do what you expect, like work with your Chromecast. Another cheesy knockoff.
It works as it should, but I preferred the messenger service that used to come with Facebook.
This bogus knockoff never worked with my Chromecast device.

I had tried an off brand before because it was much cheaper. The print was always grayish, and the printed text would rub off the paper. The first 50 or so prints also had gray banding, but this eventually went away. The prints were usable but substandard.This one here is a genuine HP cartridge and doesn't have those problems. It prints crisp, black text that sticks solidly as it should. Yes, it costs more than the off brands, but there is just no substitute for the better toner in a genuine HP cartridge.

This device was never able to receive enough satellite signal to get a reliable connection. Spot now has newer devices that are much easier to use and don't rely on a connection to a smartphone like this one does.
Despite following the instructions, I have never been able to sync this up with any of my TVs. Essentially, it's worthless and too inexpensive to bother returning.
A worthless pile of garbage. Don't waste your time. Much of it is false or made up.

The embedded 'MMarket Pay' virus negates the user friendly interface of this software on a Kindle Fire HD. If I need to access files this way, I simply plug my Kindle into my PC using a USB cable and use Windows Explorer to access the files.

One is required for each passenger aboard a boat, and this was the least expensive place to purchase these mandatory safety vests that are essentially the same from any maker. The local marine supply store wanted nearly the same amount for one vest as this six-vest package.

Just as you place a bird feeder to attract birds, this angel stand has attracted an angel to my life. This angel has come into my life and dedicated herself to making my life more pleasant. She is kind, loving, caring and beautiful. The angel, of course, is my wife.

I installed this in an ION turntable to improve the sound over the included cartridge. It makes records sound much more full with less surface noise and reduced pops and clicks from scratches. Smoother tone and slightly higher audio level is obtained from the installation as well. Includes all the hardware, needle, needle guard and four new wires for installing into an existing or a new tone arm shell. The needle guard can stay on the cartridge and flips up for use, down for needle protection.

An efficient means of storing CDs and DVDs while consuming much less room than plastic jewel cases. They don't break if you drop them and they keep mailing costs down. Nearly as resilient as Memorex, but I've had one or two seams split open with repeated use. The cost savings over other brands is certainly worthy of the few that may need to be discarded.

The cables make solid connections at both ends while offering hefty strain relief. Ground shielding is good enough to prevent the intrusion of most electronic interference from causing hum or RF noise.

First and foremost, this Bose unit has incredible sound not only for something so small, but for a speaker of any kind. The bass is full, rich and not boomy. It has a smooth and solid bottom end across the entire volume range. High end is crisp and clear as well. It can go loud enough to fill a room with music but is best suited for high end personal desktop listening. At low volume the device will play over twelve hours on a charge, long beyond its claimed time of eight hours. Lower volume has a great deal to do with increasing battery life just as judicious use of your car's gas pedal has to do with better fuel mileage.The build quality exceeds any electronic device I have ever seen. To say it is a precision piece of technology is an understatement. It truly is a finely made metal instrument, not a cheap plastic device like most Bluetooth speakers. It's good ol' American Tech like it used to be years ago.Controls are well labeled and easy to use. All you need to know beyond the basics is press the Bluetooth button quickly to toggle between established connections and new devices, hold the Bluetooth button down for ten seconds to clear the memory of linked devices, and hold the Mute button down for ten seconds to hard reset the device.There are two connectors on the right side. One for power, one for an auxiliary input from something like an iPod. You can also use it as your computer speaker for a vast improvement over what most computers already use.The only thing I wish they would add is an SD card slot in the rear of the device, as it would be nice to use this as a stand-alone music player.

The 4K video is simply stunning. The sharpness is unbelievable. The color is rich and accurate and the image is clean even in candle light. The large sensor gives a nice depth of field usually not found in camcorders in this price range. Image clarity blows away the best Canon or Nikon DSR images. Every important manual setting has a dedicated button so you don't have to go menu diving. Even when used in the AVCHD 2K mode, the image benefits from the 4K sensor and 4K quality lens. It looks better than 2K shot with a 2K pro camcorder. The image is more than good enough to use professionally (as long as you don't need to use XLR mics), It's big enough to feel professional yet small enough to get away with almost looking like a consumer camcorder. You'd be surprised to discover in some sensitive environments, just how welcoming this is.
Nice inexpensive brand name cards for storing photos and music on your phone. All of them work perfectly.

This is solid little phone for someone who needs communications around the world but does not need full data functions. It sounds clear, has text, does facebook and emails. It also has an mp3 player and bluetooth. The perfect travel phone. If you lose it, it's under 20 bucks to replace it.

DVD recording technology is mature enough to work reliably, so it didn't occur to me that Philips, one of the founding companies of the DVD format, would still have issues after twenty years. Of the first 12 disks I used, six of them failed half way though the duplication process. This is very unusual, as most brands of DVD-R have on average 1 disk per hundred that fails. I bought Philips because of their reputation. Obviously, I made a mistake and will never but this brand again.

INITIALLY:This cheap, Chinese designed and built device failed after thirty seconds. Worse than that, after making an insanely loud pulsating sound, it shut off the TV. Neither the device NOR the TV would power back on. After unplugging and factory resetting the TV, the TV came back on but the HDMI port the Micca had been plugged into was totally dead. Nothing will work in the HDMI port any more, but the analog ports were unaffected. So yes, the TV still works but without the HDMI port.I had this same thing happen years ago with another Micca device on another TV. I would have never purchased anything from this company again, but I received this device as a Christmas gift. This new device felt as if it was much more solidly built than the old unit. I figured by now they must have corrected the problem of burning out the HDMI port. I was wrong. UPDATE:Micca sent me a brand new unit without my asking them to do so. A nice gesture, but it doesn't compensate for losing the HDMI input function of my TV. I was hesitant to try this on yet another TV, so I set it up using an unused analog port first. It worked. I got brave and tried the HDMI port. It also worked. For the fact that Micca made some sort of remedy and the second device plays well enough to use it, I changed my former one star rating to two. FUNCTIONS:In the days of VHS video, you could simply remove the tape from your camcorder and play it in your VCR. The Micca Spec is the inexpensive answer for today's digital home video shooter who simply wants to remove the SD card, put it into the Micca and press Play. Of course, you need to set up the device to find the files through the menu of your data card, but once you do, this device plays the videos without needing to edit or convert them. It will play from any SD card including the newer, faster 64 GIG SDXC series cards. It will also play video, audio and stills from USB thumb drives.You can insert both a USB and an SD at the same time and choose in the menu which to play. Once you select your folder, it will play all the videos in that folder one after the other and then keep repeating them.Many camcorders today shoot one of three main video formats; AVCHD, MP4 and MOV. Some newer, high end cameras shoot a new format called XAVC. This Micca unit will play all four formats, but not perfectly. Also note there are variations of the data rates in XAVC that can well exceed the 50 MPS rate that tested OK here. There is a mild stuttering of the video frames that makes the normally smooth 60 interlaced frame video video take on the look of 30 progressive frame video. Some users may actually like the fact their videos look this way, saying it emulates the look of film. The XAVC video suffered even more from additional stuttering, but at least you can watch the video.Some bright colors tend to peak out and look overexposed. At first I thought it was how the shot was taken in bright sunlight, but the same file plays OK on my computer without looking overexposed. So it's the player, not the file. While the video may not look as good as your camcorder created it, at least you can play your native camera videos easily on this device. You can also play audio files and jpg still images. CONCLUSION:I find this device useful for previewing and sharing footage right away without editing or converting the files. For the low price, the video shortcomings are acceptable. What is not acceptable is the fact this device can wipe out your HDMI port if the device fails. From what I'm seeing plus what I've experienced with other Micca devices in the past, this unit may not last very long. That is also unacceptable. Modern digital technology, no matter how inexpensive, and despite any operational shortcomings, should always work and should never cause permanent harm to other devices connected to it. Other reviews don't paint a rosy picture for long life. If I get lucky enough to have it still working in a year, I'll raise the rating. But for now, I'm hoping for at least six months of use and praying for no damage to my TV.

The main attraction with this camera is the 4K video. 4K resolution is simply stunning outdoors and in bright interiors. But there is more to life than 4K video. Low light capability, good photo quality, hefty build quality and audio quality. These are important aspects of a camera too, and the FZ1000 is only average in these categories.Shooting outdoors after sunset, the grain in dark objects began to build up rapidly after the sun set below the horizon. Without another camera to compare this with, or comparing it against old technology, many users might accept this as normal. But next to the now similar priced Sony RX10, there is simply no comparison. The RX10 looks crisp and grain free in the dark parts of the image. The FZ1000 image becomes grainy and the edges of objects mush out too soft as the light dissipates. Any 4K advantage is long gone at this point. The Sony's 2K video reigns king in low light.Still images are pretty clear, but are grainier than other cameras in this price range. Still, for most uses, they should suffice. This is, after all, a hobbyists camera and not a pro shooter.The long lens is crisp through the mid sections of the zoom, suffering a bit in the corners with chromatic aberration at wide angle and full telephoto.White balance tends to lag quite a bit. Large areas of one color seem to fool it into neutralizing that color. For instance, outdoor shots come out with faded greens and too much purple because the dominant green color of trees and grass tends to fool the white balance circuitry. In manual control, this isn't an issue.Video data rate choices are abundant from 12 meg per second 2K mP4 files to 100 meg a second 4K files. It also allows several AVCHD modes in the 2K video settings. Shooting 2K video with a 4K camera yields some pretty sharp 2K images.The internal microphones tend to over amplify soft passages, bringing up lots of noise and hiss. The mics themselves often sounded a little muddy with voices fading fast with distance from the camera.  Luckily, there's an external mic input.The camera tends to feel a bit plasticy and creaky at times for a 900 dollar camera.In summary, for inexpensive self contained 4K video this camera is an excellent choice. There isn't much competition at this time period. If other factors like low light capability, accurate automatic white balance, crisp still photos, great sound and solid build quality are important, there are better choices available. And remember, 4K video requires an insanely fast computer to edit and a 4K monitor to view it. As of yet, there is no cost effective delivery medium for 4K home video.

The Uqique voice recorder is actually three devices in one. 1) It's a simple voice recorder. 2) It's a tiny mp3 player. 3) It's an 8 gig memory stick. The device itself is the smallest audio recorder I've ever seen. It's actually smaller and thinner than most thumb drives.It comes with a set of ear buds and a special cable that doubles as a USB charging cable and data transfer cable. There is no USB connector on the end of the device itself. The cable is the only means of transferring data or charging the device. Don't lose it.To begin recording, simply turn the switch to ON. A small red light flashes for five seconds as the unit initializes, then recording begins. Turn the switch OFF to end the recording. It's just that simple.When you plug the device into your computer, you'll see a file structure that separates the music from the voice recordings. When you want to copy mp3 files to the device for listening, be sure to drag them into the root directory so the player finds them automatically. You can also drag other types of files like text, pictures, etc for purposes of data storage. You'd probably want to add another folder marked FILES for doing that.Plugging in the cable into your computer begins the charging process as well as initiates the file transfer process. It'll charge fully in about half an hour.The recorded files are WAV format with a 48,000 hertz sample rate, recorded at 192KPS. The WAV files will time sync perfectly with most video editing programs. These WAV voice recordings reside in a folder marked RECORD. The mp3 files for your music reside in the root directory. You can switch between playing from the root or RECORD folder by pressing down and holding the (-) button.The unit has no AGC function, so you must regulate your speaking accordingly. Leaving the unit on a desk and speaking a few feet away yields an acceptable voice note recording with minimal distortion. The sound isn't rich and full but it is very intelligible for voice recordings. If you hold the unit too close to your mouth to record your speech, or if you speak too loud, it will distort but you can still understand what's being said. For classroom note taking, the sound is fairly decent from across the room. This is a voice recorder and it functions well for that purpose. Recording music sounds very thin.When you plug in headphones, the unit knows you'll be listening to music. It begins playing the mp3 files in the root directory, but won't play the voice recordings in the RECORD directory until you press and hold the (-) button. The ear buds are very tinny, but a good set of headphones yields pretty decent audio quality when playing mp3 files.Two buttons on the end of the unit double as music skip and volume buttons. Hold it down to change the volume, or click it quick to advance the songs. Being on the end means the buttons aren't likely to get pressed by accident in your pocket.In summary, this device makes a convenient little voice note taker and small mp3 player. It serves its purpose well for what it was designed to do.

This grip serves several valuable functions. The first is it takes two batteries, making your shooting time basically all day without a battery change. The second is it allows you to grip with a second hand and when you rotate the camera for portrait shots, you still have a solid right hand grip and shutter button in the correct place.One often overlooked advantage of the addition of this grip to your Alpha camera is making it appear as if you're shooting with a 5000 dollar professional rig. Clients respect it more than the camera alone which looks like every other camera. Even amateurs will move out of your way more often when they see this 'big gun' coming.The only disadvantages? More weight to carry and you may have to get another camera bag if you want to transport this without disassembling it each time.

The first thing I noticed is how well made this lens feels. It did not, however, lock tightly onto the camera. There is a small amount of slippage when rotating the focus ring reaches the end of travel. It's enough to make the image shift abruptly. The lens controls themselves, however, do have a smooth and well dampened feel to them. The totally manual focus is silky smooth with lots of travel so you can develop a feel for the focus without looking at the lens. The focus indicator is on the left side of the lens as opposed to the top, which I find a little odd. For cinema use, however, it could be welcome.Another thing that should be made clear is this lens is TOTALLY manual, not just manual focus. The iris is completely and only manual. The camera will not even recognize the iris setting. In addition, there is no image stabilization when using this lens even though the image stabilizer is in the camera body. This is not disclosed anywhere I could see.On the Alpha series, when using the image stabilizer with other lenses, there is a crop factor that slightly degrades the sharpness and wide angle capability. That crop and sharpness factor is also present in this lens even though the stabilizer isn't active. You must change two camera settings to overcome this. The first is to enable the camera to shoot without a lens attached. The other is to turn off the image stabilizer, which you can not do until you first enable the camera to shoot without a lens attached. Only when you do this will you obtain the maximum sharpness this lens can deliver.Those shortcomings having been said, this is an extremely sharp lens. The softness at full open aperture is very minimal, no more than is present in any lens when wide open. It actually enhances the smoothness of skin tones. There is barely any perceptible chromatic aberration. You'll see it only if you pixel peep on a still shot, but you'll never notice it in a video. Sharpness is consistent from corner to corner at any aperture. There is no visible barrel distortion at the edges of the frame. Door frames look straight at any point in the camera frame. The extra stop of light gathering power is valuable in a dimly lit room where the use of external lights is not permitted. That is a strong reason to buy this lens.This lens is primarily designed for cinema use and is even stated so in the packaging. For that purpose, it is exemplary for a 300 dollar lens. Although I am a strong proponent of manual lens control, I do like the idea of using a built in camera stabilizer for my hand held shots. I rarely shoot on a tripod and although I can hold a camera quite steady as I move about the room, I can't create the silky smoothness of good camera work combined with a good image stabilizer. Of course, a steady cam rig would solve this, but I prefer the freedom of using the camera with no rig attached.If you're using such a rig or are locked down on a tripod, you simply can't beat this lens in its price class. For my event uses, however, the lack of stabilization is a deal breaker.

The device fits properly on most camcorders that have a standard size cold or hot shoe. It is one of only two lights that will fit the proprietary gapped shoe of the Sony AX100. No doubt this is Sony's way of selling their lights at double the market value. I bought this because it is one of only two lights that will fit the AX100. Of course, that other one is an overpriced Sony light as well.There is a variable intensity knob. The light beam is intense enough to be used at the lowest light setting with newer, low light camcorders. This allows the two AA batteries to last over an hour. While the quantity of light is more than enough, the beam angle isn't wide enough to cover the entire video frame at wide angle. The edges around the lit area are soft. In some venues like a person standing a few feet away with nothing around them, the light will be fine on their faces while the lack of light to the sides can be attributed to the distance of whatever is behind them.There are a myriad of other lower cost lights that have wider and more even beam dispersion at well under half the cost of this light. I would buy this only if you have a Sony camcorder that can't accommodate a light with a standard mount.

The drive installed properly using the hardware from the existing drive I removed. It's quiet in operation. Read/write speed is acceptable at 3 MB/ sec but not the fastest 6MB as the more expensive drives. It is reliable so far.

The sound quality is more than acceptable for a device this size. The controls are confusing and take a while to figure out on your own. The key is pressing the mode button which does several different functions. the annoying colored flashing LED on the bottom can be turned off by holding down the mode button. The time is set using the mode button, the FM scanning and saving of stations is done using the mode button and switching from FM to AUX input also uses the same button. The secret is how long you press it down and the button you press next. The volume function and the forward / reverse functions use the same two buttons, again, timing of how long you hold one down is key. The display shows tracks as simple numbers, shows stations frequency, the station presets and the time, one at a time, of course. Good luck deciphering the Chinglish instructions. I found it easier just to experiment and learn the logic myself. Once you learn the confusing controls, it works reliably and sounds pretty darn good. A hint about FM. Radio receivers need antennas. The antenna here is either the power cable or the headphone cable. If you use this without either, there's no antenna. In that case, only one or two really strong stations might come in depending upon where you live and your distance from an FM tower.

It's a perfect means of using a hand mike with a DSLR. The audio comes out crisp and clear equally on both channels. If you can adjust audio levels on your DSL, lowering the volume reduces the AGC hiss while retaining good audio presence.

The wires are thin but functional. The real problem is the cable doesn't function as designed. One would expect that the adapter would allow one mike to work on the left channel and the other on the right. If not, then both mikes on both channels. Neither is true. It doesn't work at all because who ever designed the wiring had no clue what they were doing. They have the hot leads grounded, effectively shorting the mike signals. Rewiring the two XLR connectors solved the problem (the 1/8 inch plug is sealed in plastic and can't be accessed). The way it should have come wired is this. Pin 1 of one XLR goes to the tip of the 1/8 inch plug. Pin 2 of the other XLR goes to the thin ring on the 1/8 plug. Pins 1 and 3 on each XLR are wired together and connected to the large ring on the 1/8 inch plug. You'll need an ohm meter to trace the right wires, but if done this way, it works well. I also knotted the wire inside the XLR connector to provide strain relief, because without doing that a sudden pull on the cable would disconnect the wiring inside the XLR plug.

With so many complicated devices being made, I was drawn to this by its elegant simplicity. It does only what it is supposed to do - play music. No clock to set, no annoying flashing lights to waste battery power and no multi-function buttons to hold down for specific lengths of time to access some esoteric function you'll only use once to see what it does. And, of course, no tiny menu that you can't see without a magnifying glass or that crushes into the unit and breaks if you grab it wrong. It's built like a brick outhouse from an aluminum frame. Plus it sounds about as good as can be expected for a device its size.So why only two stars? Because the sound drops out intermittently for a fraction of a second several times over a song. It's almost like someone keeps pressing a mute button every minute or so just for a fraction of a second. I have had three of these units and all three have the same problem. It's either a design problem or a bad manufacturing batch. It isn't cost effective to return it.

I bought this because I wanted a short but heavy duty cable. Unfortunately, the barrel around the plug is too wide to allow the plug to fit all the way into the connector. Very few devices can use this cable. If the jack is recessed at all into the body of the camera, the wide barrel of this plug won't allow the plug to fit all the way into the jack.

So much technical info is already available on this camera, so I'll get right to the point.The video and still imaging created from this camera even using the kit lens is absolutely stunning. Right out of the box, all you need to do is charge the battery, insert an SD card and you can begin shooting incredible images in full automatic mode that compare or surpass the quality of APS DSLR cameras like the Nikon D3200, the Alpha 57 or Canon T3i. Color saturation is near perfect, color accuracy is just about what your eye sees and the exposure control is very smooth to react to changes in light. Auto focus is very smooth and does not hunt and peck in video mode. It seems to always find perfect focus while being nearly transparent to the video, meaning all you see is a consistently focused image from 12 inches to infinity. Chromatic aberration and edge softness are not objectionable even with the kit lens; a result of the camera's firmware ability to correct issues even in the kit lenses. Upgrading your lenses, however, yields even more stunning results.In short, this is the best automatic shooter I've ever used, and I've used hundreds of cameras. Image sharpness is very crisp without over processed edges. Diagonal straight lines show no aliasing stair stepped look when tilted at odd angles, and the kit lens shows no noticeable softness in the edges or chromatic aberrations in videos. Still images look sharp and crisp with only a tiny hint of softness in the corners if you pixel peep into the image fully. It's a really crisp kit lens for all but the most demanding professional uses.Low light capability is very good up to ASA 6400, a notch above even the rave reviewed Lumix FZ1000. At ASA 12,800 and 1/30 exposure, this camera practically sees in the dark at the expense of some subtle film-like grain. ASA 6400 is good and ASA 3200 is excellent. An unusual feature is the ability to pre-program the automatic ASA limits on both the high and low ends anywhere from 100 to 12,800. In short, the manual controls offer the ultimate creative image control in a camera you can fit in a large pocket.Now, automatic shooting aside, you bet there will be times when you want to take control. The A6000 gives you complete manual control of each function individually as you wish rather than tying two functions together. This means you can set your aperture, set your shutter speed, set your white balance to any Kelvin temperature, use manual focus and let the ISO be automatic. Or any other combination of manual and automatic control you desire. And they're all available via a camera knob or button and can be changed on the fly while shooting video. Other cameras I've used give a stair stepped transition in lighting intensity with certain combinations of manual and automatic control but the A6000 transitions are smooth no matter how you set the functions.For those who like automatic functions, you can leave this in full auto mode and get consistently good still shots and awesome video. The video is way better than even most of the Sony Alpha DSLR-sized cameras like the Alpha 57 or Alpha 77. Dabbling with the manual controls brings forth even better imaging when lighting conditions are less than ideal. What's nice is you can select a single manual function while leaving the rest automatic, or set everything manually and leave just the ISO automatic. This becomes really important for video. In ISO only auto mode, you can control your aperture and shutter speed while allowing the ISO to adjust the gain automatically for changing light conditions. But suppose you don't want the gain to rise to the point where the image gets grainy? You can program the ISO to be variable only between two preset levels, say from ISO 125 to ISO 4000, or any other settings you choose. This allows just enough variable light control for the conditions you're shooting in, while not going to the extremes of overexposure or too much grain. White balance can be set manually, automatic, pre-programmed for your favorite three presets or dialed in manually in 100K steps from 2500K to 9900K. In addition, you can fine tune each of those settings to precisely match your lighting, then take it up or down manually to warm up or cool down the image as you see fit. Add in the ability to manually control sharpness and color saturation and you have one heck of a video camera. Video shot with this camera is good enough to use commercially, assuming of course, your client doesn't see you using a pocket sized camera. You can shoot in very low light without dark backgrounds looking grainy. You can shoot spotlight illuminated actors on stage without blowing out the faces with overexposure. It's simply amazing how much manual control this camera allows. You might expect this on a full size 3000 dollar camera, but on a pocket camera under 500, it's almost unheard of.The camera grip provides a secure hold with one hand. The left mounted viewfinder makes for easy viewing without nose smudges on the LCD. Build quality is solid and tight with no squeaky plastic sounds when you grip the camera. An industry standard hot shoe tops the camera. It has the standard electrical contact for use with other brand flashes in addition to having the Sony proprietary contacts for use with Sony microphones or lights.Sound quality is rich and crisp with no undue AGC pumping action. AGC is smooth and gradual without intruding on natural sounds. The internal mikes are on the front of the camera and provide excellent vocal presence for home videos. My advice here is to remove the camera strap holders if you don't use a strap, because they'll rattle against the camera if you don't. There are no adjustments for sound and there are no ports for external mikes or headphones except by using the Sony hot shoe. It's a shame, because the image quality of this camera is good enough to make films that look great.If there's one thing I think is below par, it's the image stabilization. It is OK for handheld shots while you are standing still, but it doesn't have enough latitude for silky smooth videos while you are walking. The little brother to this camera, the RX100, has much better image stabilization. On the A6000, stabilization is in the lens, and another lens might offer better results. Also, the power zoom is a slide switch on the side of the kit lens. It feels rather odd and not intuitive, but it works. Any other lens, however, eliminates this issue.In summary, if you need a small jacket pocket camera/camcorder and want image results as good as a mid level DSLR, the a6000 is one of the best choices.

This is a decent phone for use with a magic jack or similar device. I use it with an ATT wireless home phone device which works through the cell towers. Basically, since the ATT device has an internal battery backup, using it with this handset emulates the old fashioned two piece cellphones of the past. On a trip it's nicer using this in a car than a regular cell phone as the coverage is much greater in fringe reception areas. The phone needs to use the supplied cable and can't use a standard phone cable since the connectors are different sizes at each end.

This replaces the rental modem from Comcast, saving over 13 dollars a month in rental fees. It works perfectly, actually a tiny bit faster than the box it replaces. The cost of this box will pay for itself in saved rental fees within six months. My only regret is not knowing this sooner, as Comcast stopped selling modems years ago in order to increase their rental profits. It feels good to give them less.

A mildly entertaining artist rendition of the solar system in motion. You can change the time line to watch things happen faster than real time, and you can change your visual perspective from earth to any other planet or moon. Other than that, it doesn't do much. It would have been awesome if these were scalable NASA photographs of the real planets.

My wife loves these little things. Personally, I don't get the whole jewelry thing, but if she's happy, then so am I. These fit her bracelet well and quite frankly, I don't think there's much that can go wrong with a product like this.

Obviously at this price point you can't expect the apps and functions to be the same as an expensive smart phone. But the features the phone does have should work. They don't. I was never able to get on the internet with this phone. It kept dumping the connection after a few seconds, telling me there was insufficient memory even though the phone was brand new and had nothing at all stored in the memory. Net 10 reps were unable to figure out the problem and no one was ever able to solve it. I returned the phone within two days for a refund, but of course had to deal with the hassle of changing my number to yet another phone.

Yes, I know two newer models of this exist, but I wanted a camera that could fit in my front pants pocket. A video camera I could always have with me that would also produce professional quality video and good stills. This original model is smaller and less expensive than the newer one. It fits in my pants pocket. The newer one doesn't. The best camera is the one you have with you.When I shoot a paid gig, I bring pro equipment that looks the part and gets the shots. It is disappointing to be somewhere when a video op presents itself and my dinky camera can't cope with the low light. The Sony RX100 doesn't let me down here. When the house lights go down, this camera can see better in the dark than I can see with my own eyes. If I can see it, so can this camcorder. I could literally shoot a paid gig with this, and the results would please almost any client. As long as they didn't see the small size of the camera. On the other hand, at a wedding, using this I blend right in and no one would ever suspect I wasn't a guest. I can get shots with this where my pro gear would make the guests clam up. Shots where the groomsmen speak their mind because they're talking to a friend and not a camera. It's priceless later on.No, this won't get quite the same results as bigger cameras like the new 4K camcorders. When I compare this to any 2K camera, however, I'm looking at results that are closer to pro level than consumer level, and this shoots magnitudes better video than any other camera this size. At this price and size, there still is nothing that can generate pro looking video as good as this camera, save for the newer versions of this model.In full automatic control, the color is accurate and well saturated without looking too much so. Video is devoid of grain until you get down to 6400 ASA, and even then, it's not bad. At ASA 6400, it looks more like 16mm film grain than video noise. Lens sharpness is good corner to corner, but not as tack sharp as the new Sony 4K camcorder shot in the 2K mode. Still, there's no noticeable chromatic aberration (color fringes) around objects in the corners. Exposure is rock solid, and turning off HDR setting gives a film-like high contrast gamma.Some of the features I like are the total independent manual control of all functions. I can program the buttons for my favorites so I don't have to dig through the menus too much. The manual focus ring is smooth and well damped to prevent accidental focus slippage, and the video peaking lets me see exactly when the focus is perfect, even if I can't see the screen clearly. As I stated before, I can create pro results with this thing as I never could with another camera this tiny. Looking at the finished product, no one would ever know I didn't use a pro camera unless they saw me actually shooting with this.Still shots are good but could be better. The lens, though great for video, tends to be just a bit soft for stills. This can be an advantage for portraits, however, as skin tones look quite natural without bringing forth the flaws.In the end, using any camera is about creating visual art. In the hands of someone who knows how to compose the shots, utilize lighting and manage the camera settings, an indie film could be made with this that would hold up on any big screen TV or local theater.

This is a solid and reliable OEM battery made to the original factory specs, so you'll pay more than a cheap Chinese knock-off, but less than from the Sony web site. It fits well and holds a full charge a long time, depending upon the camera you use it with. Other OEM Sony batteries have lasted five years of more and still work, while the knockoffs last about a year.

This device frees both hands for on the go filming. Just make sure you slide the camera forward enough of your head and aim it forward to avoid getting your hair or forehead in the corner of the shot. The con? No up or down trim adjustment, so straight ahead shots are filled with too much sky unless you point your head down a little lower than normal, and let your eyes look upward a little higher than usual. This strains your eyes after a  while.

This seals as well as a blender bottle but has two compartments for two different formulas. I often order stuff that looks hot pink in the product photo but when I get it I am disappointed. This one is actually as pretty as the photo, a gorgeous translucent hot pink. Each side has a drinking cap that pops open and everything seals up great with no leakage, not even between the two sides. Each side is too small for a blender ball but it does have the screens which helps with blending. I do wish there was a way to put a blender ball in each side because I prefer those to the screens. I love having two different formulas in one cup, if I have a protein formula on one side and a recovery on the other I don't have to pack two bottles. This bottle is one of those cool ideas that actually works well.* I received this product free for honest review with no obligation.

I recently bought a bunch of corsets from Camellias to try and this one is my favorite. Out of all of them it is the most heavy-duty and creates the most dramatic shape. I am no stranger to corsets, I paid $200 for a custom corset. A lot of the Camellias corsets I tried were similar in quality but I'd say this one is the most so. It has real steel bones, I checked them with a magnet, it sticks all over the corset. The one thing that stands out that it doesn't have is waist tape, it may be sewn inside and be invisible but I can't see or feel any.This feel like a heavy cotton twill like my custom but the tag says it is 90% polyester, 5% cotton, 5% elastin. This doesn't scare me away, it's very sturdy and durable. however if you are already ingrained in the all-day-every-day corset culture you have spent or are looking to spend $200-500 for the best of the best. I thought I would be one of those people when I bought mine but turns out I don't want to wear a corset every day so I wear them for fun, fashion and photo shoots only. I recommend this corset for anyone but the most dedicated tightlacer and honestly I wish I'd skipped the $200 custom and ordered this instead.Sizing: size down from the size chart. I ordered a small and the size chart says I should have a medium, but I am now exchanging most of my mediums for smalls so the corset waist size is 4" smaller than my natural waist size. I found most of the ones that were my size according to the chart I was able to completely close right away.Tips: 🔹don't pull it as tight as you can when you first put it on. Make it only moderately tight and then after 45-60 mins pull it a little tighter, go gradually. Also only wear them for a few hours a day for about the first week or longer. Or gradually increase the time you wear it. The corset and your body need to both adjust. It will mold the corset to your body shape and make it more comfortable and also extend the life of it.🔹Straighten the back panel as you go. It's stiff (boned) so it won't bunch up and if you adjust it as you go you can get it in the right place.I received this free for honest review.

Unfortunately when I ordered this my correct size was not offered so I ordered one size up. It's not tight enough to be worn for any sort of waist training but it's fine for a fashion corset--This would be an excellent waist cincher had I ordered my correct size. The material is strong and thick and it has the same rubberized outer layer as another similar Camellias cincher I got in my size (which I love.) This model is a little different than others I have used. You wrap it around and hook four sets of hook & eye closures in the front, similar to bra straps. Once you are properly cinched in you zip up the front. The first time I zipped it I had a little trouble but then I got the hang of it. You must hold the zipper down with your fingers until it's seated well and aligned and then zip it up, similar to a jacket but since it's tight you have to be a little more careful.Note: I posted photos of it over my clothes. Since I ordered too large a size and it is not tight enough on me to really cinch much I didn't show a photo under my clothes. If I exchange this for a smaller size I will update with new photos.I received this product free for honest review.

This is a really nice corset, it is not a cheap costume piece. I have long been interested in corsets and ordered a custom one for $200 that is actually pretty similar to this. The heaviness and construction is similar, the big difference I can see is the outer hardware on this one isn't as nice or thick as my custom corset. The outer material on this is silk, my custom is a thick cotton denim-like material. This is well made and honestly I'm shocked how nice this is for the price. If I had known I could get one like this for under $40 I would never have bought a custom one. This one looks great over clothes too, I love how it looks with a black dress. There are real steel bones in this, I checked with a magnet.Sizing: I ordered according to the size chart. The fit is good but I feel I could have ordered one size down because the corset edges were completely touching when I laced it up and I would have preferred a gap so eventually I could lace it tighter if I need to. I was able to lace it up just as tight as I wanted, and since I'm not planning on becoming an everyday wearer or a "tightlacer" this size is just fine for me. If you are a seasoned corset wearer you will probably want to order one size down from the size chart suggestion.The lacing is correctly done, it pulls tight from the smallest part of your waistline instead of at the bottom. The top lacing and bottom lacing are a continuous loop. I didn't have anyone to help me tie it but it is a lot easier if you have help lacing it, however I was able to pretty easily do it myself.Suggestions:🔹Tie it only moderately tight at first, once your body adjusts (in about 30-60 minutes) you can gradually increase the tightness. Start out wearing for only an hour or two for awhile and gradually increase the time you wear the corset as you adjust to it.🔻Don't tie the laces around the front of the corset, it wears out the material and ruins it.🔹Adjust the back modesty panel as you lace it.* Disclaimer: I received this product free for honest review with no obligations.

I love these, possibly even more than the full-length similar legwarmers. I can wear these with short or tall boots and they are really cute. They add a feminine touch to motorcycle boots and I love to wear them with my wellies. They work well over jeans but the ones I wore in the photo werent skinnies and they look much better with very form-fitting jeans. I have fairly skinny legs, these might not work for under-the-knee if you have large or really muscular calves but they can be worn lower. I didn't even try to get them over my knee, it didn't seem they would fit.I got these in light grey and I seriously want every color now. They are well made and look great.I received this product product free for honest review.

I haven't had a bottle yet I can't clean with this, even my narrow-mouth stainless steel water bottle. It washes the sides and bottom just fine for me. The straw cleaner is awesome and I can't believe I waited so long to get one of these. The small loop brush can get in the tops of my bottles and clean them unlike anything I've used.
