I love how these come on a loop and can easily be taken off to use individually. I have no problem using these all hooked together either. I have nothing bad to say about this, it works great for me.

My boyfriend burns through about one belt a year so I got him this super durable leather belt. It's stiff and strong and I bet this one will last longer than one year. The leather feels like it could use some oil, it feels strong but the stiffness could be lessened with some Neatsfoot oil or leather conditioner. He stitching is neat and clean, it's a good-looking brown belt. I had no problem putting it through my belt loops but if your pants waistband is narrow you might want to measure and see if this will fit.I received this product free for honest review.

This pillow is my favorite, I almost can't sleep without it now. I like how you can put one end under your head and hug or rest your arm on the middle section and hold your knees apart with the other end. Before I got this I kept trying to use a regular pillow between my knees and it would end up on the floor every night. This pillow stays put. When I turn around to face the other direction the pillow hugs my back and keeps the draft out. It's honestly the most comfortable, wonderful body pillow I've ever used. It's soft but somehow keeps its shape and doesn't squish flat. I never thought of spending $60 on a pillow but I would buy this again in a second. My boyfriend calls it my nunchuck pillow.The one thing I don't like about it is the fabric really picks up lint. I never got the pillowcase made for this, I'm still waiting on the order so in the meantime I put a pillowcase over the end where I rest my head.I received this product free for honest review.

This is bright red and perfect for keeping in an emergency bag or in with camping gear. It has reflective strips all throughout the cord. In an emergency this can be stripped to use the thinner strings inside. You can use it to set up a tent, sunshade, windscreen, clothes line, trail markers, etc. I haven't found anything wrong with it, it's very useful.I received this product free for honest review.

This is so easy to use and takes all the fuss out of opening a bottle of wine. Just center the corkscrew over the cork, press the rabbit ears over the lip of throttled me pull the lever down and back up, the cork comes out. Then repeat and the cork pops out. Opening a bottle is so much easier since I got this. The set came in a nice black gift box with silver foil. I'm thinking of getting all my friends a set for Christmas because I like mine so much.I received this product free or at a reduced cost for honest review.

I went on a cruise and struggled to keep my towel draped on the back of my chair. I saw some people using these and had to get some. They are as strong as they need to be, I don't get to use them as often as I'd like (if only the beach was closer) but for my uses they are excellent and I will take them on every beach vacation I go on from now on. They also work well to clip your towel up to dry.* I received this product free or at a reduced cost for honest review.

You never know when you are going to see some wild animals or interesting things on a walk or hike so I like to carry this monocular with me. We also like to use this to see the birds in the field behind our house. This is a nice monocular for the price, it's almost as good as the one I paid more than three times the amount for. It included a carrying case and a microfiber cloth to wipe the lens. Both lenses have a cover and the whole thing is water-resistant (though not waterproof.) It's compact and takes up much less room in my bag than binoculars and as a bonus I kind of feel like a pirate or sea captain when I use it.*I received this product free for honest review.

These are really cute! I can wear them either as knee highs or thigh highs. They look really cute with boots or can be worn by themselves. I've found they stay up better with leggings or nylons. I got the black pair but I already had a white pair so I posted both pics.I received this product free for honest review.

I am very picky when it comes to brushes. I have a lot of different sets to compare, they don't have to be expensive but they have to be the right fullness and weight to properly apply the makeup they are designed for, they can't poke my eyelids or be rough and the bristles can't fall out on my face. These brushes are really, really good. They feel good on my face and blend well. They apply makeup well. I do wish the stipple brush (big full flat top brush) was a bit denser but it's okay, good dense ones that are also cheap are very scarce. I use these brushes every time I put on makeup and I love them. The beauty blender sponge is not the name brand one but it works pretty good though I have never splurged on a real one so I don't know what the difference is. I've used it to put on blush and contour but my favorite thing to do with it is pat it over my foundation and blend it into my hairline to make sure everything is even. These are AWESOME brushes and very affordably priced. I would buy these again in a heartbeat.In my photos there is some makeup on some of the brushes, I photographed them right after using them and you can see how they look after they have a little makeup on them. You can easily clean them with gentle soap (baby shampoo or a soap created for brushes) in cold water and lay them flat on a clean towel or paper towel to keep water out of the ferrule.(Product provided free or at a reduced cost for honest and unbiased review.)

The thing that first appealed to me was the cute cardboard tube this thermos arrived in. It would be perfect for gifting. The thermos says "I love you. Always have, always will." I could do without this, I'd rather it be plain black with maybe the Urbane logo but to each his own. The top has a plastic insert which makes it easier to pour or drink out of and the lid screws on and doesn't leak at all.The thing that most impressed me was the heat retention capability. I did a heat test with 6 thermoses and this one tied with one other for 2nd place. The first place winner was only 3 degrees warmer.I poured boiling water (approx. 188 degrees) into 6 thermoses and 24 hours later I checked the temperature. This one was 101 degrees after 24 hours, the winning thermos was 103 and the losing one was 68 degrees.I'd buy this again.I received this product free or at a reduced price for honest review.

I have washed this a few times already and it has held up well with no color fading or degrading. The material is soft and absorbent, it has pockets so I can slip it directly over my yoga mat to absorb all the dripping sweat. As a bonus you can also use this as a regular towel or at the beach and it works great. The lavender color looks like he photo, honestly it looks more purple than lavender to me. I like that it came with a smaller towel to use to wipe face sweat away, I use the hand towel for all my workouts. I'm very happy with this set.I was sent this product free or at a reduced cost for honest and unbiased review with no obligations.

I paid about the same amount of money ($20-ish) for the last fm transmitter I used in my car but it was a pain to use. I had to change to one of 8 pre-selected frequencies and also plug in something to the charger of my iPod or phone. I had to remove the case each time because the plug didn't fit. I finally got fed up with it and got this one and it works way better and is much easier to use. It was a breeze to pair via Bluetooth and there was nothing to plug in. The unit is powered by the cigarette plug in my car so there is nothing to charge. Just select a station and match it with the car stereo and my music plays through he radio. It's simple and easy.The Rose gold and white color looks clean and nice too. The head has a swivel so I can point it however I need to to make it easy. I don't have to fuss with it at all once I start my music unless I want to change songs on my phone. I wish I had skipped the other model and just got this one, honestly it works so much better.I received this product free for honest and unbiased review with no obligation.

This is a fun wig! I don't think I will convince anybody this is my real hair but who cares. This is long and has some wave/curl to the ends. For the photo I didn't comb it but be sure when you brush it to either use your fingers or a wide-tooth comb and be very gentle, starting at the ends and work your way up because the hair looks rattler the more you comb it and break the end fibers.This wig is what I would expect for the price. It has a nice wig cap, not a cheap one that is too small. There are plenty of wefts so it looks nice and full without showing the wefts at the cap. I have fun wearing it.* I received this product free or at a reduced cost for honest review.

*I got BLONDE 2 but it is currently out of stock so I have to review another color.This is a really good wig for the price. I have about 100 wigs of varying color and quality and this is comparable to my $50-60 wigs.Here's why: The wig cap is good, it's not one of the cheaper ones that is too small.There are lots of wefts. This is important for thickness and also (more importantly) not having the wefts show through at the top back of the crown.The hair looks decently real. It has some shine but no more than most of my wigs.The wig does shed. Once you gently run your fingers through it and pull out most of the loose hairs left over from manufacturing most of the shedding will stop.This is a great wig for the price. I would expect to pay more for this.*I received this wig free for honest review with no obligation.

This came in a nice gift box with a cloth dust cover as any good handbag or wallet should have. The leather smells good but has a very light scent. The wallet is lightweight and the seams are all straight, very clean and nice. It's a simple wallet but well made and it should last a long time. Having RFID blocking technology gives me peace of mind.*I received this product free or at a reduced cost for honest review.

This oil is a nice base layer for lotions but doesn't moisturize as well by itself if your skin is really dry. It has a really nice, intriguing scent that both my boyfriend and I agree is unisex. I like to put a thin layer of this moisturizing oil on after a shower and follow up with a light lotion. I use jojoba oil often, it is the oil that most closely mimics our own natural body oils so it's great for adding moisture back into dry skin.I received this product free for honest review.

I have used these before, they work well for dry items. I used them on a bottle of vanilla and it eventually ran so I decided these only work well for things like rice, beans, quinoa, etc and storage items (markers, crafts, etc.)This marker is really juicy and opaque, it works well. These labels are a lot of fun!I got this product free or at a reduced cost for honest review.

Tahari is a brand I buy often because I have come to love the quality and I was not disappointed in this scarf. It's wide enough that when you double it over its just the right size to keep your neck warm and look just right, it's nice and puffy. The color is a charcoal gray to turquoise gradient.I received this free for honest review.

I got this in red, at this time the red is not offered (possibly out of stock?). This capo is made of a lightweight aluminum and seems to be well made. It does the job, I got this for my boyfriend who plays guitar and he said it was nicer than the capo he currently has. He likes the quick change ability.The price is good, I don't know what these normally go for but around $10 seems completely reasonable for something of this quality.I got this free or at a reduced cost for honest and unbiased review.

I am by no means a professional photographer but I really wanted to try some lenses at a low price. For under $10 the price is right for this kit. I found I had to take my phone cover off which might be bad for people with a hard to remove case but for me my case is made of silicone and slips right off. The lenses work fairly well. You have to have them exactly centered over the camera or the edges will be blurred. They work decently well but they are a bit of a hassle because of how you have to have them placed just right and adjust them with the camera on so you can see how the photo will look. To give you an idea if you touch the clip or bump it you will have to readjust it, it's very sensitive. For the price it is a really fun toy but because of the trouble it takes I really don't use it much.I was most interested in the macro lens and to use it you have to unscrew it. I wish the three lenses were separate. Four stars because it is a fun phone toy and the price is right.I received this product free or at a reduced cost for honest and unbiased review.

This windchime sounds really nice. It doesn't look as nice as a higher-price windchime but it serves the purpose. Traditionally wind chimes are used to ward off evil spirits, whether or not that works the chime sounds pretty. I think the quality is decent for the price.I got this at a reduced price for honest and unbiased review.

These are not top-quality brushes but they are good for the price. They are perfect for crafting and very similar to the lower priced student-quality acrylic brushes we used to buy for One Stroke lessons. My guy likes to paint model airplanes and uses a variety of brushes and these are much better than the ones that come in the kits. He is getting these as a stocking stuffer this Christmas.I received this set free or at a reduced price for honest and unbiased review.

This bra is really nice. I usually wear a 34 C-D, depending on the brand. I ordered a 34C and it fits perfectly. It's very comfortable. It's not padded--at least not for lift or size--but it does have a thin foam layer inside the fabric so it's not thin enough to show through, especially in the winter (if you get my drift.) It came with an extender to give this another 2" or so, making this work for a 34-36. This color does say brown but it is the nice dusty purple just like the photo. The extender is pink though, not sure why there are two colors. The band is nice and wide with 4 hooks and the shoulder straps are wide enough to give support and not dig into my shoulders. It's comfortable and nice.*UPDATED with photos.I received this product free or at a reduced cost for honest and unbiased review.

This mat works really well. It really makes draining the grease easier. The only thing I don't particularily like is having to clean grease out of it. I drain it when it's hot and then use a dish brush and hot water to scrub it. I can even cook Turkey bacon on it and it gets grease out, pretty impressive!I got this product at a discount for honest and unbiased review.

I don't like taking fish oil capsules that have a fishy aftertaste, these are excellent. They are easy to take and I like that I don't have to take more than one. I haven't burped from them or had any issues with an upset stomach. I got these free for honest and unbiased review but I would buy these again because of the high quality.

The rack isn't the issue, it's small and sturdy and has a nice chrome plating. I was dubious about the "magic stickers" and for good reason. I dusted as instructed and put up the rack on my smooth painted door and 10 minutes later it came crashing down with nothing hanging on it. So just know it wont work on all walls. If you have smooth marble or tile, glass, etc it works just fine. I wanted to put this up to hang hats but instead I have to use it in the shower because it's the only place I have a smooth surface to mount this on.*EDIT: it did not stick on my shower tile either. The magic stickers are not so magic for me.I received this product free or at a reduced cost for honest and unbiased review with no obligation.

This is a really nice hydration belt with pockets for a phone, keys, an iPod or a small snack. This is one of the best I've tried because it has slightly larger bottles and the back of the belt has rubberized grips to keep it from slipping and sliding which is one of the issues I've come across with other belts. It's an excellent design! This is good for a stand-alone for walking or running but also if you are hiking, and if you have a backpack on you can wear this on the front to put the stuff you need to access easily without taking your pack off. It's wonderful. I got this free or at a reduced cost for unbiased review and I would buy it again, it's $20-ish well spent if you like to be active or explore outdoors.

The smaller the better when it comes to biking, especially if you are riding trails. This pump is small and lightweight and thanks the attached tire gauge I can check my tire pressure and top up before every ride. Since I usually ride with a 10+ person group someone is bound to get a flat on pretty much every trip so it's essential to keep a bike pump. This one is small and easy to throw in a bag but it's easier to keep it mounted on the frame. It includes the mounting hardware.I received this product free or at a reduced cost for honest and unbiased review.

I got the small 2.03 oz size to carry in my travel bag. This is perfect for vacations if your hair needs some extra help, especially if you are at the beach or using the pool and exposing your hair to chlorine. My hair feels really dry after being in the saltwater all day and this hair masque really helped. The squeeze bottle has a pretty grey/mint color scheme and a thick, creamy consistency. It has an herbal floral scent, it's difficult to pinpoint what the scent is but it's not overpowering. I wash my hair first, apply the mask and then let it sit while I do everything else to leave it in as long as possible. It says you can leave it on up to 5 minutes and I don't time it but I'm sure I leave it on longer. It rinses out well and leaves my color processed hair much softer. This is my first time using an Herbalosophy product and I don't know much about the brand but it seems good and I'm happy with the results.I received this sample product free for honest and unbiased review.

For hot or cold brewed coffee this press works well. I get less grounds (read: none) in my coffee when using this than when using my standard electric coffee maker. The borosilicate glass is heat resistant and strong yet thin so use care when washing it. The handle comes off the glass for cleaning but I found its easiest to get off when wet with hot water. I really appreciated the thoughtfulness of the company to include three extra screens should I need to replace it! this works as well as my Bodum and very similar in design. I'd skip the higher price and get this.I received this product free or at a reduced cost for honest and unbiased review.

The last butterfly wine opener I had ended up breaking so I was on the search for a sturdier one that wouldn't break. This one is heavier-duty and has been reliable or me. Its easy to use and comfortable, I couldn't be happier with it.I received this product free or at a low cost for honest and unbiased review with no obligations.

I don't believe in miracle creams, to get the best results you need to drink lots of water, have a healthy diet and exercise. You will not get as food of results with this cream if you don't go the healthy route. However, I did see results without doing all the above steps. I have not been great about exercising, my diet is fairly good and I'm inconsistent about drinking enough water but I am thin, just not as firm and shapely as I prefer. The results are temporary and have to be done consistently, the cream doesn't permanently change anything but seems to smooth and puff up the skin. This cellulite cream smells better than others I've used. Some smell like chemicals, this one smells like menthol. As far as cellulite creams go this is one Id purchase again.I got this product free or at a reduced cost for honest and unbiased review ith no obligations.

I got this specifically to wear as a layering piece and not to wear at the beach. I followed the size chart (not Amazon's but the one the manufacture provided in the product details) but I should have erred on the side of ordering up because the top is very tight on my rib cage and very hard to get on and off. Even if it fit me better it would still hard to put on and take off because the straps don't have any sort of buckle or clip, you pull it over your head.Despite the sizing issue the the top is hot! It held everything in place better than I expected. It looks cute under low-cut tops and adds interest and a unique detail even though the top has to be pretty low cut to see the straps. I love the look, I just don't like how it feels.I received a promotional sample free for honest and unbiased review.

This is an excellent Apple MFI-certified lightning cable. The cord is durable and works well. It works with either direction facing up, something I always check since not all of the lightning cables work both ways.  Since the color is black it doesn't show any dirt or dust I happen to get on it. I'm happy with this and would buy again.I received this product free for honest and unbiased review.

I am always shopping for camping and survival gear and have wanted a cook wear set for awhile but the price was prohibitive. This set has a lower price tag so I didn't think it would be very good but I was very pleasantly surprised. The pots and pans are sturdy and thick, they are comparable to the more expensive sets I've looked at. These are lightweight and compact. They all fit together into a drawstring bag and I actually found it easy to pack them up again--Sometimes once you take something apart it's difficult to repackage it in the same way. The ladle, cooking spoon and plastic dishes are small but ideal for backpacking. I'm really happy with this set.I received this product free or at low cost for an honest and unbiased review with no obligations.

I will start out by saying this is definitely a costume-quality item. Don't be expecting something expensive-looking. For dressing up or Halloween this is perfect. It does fit an adult but probably fits a child better, it's just a tiny bit too small to fit my head without crunching it down. It's made of cheap, shiny plastic with plastic gems and sparkly red stiff material. It's perfect to present to someone as a gag gift or for a birthday crown.I received this product free for honest and unbiased review with no obligation.

You never know when you might need to do some repairs, this kit is good quality and works well. I wish it came with some sort of carrying bag but no biggie. The kit works well and I'm happy with it. The tools are sturdy and do the job with no issues.I received this product free for honest and unbiased review with no obligations.

I gave this to my brother because he needed a soldering iron. I warned him to be careful because some reviewers have had trouble with the plastic housing but he hasn't had any trouble so far. He said it works well and he's happy with it.I received this free for honest and unbiased review with no obligations for a high rating.

This is a very pretty bag. I actually think it looks better in person than in the photo. The design stitching is clean, colorful and looks good, it's very well done. The material has a suede-like microfiber texture and is soft and tactile. The bag is somewhat stiff to keep the shape and a little crinkly. The snap is magnetic but you have to press it to get it completely snapped. I like this bag, it has a nice boho hippie look and it's fashionable and cute.I received a sample product free or at a discount for honest and unbiased review.

I like this bracelet because it doesn't flip over and irritate my skin. It's pretty and adds some sparkle without being too over the top. I've had similar bracelets before I couldn't wear because they scratched and irritated my skin but when I put this on I forget I'm wearing it. It hasn't discolored yet and still looks beautiful. I appreciate that it comes with an extender so multiple wrist sizes can use it. I need the extension just barely but it would be too tight without it. Also the clasp fits tightly and it never slips off.I received a sample free for honest and unbiased review.

I have bought a lot of these type of no-show socks and they haven't worked out for me before. Either they slide right off my heel and end up wadded up and uncomfortable around the ball of my foot or they dig in above my heel and I end up having to take them off. These are probably the first pair I've owned that doesn't slip off and is completely comfortable. They have a silicone pad on the back that keeps them from sliding off which actually works. They are thin and feel soft, they feel high quality. After having tried them I would buy them again. I got these free to test for honest and unbiased review.

I have the blue one, a leopard print one & I gave my mom a black one because she colors her hair. Amazingly they still look pretty much the same as the day I got them, the material is incredibly durable and doesn't seem to really shed. They are the best hair towels I've ever used, I even take one when I travel. You should dry them without fabric softener or a dryer sheet because it coats the fibers and makes them less absorbent.For the people who say it doesn't fit their head, I used to feel the same way when I first got it but now I just twist the end less before I hook it on the button. It doesn't have to stretch as far and my hair still gets dry. These are worth every penny.

These are thick, more like higher quality restaurant napkins than tissue. You can get them wet, they are stronger than tissue but will rip if you try. This order included 24 packs but I can't find any information about how many tissues are in each pack. These work great to remove makeup, especially if you use cold cream to remove it. I also like using them to spot clean my makeup brushes, I always have a napkin or paper towel near when I put on my makeup and I wipe excess color from my brushes off. These work well for that and they are a great size to keep in my makeup bag. Since they are tough like napkins they also work well to keep in the car and in my bag for anything I typically need a napkin for. They have a scent to them.The outer package is funny, it has a man wiping lipstick off his cheek. The individual packets don't have any illustrations or graphics on them. They say "Face - clean & soft tissue."I received this product sample free for honest and unbiased review.

This is one of the nicer knee sleeves I've used. It has a very firm feel and gives a lot of support. It doesn't slide down or get displaced and I can wear it alone or under pants. I don't have to wear a knee brace regularily but I occasionally get injuries doing plyometrics or twisting my knee wrong and this brace seems to help.I twisted my knee getting out of the truck and was able to properly test this. It absolutely helped and the pain went away quickly. I will continue to use this as needed, it works!I received this sample product free or at a reduced cost for honest and unbiased review.

I like these but I was expecting them to be a little bit sharper. When I cut my nails they left a slight ridge which I had to file off. My mom has some issues cutting her toenails so I gave them to her to try and she said the same thing, they didn't cut completely smooth and she had an issue cutting the toenails straight across. The length is useful for reaching your toes but I wish they were a little sharper.* I received this product free for honest and unbiased review.

This is a great book. Highly readable and it answered a lot of questions I've had about effective online teaching. It seems mostly aimed at those who oversee online instructors and online education programs, but if you are a student thinking of taking online classes this is quite interesting since it will help you evaluate your different options to figure out ahead of time which courses or which programs or online sites will be the best for you. As someone who has taught classes (not online, and not recently) I thought it was interesting as well, as when I was teaching I never had a clear idea of what was really expected of me other than a bare outline of a syllabus that was provided for me. In fact, this is definitely as good a book for online instructors as for their administrators.

This is a relatively interesting look at community college finance, where it's at, where it's going. It is meant as a guide for institutional leaders, apparently, but it reads like a book meant to supplement a college course, which summations and discussion questions/exercises at the end of each chapter. Reading and comprehending this book is a good start for anyone who wants to have meaningful conversations about community college finance. As a community college student I found some parts eye opening.

This kit is supposed to be for ages 6-15. On the one hand, 15 may be a little old for this, on the other hand I wouldn't have a kid much younger than that doing these all by themselves. In fact, I would say in general this is a kit that can be a great bonding experience between parent and child but with so many fizzing, exploding, launching things this is just a recipe for trouble if done unsupervised. Definitely one of those kits that is what you make of it and if you are the adult who is going to do this with your child it's a good idea to go over what you're doing ahead of time for any of the projects you haven't done before (or even ones you have if you need a refresher on the sciencey bits.)

I don't really like the SpongeBob tv show, I find it annoying and just dumb. However, I do like this Mega Blocks set, it's cute and a little bit of a challenge to put together but worth it. If you can get a kid to play with this set INSTEAD of watching the show, their play session is bound to be about 100X better, more interesting and creative. All the little pieces are so cute and it's just too bad the Patty Shooter doesn't work better.

This seems like a good biotin supplement. Nothing too fancy. They call it "rapid release" but as far as I can tell that's just normal release, although it does come in a capsule which may break down faster than a coated tablet. You can take 1 or 2 of these a day to be in the normal range for biotin supplementation. Biotin is often touted for helping with hair growth, and that's why I was interested in it, but you should know biotin deficiency is rare and as far as I know there have been know scientific studies that taking a bunch of biotin for those who are not deficient is going to make your hair grow better/faster.

This is a great game for fans of SoA, even if those people don't think they like card/strategy games. Even people who would never want to play a game like Risk (and this game is kind of like Risk but you get "fun" stuff like guns and money and other elements that mix things up - or add some anarchy - to the game) will probably find this game fun because it is probably the closest they will ever get to living out a SoA fantasy. It's advertised as taking an hour to play, but I can't really see that unless you're really "efficient" about it, which doesn't sound like much fun.

Great, old fashioned style of carrier. I was thinking this would allow your child to sit up a bit higher and I thought great for stuff like parades, but really they sit with a view more of the back of your head. Nice for hiking when there are things to see from side to side, or for grocery shopping (pretty good for keeping little hands from grabbing stuff) at stores with bigger aisles (you might really injure someone just by turning around in a store with narrow aisles, or maybe knock a bunch of stuff over. It's like those kids that get on the subway with a giant backpack on and they have no idea they are suddenly a foot wider from front to back. And by kids, I also mean Silicon Valley nerds on the train.) Anyway, it's not the lightest weight carrier around, but it's pretty cool the way it can stand up on its own when you set it down, so depending what you're using it for it may be worth it just for that.

Overall I like these, I think they have a great, old-fashioned look and feel. I do think they are a bit bulky and there are many more modern-day options that soak up more water and yet are sleeker and smaller. Especially when washing dishes with these I notice the bulk. The yellow color is very cute and adds a bit of sunshine to my kitchen. Also, they wash well but if you get some broken threads they can look pretty raggedy. I've gotten some swedish dish cloths lately that I like better than these.

I got this before upgrading to Windows 10 (from 7) thinking it would help make the install go smoothly. lol...it really doesn't help with install at all, so I needn't have waited. Windows 10 installs very easily all by itself.So, after I installed Windows 10, I kind of forgot about this book for a while and just started using Windows 10. It seems pretty easy, a few changes in the interface but overall things are easy to find and not anywhere super weird. I did want to remove some stuff from the startup menu and ended up googling the steps for that and it was super easy.Finally, I thought I'd read this book and learn about all the cool new features of Windows 10. It does go into detail about some new features, but it also contains info about a LOT of really obvious stuff. You could easily upgrade to Windows 10 and NEVER pick up a book about it and never feel like you missed out on anything. If you wanted to be really sure, you could google something like, "top new features of Windows 10" and you'd be all set. There is so much of the obvious stuff in the book, that it gets in the way of finding the stuff that may not be obvious. Maybe it could have been organized in a way that made the trickier stuff or cooler stuff stand out or stand alone. It is a beautifully laid out book with many pretty pictures in full color, but mostly it's just a waste of time.

This is a nice party book that I thought had some creative themed ideas and best of all is that it's in a book format and not just someone's board on Pinterest so the ideas seem a little more unique and like you could do them for a party and five people aren't going to tell you, "oh, I have this pinned for ages and have been meaning to do it!" They are much less likely to have this book.There are a lot of creative ideas and they do have different themes from different Disney movies, but they also are mostly very universal so you could easily adapt them for whatever theme you want.

This is a "food for thought" book and a "wrap your head around it" book for those who keep hearing they NEED to use big data and use it well but aren't really sure how to think about or talk about it properly to get started or even decide how important it is. It's actually more user-friendly and easier to just sit down and read than I thought it would be. This book won't make you a whiz at using big data for your organization, but it will teach quite a bit if you are new to the subject and it will make you sound like a whiz at meetings and cocktail parties.

This thing is pretty useful. I've seen some of the stuff Cuisinart has been putting out that is pizza-themed and thought some of it was a silly idea, but this I like. I use it on the big, rectangular baking stone in my oven and I can just pull the rack out halfway and clean off the stone without actually removing it. Saves me from having to wrestle around this big, heavy stone (and possibly drop/damage it) and I can even use it while the stone is hot (like you know when the stone is dirty and you forget so you just preheat the oven? Yeah, I have seen people try to clean a hot stone without something like this and it's not pretty. Or safe.) I hope they come out with a matching dustpan/crumb catcher type thing.

I started following Kevin Gianni on YouTube about seven years ago when my then-boyfriend and I became vegan and I wanted to find any way I could to help him stick with it and make it about health (for me it was an ethical choice.) Kevin was traveling around the country in an RV with his wife, making a bunch of vlogs and themed videos. I never became a raw foodist, but I did follow a number of raw foodists like Kevin Gianni on their YouTube channels and blogs and took whatever healthy tips/recipes I could from them. Eventually, my interest in these videos waned as most of these people seemed to take a journey away from raw food and also seemed to pimp their own products more and more. I didn't subscribe in order to have someone sell me stuff and Kevin Gianni is one of the worst with the "all content contains an ad and promotes my wife's skincare line".So, having said that, this book is, surprisingly, mostly ad-free. Hurray!I liked this book not because Kevin is the best writer (he's not, but he's not terrible, either) or because it answered all my questions about food and eating (it doesn't) but I liked it because Kevin does explore a few subjects in interesting ways. He did remind me of Jillian Michaels, though. I'll explain: If you've only seen Jillian Michaels on The Biggest Loser then this won't mean anything to you, but if you've listened to her podcasts you can really see her taking a journey. She reads a bunch of papers in medical journals and talks to some experts and gets really fired up about certain things and then preaches it to the world. If you fast forward a few years, you will find she is just that much further down the road of her journey, and now eschews at least some of what she was saying before and has a bunch of new ideas. Kevin Gianni is the same...he's on a journey, and really this book reads like he's very much in the middle of it and still getting his act together. In fact, I think he may have published it a bit prematurely. In the meantime, however, he does have a few good pieces of advice and has researched some things in depth, like coffee, although I was surprised he didn't go into anything like roasting your own beans after sourcing them from somewhere like Sweet Maria's. I look forward to Kevin's next book, in maybe another five years, to see how his opinions and ideas have changed over that time.I had originally purchased this for Kindle, but I was then offered a hardcover review copy and I'm really glad I took it. If you have a choice, I recommend the hardcover as it's a very nicely laid out book and a much better experience than the Kindle version.

Okay, this lock is not going to stop a determined thief who sets out to steal something and has even the flimsiest bolt cutters, but it's great for preventing impulse crimes of opportunity. I like it for locking up my bike trailer when I go to get cat litter. Probably no-one in the hundreds of SUVs and pickup trucks in the parking lot is going to swoop in, detach the trailer from my bike and zoom off with it, but with this cable lock I just have more peace of mind and will even spend longer in the store without trying to glance out the window every ten seconds. I really like the long length.

This rice cooks up quick (20 mins, and if you're lazy don't even stir it) and into surprisingly firm, individual grains for a parboiled rice. It's not my favorite rice ever, but it's great for when you're in a hurry, holds up well under heavy sauces, and it's great in soups where quick cooking and the ability to hold a firm texture is a big plus. Would also make great red beans and rice (I made it and put a curry with garbanzo beans and potatoes over it, but now that I've mentioned it, I want red beans and rice!) Definitely a great thing to have in the cupboard for when you're trying to throw something together. I usually use a rice cooker and some brown jasmine rice, but cooking this up in a pan was definitely faster and really just as easy.

I love the design of this cat fountain. It takes the idea of the water bowl with a spot for a jug of water that you tip upside down and improves it by putting a lid on the jug that doesn't dispense any water until the jug is all the way into the bowl. Then, it adds a fountain to the whole thing.My cats didn't seem as enthusiastic as I at first, but this may be partly due to me taking away the old water bowl, installing this in its stead, then setting a couple Aerogardens on the floor nearby that I was cleaning out by running bleach through them. Suddenly, no old water dish, just three bubbling contraptions and the smell of bleach in the air. After that, it seemed like I never saw the cats drinking any water - really, it's not the kind of thing I normally sit around waiting for them to do, but one cat had a tendency to come away from the water bowl with a wet chin and walk around that way for a while and now...no wet chin.It's been maybe ten days and I have now seen all three using it all the time, although no more wet chin so that's odd. The bubbling fountain aspect of it doesn't seem to bother them, but you can give it a little turn and it won't bubble any more just in case. This is also handy if the noise bothers you when you're trying to sleep. (Most people are probably not sleeping in the same room as the cat fountain, but I think there are plenty of reasons you might want to "turn off" the noise of the bubbler for a while.I'm not going to take a star off for this BUT I wish this was ceramic and glass instead of plastic. I used to have a ceramic fountain for my cats and I couldn't remember why I got rid of it until I got this one. It was because, as beautiful as it was, and it did have a lovely design, it LEAKED. It also got really noisy if it ran low on water which of. course. it. did. because it LEAKED. This Oster Fresh Sips doesn't leak and it's very easy to tell when you need to fill the tank with water again, and like I said, because of the cool cap thingy on the tank, it doesn't even spill out when you go to place it back in the dish. It just would be a teeny, weeny bit better if it was ceramic and glass.

I am a sucker for anything with magnets, although I am sometimes disappointed in the quality of the materials and even the magnetic properties. Not with this, though. The way these pieces fit together is great fun and it makes putting everything away very easy as well. It is great to watch kids figure out what they can and can't do with this and check out the final result. I have seen some people mention keeping track of the little parts, but they are not that little compared to 11 1/2" doll accessories or Littlest Petshop pieces (ugh about those) and they are magnetic. I do wish there was a little more flexibility as to where you can put the magnetic dolls and accessories on the panels. Overall, it's a great, quality toy.

This wearable toy is pretty awesome. You get to wear the "repulsor" and then it tells you what to do as you interact with the action figures on their base stations. You might think doing this without a video screen would be weird or not so much fun, but this makes it seem like interacting with stuff on a video screen is what is weird and limiting. It may be worth it to get a second repulsor, so two can play. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is it needs about a zillion AA batteries. I think it would be worth it to pay a little more and get a rechargeable battery pack - it would definitely save money in the long run. In fact, make sure you stock up on batteries when you get this.

This book gives the impression that since previous Frozen Hairstyle and Disney Princess books did well, Disney wanted to cash in some more and put out another book but didn't want to put in a lot of effort and ran out of hairstyles.There is information about basic hair care and using hot irons. Then there is some information about basic things that have nothing to do with Frozen, like teasing your hair and different ways to make curls, braiding a scarf into your hair, that look like they came straight off YouTube. We are shown how to glue glitter onto a hairbrush. There are pictures of the Frozen characters here, but their hair does not match the hairstyle you are making.The next part is how to make accessories with a hot glue gun. Again, you are not making anything that matches what a Frozen character wears. Also, the photography looks nice, but if you're looking for explicit how-to photographs, it is lacking.Finally we come to straight-up hairstyles and braiding, and these ALSO do not match Frozen characters except the very first one pretty much does. The instructions aren't very good and there was one I read five times and still couldn't figure out what they were trying to teach us to do. (The "super long" ponytail. I finally think I figured it out, but I think it only looks good on the model because of just the right camera angle.)There are a few good tips in this book, but it drove me crazy that other than one long braid down the back you don't learn to make a single Frozen hairstyle, and if you're just looking for a more general hair care and styling book there are better ones out there.

This is a well designed surge protector. I like that you can slide to cover the outlets. I like that you get THREE outlets, and I like that the plug in the back is positioned on the bottom, so you can plug it into the top of two outlets and you still have the bottom outlet free. This is very handy for a lot of stuff that has those big, giant bricks you're supposed to plug into the outlet...you can plug one of those in underneath this. Well, some of them may still be too big, but for a lot of them it works. Lately I've tried some different power strips and surge protector type things and they all seem to have some little detail that makes them not quite right for me, but this one must have belonged to Baby Bear.

I am overall impressed with how much this doll looks like Mal (daughter of Maleficent) at the coronation in the movie "Disney Descendants". The dress is really accurate, although there is a kind of tulle layer between the other layers that I thought they ran out of on the dress on my doll or that maybe they placed it wrong. Looking at the product pictures, I guess they are all like that. Anyway, looking at all the details they really did a good job and even the face is very expressive and she's paler than the other DD dolls, just like the Mal character, and has a sly look on her face. The face is exactly the same as on the other two versions of Mal that are available, but the hair is different. ALL the Mal dolls have weird hair - like the other characters have long hair you can play with and just a little bit of it from the front will be styled and fastened back, but the other two Mal versions just have weird hair that is shorter in the back and longer in the front and quickly loses any style it had. THIS one has her hair up, so in a way it's the best version BUT you're kind of stuck with her having this updo. (Not sure what would happen if you took it down...maybe you can do that to yours and let me know! ;)

This is a good bandage and I like that it has a strap to fasten it on instead of those little grippy metal doohickeys. Of course, you do need to plan ahead to get the strap/buckle in the right place, but overall it's pretty easy to do one handed. Also, I think the black looks cooler than the sort of beige/fleshtone of so many bandages. Still waiting to find one in teal, like some pretty compression tape I got, but I'll take black for now. Other than that, it's a pretty basic elastic bandage.

This thing does not work as well as my microplaner, but it also does not grate fine slivers of my fingernails into the ginger, so I'm sure anyone eating food I might prepare will appreciate me using this and not contaminating their food with fingernail (that does sound kind of gross, I guess!) This grater is very pretty, I really love the colors, I just wish it grated a little bit more effectively.

This is a good, moisturizing cream and my hands need it! Unfortunately, it does smell kind of weird. I don't mind it when I put it on and then go outside, but I can't put this on and then sit somewhere where I might put my hands near my face. It does moisturize well, though, which does the trick to make my hands look younger, and it lasts pretty well, too.

Oh! Before I forget I want to tell you something - it's a little bit of a spoiler but not much and some people may want to know this (but skip this first paragraph if you know you don't want even the smallest spoiler and killing animals doesn't bother you.) In this book, three dogs are killed in a really gruesome way. We don't actually witness the act, only the aftermath, but, although you could argue it was important to the development of one of the characters, I felt it was a pretty unnecessary thing and then it kept being mentioned for the rest of the book. :(Okay...on to the regular review...Overall, this was an interesting book. I had to spend some time thinking about it after I finished and before I started to review. The plot is quite intriguing. Someone has set up a social networking site that asks teens (all from the same highschool, a little less than 700 of them) "what do you need?" and there is a blurb on the site about want vs. need. I found myself thinking about want vs. need myself quite a bit and doing that ruined the premise of the story a bit for me. While other kids are saying they need iPhones, Kaylee says she needs a kidney for her brother. Because her need is deemed a genuine need, it's not treated the same as the other requests on the site. BUT...does Kaylee NEED a kidney for her brother? That's my question.As a verb, Need is defined as: require (something) because it is essential or very important.As a noun, Need is defined as: a thing that is wanted or required.Now, those definitions are a little fuzzy. Maybe someone does need an iPhone because their old phone is broken or because they don't have a phone and they can't get a call about a job interview or something else important without a phone. At the same time, Kaylee isn't going to die or anything if her brother doesn't get a kidney.The whole premise is a bit whacko when you think too much about it (which obviously I did) and as I was reading the book there were many times I was like, "but why don't they just _____?" Kind of like watching a horror movie and you yell at the characters to not do the obviously stupid thing they are about to do. I mean, watch one of those schlocky B horror movies. In fact, this would probably make a good B movie.I do think if I'd read this when I was 13 I'd have liked it a bit more, but I'm assuming that I might not have been as aware of all the nonsensical parts and just been in love with the creepy premise and perhaps not found some of the hints about what is going on so totally obvious (like the first one is: why would Kaylee's dad disappear/run away? I thought that was completely obvious.)

This is a cute apron of a decent quality. The fabric is good and even the Chalkboard print is overall good and the style and the way the neck strap adjusts, I like all that and I think it's generously sized to fit almost anyone. The only thing I don't like about it is - I didn't realize it was going to say CHARCUTERIE all over it. I mean, there is not a lot of variety in what it says all over it, so it doesn't just say it once in an inconspicuous place. As a vegetarian who knows other vegetarians/vegans, it's not exactly an apron I can wear around company or take with me to a cooking class because of this.

This is a nice dishcloth. They clean well, absorb a lot of water (like if you want to wipe up spills with them) and can be washed and used again and again. They are cute, a very good size and I really like that they are made in Sweden. You do want to think a bit about how you hang them or set them to dry, as they dry in that shape.I do think the price seems a little high, but searching around the 'net I found that it seems to be about the same everywhere, although you may be able to find some cuter/more colorful styles. Perhaps we are just too used to really cheap products from China?

This is a great little camera bag for my Nex-6. I've tried a few different bags and a case that is formed to the camera (where you snap part of it off when you want to use the camera) as well as just putting the camera as-is in my purse (BAD idea) and this case is the best, whether storing the camera when not using it or carrying it around. I really like the cross body strap and the inside is the perfect, cushiony protector for my camera. It has a little extra room so if I were to put a bigger lens on it, it would still fit. If I were to make one change to the bag, I'd put a small pocket or two on the outside, just big enough to hold a few things like keys, ID, lip balm and a little money and/or credit card, but I still love the bag even without that because it fits my camera so well and is so protective as well as ergonomic to carry around.

This was an interesting little book. It's really more a novella. One of those stories you find written to satisfy the gap between two larger books (often published as an ebook only these days.) The prose walks a fine line between well crafted and over worked, between being wonderfully creative and just trying to stretch the story out a bit longer.This all takes place in a rather short period of time. I found it interesting because I feel I've known many Jack Gantoses and can even relate a bit. I went to a high school that was half the children of idealistic hippie parents and half kids that didn't fit in anywhere else and perhaps had been in trouble and were a little lost in life. It was a last stop/chance for many kids who had trouble finding their place in the world and Jack Gantos probably still would have gotten in trouble if he'd gone there, but he also probably would have made some great friends. They could probably write their own novellas that would make a nice set lined up side by side with this one.In the end, I'm no sure this book would make much sense to someone who can't relate. It doesn't magically explain anything. It is a nice diversion and an easy read and probably a must have if you are a fan of the author's other works.

This is an okay set of wooden spoons and I like the way having the handles all colored the same really makes them a set. This is similar to something you might buy at Daiso except for the handle coating only you are paying 10X as much so I have to question the value. BUT if the color on the handle matches your kitchen colors, that may make it totally worth it. I really like wooden spoons, especially bamboo, and it's useful to have all the different shapes and styles.

Update: after 3 weeks in the window these had turned almost completely brown on the outside from the UV. I wouldnt bother with these.The package came with 6 blinds, and I was installing them in my 36x70" windows and I cut two to width, but the blinds were not the same length as they are supposed to be. One fit with several inches to spare and the other was 4" short with the same amount of stretch.  Basically, just use black art paper and cut to fit, you will lose the pleat, but if you have to pull it out to get the necessary length, it isn't going to matter anyway.These aren't bad, just a bit expensive given they are just a pleated piece of paper, and given the poor quality control with each blind being a different length means I wouldn't recommend these, but they are great as a temporary blind, they block most of the light.  They will last me the month until I get real blinds.

This is a great basic walker/trainer of sorts.  It has no gimmicky noises (yay!), and no batteries.  It only rolls back and forth in a straight line, so the kid has to pick it up to turn.  Don't use on an upstairs level where they could roll it down the stairs of course.  Kids love this, and both my 1.5 and 3 year old play with it.

Bottom line is this is an inexpensive and light weight phone that is great for web browsing, running casual games that don't take much processing power, and general use phone, however the graphics performance is distinctly low end.  My 3d Benchmark Unlimited tests scores were only a bit over 4000, which is not very good compared to the near 20000 from my S6 Edge or a similar priced unlocked Amazon Fire Phone.  What do these numbers mean?  Not a lot, but if you game you will have very jerky video on this phone, it was only able to maintain 10 or 15 fps on a 720p video game rendering (both Fire Phone and my S6 edge could do 60 fps).Gaming aside, this phone is very slim and light and will fit many users needs as a basic web and smart device.  It is lacking some relatively standard features like NFC, and the screen resolution is noticeably worse than something like my S6 Edge.  However, the value is fair for an unlocked no-contract phone, but you do get what you paid for.  When the Fire phone was a similar price it was a much better buy since it was such a high performance device, however it is bulky and fairly heavy.So nice phone overall, but has some limitations which will put off some users.  If you can get an Apple, Samsung, LG, etc flagship phone on contract for the same price, it will be a much better phone, but this phone is not bad at all.Also note, that if you have ATT, this will not be LTE in most areas, but you can still get 4G which is fast enough for almost anything, I was able to get 3 Mbps up/down.

Great diapers with a secure and leak free fit.  I really don't have to worry about these coming off (except when the kids tear them off), and I trust they will stay leak free.  Amazing how well diapers perform these days.

This trimmer works great, doesn't cut too close so little risk of injuring yourself.  Cuts cleanly and smoothly, but will leave a short stub.  My wife loves it as I am not plucking my nose hairs while watching TV. I am glad it is not powered, a simple squeeze of the handle makes it easier than finger nail clippers with no charging necessary.  Great investment for unruly hairs.

These are food. Wouldn't say that they are good. They are mostly hemp hearts and sugars. My main complaint is they are sticky to eat, I prefer dry exteriors to make them easier to hold.My son didn't like these at all, but they are much like any other protein bar for flavor. Give them a try if you are looking for protein bars, otherwise get something with better flavor and that won't stick to your hands.

First let me start by saying that this watch is 5 star quality, but the shear size of this thing means I will never wear it.The stainless construction is nice, and the looks with the wire are great (except thickness from the side).A huge issue is the weight. The watch weighs almost 1 lb. I can't type at the computer, it throws my stride off, my arm is noticeably fatigued after wearing it for a short while, and it makes using my smartphone very awkward.The crystal is a nice anti-reflective piece, with very high clarity.  The chronograph is mostly for appearance since the wire mesh makes reading 10th and minutes extremely difficult. Knobs and button feel is excellent.I am a bit mixed on this watch, as a lot of it is personal opinion. Read my negatives and if you agree don't buy the watch, but if you don't mind the size and weight it is a great high quality watch.

This light has a very heavy base that makes it suitable for a location where it might otherwise get knocked over easy, but I wouldn't put it where kids could pull it over as the base could cause serious injury to a small child.  It is meant to be a shop light, so this is not really an issue as the kids should stay out of the shop anyway.Assembly was easy, put two screws through the base, and use the included wrench to tighten them down.  A wrench is also included for adjusting arm tension.Build quality is good, with all metal construction, but I don't like that the light can't swivel, especially given the design, it almost looks like it was designed to swivel, but changed their minds last minute.  The lack of swivel makes positioning the light in the desired spot much more difficult.  Also, the head should swivel to change the downward angle of the light.  A typical magnifying work light has all these adjustments (base swivel, head swivel, and similar arm adjustments), so this is a bit limiting in comparison.The power switch is very annoying to use, it is a touch sensitive switch that you tap with your finger.  The hard part is if you want to change brightness you tap and hold your finger there until it reaches the brightness you want, it first dims, then gets brighter, and cycles until you let your finger off.  As long as you don't change it often it isn't a big deal.Brightness is good for the power consumption, but not compared to one of the fluorescent work lights with a higher power rating.  It is also very cold light with not very high color rendering.  For a shop light this is generally fine.Overall, I like this light, its heavy build quality, and the fact it is sturdy enough to hang something from the end of it, but I knocked off a star for limited adjustability and annoying power switch.  A cool bonus feature is it has a built in USB port for charging your devices.

Nice quality blue jeans, I like the wrangler blue, not too dark or light.  Fit is as expected (classic is for thinner people, get comfort if you are overweight or just want a looser fit).  I don't have a lot to say about these, they are pants.  I really like the wrangler value, they tend to last longer than the more expensive jeans I have tried and do what they need to do.
Nice breathable polo shirt. Fit and finish is nice and as expected, collars are straight, nice and cool.  Good value.

Nice mid-priced headphones.  I had to switch to the smaller ear cups, but once I did they fit a lot better.  Sound quality wasn't up to the Aurvana headphones I also received to test, but these are also half the price.  The main difference is they lack richness in the vocals.  These are a bit tinny sounding.Since these are basically an ear plug, they do a decent job blocking out noises.  Controls are easy and they work well.  Headphones are a highly personable item.  I think these sound good, but not great. Average for their price class.These headphones come packed in a plastic pack, no pouch or anything for carrying them around, which is unfortunate since the ear cups can be pulled off.  I expect premium earbuds to come with a pouch.Bottom Line:Nice headphone for the money, as with anything HiFi related, you pay 90% more for 10% improvement.  These are a step up from base model earbuds, and they cost a bit more too, might be a good trade-off with the higher priced units.

What to say about this?  The liquid is sort of a gross color I am not used to, but whatever, feels the same, works into a nice lather, but it smells like Suave.  If you like that smell, great.  If used in your hair you might want to add a conditioner after since this left it pretty dry and statically, vs my usual shampoo/conditioner product.  The scent is mild and the product works as advertised, so a nice solid body/hair wash.

These are a nice set of great looking and high quality utensils.  The stand is nice, but is designed for standing on a counter with handle down, tool head lifted off counter.  The stand/prop is not for hanging on edge of pan as mentioned in another review, if you do this the tool handle is heavy and will lift up out of the pan and fall on the floor or range.  The stand could also get in the way in a drawer or holder, so these will work best if you hang them from the handles while not in use.The set is a practical set of a slotted and normal spoon, a soup ladle, spatula and potato masher.  All tools work as expected, and the handles are a nice quality silicone.  I like the stand as it gives a nice separation between the handle and the utensil like a finger guard/bolster on a knife.High quality, great looks.  Win-win.

This is a nice working lamp, with clear optics, but the balancing system is a bit flimsy not always wanting to position the magnifier well, and the light is not very secure.  Directions were poor and didn't mention removing the packing foam from around the light bulb, and the wire wraps that hold the bulb in don't do a good job, the light kept falling down on me until I got them positioned properly.So the light is good, but there are definitely better units out there.  The price is good on this one though, so I still recommend it.

I bought the Samsung S6 Edge for its classy looks, glass and metal design, so although this case does a great job of protecting the phone (except from a bar/edged object hitting left to right across the screen), it ruins the look of the edge.I was easily able to insert and remove my S6 Edge from the case, and all the buttons/functions work as expected, so it definitely isn't a bad case, but if you feel the need to buy a protective screen like this just buy the plain old S6 without the edge screen, since with this on you lose most of what differentiates the edge.My Edge will continue in the buff for the time being.

Having used compact SSD drives that are much smaller and much much faster (like 3x faster reads and writes), it is really hard to use magnetic disk anymore.  I am glad to see Seagate trying to maintain a presence, as for now they are still better value per TB than SSD, but that is all they have going for them.Benchmarking this with Black Magic Speed Test on my MacBook Pro with USB3 I was able to get about 100 to 120 MB/s both read and write.  So performance is on the slow side for spinning disk, but comparable to other bus powered devices.I was hoping for smaller size given that this is the "The thinnest 750 GB portable drive", this claim is only because there are no 750 GB external SSD drives. To be fair it is maybe half a mm thinner than the Samsung T1, but is much larger over all.The build quality is nice, but the matte finish is surprisingly annoying.  It is rough and rubs on everything, and collects finger prints and looks bad quickly.So if I took this drive by itself, I would give it a good rating, nicely made and thin.  However, my rating comes from what is on the market today, and the SSD drives are much better choices, offering much smaller sizes, no physical spinning disk to take impact damage (especially important with portable drives), and much higher performance (about 3x, typical).  There might still be a place for spinning disks in servers or when cost/TB is more important than portability and performance.I included a photo with a small SSD drive for comparison.

Great battery, output of ports lives up to specs with one port outputting over 2 amps continuous (measured with a USB watt-meter) and the other outputting 1 amp, so most high end smart phones and tablets will benefit from using the higher rated port.  Capacity is great, being able to charge my S6 edge multiple times, and it is nice to see a more compact battery using prismatic (pouch) cells instead of the standard Lithium 18650 cell (looks like a giant AA battery).The weather sealing is simply a sealed pouch that the battery is in, no better than using a ziplock for any other battery, so I wouldn't buy it for that reason alone, although it does provide some shock protection for the well built aluminum battery enclosure inside.  You can't use the battery while the pouch is closed.So overall, I recommend this battery, and it lives up to the advertised specs (surprisingly uncommon with inexpensive batteries), however, I find the value of the battery very low at the MSRP.

These are pretty nice ear buds, they don't do a great job with noise isolation, but have nice clear sound quality and fit well in my small ear canals.  However, I generally prefer the over the ear studio monitor earphones for added comfort.  If you are on the move and need a nice set of high quality earphones this is a great set.  They come with a nice case that you can slip into your pocket, and a nice quality control for volume.  They are fairly pricey and I can't say I was blown away by the sound quality (used to using high end sennheiser cans), with a notably weak bass response (typical of this style of earphone), but definitely better than a stock set of earphones included with the phone.  Trebles and vocals sound nice and clear.

This is a neat toy, but both my 3 year old and 1 year old wan't nothing to do with this giant Elmo.  The problem is that it is not approachable or hug-able with its hard and heavy head and being nearly as large as either of them it is a bit scary.As far as function, the toy is great with sensors for all sorts of motion, it can detect when you clap his hands, when you are moving around with him, etc.  So I would give it a 5 as far as toy quality, but it fails where it really counts and that is it will be an expensive shelf decoration.

These almond bars are amazing.  At least if you like almonds.  They have loads of whole almonds, good flavor, not too sweet and not too savory.  If you like sweet you might look elsewhere.  Texture was good, and I loved that they used honey for sweetener.  They are a bit gooey when warm, which I like.  A little on the messy side.

I will keep it short and to the point, I love this phone.  I bought an S4 when it was released, and immediately popped a 16 GB memory card in the back and never took it out after owning it for two years.  I always used the factory battery, and didn't see the need to swap it out (have to turn off the phone anyway to do this).  If you really need those features (and don't just think you do), get an S5, but I expect most don't really need those features.I bought the phone off contract and had to pay full price (disclaimer is I work for SSI and received a discount off the phone, but even if I hadn't I would have been willing to pay full price).  I had the opportunity to handle both the Edge and non Edge phones in the store before buying, and preferred the slightly sharper edges to the Edge phone, they hold better in my hand and don't slip down, so I bought the Edge.  Lets not kid anyone, the edges for show only, the clock function and edge colors are pointless, and stroking the edge to make the clock starts is so finicky that it is faster just to turn on the phone.The phone was easy to setup, very responsive compared to my S4.  The camera starts in no time, the new interface is slick and smooth, and performance of the phone is stunning.  The look and build quality of the phone is at the top level, as good as any competitor, and actually the phone isn't prone to bending like certain other phones (A friend has one of those phones, and it did in fact bend after a short while from light use in a pocket).  To be fair, my S4 had this problem as well.I am blown away by camera image quality, as good as any point and shoot.  I don't play many games on this phone, so didn't really need the processor performance, although this does give real time HDR video as well as 4k video lacking in most competitors.  When I do play the occasional game I am blown away how fast this is.Call quality is good, as with any phone, holding in certain ways can hurt call quality since the antenna is internal to the phone.  I only have a problem with this in rare cases when I hold the phone with my fingers on the back in building with weak signal strength. It isn't a problem, I switch to holding the phone normally if someone can't hear me.Battery life of this phone is excellent.  Some reports complain that it is a tiny fraction smaller than the S5 battery, and that is true, but it is still much larger than the main competitor's battery and has no problem lasting 1 or 2 days of moderate use.  The adaptive quick charger included can charge this phone so fast that battery life is really of no concern for most users.  Literally, 20 minutes on the charger and the phone is half charged again.  I haven't bothered with wireless yet (too slow).I love the pedometer, it seems accurate enough for its purpose, and the heart-rate monitor is much better than the one in my Gear S (which I don't wear much).  The red light does a better job detecting pulse than the green light in the Gear.My only complaint about the design of the phone is that hair can sometimes get trapped between the metal and glass and it will pull when you take the phone away from your head, but this is pretty rare and only if you rub it up through your hair or something (like bored and fidgeting).  Now I hope Samsung is quick to release their Payment option, as I think ability to use it with any mag strip card reader puts it way ahead of the competition.Finally, I found this phone has an IR blaster on it, meaning you can use it as a universal remote for almost all of your TV and other entertainment needs.  The Peel app is pretty decent and has schedules, reminders, favorites, and a huge supply of devices you can program it to work with.  All of my devices worked fine.  It can even do more complicated things like let the volume switch adjust the amplifier, and the channel button works on your TV.  You can also setup multiple rooms for different profiles.  This is way handier than I would have thought, although more flexibility would be nice (like the control for my TV lacks the "Netflix" button that is on the real remote).I am not gushing over this phone, as I really like the main competition for it as well, but honestly this phone surprised me, and I am glad to say that a Samsung product easily performs as well in function and in build quality as any of the competitors.  My S4 was always lacking on the build quality department.  I am glad to see Samsung has stepped up their game in a serious way.

These are nice microfiber towels, designed for kitchen use, but can be used for anything.  Really, they are just a kitchen style pattern on a regular microfiber towel like you would use for a car polish.My only complaint with these are the washing instructions are specific in that you should wash them in cold water and with no fabric softener.  This makes them perform better.I don't really like the pattern on these, but I am not reviewing the pattern.  If you have dry skin like mine the towel will scratch and stick at your skin (hard to explain), which is a bit annoying, but typical of microfiber towels of this style.Why do I give them 5 stars?  They works well, each towel will hold about 10 oz of water (soak it and wring it into a cup).  They dry streak free and do a good job of drying.  I will probably not use these in the kitchen, and instead use them in my shop, but they are good for intended use in the kitchen (again, if you don't mind how microfiber wants to stick to dry hands like mine).

Setup:Difficult until I figured out I had to disconnect my Wi-Fi AC1200 dual band range extender to set up everything over wireless.Function:Works great as a media server with my Samsung T1 SSD (once I reformatted it as FAT instead of ExFAT, be aware of 4 GB FAT file size limit, NTFS should work too).WiFi signal strength is excellent in my house and performance is great.Works with all my devices, unlike the AC1900, which refused to work well with my XBOX 360.eSata port is a nice touchReview:Overall, I don't like the user friendliness of the interface (it comes at expense of function).  It is targeted far too much towards average Joe/Jill, but it is an expensive router purchased by enthusiasts.  However, it is a well featured and high quality router which I will keep.  My benchmarking computers don't have AC Wi-Fi, so were only able to hit 13 MB/s writing to the drive attached via USB to the router, which is plenty for my needs, but if you have an AC device it will be much faster.Overall, it is a great high speed router, but decide if you really need this kind of power, cheaper units will work for most people.

Same great skittles in a nice colorful pack.  I have loved skittles for years, and my only recommendation is never mix them with M&M and Reese's Pieces in a large bowl and serve them at a party.  One of my bad childhood memories I still think about today.Skittles by themselves are great, and these bags are nice when you want a medium sized self standing bag to put on a pantry shelf.  With these particular flavors, I don't even noticed them mixed since they are already mixes individually.  All I have to say is they taste like Skittles, and that is great.

Great affordable fitness tracker.  Honestly, all I use my smart watch for is fitness tracking, so this is a more affordable alternative for the same function.  The benefit with this is the battery life is much better, being close to a week, instead of only a day.The unit paired quickly with my S6 Edge, but I had to restart the phone after pairing before the application could sync with the band.  This isn't a problem, but at first I thought the band might be broken.  Since then I haven't had issues synchronizing between the two.The unit is easy to use, just double tap the button to put it into sleep mode before bed, and you can configure it to vibrate in the morning to help wake you up, although I slept right through it so a second alarm might be necessary.  The bad stays secure during activities.My only complaint with it is that it is very wide, it is basically half the size of my Samsung Gear S, but the screen isn't curved so it actually sticks out more.

This projector is a very nice and compact unit, it has a couple minor quirks I would like to mention. The first is it appears to use some sort of sequential sequencing for the colors so you will get a rainbow tearing effect on high-contrast subjects when something moves in front of the image, like your eyelid blinking during an action scene. This is a similar effect to sequential viewfinders in cameras, if you have ever used one of those.Secondly, it doesn't have a great leveling system. It has one center foot to raise the front up, but it sometimes tilts a little to one side and there's no great way to even it out. One method you can use is a tripod with a nice leveling head on the tripod to make sure it is level and the height that you want so you don't have to correct for Keystone. The keystone correction is digital so will lead to resolution loss, fine for presentations, probably not for movies.overall, I really like the projector. The image quality is great, and even though it isn't 1080p, picture looks very good, not that different then my 60" sharp aquos at a normal viewing distance.  The lens quality is also very good.I like that it controls just like any LG TV, it has a fast and responsive menu system, it has a built in tuner you can receive over-the-air broadcasts, and several different inputs. The volume for the over the air tuner is a little low over the built-in speaker, but it has an audio output (stereo).This is a great portable projector that I recommend, but it has a few caveats.  Nothing that would stop me from buying it, but it is they are worth considering depending on your usage.

I like to shop at a local coop, and they also give a small nickel discount for each of your own bags used, so reusable bags are a great deal.These bags will barely hold two gallons of milk, and it is a tight fit. I am able to snap up on the straps with 2 gallons of milk and the handles hold strong, but be aware if you pull at the stitching from the side, the handles will easily rip off the bag. This is not a normal use case for shopping bags, but could happen depending how you use it.Material quality is nice, my only complaints are the slightly small dimensions and possible strap tearing.
