This fertilizer and insect control works great. The lawn likes the "food" and the pest control part works fine so far, but will update when I have had more time with the product.It is easy to apply with a broadcast spreader, but be sure to apply as directed.  This 5000 square foot bag is good for an average house on a 1/5th acre lot.

Update:Junk, would not recommend this, only lasted two months or so of weekend use before it totally stopped working, sometimes there would be coffee, and sometimes not.  Water wouldn't pump out through the grounds.Pros:Easy to useWorks with all standard K Cups, even those without special lidsWater dispenser is easy to useWorks with ground coffeeCons:Doesn't have a shared water container between coffee side and hot water sideSlightly noisy during brewing.Review:Bottom line is I like this more than my Keurig 2.0 machine because how easy it works with both ground coffee and K cups.  The hot water dispenser is much easier to use as well, being able to dispense any amount of hot water (not fixed at 6 oz increments).  However, it doesn't have a water reservoir like the Keurig does, so it isn't as good for social events where you want to serve many people.  It is great for someone who makes maybe 1 or 2 mugs of coffee in the morning before work or on weekends.

These wipes make applying the dash protectant extremely easy, but depending on the texture of the surface it might leave behind lint so you might need a follow-up wipe with a microfiber if your surface pulls apart the wipe.  Also, if your dash is textured you might need to go over it a couple times to get down in the recesses in order to make it all uniformly shiny.  Any spot you miss is going to look very bad in comparison to protected areas.A few comments about UV protection, the windows in cars are tempered glass, and the front window is multi-layered in all cars, meaning it already has near 100% UV protection.  The side windows are probably only 70% in most vehicles which don't have special glass, so don't expect this to help the dash a lot.  Main function is it looks nice.Has a slight VOC smell like a new car, but isn't overpowering.  If you apply it, give your car an hour or so to air out before driving.  Also, this product is very slippery after applied, do not put this on your steering wheel or anything else that requires a secure grip.One complaint I have had with these products is they evaporate over time and leave a film on the windshield.  I will update my review if I notice anything like that after a couple months.

Easy to setup dual band (2.4/5 GHz) repeater.  Easy to setup with my smartphone, had it running in just a couple minutes.  Plug in, attach your device to the specified WiFi network, open a web browser, start the setup and tell this device your networks and passwords you want to repeat and you are good to go.  My signal strength improved dramatically in my upstairs rooms after installation.

Nice high quality stacker.  Opening the product was easy enough, just open the box and remove some hard plastic shrinkwrap from around the stacker (be sure to dispose of any plastic film immediately due to choking risk).The stacker is very easy to use for all ages, and very open ended in how you use it.  The child is free to make any choice they want on how to stack, making different patterns, or matching, etc.My only complaint besides the value is that the hard plastic is noisy when it hits together, making it a fairly loud stacker for the kids to play with if they get aggressive with it.

Excellent drive.  It is hard to picture just how small this drive is, especially considering it is 500 GB.  I included a picture so you can see, it is about the same length as a standard smartphone is wide.The packaging is nice and feels like you are opening an iPod or something, nice high quality cardboard box with nice inserts.  It is a bit wasted since the drive build quality itself is inexpensive plastic.  This is actually my only complaint with the drive, if it were nicer build quality it would be even better, but it isn't bad so I don't take off for it.There is a basic setup which worked perfectly from my iMac 2012 running 10.10.3 Yosemite, it takes a couple minutes to perform and you are offered the choice of encrypting the drive or not.  As a warning, if you set encryption the data is unrecoverable if you forget your password, but you can use the drive again if you factory reset it.Performance is excellent.  I saw 390 MB/s write and 433 MB/r with my Mac Book Pro running Black Magic disk test and using the computers USB 3 port.I don't usually say highly recommended, but this is an amazingly nice data storage device that I would have never believed possible 10 years ago.

I received this battery in exchange for an honest review. Overall I like the form factor of this battery pack, with the nice rounded edges. It is easy to hold or put in a pocket. Its output is only rated at 1 amp, so it is mainly for cell phones and not for tablets. Most tablets need about 2 amps  to charge adequately.This device is very simple to use, plug the big USB port into your favorite USB charger and plug the mini USB end into the battery, or to charge your device take the same USB cord and plug the big USB port into the battery and the mini part into your device. There is a button on the battery  which will let you check remaining life, by lighting up one or more of 4 LEDs.The capacity of this device is to enough to charge most smartphones once or a bit more.

This Solar powered LED light is okay for a limited purpose of where you want a not too bright motion light where wiring a hardwired light isn't practical.  The initial battery charge lasted many hours, but after draining it completely and letting it charge outside for a day it only recovered maybe 1 hour worth of charge, so don't use this light if you want it to provide light all night, every night as it doesn't charge quickly enough to do that.Brightness is acceptable to illuminate a door so you can find your keys and open the lock, and the motion detector works well enough for that.Quality is very low, poor fit and finish, and ugly blue/white lighting (very low CRI).Overall it is a fine light, and works well enough for what it is, but the places I would really want to put it wouldn't work with Solar.  I think it is designed for the side of a trailer or something, but would work outside a shed too.

Great for kids who want to be like their super hero Captain America, just make sure to keep it out side.  Inside, look forward to destruction and household decoration as the spinning ring flies and knocks everything off the shelf.  The launcher is pretty powerful when pulled aggressively and can really send the rings flying around the house.The only thing I noticed when I opened it was that it was pretty small, but the product pictures on Amazon do a good job of showing scale with the model holding it.  If you see the box in a store it is pretty obvious how small the shield is.Assembly is straight forward, there is a hand grip you have to install on the backside by pushing it in, but be sure it clicks in all the way.  I had to set the shield on a hard surface and push down on it fairly hard to get it to snap into place.It is a fun shield, and even if the ring launcher breaks, the shield is still useful as a shield or halloween costume prop.  Fun toy for the younger kids.

This thing is a machine.  It will crunch through CD after CD (through the top slot, not auto-feeder) and keep on shredding.  It hardly slows at all as you feed it large quantities of materials to shred.  The auto-feeder portion is also nice, but don't know how much time it will really save unless you have reems of 8.5x11 paper to shred that is in nice stacks.  As it is you can feed pretty quickly through the top slot and since the machine doesn't really slow down like some cheap units I have had.Safety is decent.  The bin doesn't latch in though so kids could pull it out and get fingers into shredded CD bits (fairly sharp) and make a mess, so I would keep it away from the little ones.  The cutters are exposed if you open the lid for the auto-shredding tray.  They aren't particularly sharp when not in use, and shouldn't be able to be turned on with the lid open, but again, another reason to keep little kids away from it.This shredder is for someone who generates a lot of paper that needs shredding.  For your average home user it is definitely over-kill, but maybe if you have a small business or something where you need to deal with a lot of invoices or something it could be handy.Overall quality seems acceptable, but I notice with mine that the bin doesn't fit that nicely under the shredder with a gap around the front edge, but all it really needs to do is collect the trash that falls out so it still does the job.
Work great, fit my daughter about the same as Size 5 (she has a pretty small waist).  Three different patterns.  Not a lot to say about these, they are absorbent, sturdy, no complaints.

Nice styled wraparound sunglasses, that also serve as protective lenses.  These don't have much more coverage than regular wraparound sunglasses, but would make a great set of shooting glasses, or other safety function where you only need safety from the front and sides. Even riding bikes or motorcycles. The lens sits pretty close to my face, but still has a small gap.Any safety glass which is polycarbonate is going to have near 100% UV protection, so this really isn't a competitive advantage.  That aside, these are excellent out-door safety glasses for contact users or those without any corrective lenses.  Fit tight on the head, but still fairly comfortable.

Powerful, quiet, great for small jobs/home owners.This style needs to be held on the right so it doesn't pull up against your leg. A tad heavy, but balanced well enough and is great quality.I also received a Greenworks 80V blower to test at same time, and they are similar noise levels. I like the Dewalt since it starts instantly and has a more sensitive trigger, but Greenworks is a tad more powerful and has three speed settings, which gets around lack of sensitivity issue with variable trigger, and sucks from the back so it is better for lefties. I recommend either.

This chain saw is the perfect matching for a home owner who uses a chain saw a few times a year, but doesn't want the maintenance associated with a gas 2-stroke saw.  No worrying about mixing fuel and oil, no worrying about old fuel, you pop the battery in and it will start.I have both the 40 V 4 AH saw and this 80 V 2 AH saw, and both are good.  Both have 145 watt-hour battery packs, but the 80 V saw seems to run the blade a little faster and is slightly more powerful, so expect battery life to be slightly less.  Both are good for a consumer who might cut down no more than a few trees a year.I find that these saws make good pairings with GreenWorks' other tools, so you can use the same battery in your lawn mower, so if you buy a couple tools you have some spare batteries to swap around.If you cut too quickly the saw will stop cutting and beep, this is the same as a gas saw would do when it stalls.  Overall power is excellent, and they will stand up to any light duty usage.  It isn't totally mess free since you still need chain oil, but I love how quiet they are compared to gas saws, and no idling either.My only complaint is that the new 80 V saw doesn't include a cloth case like the 40 V had, but it is not really necessary either.  Definitely recommended for a consumer, and for pro if you do light use and have some spare batteries.  If you are cutting all day I would probably stick to gas for now.

Nice high quality drill bit set.  The hex ends are great for quick release and the overall tool quality is good.  The innovative sleeve makes using this set even faster.  No need for a separate driver for screwing in bolts, or clumsy bit changes.  I would probably use a separate driver anyway since I have one.  Not much to say about these; drill, drive, and screw.  What more do you want?

The ingredients list basically has some fancy names for oil listed on it, and the organic calendula is the last ingredient.  You might as well just grab some olive oil and rub it in as it smells a lot better.  I liked the shampoo/body wash, but not this due to the fragrance.  If you like heavily floral smells this might be for you.  I keep smelling my hands every time they are by my face and it makes me want to gag.

I love to review electronics gadgets, so jumped at the chance to review the J-Tech Digital vertical mouse in exchange for an honest review.  The mouse is a bit awkward to use, I tend to grab the buttons when I go to move it (at least initially), but with a little time it is easy enough to get used to.  This mouse is best for right handed individuals.The DPI button on top is really great for quickly adjusting the tracking speed from super slow to super fast in 3 steps (total).  So it has Slowest, slow, and normal speeds.  This style of mouse I like to track quickly, so set it at the fastest speed, but the slow speeds can be nice for precision work.Be sure to try it without the base extension, I found the angle with the base extension removed better for my hand, but you might be different.Again, set to fastest speed so small wrist movements can move the mouse across the screen, and if you like your wrist more vertical, I think this is a great comfortable mouse.

Lots of marketing thrown into this, with ingredients like Organic Calendula, but lets face it, it is soap mixed with lotion.  The first non-water ingredient is your typical sodium laureth sulfate typical of most soaps and shampoos, and it is distributed by a laboratory.  It smells like soap, but you can tell the moisturizer mixed in, it separates out.  It makes my skin feel soft and the babies don't seem to care, although it will burn the eyes if it gets in them, so avoid eye contact.

Nice looking, high quality, kettle grill cover.  Remains flexible in the cold, which is nice, as my other cover I can take off and stand on the ground and it won't tip over in the cold, it was like removing a piece of plastic.I am using this on a Weber 22" grill, and it works fine, covers it pretty loosely.  There is a string included for cinching around the bottom through grommet holes, but I didn't bother, I like to be able to take the cover off quickly.  In a windy area it might be worth using this.

2:11 MinsUpdate: In video case is upside down, flip the iPad over and it works better And won't open up.Pros:Nice build qualityClear panel on the back to see apple logoDrop protectionCons:Any Angle support can easily be used upside-down.Rubs on screen if you don't straighten Any Angle bend before closing itSlippery on the backBottom Line:Nice quality case, don't know how useful any angle feature is, but it could be nice, especially if using with a keyboard.  Functionally, the support is far more useful than the nice Apple case I have for standing up iPad horizontally and added drop protection is nice, but it is bulkier and heavier. Always a trade ofd.

2:47 MinsPros:Simple, Well balanced, Rapid ChargingCons:Bulky, 2 second delay after pulling trigger, no leaf vacuum option (blower only)Review:See video.Air speed is not as good as my cheap 120 V wired blower, but at the same time I never like to use that blower because dealing with the power cord is a hassle.  I really like this 80V pro blower and plan on using it for cleaning up my sidewalk after edging, cleaning up around the house, drying my car after washing, etc.  It has a lot of air flow, which makes it great for those uses.  Also, I will get the 80 V lawnmower and snow blower and then have everything on the same system.  This makes dealing with batteries easier.Some Technical rambling:Comments about higher voltage power tools:  80 V doesn't automatically make it more powerful than 40 V, and since power is a product of current times voltage, we really have no idea if an 80 V tool is more powerful than 40 V tool unless it states the current it operates at.  What higher voltage allows is smaller internal wiring, and means you can make more power at the same current flow, so it is often more efficient to run at higher voltage.If you look at the 40 V 4 Ah pack for the older line of tools and the 80 V 2 Ah pack, they actually have the same watt hour rating, or they can both supply the same amount of power.  Internally they both have the same number of cells, but they are wired differently, one to give higher voltage the other to give higher current, but both can deliver the same amount of total power, making the 80 V battery pack a little over-priced in comparison.One thing I notice with the manual is they have some incorrect information on Lithium-ion battery storage.  They say to store fully charged at room temperature, but according to Battery University and other well respected battery sites, Lithium-ion is best stored long term in cool locations at 50% charge or less.  For best longevity (long term), charge your batteries immediately before use and store them charged over winter or when not in use at 25 to 50% state of charge in a cool dry area.  If you drain them completely, don't store them without charging them for a little bit.  Lithium-ion doesn't like to be drained until it is dead.  Battery University indicates that storing fully charged at 77 F for just a year and you would lose 20% of the capacity, permanently.  This means your batteries would only be useful for a few years before dropping to about half their original capacity.  Stored at 40% charge and the same temperature, and the capacity would only drop 4% over the same year.

This is a great product for someone who uses their MacBook as both a desktop and a laptop.  You can hook your external monitor and storage drives up to this, along with ethernet and other USB devices, but have it easy to disconnect the computer.  My only complaints with this is it will not provide power for the computer, so you still need to have the power adapter hooked up to the Mac to keep it running, and it has no status light to indicate it is plugged in and connected.Thunderbolt is basically PCIe run external to the computer, so it is an extremely versatile and high speed bus, so it allows a lot of flexibility in terms of running video, audio, and high speed devices.  I am glad this dock included the Thunderbolt cable, since Apple charges a pretty high price for them.Another thought is if you have a 2012 Thunderbolt mac with no USB 3 ports, this will give you a USB 3 port suitable for performance of high speed SSD drives.  I tested it out on my MacBook Pro (new enough for USB 3) and my high speed memory card had no trouble running at 180 MB/s write and 280 MB/s read on either the dock's or computer's USB 3 port.So overall, this is an excellent dock.  With it you will maintain the same number of Thunderbolt ports (it has 2, but one is required to hook it to the computer), HDMI, 2 USB 3, Ethernet RJ45, and a front mounted USB and audio/mic ports.Definitely worth while if you use your MacBook at a desk frequently, especially if you use additional monitors and storage.  Like hard drives for video editing and storage, backup hard drives, etc.

I received this for free in exchange for an honest review.First thing I did was look at the directions to see if it could filter urine.  I don't see that it is listed and it says it is not suitable for sea water (probably due to sodium) so I would assume this is not suitable for urine.  I tried it with salt water and still get a strong salt taste.  This isn't a deal breaker, but this would be handy to be able to have this ability in an emergency.That aside, it wouldn't be a bad idea to carry one of these filter with you back packing or going into some area where you might not have access to clean water and didn't have a fire or time to boil water.  My only complaint with it is that it takes a long time to drink through the unit, it takes a lot of force to suck the water through the filter mechanism, but this is worth the effort for clean water.Limited purpose, but great to have when you need it.

While it is unrealistic to believe reading this book will eliminate all conflict in all marriages, the information Dr. Hawkins provides is valuable and presented in an easy to read and understand manner.As a therapist myself, I completely agree that seldom is the initially identified irritant the real reason for marital discord, but usually just the jumping off point. However, unless both partners are committed to seeking the truth and experiencing the growing pains associated with personal change, there won't be an end to fighting.Conflict requires at least two participants, and if one refuses to fight, surrenders so to speak, the conflict must end. My experience with couples is that the non-surrendering partner will escalate the behaviors while attempting to elicit the expected response (it's somehow validating) for the now passive partner. If that response doesn't come, then the opportunity for meaningful conversation presents itself.One element that concerns me is the self-humbling advice. I don't think this works in the long run if it's one-sided, if it's unappreciated by the non-humbling partner, if it becomes the end of the conflict and not the resolution. It just becomes a pattern in the process of conflict.The problem inherent with most books of this nature (and therapy itself, for that matter)  is that real people in pain don't always (maybe even rarely) respond as we think they will - in a rational, non-defensive, non-judgmental manner. So we therapists  open our toolboxes and offer our most revered  tips and tricks, only to find they are useless in the face of life-long habits and beliefs.This book - and hundreds of others - is chock full of great advice, but it will not magically dissolve conflicts, particularly those ingrained in a couples interactions with each other. So rather than expect a miracle, expect to learn something new about yourself and your partner and integrate what you learn with a few sessions of therapy. There are many therapists who work on a sliding scale for fees and a few sessions can provide a context for the material in this and similar books.

Warning:  I am predisposed to love any story (book, movie, song, etc) about dogs. I am a bonafide  dog lover and I make no excuses for that.To summarize the plot of this short and sweet book: widower George decides to sell everything and travel across the United States, seeing the sites (and sights) he and his wife were never able to see, due in large part to her illness. As he prepares to depart, his adult daughter coaxes him into taking a St. Bernard named Lewis along. Lewis is the well-loved dog of a small boy who has developed a serious allergy to Lewis. The family doesn't want to give Lewis away permanently, just to have someone foster him for a year or so. Reluctantly George agrees and the journey begins.What George soon discovers is the magic of Lewis (and all dogs) - Lewis' ability to be the perfect companion. polite, respectful, and a heck of a good listener. As the miles roll by George tells Lewis all the things he cannot tell anyone else. Lewis is non-judgmental and certainly not critical of anything George tells him. George finds a measure of peace which has previously eluded him.I don't ordinarily care for blatantly religious books as they seem to push an agenda not appreciated by all readers, but this book was different. More 'spiritual' than 'religious' and I can't imagine it would be offensive to anyone.This book will triumphantly take it's place with other dog books on my bookcase shelves, and when I see the cover I will fondly remember Lewis and his healing demeanor.

Ferals is an engaging fantasy with seriously sinister villains, nefarious plots, and unlikely heroes. For fullest enjoyment you must suspend your disbelief and set aside your preconceptions.Abandoned as a small child by his human parents, teenager Caw has been raised by crows and now he can communicate with them and command them to do his will. He lives in Blackstone, a gothic sounding city where the good is almost outnumbered by the bad, and the battle for the city never ends.Arising after a period of dormancy is The Spinning Man, a harbinger of evil and corruption, who some years ago brought forth a city-wide summer of violence and destruction. Caw and some unlikely friends must join forces to save the city.As I read I kept seeing this as an animated film. The characters are drawn for a screen, to me. The book is dark and slightly disturbing so I wouldn't recommend it for anyone under 15, probably. As it is the first of a trilogy, I expect future stories to widen the scope and flesh out even more the characters introduced in Ferals.  I enjoyed this and would recommend for more mature teens.

Set in 1950, the Muckers are a high school football team in a small Arizona mining town destined for oblivion. With the mines closing, the residents leaving the town in droves, the football team embodies the last hurrah for this town. The team's quarterback, Red,  is the younger brother of the last great quarterback the team had a few years back. But rather than going on to college and professional glory, big brother went to the Army and was killed in Korea. Red has much to deal with, given the weight of being the last quarterback ever for the disappearing Muckers, his grief and anger about his brother's death, and his own uncertainty about the future.This is a well written novel based on a real town and team in Arizona. The characters are likeable with good hearts and their own difficulties. Without specific spoilers, the ending is good and positive for readers, not just young adults.Recommended for those who enjoy the underdog triumphs stories and movies.

Agoraphobia is an anxiety disorder which seems on the surface to be sort of silly - unless you or someone you know well has experienced it, and then you and understand that  to sufferers the world outside is terrifying and dangerous, and the only way to remain safe is to remain inside. This story is about a once successful filmmaker whose life was turned upside down with the deaths of several family members, so she retreats to her family home with her young son and shuns the outside world it its dangers and pitfalls.Young Willie hardly questions this existence until he approaches his teen years, then begins to doubt his mother's perceptions. He dares to venture outside and starts to experience a blossoming of his senses and intellect. As he interacts with others his world expands dramatically.This is a well written story, bittersweet but beautiful. The characters are engaging and the story captivating.

If you harbor any paranoid delusions this book will boost them to the forefront. Though marketed for young adults, it might be too intense for anyone in their mid teens, and it certainly is engaging for adults.The plot is not new - the government has conducted clandestine operations it wants no one to know, so uses highly unethical science to "wipe" the memories from the soldiers who carried out those operations.But of course some of the soldiers begin to remember, to speak to others about that. One such solider calls a newspaper, and so the story begins. The newspaper sends an intern to investigate and she follows clues until a chilling picture begins to be revealed.  Throughout she and her cohorts are in peril from the selfsame government who desperately wants to keep this story under wraps.To say more would spoil the story ------  it's very well written, more than a little menacing and scary for those who never met a conspiracy theory they didn't embrace. The ending was unsatisfying and I'm not sure it that means there's a sequel in the works or not.

In this first book of a proposed series, author Ally Carter introduces us to Grace, a 16 year old whose father in the military and usually away from home, and whose mother died in a tragic fire three years ago. Grace lives with her grandfather, ambassador to Italy, so she lives a seemingly enviable  life in the embassy house. Except - Grace believes she saw her mother murdered before the fire by a man with an unforgettable facial scar. Grace sufferers from post-traumatic stress disorder and though she's received treatment, continues to be consumed by the belief her mother's death was a murder, not a tragic accident.This book is setting up the storyline, locations, characters, and as such is not thoroughly engaging as I suspect the second story in the series will be. Grace struggles with her deeply held convictions and everyone else's contrary beliefs. It's a great plot that will hopefully in the next book burst into intrigue and activity.I think this is well worth reading and will be sure to read book two

What if Heaven isn't anything like it's imagined and talked about in church? What if it's segregated by age, vegetarian, eternally gloomy with no sitting at the right hand of the big guy?Thirteen year old Oliver - nicknamed Boo because of his pale skin and otherworldly appearance - dies suddenly while in school and finds himself in Town, a heaven populated by other 13 year olds from the USA, with dorms and no adults. Soon after his arrival another classmate appears and brings the new they were shot by a school gunman - who may also be in Town.Back home, Boo was awkward, geeky, not popular. In Town though he finds a voice and friends. He and his classmate Johnny seek the gunman among the other thirteen year olds.Imaginative, very well written, engaging characters. A coming of age story of sorts with a satisfying ending and a most unusual plot. Highly recommended.

The Cyndonian Pyramid is the sequel to the Obsidian Blade, and it's almost imperative you read the first book first.To be able to imagine and then create an alternative universe fully populated and operating under vastly different laws of physics is no small feat. Mr. Hautman has done so, brilliantly. The characters are well drawn, interesting, easy to feel for. The plot is complicated and keeps your attention. The writing is good - very good.If you want plot details read the publisher's notes. If you want an engrossing read, just start reading (but read the first book first).

I don't usually read other reviews before I write mine, but this time I did. I was struck by the many reviews often many paragraphs long that so thoroughly discussed the plot, writing style, and characters. Those long reviews will answer every question any potential reader might have about this book.So what will I say? It's a wonderful terrible book. It will wound you with the unfairness and downright meanness of the girls. At the same time you will appreciate the author's insight into how today's social media has become an entity into itself, molding and shaping reality in a bizarre way.This book is amazingly well written in a style unique in my experience. I would like to read about the author an what shaped her  vision of this novel.This is definitely one I will share with my teenaged granddaughters.

I'm very tech backward. My phone has features I'll probably never use, and I certainly never expected to have a wireless charging pad - then Amazon offered this one to try.  It really couldn't be easier. You plug the pad in, place your phone on the pad, and like magic (because wireless does seems like magic to me) it charges.There's no more fumbling with the USB charging cable - which end is up and which end is down. Just lay the phone down and the light comes on indicating it's charging. It may be my imagination, but it seems to charge more quickly, too.A great product you didn't know you needed until you have it.

If you've used mechanical pencils in the past and been aggravated when the lead broke, or the eraser didn't work well (or fell out mid erase) or wasn't comfortable in your hand - this set of 4 mechanical pencils might change your mind. For one thing the "lead advancement" mechanism is smooth and works well. The lead seems just a bit thicker so it doesn't fracture as easily if you press down a bit, but it doesn't leave a broad "kindergarten" kind of line.These are probably designed for kids because of the Avengers motif, but adults can love them too!  (the Avengers AND the pencils.)  The triangular shaped barrel is comfortable in the hand and I found my hand didn't get as fatigued as with a round pencil.An excellent mechanical pencil which feels well made and sturdy. Highly recommended.This package comes with an extra package of leads and erasers, a nice touch for Paper Mate to do.

We have a chubby little Chihuahua with hip problems so I thought this might be a good opportunity to see if changing her diet will help her lose a little bit of weight and maybe make it easier for her to get around.The description suggests 70% of dogs will lose weight over 10 weeks with this food, fed by recommended portions, so I won't really know how effective it is until that time passes, then I will update this review with hopefully positive results.Hill's is a premium food by anyone's standards, and used to be sold only by veterinarians in formulas designed for dogs with medical problems. They've now branched into more widely distributed venues and have "regular" dog food (soft and kibble) as well as their specialty products.J-Lo (the Chihuahua) loved the portion I gave her for dinner tonight. I think she would have preferred a larger serving, but if she seems too hungry I will supplement with veggies maybe. She's older and didn't have any trouble eating the food and licking the bowl, so it must have pleased her picky palate.Time will tell if this helps her lose a little weight, and I will report back.

I have dogs and dogs mean increased dust from outside, pet hair, and pet dander. When you add that to regular household contaminants and odors, keeping an odor free home is a chore. I was eager to try this small machine for those very reasons.I have other Holmes products that I am quite pleased with, and this air purifier is another great product. It is quiet while running, and seems to help eliminate odors. After running for a week, I checked the filter and found a fair amount of air-borne particles which had been captured by the unit. The machine is sturdy when placed horizontally on a table and does not interfere with watching television or listening to music.Hopefully this little until will continue to work well and I will consider getting a larger one for the den.

I didn't use this taco grilling rack exactly as recommended, as I wanted to try it quickly and we hadn't grilled in a few days, so this is what I did.I'm not fond or purchased taco shells, so I took corn tortillas and brushed them with peanut oil on both sides, then draped them across the peaks of this rack.  I stuck it in the oven at 400 degrees for several minutes, until the shells crisped up. Then I placed the shells folded side down into the valleys of the rack, and filled with taco meat, veggies and cheese.This worked very well this way. I can't see any reason it wouldn't work equally well on a grill to make the taco shells. The coating on the rack is non-stick and the baked shells were easy enough to remove without sticking. Having the valley to put the shell in to be filled made it very easy and tidy. Can't wait to try grilled fajitas in the shells!This is a winner for me. Will be having tacos very frequently now.

I'm not a reader of the anime or manga comics but I have seen illustrations and thought I had a pretty good idea of what Miss Manga might mean: heavy, thickly applied mascara to form spiky lashes That's really not my style, but as I haven't recently been very happy with mascaras I've tried, I thought this was worth a try.I've always been a L'Oreal product fan, and I'm quite pleased to say this mascara is not what I expected, in a very positive way. It wasn't thick or clumpy, my lashes didn't form into dangerous looking spikes.  I really like the brush and it's easy to apply a couple of light coatings which enhanced my lashes without making me look like a comic book heroine.This washed/wiped off easily with a little coconut oil on a cotton pad. So far very happy with this mascara and will buy it again.

My husband likes insulated tumblers with straws for his iced tea and I have purchased several various brands over the last year. The Copco is his favorite for these reasons:  1.  the screw on lid is threaded well and easy to attach. No mis-threads or moving the lid around to try to get the threads lined up to attach.  2.  when the lid is attached, the side of the lid is flush with the side of the tumbler; there's no lip protruding  3.  the straw is flared on the bottom so it won't pull out of the tumbler  4.  the double wall provides an insulating effect which slows down the melting of the ice  5.  the double wall also eliminates condensation on the exterior of the tumblerI wash these by hand and do not submerge them in the wash water as it is possible for the glue that holds the tumbler walls (on all insulated items) to separate and allow water into the air space between the tumbler walls.These are well constructed and sturdy though unfortunately this order arrived with the outside wall cracked.  Amazon's amazing customer service was quick to fix the problem however. Prices for these tumblers can vary greatly among vendors so check for best deal.

The primary requirement of a hair clipper and blade is that it cut hair easily and accurately. It's important to have that sweet spot between too light and flimsy (which means it will break the first time it slips off a table) and too heavy, which causes fatigue for the hair cutter. Though my experience with hair cutters has been limited to the Oster brand, I'm pleased to say this Wahl has exceeded my expectations.The clipper body is contoured to the hand which reduces hand cramping and increases the user's ability to maneuver the clipper as needed. There is some vibration as is to be expected when you're holding a motor in your hand, but the vibration is not significant (at least with my set of clippers) and didn't cause any discomfort. The clipper housing remains cool for the duration of the hair cut and only begins to warm up after several haircuts. Even this it isn't uncomfortably warm.The kit comes with literally everything you need to complete a haircut without searching for scissors, combs, etc. around your home. The kit proivdes a selection of blade sizes and comb sizes for precise cutting. Though it's too early to know if the blades will remain sharp for a long time, they are certainly sharp and ready to cut out of the box. The combs are heavy plastic with metal attachments and allow the cutter to cut hair to the length desired.The clippers come with a long cord which means you can easily move from front to back and side to side when giving a haircut.  When you're all finished, use the small blade brush to brush out any hair from the blades and store everything in the handy (and very sturdy) storage box.Wahl has done a great job in designing and manufacturing these clippers. They should provide years of service if treated well.

Trash bags are not a very glamorous household item or one thought about very often - until you run out or a cheap one breaks and spills garbage all over.  Yes, this has happened to me.Hefty is not just the name for these bags - they are genuinely hefty, made of thick plastic with a little "give" so they stretch rather than tear when stuffed full, or a cereal box pushes out the side. The bands that run through the top are strong and easy to pull to tie the bag tightly.  This size, the 30 gallon size, will hold a lot of household trash. It may be large for a regular kitchen trash can, but I just folded the top over the outside of the can.  I was able to compress trash without tearing the bag and I was able to put probably twice as much in one of these as I usually put in two of my previous bags.There are some items where spending just a little bit more money pays off big time in less aggravation, and this is one of those items. I'm sold.Completely recommended.

The Fellowes 49C shredder is a step (or 2) above any shredder I've purchased before. I would consider it close to top of the line for home office use or light business office use.It's relatively quiet and the motor actually sounds powerful.  It easily shreds 8 sheets of 20 lb. paper at once with no bogging down or hesitation. The motorized head sits on a waste bin and it's easy to add a trash bag to catch the shreds so you don't have them floating everywhere when you empty it.There are several safety features such as the feed chute, which is very narrow and I don't think even a small child could get a finger in there - though of course this should not be operated around small children.  It will only operate when firmly seated on the waste bin. It will not function when held up or even placed on any other waste bin (I tried it on a larger waste basket and I wanted to use large trash bags - wouldn't work.)One thing that separates it from a more commercial shredder is that is it is recommended that it only be used continuously for 5 minutes. I didn't read that at first, and used it for more like 8 minutes before the red light came on and it quit working.  I thought the trash bag was full (and it was) but when I changed the bag, it wouldn't come back on. Then I thought perhaps it was jammed, so I tried to pull some of the shreds out of the cutting teeth (not recommended, as they are SHARP). It still didn't run. Just as I was revising my opinion (in my head) my husband read the instruction booklet and told me about the 5 minute use limit. Sure enough a little later the green light  came on  and it's been running great ever since.So if you have lots to shred, break it into 5 minute sessions. I'd been saving shredding for months - I expect in the future I'll shred pages as I scan them and won't have a trash bag of papers to shred.This is an excellent, heavy shredder and one I feel confident in recommending for home of light office use.

I read this series years ago and loved it.  It's amazing to me Nora Roberts is so prolific and still writes so very well.So, when looking for some books to send to an incarcerated woman, I thought of these and ordered them for her. It will be interesting to get her take on the books.

This is a sturdy, well-built slicing blade that is perfect for slicing potatoes for au gratin, or cucumbers, or firm cheeses or other firm fruits and vegetables.One of my favorite uses though, is for lettuce.  I love shredded lettuce in tacos or on hamburgers or for my salad.  I discovered a long time ago the shredder blades make a mess of lettuce, but the various slicing blades are perfect. I like the size of this blade particularly.Wonderful and useful addition to the Cuisinart food processor toolbox.

For far too many years I've set shampoo, conditioner, and body wash on the rim of the bathtub. Unsightly, Awkward.  Dangerous.  Finally saw a post on Pinterest with a similar item on the inside of a shower curtain.  Came to Amazon.  Found this organizer and now everything is hidden behind the shower curtain and easily accessible.This organizer is well-made; seams are sturdy and fabric holds the weight of the products well. Being mesh, water drains out

Personally I am not an egg eater, but. . . Texasman makes eggs in this several times a week for a breakfast sandwich.  A bit of bacon grease or non-stick spray, drop in the egg (minus the shell, of course), use a fork to break the yolk and give a stir, then about 50 seconds in the microwave.These work so well I've given many to others - this one went to a client of mine who wouldn't make breakfast for himself. . .  He reports he's used it several times and likes it very much.Wash in the dishwasher, top shelf.  Winner!
You might not think you need double sided tape - but you do!  Great for invisibly attaching two pieces of paper together without bulk and without the wrinkling you get from ordinary glue.c

Such a utilitarian item, and one that doesn't get much thought until you need it.I needed this for work - too many electrical items to fit in two outlets. Ordered this GE Grounded 6-Outlet Tap and was able to plug in everything I needed.Easy to install, safe to use. Great product.

This is a great baking mat which resembles closely the MIU and the Silpat.  I recently baked some bacon with this mat on a rimmed cookie sheet, with a cooling grid over it and the bacon on the grid. What a mess after the bacon was done. After pouring the grease into the bacon grease can (is that a Southern 'thing'?) I let the cookie sheet and mat cool, and they washed as easily as could be.The harder test was when I used the cookie sheet and mat to cook freezer burned hamburger patties (cleaned out the freezer)  to give to the dogs. I over cooked them and there was quite a burned on mess - it still cleaned up as easy as could be.The other use for these is if I am separating bacon or chicken breasts, or any other product, to be frozen. I use these mats to separate the items while flash freezing, then vacuum seal after they are frozen.  There's no sticking with these mats. Love them.

Bought two of these - one for an artistic 12 y/o granddaughter and one for myself. Unfortunately I don't have any innate artistic talent, so my Zentangles aren't nearly as free spirited and/or creative as hers, but it's a lot of fun to play with.The author encourages and demonstrates the techniques, and I'm pleased with my results.A great book for anyone who likes to doodle, or is interested in the art of zentangle.

This is excellent paper.  Not quite as thick as cardstock, but much heavier than ordinary copy paper. As a budding cardmaker, I think I might like this better than cardstock for cards that are not loaded up with embellishments.The paper is a nice shade of white, not blinding white, but you won't mistake it for ivory or cream. The surface is smooth, but not slick smooth. Very nice paper at a good price.

These glasses are our tea glasses.  They are sturdy and hold plenty of iced tea. The lids screw on tightly and the threads are well manufactured so you don't have to struggle to line them up to screw on the lid.The double walls serve as insulation and keep ice from melting as quickly as in a single-walled glass with no lid.  The clear plastic allows the color of your drink to show. We don't use the included labels, but they were cute. These fit in the cup holders of all our vehicles - very important to Texasman who goes nowhere without his tea.Considering they are well-priced, sturdy, and effective, this is easy to recommend to anyone looking for an insulated glass.

This pull-down spray head is touted as a universal fit for a range of nationally known faucets. I have a Price Pfister kitchen faucet and this pull down spray head would not fit - none of the adapters included worked. Maybe mine is just too old.Second, unless the faucet you want to install it on is the kind with the high, arched faucet, then this (rather long) head will be too low in your sink.Fortunately if you order this and it doesn't fit, Amazon has remarkable customer service and they will help you.

This is the story of a universal nightmare where everyone you love - your entire family - is destroyed in one tragic moment.There will be many detailed reviews which outline the plot in great detail, so suffice it to say on the eve of a family wedding the bride's mother, June,  is the only survivor of a horrific explosion and fire. It is all too easy to imagine (fear, dread) how one would feel in the aftermath of such tragedy, and how on earth you  find the courage to go on.This book is beautifully written with a cast of intensely drawn characters who at first seem almost peripheral to the story, but through the author's finely nuanced writing share their own stories. It was all to easy to identify with June's emotional paralysis and her struggle to cope with her grief and guilt.It's almost impossible to put this book down, and almost impossible to continue reading.  It is very likely to trigger a strong emotional reaction, one that will take a while to fade.

This is not the light-hearted, funny, and ultimately happy ending story I expected.There are essentially two stories which I thought actually weakened both. There's the main character, Plum, who believes as so many women do that happiness will be delivered with a low number on the scale. She's willing to do almost anything to be thin.Then there's a radical group of women who are misandrists and are "out to get" men. I believe what was so off putting to me about this group and their agenda is that it was stereotyping men just as other groups have been treated over the years (women, gays, different races, etc.)  Maybe this was the point of the book, in a satirical way, but that's not how it read to me.  Women's studies was one of my minors in college and I wholeheartedly support women's equality, but this isn't anything new. The author seems to have just discovered this, and has chosen a violent (in the book) way to provoke societal change.It wasn't an entertaining book. If you haven't had much exposure to women's issues, this might be an enlightening, if disheartening read. The author does write well, I just didn't like the book all that much.

We are a no-kill sanctuary for abandoned, rescued dogs. Fleas are the bane of our existence. It's is a never ending battle, so I was happy to be offered a chance to try a new weapon - this Black Flag Extreme Flea Killer.I was initially disappointed that it is for indoor use only, meaning it probably isn't UV resistant or water resistant outside. I will still need to purchase the insect growth regulator as well as the adulticide for outside., but for the time being we are using this inside the dogs' sleeping/lounging rooms.Though the instructions are sparse, you'll have best results if you clean the area to be treated first, vacuuming up any debris or dust. Spray liberally in all the nooks and crannies.  It's safe to use on pet bedding and carpets. Keep your pets out of the room until the spray has dried- and even then add a couple of hours before you bring the dogs back in.  A flea program is only effective if the dogs/pets are treated at the same time as the environment. A good bath with a flea shampoo and then application of a topical flea repellant/deterrent is the best way to treat the pets.I will update this review as necessary if this product seems to work less well over time.

It's unlikely I'll ever meet author Eric Mitchell (though you'd love East Texas, Mr. Mitchell!) but if I were to meet him I don't know if I'd bow, faint, or just stutter my thanks for this cookbook over and over. He is a pit master and leader of the Yabba Dabba Que Barbeque Team. His team has won multiple barbequing events so this man knows his smoking, grilling, and barbequing. This cookbook focuses on using ceramic cookers such as the Big Green Eggs rather than more conventional cookers. However, I believe the recipes could be essentially duplicated on any cooker with some care and forethought.We have the Kamado Joe Ceramic cooker and this book has provided valuable information about setting up the grill, learning to make the fire and raise or lower the temperature of the interior. There are good explanations for why this kind of cooking tends to create such diehard fans: the meat is almost always moist, you have the option of cooking over the fire or by using the cooking stones (included with the Kamado Joe but an accessory with the BGE, I believe)  you can cook/smoke indirectly with lower heat.This author dispels some of the incorrect information about these cookers, too, such as the exterior doesn't get hot (it can), and other misconceptions non-owners might haveI am a died in the wool meat and potatoes kind of gal, and this cookbook is full of the most wonderful recipes imaginable. While there are some recipes (the vegetable ones mostly) that don't appeal to me, Texasman was busy making a list of the ones he wants to try (he loves his veggies - thank goodness opposites attract.)Mr. Mitchell differentiates between the terms grilling, smoking, and barbequing since so many of us use them interchangeably. His recipes include beef, chicken, pork, lamb, and seafood. He has recipes galore for side dishes, appetizers, and even desserts. There are lots of color pictures in the approximately 8" x 8" 224 page book. My only complaint, if you will, is that the font used for the recipes is uncomfortably small for my old eyes. There's plenty of blank space below most of the recipes, so a larger font could have been used. Maybe in the next edition. . .He includes a chapter on maintenance of ceramic cookers and how to move/set them up. The index is well organized and there's also a list of resources.

Though I have the utmost respect for Cuisinart products, there was just something scary to me about putting this stone on the grill. I know people cook pizzas on the grill all the time (though I never have) but I just feared the intense heat would crack the stone.It didn't.As soon as we had a break in the cold here in East Texas, I made some pizza dough to try out this stone. Dadgum yeast was old (I guess) and wouldn't rise. So threw away the dough and pulled out a frozen pizza, the kind with the rising crust. Heated the gas grill and - and with great trepidation - cooked the frozen pizza on the Cuisinart Alfrescamore stone on the grill.The stone survived unscathed.  The crust was crispy without being tough, it didn't stick to the stone, and the grilled flavor was a little different - in a good way - from oven baked pizzas.Now I am eager to try a homemade crust pizza, and maybe focaccia bread on it, too.  Pretty sure this will get used a lot this summer.Recommended without reservation.

I was eager to try this freeze-dried or dehydrated dog food not only for the quality ingredients but also the convenience. I have a couple of older rescue dogs (Pekingese and Shih Tzu) who have lost some teeth as they've aged, so crunchy dog food - even the smaller sized kibble - is a little harder to eat. As a result I often make their meals from cooked chicken or beef and add rice and vegetables. But it requires planning to make sure I have their food ready all the time. . .This product couldn't be easier to prepare - just scoop some of the powder into a bowl and add warm water. Stir, let sit a few minutes, and serve. My dogs gobbled it up rapidly and nudged the bowls around as they continued to lick the sides. The texture is similar to cooked oatmeal , sort of a mush if you will. It has a mildly unpleasant odor to me, but obviously not to the dogs.I love the long list of healthy ingredients and will incorporate some of those into my homemade dog food.  If this is the only dog food fed though, I would worry about the ultimate effect on dogs' teeth without the teeth cleaning effect of crunchy food. Maybe that could be achieved with treats and chew bones.The only negative I see is it is very expensive if you are feeding multiple dogs (or large dogs), as we do. I think it's great to have on hand if a dog is ill or if you're traveling with your dog(s).

I've had these sheets on my bed 4 days and so far I love them.The fabric is silky smooth and soft. It's not cold and slippery like satin. The color is a beautiful dark gray, with embroidered stripes on the hem of the pillowcase. Very subtle and understated. Elegant even.The fitted sheet is deep enough for my pillow top mattress and after 3 nights (one was a restless night) the pockets have not slipped off.After the first night I went to the Amazon website for these sheets to order more - and there are many beautiful colors. That's how impressed I am with these sheets. I didn't order however, because common sense said wash them first and see how they are after that. So I'll wash them in a day or two and if there are negatives to report I'll do so in a jiffy. If not, then every one in my family is getting a set of these sheets for the first day of Spring. Really impressive sheets so far.

Taste of Home publications have always seemed designed for the "ordinary" among us, those who appreciate delicious food but want to use common ingredients.  This cookbook is filled with recipes I will never make - and even more disappointing - recipes I wouldn't eat if someone else made them.I confess I am a picky eater and don't like to try new things and odd ingredients,  so if you do, by all means pick up this book as it may be right up your alley.Very disappointed in this book,

Though I love much about the digital form of storage, there's just something comforting (to me) about picking up a binder and thumbing through the categories until I find what I'm looking for.We do pet rescue/sanctuary for elderly dogs and I've used this set of dividers to set up a binder for the individual dogs' medical and grooming records. I'm still keeping it digitally, but also keeping a paper copy.The divider pages are sturdy, the binder holes are reinforced so they won't tear out of the binder, and it's easy to go to the Avery website and access their templates for printing the labels. The label application is novel as they are all printed in one continuous strip for application to the tags. There are plenty of extra labels in case you want to change them. I haven't tried pulling one off to see how easily it removes. One option would be simply to flip the labels over and use the back, if necessary.My only criticism is that the tabs are very narrow and not very tall, which means the categories (or dog) names have to be very short or abbreviated.

Believe it or not, the snack size Hershey is the most economical size to buy.  I bought 12 bags for Texasman for Valentines Day (emptied them into a box to cover up the "real" gift). Texasman says there's no other chocolate that even comes close.Product was fresh, well packed and was sure a hit when he opened his present.

I bought this monitor as well as a keyboard/mouse and CPU for a friend whose computer had crashed. She's disabled and the computer is one way she stays connected to the world.She is thrilled with the size and clarity of this monitor. She says the picture is sharp, bright and clear.She loves it, and I'm so glad she does.

How's this for an unconventional use.  I have an electronic signing pad on my desk for documents I and my clients must sign. The pen can be used with or without a ballpoint refill in it, but I've found that I and my clients like to be able to see their signature, so I've used the refill for years. For all those years I've cut up paper I was going to throw away and taped it to the top for signing. Tedious.Then one day I that the idea to ask Texasman to build a stand for the signing platform (probably 6 by 8 or so) with a way to hold this roll of adding machine paper underneath, feed it across the signing area, and under a bar that would keep it stable, and then have a serrated edge off a box of foil to trim the used paper off.  Clear as mud?  Well actually a client build me a prototype and it works great.As far as the paper itself, it's thick paper, probably equal to 20 or 24 lb. typing paper. It takes the ball point ink wonderfully, and I couldn't be happier with my invention. Maybe I'll take it on Shark Tank and give Mark Cuban a chance to invest!

In East Texas, frequent thunderstorms can knock out the power and leave us in the dark. We hustle around looking for candles and flashlights (I am eternally unprepared - I'll be a goner if the Zombie Apocalypse occurs). Amazon had this as gold box deal one day and I just ordered it without much premeditation.It requires 4 D batteries, and the light is strong and bright.  It feels pretty sturdy, though could break if it falls from a height onto a hard surface. Fortunately even at full price it's still affordable so if that happens I'll get another.Wouldn't you know, knock on wood, there hasn't been a need for it  but I'll be prepared in the Spring when inevitably the thunderstorms rage. No more sitting in the dark or going to bed early because I can't see anything.Very pleased with this lantern, and I intend to buy my children several for their homes, too.

I buy my daughter one of these calendars every year at Christmas. I believe if I ever fail to do so she might shove me out the door and deprive me of Christmas dinner!Mary Englebreit is an amazing artist and her illustrations bring a smile with each turn of the page. That she incorporates an inspiring or cheerful saying/quote on each page is just icing on the cake.

I purchased this wrap not to use as wrap, but to incorporate in my handmade greeting cards.It's not as thick as acetate but if handled carefully it works just fine as windows and liners in cards.I haven't used it for basket wrap, as I prefer the basket bags for their ease of use, but if you know how to wrap a basket with cellophane, I think this will work just fine. At five feet long and two and a half feet wide, there's a lot of product there, though for  a large basket it might not be enough. However it's inexpensive enough to use two rolls if you had to.Recommended for any use you can dream up.

These are (cue the corny music here) the cutest designs ever. Owls were a prominent design element in the seventies and it's been interesting to see the resurgence of the motif in this decade. I haven't colored any of these, I just wanted the designs, possibly for other craft uses.Again, incredibly cute designs. Fresh and appealing. Printed on heavy paper.

I found this book in a bookstore many years ago and have probably purchased 20 copies to give away.The title implies the information is only useful to women, but I disagree entirely. Every person could benefit from the lessons - or 'secrets' - contained inside.Of course one must be open to explore new ideas, and the opening chapter, or introduction, may be off putting for those whose spiritual beliefs are rigid, as Ms. DeAngelis describes her own beliefs of reincarnation. If this isn't your cup of tea, however, just skip that portion and go on to the secrets, such as "every relationship is a mirror."There's so much to learn and each time I reread it I get a new take on one or more of the secrets described. As we grow older our lives evolve and change and so do our innate understanding of ourselves. This book will trigger deep though and offer insight.

We have had a terrible habit of bringing the mail in and piling it on the kitchen counter. During the week it often went untouched for days because we're just too busy to sort through it. As I pay the bills online, this wasn't actually catastrophic until I couldn't find something important such as new insurance cards, etc.I ordered two sets of these  wall files (4 total) determined to both sort mail before it got lost or accidentally thrown away, and also to reclaim the counter top. Handy Texasman easily attached them to the end of a row of upper cabinets in the kitchen, where they look just fine and aren't very obtrusive. Now whichever one of us has the mail in their hands sorts into different files (magazines, catalogs, that which is probably junk but should be looked at, and "other."  It just feels good to have some degree of organization and I've set myself the goal of going through everything on Friday and either discarding or scanning the important stuff for digital storage. The magazines and catalogs go to the chairs where we read and I'm trying to stop hoarding magazines (oh, the recipes. The decorating hints.  The landscaping ideas. I must keep them) and scan in the pictures etc. I want to keep. Then I take the magazines to the waiting room where I work and let others enjoy them.They are fairly sturdy. Not like a wooden file, but they can hold a couple of pounds of material and if you use the proper mounting screws (with anchors if going into sheetrock) they will serve very well.  Very pleased.

I bought this and a couple of other car coloring books for Texasman, who is an unabashed car lover. It's the one interest he's had since he was just a boy, lusting after Corvettes and Camaros, Mustangs, Challengers.  And the '57 Chevys, too.I don't think he intends to actually color the pages, though if he ever slows down he might. The pictures are hand drawn (or so they look to me) more like illustrations than photographs. The paper is thick enough to handle markers, I think, though colored pencils would probably work best.If you know someone who loves the old cars of their childhood, this will make a wonderful gift, whether they ever color them or not .
These fit perfectly around my ears and deliver great sound while muffling the noise around me while I try to work.

I'm that person that always overpacks and stuffs as much as I can in my suitcase. There's been time where mine has been too heavy and I've had to start taking my stuff out at the airport and putting it into my boyfriend's bag. For the price, you can't beat the hassle and money it'll save you at the airport. It's really easy to use and fits easily into my suitcase if I want to take it with me (perfect for when I know I'll be buying stuff while on vacation), I love that it's eco friendly too!

I always love reading summary and analysis books alongside a full length novel, and Book*Sense by far has some of my favorite. I love that they also offer a large variety of books, so I know I can always turn here when I'm looking for one. This is great for reading with (or after reading) the original and makes it a more interactive experience, as if you were at a book club. I love all of the thought provoking questions and the hidden themes this book offers--it crazy to see how much I miss while reading the full novel! Would highly recommend!

I've always been interested in trying the Mediterranean Diet since I'm a huge fan a mediterranean food, and this book taught me everything I know! It gives you a lot of background and health information that helps give you a good idea about what this diet is all about. The recipes were amazing and everything from breakfast, lunch, dinner, and even snack recipes were included. A very well rounded book, with a lot of great information. I would highly recommend!

With the holidays right around the corner, I've been having a lot of family staying with me lately. I love baking and wanted some new recipes and this book was perfect! I like being able to make things the night before guests arrive and then its ready to go in the morning. This recipe book has just about anything you can possibly think of. The recipes are easy to follow and understand, which makes it great for anyone to follow!

Chained Melodies has easily been one of the best, most touching books that I've read in a long time. I found it very relevant to todays society and both of the main characters, Tom and Will are very relatable and multidimensional. Their lives have been so different from one another, but something always seems to bring them back together. It's a very heart warming and feel-good type of book, and the ending was great. I would highly recommend this book!
I have small ears and the small size ear bud fit perfect and comfortably. The sound is great. Great price for a great headphone!

With the holidays right around the corner, I've been baking non stop (at least it seems that way!). This is the first year that I'll be having family stay with me, so I've been really trying to "impress" them with my baking skills and making things from scratch. This recipe book has been AMAZING and has given me so many new recipes that are not only unique, but delicious as well. There are some classics, such as banana bread and various cookies, and some things I've never even heard of, like the potato and bacon scones (who knew?!). There's a little bit of everything and a little bit for everyone with various baking abilities. Couldn't recommend this enough!

I was searching career sites when I stumbled across this book and I'm really glad that I found it! As a recent graduate, this book has been especially helpful not only for increasing my potential in my career but in my overall life as well. If you are unfamiliar with E.Q. Librium, Bethel does a great job at breaking it down in the beginning. She then shows how it correlates with your everyday life and how it can help you become a more well rounded person. There's a lot of connection between E.Q. Librium and the workplace as well which has been the most helpful to me. A really eye opening book that was really interesting to read as well.

The Time Odyssey has been one of the best children's / YA books that my niece and I have read in a very long time! We both enjoy reading, and she loved this book as well. The time traveling aspect made it entertaining, and I enjoyed the snip bits of history as well (it helps her learn without feeling like she's actually learning...brilliant!). 10-year-old Rel is a great main character and he finds himself in many different adventures. Between battles, meeting famous historical figures and Rel learning about himself along the way, this book is action-packed and great for children and adults alike.

Triangulating Bliss is one of the most enjoyable books that I've read in a long time. I think part of the reason that I love it so much is that it incorporates so many of my favorite genres--romance, paranormal, mystery (among others) and it's such a multidimensional read. You can truly see how well this book was thought out by how well developed everything was. This was the first book I've read from Jalbert and it really put her on the map for me! I'll definitely be back to read the rest of this series.

I've been on and off so many health kicks, and I've been really trying to find a way that I can stick with it instead of always going back and forth. This book has provided a lot of helpful tools for me to use and has really changed my mindset about change. I've learned that I really need to take baby steps instead of diving head first into things. Not only has this helped me with my eating habits but also my lifestyle as well. The perfect book for a more well balanced life!

Beautiful Persuasion is one of the best romance books that I've read in a long time! Told from both Ellie and Julien's perspective, I fell in love with both of these characters. Julien is the typical guy that we hate to love, you can't help but give into his charm. Ellie on the other hand, is such a strong woman character that I really admired. I loved how realistic this book was, and it's not your typical love story where the characters immediately fall into love. I would highly recommend!

This is such an amazing book for anybody who has struggled with dating or is in a new relationship. This book is definitely geared towards women and has been such an amazing help for me! I'm just getting back into dating and have had a harm time with reading into things. It has helped me take a step back and re-evaluate my relationship and where it should be. I also feel like I can understand men a lot better in general after reading this book.I've been in a lot of bad relationships and this really helps you identify those "traps" and how not to fall into them. Some of these "traps" have even happened to me and it's great to see light shed on these issues. Everything from ex girlfriends, jealousy, and other common issues that you find yourself dealing with in relationships--this book has you covered. Such a helpful, quick read that has a lot of useful information packed into it. A really great book!

This product works well, especially for the price. I actually am very pleased with the product itself.This is a wonderful clipper. I was impressed the first time I used it.Getting his hair trimmed really helps him stay cool & causes less mess for us.Overall,it is very affordable and performs well.

I'm a huge fan of Murray's books and Gravitas was no exception to that! She's able to create a world that is so different from ours, but is able to make it intriguing and believable. There's the perfect mixture of science fiction, fantasy, romance, action and aliens all mixed into one that makes it such an entertaining read for fans of many genres. I love how powerful the women are in this book, and it's great to see the gender roles reversed a bit. Such an awesome story that I would highly recommend!

I love how simple it is to use my crock pot, but I could count on my hands the number of recipes I knew before reading this book. I wouldn't have even thought to make most of these (including beverages--who knew you could make them in a crock pot?!). With the holidays right around the corner, I'm so glad I picked up this book. There's a little bit for everyone in this book. A great collection of recipes, and the table of contents makes it easy to find exactly what you're looking for on your Kindle.

I've been needing a new folding chair for quite awhile now and have been shopping around for the best price. The style on this one really stood out to me and reminds be a bit of a papasan chair which I always love to curl up in. The padding in it makes it a lot more comfortable then a typical camping chair and for the price, I couldn't pass it up! Folds in and out of the bag really easily and feels sturdy when I'm sitting in it. I'll probably end up getting another for my boyfriend!

Beyond the Event Horizon is such a great start to this series and a really good short story overall. This was a great science fiction book mixed with aliens, so it was right up my alley! I've read a lot of books in this genre, but I loved how unique the story line is for this series. It was such a well developed story line and you can definitely tell it's paving the way into a great series. Overall, I really enjoyed this and definitely can't wait to read the rest. Highly recommended!

False Flag: Able Thunder is one of the best action/war books that I've read in a long time. It was very fast paced and intense all at the same time. I think part of the reason I enjoyed it so much was it was realistic to the current world around us and it was something that I could actually see happening. It's all about a corrupt political system looking to start a war in the Middle East and don't mind pinning the blame on other people. Overall, such an amazing book that I really enjoyed!

I've read several books from Wolk now, and he's quickly become one of my favorite horror authors. He's ideas are borderline genius and Hell's Playground is no exception. There's a level of realness to this story line that makes it all the more creepy and scary. Wolk really brings Hell and Satan to life in a whole new way and it's thrilling throughout the entire book. I only wish his books were longer because I never want them to end! Another great book.

I travel a lot and always need a back up battery for my phone. I had my old one for a long time and it finally wasn't holding the charge long enough so I decided to try this one out. It's a lot cheaper than the other I bought (I think that one was $40) and A LOT slimmer too! Really can't beat this and I'm more than happy with how well it works. I get about 4-5 full charges with my iPhone 5.

This case is amazing for the price and reminds me of my boyfriend's otter box that he paid way too much for! I love that it's a neutral color but then just has a little pop of color. It fits very sturdy and snug on your phone and really adds a lot of protection to your phone. My favorite thing is that it actually allows you to sit it up when your watching videos. I'm always on Youtube so it's perfect for that! Great product and I may even be back for more color options.

Perfect for puppies and small dogs if you don't have a fenced in back yard! It's easy to put together and will go up and down very easily so you can put it away when you're done with it for the day. It's sturdy, even with a puppy jumping all over it too and it looks like it will hold up for a long time. Overall, really good product for the price and it even comes with a shaded cover.

I've read other fitness and health books from Sheridan and also love his approach to things! His books aren't the "norm" and present a new way of doing things which is especially helpful if you haven't had much success. This book has the perfect blend of science, day to day useful information and motivation all rolled into one. People always make excuses of why exercising takes too long, but looking at it from a 1% stand point, really put things in perspective for me. Another excellent book!

Moreta has created such a great guide to really help you control your anger. When I'm stressed out, sometimes I have a really short fuse and my anger gets the best of me. This book helps you get to the root of the problem and teaches you not only about where your anger comes from, but how to effectively control it. Beyond just controlling your own anger, it also helps you strengthen the relationships around you as well. It's a quick read, but has a lot of great information which was just what I needed.

I've read several books from the Holy Ghost Writer and this has been my favorite by a long shot (and I love all of the HGW books). With the 9/11 anniversary just the other day, it's been fresh on my mind on a daily basis. This book not only captures the devastating tragedy, but puts a fictional twist on it as well. It's done so very respectfully and only enhances the camaraderie we all feel. It shows different perspectives and evaluates many different aspects of life--good and evil, heaven and hell, etc. A truly remarkable book!

Ascension: Invocation is one of the best science fiction/fantasy books that I've read in a long time. It's such a new look at Earth and humans. I'm so used to reading about aliens coming from the galaxy and invading Earth, but this adds a big twist to that. I absolutely loved Alicia's character and loved that she's a strong female lead. She's relatable, and it's a bit of a coming of age story as we get to watch her grow in her decisions and actions. Overall, a really great book that I couldn't recommend enough!
We purchased these to go on the outside of our house and we have been really pleased. Since there is no wiring required, they are so simple to install.

Cage of Desire was a great start to this series! It's a bit of a taboo romance, which makes it so out of the ordinary and a really entertaining read. Clark lays down a really good foundation in this first book for the main characters, Mia and Eric, which can be hard to find these days in short stories. There's a lot of build up and anticipation in this book which makes me even more excited for the next! It ends on a bit of a cliffhanger, but that can be expected with a series.

Dawson has truly created an awesome suspenseful thriller series with The Ward Lowe series. With each book, the story becomes more intricate and we learn more and more about each of the characters. Trouble always seems to surround Jack, and in this book, he's in one of the worst scenarios yet. With a lot of action and a fast paced story line, this is such a great book that will appeal to many people. Overall, couldn't recommend this series enough.

I'm a huge fan of the Weekday Brides series and I've been picking up a sidekick to them all whenever I can find them. This is the best sidekick that I've come across for this series and I love how much additional insight this book offers to the original. Not only does it provide a summary, (which is perfect for book clubs), but it really helps you see parts of the book that you missed the first time around.
