I felt like I got to know the characters and the story even more after reading this--would highly recommend!

I've read all of Ken Rossignol's "Martha and Danny Jones Thrillers" and I keep falling more and more in love with these series the more of them that I read. The Sea Empress can never be just a relaxing cruise, especially with Martha and Danny around. Each of these books has such an awesome storyline to it, they never disappoint. If you love old black and white detective shows or mysteries, you'll really enjoy this entire series--make sure to start at the beginning!
Great little lights with a cool remote control which you can add a timer to and change the brightness.

This book is such a great guide for anyone whose been out of the dating field for awhile like myself. I've tried everything from online dating to blind dates without much luck lately. I've fallen into a rut where I don't even want to date anymore. This has really helped me take a deep breath and reevaluate things. The author provides some really helpful advice to keep an open mind and to help you be more successful while you date. Overall, an excellent book!

I've had a lot going on in my life lately...between moving this past week, working, classes and running the house, I've been getting much more stressed out than usual and my migraines have been worse than ever (I think they're stress related). I always find that the best advice comes from someone whose been in the same situation as you, and Juls has some of the best advice! This really helps you get to the root of your problems and to learn how to be happy in your daily life. It was such an uplifting and motivation read, I couldn't recommend it enough!

Such a motivating book by Lemense! This is a must read for anyone who has struggled with confidence or being overly-confident. I felt like I really got to know myself even better after reading this book. Lemense provides great advice and tips to better understand yourself and how to become a more happy, well-rounded person. I enjoyed reading his own experiences and life lessons and found that it really helped enhance the quality of this book. Overall, one of the best motivational books that I've come across!

Alcoholism runs in my dad's side of the family and I've witnessed first hand the depths of what it can do to a person. Clara shares her own struggles and battles with her relationship with alcohol. Seeing into someone's mind who has been through this is definitely an eye-opener, since a few family members I have don't like to share what's going on. This helped me see the other side of things and to see how hard of a struggle it really is. This is a great book for anyone who has been affected by alcohol in their lives whether directly or indirectly.

Sometimes I find that the second book in a series can fall a bit short after an amazing first book. That being said, I'm happy to say that this book definitely held its own and was just as good! Plemons has himself an excellent series here, and I wouldn't be surprised if it become the next "big" series that people are swarming about. In this book, Arena's story continues, as does the violence and war around her. Not only does it have a lot of action throughout, but it also takes a look at faith and I gained a lot from reading this book--both entertainment and a deeper look at my own life and decisions. A really awesome read!

I'm a big fan of short stories, especially lately since I haven't had time to pick up a longer length novel. My Afternoon at Ebbets Field was definitely one of the best that I've read in a long time. It has such a moving storyline, that's also relatable since most of us have experienced, or know someone who has battled with cancer. It's heartwarming, sweet and a book that'll leave you thinking even once you've finished reading it. I couldn't recommend this enough! Wonderful!

This is such a great book--you really can't beat the experience that Dryden offers if you're looking to become a PA or are currently going through the process. From undergrad classes, all the way to becoming a physicians assistant, this book has you covered. Sometimes it feels like everyone around you competing for a spot in the class has done everything right and you feel a bit behind them, this book definitely showed me that it's still possible even if you chose to be a PA a little later on in your college career. A really helpful book, that covers a lot!

The author has tried to add value to people.  It contains very useful tips. I was thinking building online business is not that much easy but after reading this book I got convinced like it is easy if we know the right strategies, ideas and some technical knowledge. Author has revealed the secrets of online business.  I feel that the author should have described certain details deeply as it gives beginners better idea on the exact way of starting online business.

Sometimes I find that the second book in a series can fall short after an amazing first book. That being said, I was really happy that Beacon held it's own in this series, and was just as entertaining and suspenseful as the first...if not more! It's not often that a series gets better as it goes on, but this one definitely does. For anyone who loves supernatural beings, suspenseful story lines and even better characters, I would highly recommend this series. I look forward to reading the third book and think this series has the potential to be the next "big" series!

I'm a huge fan of poetry, and especially loved this collection and how relevant it is to the world around us. Covington takes you around the world and takes a deeper look into the culture and life that inhabits it. Through terrible happenings in the world, to more joyous ones, each poem will leave you feelings something completely different from the next. These poems had much more depth to them instead of simply being poems, they resonated deep within me and help motivate you to get out there and make a difference. Couldn't recommend this enough!

Such an empowering book for women like myself who are in the networking field. This will help you enhance your skills, or even gain new skills to help your business. While this book provides great advice, it's easy for a business book to get boring. Luckily, this one doesn't and the personal stories throughout it really help keep things entertaining. There's some really helpful advice, that gives you the tools you need to succeed--it's then up to you to put them to work!

Firing of the Crucible was nonstop entertainment from start to finish. I'm a big fan of science fiction and space/aliens books, so this book was right up my alley. For a start to a series, it did a great job at introducing all of the main characters and a really good job at introducing The Empire to the reader. Sometimes with science fiction books, I find them a bit hard to follow since they take place in worlds unlike our own, but the author did a great job at keeping everything in order. Overall, a great start to this series and I'll definitely be reading the rest!

I've been such a big fan of short stories lately since I haven't had time to pick up longer novels, so this was the perfect length. This was such a great short story, I'm really glad to see it's a series! An Assassin's Tool has such a great fantasy storyline to it and was nonstop action throughout. You can definitely tell that Darby is a seasoned writer and that this story was well thought out and well written. I've noticed that with some short stories they're poorly written, but that is definitely not the case with this one. I look forward to reading the rest in this series!

After reading Troy and Roy Search For Treasure Book One with my niece, she wanted to read the second book with me as well! We both love reading their adventures and the author also writes such an entertaining story. I love that there's always a deeper meaning behind these stories and that they're perfect for her to practice her reading while I'm babysitting. I'll definitely be looking into getting the coloring books next, since we both love to color together!

I'm such a big fan of the Fiona Frost mysteries, and Order of the Back Moon has been one of my favorites so far! This one has a super creepy aspect to it and keeps you on edge throughout the entire book. Fiona's life is constantly in danger and she's doing everything she can to just make it through her forensic training program. I look forward to reading more in this series--Blossman does such an excellent job coming up with new ideas for each one. Another 5 star book!

Rise of the Retics is one of the best fantasy books that I've come across in a long time! The storyline was completely different and new, which I always enjoy, since sometimes I find the same theme throughout many fantasy books. There's a lot of action and suspense mixed into a fast paced storyline! There's a lot going on in the storyline, but Lantz makes it very easy to follow and keeps things in this new world clear for the reader to understand. Really great book and looking forward to see what the rest of the series has in store!

After accumulating a lot of savings, I'm looking to start investing in other businesses. This book was just what I needed and really touches on a lot of topics; many of which, I wouldn't have even thought to ask myself. It covers key topics and then has specific questions for each of those topics. It's serves almost like a checklist to make sure your not leaving anything out while going through important financial decisions. Overall, a really helpful book that I would highly recommend.

This guide was a quick and easy read but had a lot of great information about anxiety. I'm someone who stresses out easily when there's a lot going on in my life and my anxiety is terrible. This book really helps you get to the root of the problem and how to turn your anxiety into something more positive. Waters provides some really great advice and helps you have a more positive outlook on your life. Overall, a really helpful book that I got a lot out of.

The Happiness Broker is one of the best short stories that I've read in a long time! It's the perfect length for an afternoon or evening read, and I loved how thought-provoking it was despite the length to it. This book really looks at life and death and the power between the two with the way the universe is balanced. It explores the stories of two men and the choices they make when they hold the power. Overall, a really entertaining story and I really enjoyed Williams writing style. I'll definitely be checking out more books from him!

I love essentials oils and I wanted to find out how to use them safely and effectively on my dog. We recently moved into a home with a backyard, and now that my dog is able to go out and play, I don't want him to bring in any fleas since I'm highly allergic to them. I loved that this book not only focuses on treating fleas and ticks, but also a lot of other common health issues too. The dilution directions were easy to follow and give you the perfect amount to safely apply to your pet. A really helpful book!

This is such an awesome guide for anyone looking to go dairy free. I have a friend that's dairy free who has really noticed a difference in the way she feels, so I've been debating it for a long time now. I absolutely love cheese though, so this book was perfect for me! Kalaf offers a lot of great alternatives to your common dairy products and a lot the ones I've tried taste pretty similar, if not better. Overall, a great book for beginners and a lot of great information!

Beauty and the Barber is one of the best short stories I've read in a long time! I'm not really sure which genre I'd categorize it under--it was very entertaining with a bit of humor and quirkiness thrown into it as well. Butterfly's has a constantly changing life and nothing can ever seem to be smooth sailing. If it's not one thing, it's another for her and she just can't seem to catch a break at times. A really cute, entertaining story that makes for the perfect afternoon read!

While it's a fictional book, I love how Code 6 North of the DMZ focuses on relevant and important issues that still surround issues that people in North Korea face. The prisons in this country have always intrigued me and this book really brought a lot of light to it. This book is non stop action and had me on edge throughout the whole thing! Paul Decker is on a mission and a revolution for freeing prisoners, and it's no easy task. A really great book!

Often times in series, I find that the second book can be less than spectacular when compared to the first. That's part of the reason I enjoyed this book so much--it held its own next to the first and was just as good! The Pelagius Game series is fast paced and great for anybody who loves fantasy with action mixed into it. Born Villian has an even darker aspect to it than the first and things are starting to get crazy. Overall, a great series and I look forward to reading the next!

Inner City Blues is slightly longer than the typical short stories that I read, so it made it the perfect length for an evening read before bed. Bree's character was one of the best characters I've come across in a book in a really long time. She's had all odds against her and has faced so much adversity from everyone in her life, but her motivation is truly inspiring. Hearing her story, and watching her grow as a character was motivational in so many ways. A truly great story, with a character to be admired!

Like a Shag on a Rock is one of the most entertaining and funny books that I've come across in a really long time. I found Tom's character to feel like a friend and someone I could relate a lot too (with all the craziness he goes through). He just can't seem to catch a break, and everywhere he turns, something else happens! This was a perfect, light-hearted, afternoon read that I really enjoyed. If you just need a good laugh, or feeling a bit down in your life, this is definitely a book that'll perk you up!

I wasn't sure I'd like this thing, but I have read there is so much advantage to drinking soy milk over cows milk, I wanted to give it a try. I'm amazed how much I like this thing. Making soy milk is super easy (I'm using Bob's Red Mill Soy Beans). I leave them soaking, usually over night, then make a batch in the morning... When you drain the milk through the strainer (once it's completed it's cycle), you're left with a product called Okara, which you can use for baking, fertilizing your garden, bug repellent for your plants, crackers, all kinds of things.. Just do a search for Okara recipes..I've also used it to make coconut milk.. I used a bag of Bobs Red Mill Unsweetened Coconut instead of soy beans and set it on the dry bean recipe. Coconut water came out great.. I used that to make Kefir... I also made Raspberry syrup for ice tea using the hot chocolate setting.. Filled the machine with water to the water line, added a bag of frozen raspberry's and stevia to taste, and it came out great. I used the strainer and then poured the product in a bottle to keep in the fridge.I made a batch of soymilk, which came out the perfect temp for making homemade yogurt, so after straining I poured it into a mason jar and used it for yogurt.. I've only had this for about a month, so I'm sure I'm going to discover a lot of other things I can use it for.. So far, so good!!

We usually buy Dogswell Happy Hips for our Doxie's breakfast meal (he only gets 1/3 can each morning). But suddenly the price of Happy Hips soared.. When comparing the ingredients, this is the same recipe, it just doesn't include the glucosamine, so we bought it instead. He loves it as much as his Happy Hips, so I can't complain. We worry a lot about the quality of our furry childrens foods, but after researching this company, it seems to be one of the safer pet food company's out there... Interestingly, the price of Happy Hips came back down so the next case we get will be Happy Hips, only for the added benefit of the glucosamine.

I like the way my hair looks after using the Renpure cleansing conditioners, but I wish the product was a little thicker.. This one is actually a bit thicker than the Cleansing Cowash..I wondered what the difference between the Coconut Creme Cleansing Pudding and the Coconut Cream Cowash Cleansing Conditioner was, so I purchased both...This one is slightly thicker, but not by much. They clean and condition the same. This one does not smell anything like coconut, though, which really disappoints me, but the Cowash really doesn't either... This one has kind of a spicey kind of scent to it (that I don't really like) and the Cowash has a very mild, clean scent, which I prefer.I've noticed if you shake these products up before pumping them out, they do seem a bit thicker, as most of them are almost as runny as water. It's hard to keep this product in your hand when it's so runny.. Other cleansing conditioners are really thick, making it easy to get from your hand to your head, and they also create a creamy feel when cleansing the hair.. This product doesn't really do that.. It just kind of feels like your rubbing something into your hair, but not that much different than rubbing water into your hair.. and yet, the end results are impressive.. My hair does seem calmer (I have very thick, curly, long hair), and I do see a difference when looking in the mirror..I have now tried four different brands of cleansing conditioners. The cons to this one is the runniness of the product, the smell that isn't anything like coconut and the fact that for whatever reason, the bottles "leak"..(I have three bottles of Renpure and they all do the same thing). I have to unscrew the cap a bit or product runs out of the squirt top, making a mess of my shower shelf and also wasting product. The pros are, it leaves my hair in better condition than most cleansing conditioners. I'm not sure I'll buy any more of the Renpure, though, because I really don't like how runny the products are (or the smell of this one)..

I bought these for our screened in porch to use as cutains.. We have furniture on the porch that we don't want to get wet, so I hung these on the windows so they can easily be pulled shut if it's going to rain.. The fabric is really nice.. It's fabirc, but still water repellant. The color is ivory. It's a very pretty ivory, like a very pale yellow.. The grommets at the top seem very secure. I used metal shower curtain rings to hang them. They open and close easily and I have curtain tiebacks to hold them back when they aren't needed.. The fabric is very soft and looks just like curtains when pulled back or released.. they did, indeed, keep our furniture dry during a big thunderstorm, so I would assume they would work great in the bathroom as a shower curtain.

I only wore these shoes two times, and have to say, they really are incredibly comfortable...They are a bit wide.. I usually buy shoes in wide, but not always, and these were a bit wide for my feet, but they were comfortable and were almost like being barefoot. I was very pleased with them, until I got caught in the rain.. I had to go from our vehicle to a building after it had rained, so the sidewalks were still wet.. They weren't soaked, but the bottoms did get a little wet..The next day I kept noticing something smelling odd in the room these were kept in.. The smell was like male cat urine.. If you have cats, you'll know what I mean.. It's the scent a male cat leaves when marking his territory.. It's a horrible smell.. Our cats don't go in that room as there is a door on our hallway that's kept shut.. (plus our 2 cats are both fixed so they no longer have that marking scent)..The 2nd day, the scent got stronger and I started going through the room trying to figure out where the source was coming from.. By the 3rd day, that entire part of the house had that smell... It was driving me crazy...I started eliminating possibilities (I had just received an order in the mail, thought maybe someone's cat had marked the box)... One by one, I was removing things from the room, but nothing was helping.. Something told me it was these sandles (I hadn't worn them since Sunday when they'd gotten slightly wet and they were now in my closet).. I picked them up and sure enough, they reaked... I put them out on our screened in porch and by this morning, the rooms in that part of the house have no bad odor but the screened in porch reaked... Unbelievable!! AND the sandals smell even worse.I guess if you live in the desert and never allow them to get wet at all, they'll be fine, but oh my, here in Michigan, we do get rain and sidewalks and such will stay wet for a time... I can't believe one pair of shoes can smell this bad.. I'm not sure if it's a chemical they use on the rope used to make them or if a male cat actually sprayed them, but they are being shipped back to Amazon today.. I feel bad for the UPS driver that ends up with them in their truck!I have since read info on the internet about rope sandals and that if they get wet, they will smell like a litter box... Why then, do people want these shoes??? I don't want to have to worry about drying my sandals completely if they get wet from rain.. This seems kind of crazy to me.

Works with my 4th generation fire kindle.. Allows us to watch utube video's, cbs access, etc on our big screen tv.. We're dropping our cable provider to use only HULU Plus, Amazon Prime, Netflix and CBS Access. saving us a lot of moola. This little device is helping us to be able to do that. Picture is clear and have had no problems with it. Simply plug it into the tablet and connect with an HDMI cable to the tv.. easy peasy...

I don't know how we missed this series on tv, but we found it while looking for something to watch instead of reruns.. The show is great.. Kind of reminds me of the Good Wife.. It's a story about lawyers and all their cases, plus info about their personal lives.. The young lawyer isn't really a lawyer, but is brilliant and is able to decieve people into thinking he is a lawyer.. Lots of twists and turns, lots of relationships.. Keeps you engaged and interested.

Well written movie, great acting.. As a woman, i didn't enjoy the war scenes but my husband thought they were very accurate and true to life.. I've heard a lot about this story since the movie came out but don't remember hearing anything about it before that, which is sad... It makes you understand how deeply disturbing it is for our military to go through what they do, especially if they have to kill someone, or like this person, kill many, many people... I just can't imagine how that would mess up a persons head.. I love true stories and my husband loves war stories, so it was a win win for us...

If you ever watched even one Rehab Addict, then you are probably addicted as well.. This show gives you a lot of good ideas, as well as information you can really use... The star of the show is this tiny little lady who is one hard working woman!! Love this show...

I make doll clothes for a living and use a lot of this seam binding.. I have used it for a couple of years now.. It's fantastic and such a bargain compared to buying single packs of it in the store... A roll of this lasts a very long time and is convenient to use.. No undoing the cellophane wrapper to get to it.. Just unroll what you need, snip it off and stick a small straight pin in the end to keep it in tack.. Easy peasy.. Works great for hemlines, waistbands, etc...

I give it 5 stars for what it is and the fact that it works and arrived on time. But honestly, I think these cartridges are a huge rip off.. They cost way too much for what they are.. There are times it's cheaper to just buy a new printer that includes 2 cartridges than to buy a replacement black and color cartridge.

I have Achim Buffalo Check curtain panels in a couple of rooms in my house. My kitchen is dark red and ivory white and I've been wanting to remove the undersink cabinet doors for quite some time to add curtains for a country look. I ordered these for that purpose, used a tension curtain rod and they look great.. They fit perfectly. My husband keeps walking into the kitchen and talking about how nice they look. All the Achim curtains I've purchased have been very good quality, especially considering the price. I ordered them in the burgundy buffalo check, but I would call it a barn red, not a burgundy.

I followed the directions perfectly. I completely cleaned the shower floor, made sure all cleaning residue was rinsed clean, I dried the floor with a towel, then let it sit an additional 24 hours to to make sure it was completely dry. I laid the product down according to the directions of removing the back layer exposing the sticky surface, I laid it down, worked out all bubbles, made sure the edges were completely sealed down. It's recommended that you let it sit for at least 4 hours before 1st use, but recommends 24 hours. I went one better and let it sit for 48 hours before using this shower.. In all, I didn't use this shower for 5 days allowing it to be completely cleaned, dried and cured... I've now used that shower 3 times and the edges are lifting and there's bubbles in the center... I doubt it will last even a month before completely lifting. This was a waste of money. Maybe it will work for someone else, but for me, a lot of work for a product that doens't work.

I purchased this for my husband along with the Cataract Eye Drops with Cineraria 15ml. He was scheduled to have cataract surgery in December, but then ended up with the flu and a couple of days in the hospital, so he opted to put the surgery off because we have hospital bills to pay off and the only cataract doctor in our area does not offer a payment plan. We just can't afford it right now. I did some research and found that other countries treat cataracts with eyedrops, not with surgery. That search brought me to Amazon and this product.. I decided to buy the two products for my husband to see if it might help..After using both for 2 months as directed, he feels that he's seeing an improvement, so much so, he's decided to just continue to use these two products rather than reschedule the surgery.. He's very hopeful, and so am I, that this will help dissolve the cataracts... No matter how safe laser surgery doctors report it to be, there can be complications from laser surgery, and this does seem like such a safer alternative.. It's at least worth a try in an attempt to prevent the need for surgery.It isn't a quick fix and needs to be used as directed on a daily basis.. As for us, we are very hopeful and will continue to give this a try.

My husband was suppose to have cataract surgery in December, then he caught the flu and ended up in the hospital for a few days. We cancelled his surgery not only because he was sick, but also because we now have hospital bills to pay off and can't afford the surgery right now..The cataract doctor doesn't offer a payment plan, so it's all or nothing.  I found this product on Amazon and decided to buy it for him, along with the Homeopathic CATARACT care eye pellets w / Cineraria & Carnosine for treatment and prevention of Cataract.. He has used them both faithfully for 2 months and said he does see some improvement.. I recently asked him if he wants to go ahead with planning the surgery now, and he said he'd rather keep using these products and see how it goes.. He does feel like they are helping. I would say it's a long term use thing that needs to be used as directed to see results...I've done some research on Cataract's and it seems that other countries do not treat them with laser surgery, but rather with eyedrops like these. If he was to have the surgery, he will then have to use eyedrops made specifically for this purpose made by a compound company this cataract doctor uses.. The eyedrops will cost him about $200. I do not know what those eye drops contain, but I have to wonder if it's the same kind of product???? Just wondering out loud, I do not know if it's a similar product or not, however, if he's going to have to use expensive eyedrops after expensive surgery, isn't it worth a try to see if a product like this can prevent the surgery to begin with?I'm glad my husband is willing to give this a try before choosing surgery :o)  I know they say laser surgery is perfectly safe, but gosh, it's your eyes. I know if it was me, I'd try an alternative treatment over surgery any day.I see Amazon is now selling it in a 6 pack at $92.. When I bought this it was $17 for one bottle.. I hope Amazon starts offering the one bottle choice again, as we won't be buying 6 bottles at once. I would worry about it expiring before the product could all be used..

I've been buying Pet Guard Fish, Chicken and Liver canned food for years. Our senior kitty has health issues and I chose this brand because of their high ratings among organic pet food sites as well as vet recommendation. This is the only cat food my older cat has consistently loved all these years, but suddenly, neither one of my cats want to eat this.. We are throwing out more than what is being eaten... The consistency of the product has changed as well as the smell.. Obviously, the recipe has been changed.. At first I worried something was wrong with our senior cat, but after noticing our younger cat is also no longer interested, I knew it was the cat food.. They used to run to their feeding area with their head in the can before I could even get some scooped into their bowls.. Now they could care less..UPDATE: I was contacted by Pet Guard, who assures me the recipe has not been changed. They did say that if the product was frozen, it will change the consistency and smell of the product and they are wondering if that is the problem. They are sending me replacement cans and said they would like a few of the cans I have back to try and figure out what is going on.. I'm not sure if the product maybe froze at an Amazon facility or the vendors facility, or UPS facility, but I know it didn't freeze at our home as we brought it in immediately after delivery. We did have a bitter cold winter this year on this side of the country, so maybe that is the problem with these last 2 cases of food.. I'm hoping it is because my cats truly did love this stuff up to this point! I will update my feedback once I receive the replacements and see how our boys act about it...UPDATED UPDATE: PetGuard shipped us a can in every flavor so we could see how the cats like them.. I opened the Fish, Chicken and Liver first. The cats were in the livingroom and came running into the kitchen from the smell of the catfood.. They both gobbled it down.. I think it's pretty obvious that the last 2 cases I received from Amazon had most likely been frozen somewhere along the way, changing the texture and smell so our boys weren't interested in it..I give PetGuard 10 stars for customer service but I'm afraid Amazon only gets 1 star.. If this product is freezing somewhere along the way, how many other pet products is this happening to?

I saw these on amazon but thought the price was a little high for something I wasn't sure would work.. Then I happened to be in the Dollar Tree and noticed they had a set of two for $1.. It includes a large one for the tub/shower and a smaller one for the sink, which is all I needed.. They are working great, no rust, no coming apart.. I have thick curly hair which clogs up my shower drain, but with this, it catches the hair and all i have to do is pick it up and dumb it in the waste basket.. Very easy to deal with (much easier than cleaning a clogged drain)..The plunger system in my sink is not working right and the plug continually gets sucked down and then I have to use a screw driver to wedge it up.. It's a newer sink, so not very happy about that.. I finally just pulled the plug out but wanted to keep the drain covered so there was no chance of rings, bobby pins, barrets, etc falling in the drain.. This is serving that purpose great..I've also seen a set of these at Walmart for around $3.00.. With that in mind, I just think these are over priced and you can save your self money by getting them at one of those stores...

To be honest, I haven't read this yet, but my husband did and loved it! Couldn't stop talking about it.. He said it was incredibly informative, interesting and well written... He couldn't put it down..

We had a pellet stove installed this year, which requires daily cleaning.. I bought this for my husband hoping it'd make the job easier for him.. He was using a regular shop vac, and a lot of dust was escaping and floating around the room, not only making the room dusty, but making him feel all stuffed up with itchy eyes..Because of the price, I wasn't sure this would be that much better, but I really couldn't afford the more expensive units.. I had nothing to worry about.. This thing works fantastic.. My husband loves it... It's very sturdy and easy to manuver, and no dust escapes the thing.. The body of it is metal and the hoses are very sturdy and flexible.He never uses it when the ash is still hot, so I can't say how it would work as far as that goes, but we haven't had a bit of trouble with it.. It also sucks all the build up off the glass window in no time at all. Before he was having to spend quite a bit of time getting that clean.. Now he sucks off the build up and quickly cleans it with windex.. It's saved him a lot of time and it's nice not having to dust constantly..

My husband always wore red when I first met him.. It was a real bummer when they stopped making it... When I discovered they are again making it, I purchased a bottle for him for Christmas... Smells like the original Red.. Glad it's back!

We now have 4 of these. One is in our travel trailer, 2 are in our bathrooms and 1 is a spare. We love these little heaters.. We purchased a pellet stove this past year, which heats our home really well, but the bathrooms do feel chilly.. On chilly days, these heaters do a great job of keeping the bathrooms very comfortable.. They also came in very helpful this past winter when we had record lows here in Northern Michigan. For the first time ever, the water line to our dishwasher froze up. We put one of these under the kitchen sink and it thawed it out quickly (we had lows of 20 - 39 below night after night).. From then on, we placed one of these under the sink on nights  forecasted for frigid cold weather. It kept it from freezing again... We had shower pipes freeze in one of the bathrooms, and setting one of these on a stand in front of the shower and another pointed at the wall in the connecting room unthawed it.. I use the spare one in my sewing room  when it's really cold pointed towards my feet.. It keeps me feeling warm.. The one in our travel trailer keeps it toasty warm in there in the fall when temps get chilly during the night... They're small, inexpensive, easy to move from one spot to another, don't take up a lot of space and don't use a lot of electricity.. They won't heat a large room, of course, but they will work very well in small spaces as well as warm you in work spaces.. I'm sure they'd work great in an office cubical.. Can't say enough good things about these heaters.. I have felt the plugs after they've been running quite some time to make sure it isn't over heating and I haven't felt any of the plugs ever feeling hot, let alone warm.. Very efficient little heaters!

This is pretty well made, although one of our cats has huge paws, and he can pop off the top of the rails when batting the ball... Our older cat hasn't played with it at all.. Our younger cat (6 years old) has played with it off and on, but he doesn't love it.. Seems like he plays with it when he's so bored he can't stand it.. It's a great idea, but not one of the best toys, for our cats anyways.. They have to really bat the ball hard to get it to light up. We ended up buying two kits and hooking them together, thinking bigger was better, but it really just takes up a lot of space. I'd say kittens would probably love this thing and would be able to reach the ball more easily than our big cat can..

Bought this as a little gift for my sister... Gave her a big laugh... Said she's going to save it for the next visit from a couple of their kids who are democrats. lol... Oh calm down you Obama lovers.. It's funny! Besides, things seem to be turning to crap in this country under his leadership, so it really does seem fitting...

Bought these for my husbands Gerber Recon Flashlight.. We couldn't find this size batteries locally anywhere, so I ordered from Amazon and so far, they've proved to be very good... He's had them in it for a couple of months now and it's still going strong..

Okay, I think this stuff is way over priced, but it does make a fun gift for someone.. I bought this for my son for Christmas as a gag gift. It made him laugh.. I'm not sure if it actually works or not (sorry, I know that's the purpose of a review), but it is a funny idea...

We have a dimplex fireplace insert in our fireplace that's about 10 years old. It turns on and off by remote control. The remote stopped working, so I called Dimplex to get a replacement, but was told they no longer make that style and do not have any in stock. They suggested we just plug it in to use it and unplug it when not in use. The nearest plug is behind a piece of furniture, so that really wouldn't work for us. The insert still works great and puts out a nice amount of heat, so we don't want to have to replace it.This outlet turned out to be a great solution. We can use it for other items as well as the fireplace insert, and just turn off the plug to the insert when not in use.. I've never seen a power strip outlet with individual controls for each plug, so when I saw this on Amazon, I was very hopeful it'd be a solution to our problem, and it has been... We really don't use that insert very often, but this past February had record cold temps here in Northern Michigan, and we were sure glad we had this extra heat source on some of those very cold mornings.. The plug has worked great and well worth the purchase price.

I had purchased these in the next size down before Christmas and needed bags just a little bit bigger for some of my items, so I ordered this size. They are just as great as the smaller ones.. I sell doll clothes so the pink bags are perfect. They do smell a bit when you receive them, but once you open the clear bag encasing them, the smell quickly goes away. The green bags are an added plus and I'll probably end up using them next year at Christmas time. Very pleased with these bags.

I like the design of this sink saver and it seems to be of good quality. My problem is the color. I ordered it in red, but it's that tomato red color, more orange than red... I have a lot of red accents in my kitchen, I love red, but this sticks out like a sore thumb. Next to all my beautiful red items, it looks bright orange... It does lay flat in the sink and stays put when water is in the sink. It's just the color I don't like.. Thought I'd get used to it so I didn't send it back, but every time I look in the sink I think UGH... ugly color..

This is stiff, doesn't bend, so you need to make sure it will fit your sink. Also, your drain will need to be in the center of your sink or it won't line up. We have a double sink with one larger sink, with the garbage disposal in the smaller one.. This is too small for the larger sink, and too big for the smaller sink, plus there's the problem of the hole not lining up with the drain. After a couple of weeks of use, I'm looking for a better option.

I've had this for a couple of months now.. I wanted to wait to write a review until I saw how it holds up. So far, it is very nice. I've washed it and have not noticed any threads coming loose, no snags, no seam binding ripping loose..It was soft to begin with, and actually got even softer after washing.. We have an odd sized bed and it's really hard to find blankets and quilts large enough for it.. My husband and I have different mattress needs, so we have a full size bed and a twin size pushed together to make one huge, bigger than king size bed.. I purchased this in the king size and it doesn't fit like the picture (to the floor), but I didn't expect that... it is big enough that it hangs down about 10" on both sides..I have my doubts this would fit a regular king size bed as pictured (to the floor). Maybe a king sized quilt on a queen size bed would fit that way?? It's very pretty, a very pale sage/rose color. The pillow shams are very large. They would easily hold king sized pillows. We have regular pillows in them but really need to replace them with larger pillows. All in all, I'm very pleased with this quilt. It really is a very soft fabric, warm and not heavy like some quilts are..

I have been using this wallet for a little while now and even after filling with with my state ID, credit and debit card, metro-card and money it still feels light and is not noticeable on my back pocket or even front one which I think is great. I want a sturdy yet flexible minimalist wallet and this one fits all my criteria.

As a button smasher, the game was a bit difficult to control and understand, yet i was able to beat and have fun which is what matters. So now that the price dropped online I can say it was definitely worth it. Some games are more enjoyable when you dont have to pay 40 bucks for them, weird?Either way, this si the first game that I play of this genre aside from WWE and the royal rumble event.

This is the second game I play with the same theme, the first was on PS3. While the repeating theme was a bad choice in my opinion, looking at the game itself it is not bad. I still enjoy playing with it and fighting guys. The game is fun, just stop comparing it with anything else you will definitely enjoy the experience

I love this game, it comes with a book and all but the game itself is really good, I finished and kept playing, it has three dragons so after the first it gets repetitive but you still enjoy it. I played with one class only and didnt get bored of it, I just decided to play another game because Igot this game together with 8 more and there was no need to beat and get all before moving to the next game.

The story mode was kind of short but then this is more of an arcade game. The graphics were really good and the characters that are available are awesome. This is a game that I find myself playing over and in between other games.
This is a game I always enjoyed in other platforms and it still delivers. If you have play any of the previous then you will also like this one.

I want a sturdy yet flexible minimalist wallet and this one fits all my criteria.

As a button smasher, the game was a bit difficult to control and understand, yet i was able to beat and have fun which is what matters. So now that the price dropped online I can say it was definitely worth it. Some games are more enjoyable when you dont have to pay 40 bucks for them, weird?Either way, this si the first game that I play of this genre aside from WWE and the royal rumble event.

This is the second game I play with the same theme, the first was on PS3. While the repeating theme was a bad choice in my opinion, looking at the game itself it is not bad. I still enjoy playing with it and fighting guys. The game is fun, just stop comparing it with anything else you will definitely enjoy the experience

I love this game, it comes with a book and all but the game itself is really good, I finished and kept playing, it has three dragons so after the first it gets repetitive but you still enjoy it. I played with one class only and didnt get bored of it, I just decided to play another game because Igot this game together with 8 more and there was no need to beat and get all before moving to the next game.

The story mode was kind of short but then this is more of an arcade game. The graphics were really good and the characters that are available are awesome. This is a game that I find myself playing over and in between other games.
This is a game I always enjoyed in other platforms and it still delivers. If you have play any of the previous then you will also like this one.

We have neighbors who just finished building a sun room off the back of their house. They are decorating it in a sea theme. I ran across thes coasters on Amazon and thought they would be perfect for the tables they have set up in their sun room - plus the fact that these definitely fit a sea themed room.There are 4 coasters in this set. Each coaster has a different sea creature. The coasters are made from some kind of stone and are plenty solid and heavy so they should hold up very well. The sea creatures are painted on the top of each coaster and the artists name is also written in very small writing under each creature. The bottom of each coaster is covered with cork, so they will not slide around on the table.I cannot come up with any cons for these coasters. They are perfect for my neighbors sun room. I feel I purchased the right coasters for what they wanted and I am very happy with this product.

First of all, this is a great backpack. The only reason I gave it 4-stars instead of 5 is an issue with a couple of the zippers. Note that I was given this backpack in exchange for an honest review.We took this to Disney World with us last week and used it every day. This backpack has a lot of pluses going for it...Pros:- Very light. It folds into a very small package that is easy to stow in your luggage.- The shoulder straps are wide and do not dig into your shoulders. They are adjustable for different sized people. My wife is 5'-1" tall and I am 6'-2" tall. The shoulder straps were easily adjusted so this backpack fit us both very well. This was very comfortable no matter what we had stowed int he backpack.- It has an amazing number of pockets including pockets with zippers inside pockets. There are all sizes of compartments so you will find spots for cell phones, purses, billfolds, lip balm, and even room to stow your jacket. While we were at Disney World and walking around the parks, we were purchasing t-shirts, socks, and other items of Disney "junk" and they fit easily into the backpack. We were pretty amazed how much stuff we could get in.- There are two mesh pockets, one on each side that will hold a water bottle. They are easy to get at when you need a drink.- This backpack is very well made. The stitching is high quality. You can see some stitches in the photo I have included showing the zipper problem I describe below. It held up very well during the 8 days we were at Disney World and stuffing all kinds of items to unload later in our room.Cons:The only con we had is a design problem. There are two zippered compartments at the top of the backpack have a flap that folds over the zipper to keep the rain out. This is a good thought, but we found that the flap got in the way when you were trying to zip up the compartment. Depending on what you had in the backpack, the opening distorts enough that the flap gets in the way and can catch in the zipper. So, we had to be careful to hold the flap out of the way when zipping that compartment. The picture below illustrates this problem and is the only reason I am giving this 4-stars instead of 5. The zippers themselves are good quality zippers and should hold up well.Other than the zipper issue, the wife and I really like this backpack. It is the most comfortable backpack we have ever taken on a trip. It holds a lot of stuff and I am very happy to own it.

I am an older guy  (69) but active. I wear a pedometer and my goal each day is a minimum of 10,000. I average about 13,000 unless we are down at Disney World where that jumps to around 25,000 steps per day. You don't see me sitting around a whole lot.I have had problems in the past with a torn meniscus in my right knee. I had surgery on it, but it still tweaks me on occasion - especially when I am bowling which a do twice a week in a league setting. Also, I have a big yard and garden and spend a lot of time outside working my green thumb around my property. Sometimes my left knee bothers me too, but usually not both knees at the same time. The only knee brace I have is a clunky heavy thing with metal straps in the side and Velcro fasteners to keep my knee stabilized when I bowl. I don't think I really need all that support any more, but that is all I had until I was contacted by this seller to try a complementary sleeve in return for an honest review. This looked like the perfect solution for my situation, so I thought I would give it a try.I am 6'-2" tall and weigh about 210. I measured my leg circumference 4-inches above the knee as the product page instructed. It turned out to be 17-inches. My problem is that 17-inches is right on the high end of the Large size sleeve which handles legs 15"-17" and the low end of the X-large size sleeve which handles 17"-19" legs. I contacted the seller who advised to go with the XL size as the Large would probably be way too snug for a leg that was 17-inches in diameter at the high end of Large. So, that is what I ordered. It turned out to be the correct choice as the sleeve fits nicely but is not too tight. It slips fairly easily over my leg and is very comfortable. I have bowled with it and it works great - gives me enough support that my knee does not tweak me when bowling. I have not had a problem with it sliding down my leg - it sits where I want it. I have worked out in the yard wearing it and forget it is even there. It seems to be made of high quality material and it feels like it should last a long time. I have had no problems with it stretching out of shape and losing its compression ability.Tomorrow, we are heading to Disney World and I am taking it with me just in case I need it. It will be my safety net. Because it is small and flexible, like a sock, it will be easy to pack.Bottom line: This is a great sleeve and I am very happy to have it.

Well, the idea of putting your fitbit zip on your wrist is a good one. I have had my fitbit zip for 3 years and it always goes in the pocket of whatever pants I am wearing. I even wear it to bed in my pajama bottoms. I have gone through several of the standard clip cases that come with the fitbit - they just wear out. I was given the opportunity to try out this set of wristbands for free in exchange for an honest review, so I jumped at the chance to try out a new way to wear my fitbit as I did not know a product like this existed.The product itself is of high quality and comfortable. Unfortunately, I discovered some problems with wearing the fitbit zip on the wrist. So, here are my observations.- The wristbands come in many different cool colors- The multi-packs are nice. I got one, my wife got one, and I was going to give one to our daughter who has a fitbit zip.- The quality and comfort are great - 5-stars. I like the snap clasp. These are light and comfortable such that you do not hardly feel that you are wearing anything. I even wore mine to bed a few nights, forgetting to take it off.- With a little effort, the fitbit zip snaps into the band and feels like it is anchored solidly.- The band effectively gives you a wristwatch since the fitbit zip has a clock you can get to by tapping the band until it shows up.Cons:- The idea of wearing your fitbit zip on your wrist is a nice thought. However, I found the accuracy of counting steps goes South when you wear it on your wrist. This is the only con I have with the bands.So, I borrowed my wife's fitbit zip without the band, and put it in my pocket and wore my fitbit on one of the wristbands. After 8 hours of everyday activity, which included mowing the yard, running to the store for groceries, cleaning up the flower and veggie garden for Winter, and just putzing around the house, the fitbit in my pocket measured 15,325 steps and the fitbit on my wrist measured13,117 steps. So, that is a difference of  2,208 steps, a significant difference.My wife tested hers out by putzing around the house. She noticed that when she walked with her arms swinging, the wrist-mounted fitbit recorded her steps accurately. But when she was holding a bunch of clothes from the hamper and taking them to the washing machine in the other room, no steps were recorded since her arms were still, holding the clothes. She found that whenever she was carrying things around the house and not moving her arms, the fitbit would not register steps. So, that got me to thinking. Suppose I am at the kitchen counter making supper - which I was doing at the time - and I am just standing there in one spot but moving my hands and arms around cutting onions and potatoes, scraping them from the cutting board to bowls, and just putting together a meal to cook. Looking at the fitbit on my wrist, it was counting steps as I was moving my arms around preparing food. So, it is counting steps when I am not moving my legs.So, I guess it comes down to how you live during the day. If you are always on your feet walking, or if you take your fitbit on a jog, the wristband is a great way to wear your fitbit. If you are a house person and carrying things around the house or doing things that keep your hands and arms still, you won't be getting accurate step counts. At the same time, you could be standing still and doing something involving you hands and arms that give you step counts that aren't happening.My conclusion is that wearing your fitbit zip on your wrist does not give accurate step counts depending on what you are doing. They work great for walkers and joggers in terms of accuracy of counting steps, but not so accurate if you are doing things that keep your arms from moving while you are walking, or conversely count steps when you are not walking but doing something that keeps your arms and hands moving around.The bands are a great fashion statement and are good quality. Your step accuracy will depend on how you live and what you are doing while wearing them.

I have been a Keurig user for many years. I have always had the standard k-cup brewers and have given the brewers to friends and family as gifts, so they are permeating our family society. I recently upgraded to a Keurig 2.0 series K-450 brewer and like it a lot. However, Keurig has "fixed" their brewers so that you have to use their branded coffee pods and their pods are quite expensive. The new brewers have some kind of "reader" that looks for the Keurig logo on the top of the pod. If you put a pod in that doesn't have the logo, then the brewer gives you an error message and in essence calls you a cheap old fart for trying to bypass their system. This is supposed to save you from having an unsafe (cheaper than theirs) pods ruin your coffee maker.I will have to admit that I have had a few pods explode in my makers over the years. But the pods that exploded were purchased from Keurig, so I don't necessarily believe that bad pods are only outside of Keurig's branding. Anyway, you can find Keurig branded pods in bulk at places like Sams Club that will get you close to about 50-cents/cup and if you are a Keurig frequent buyer, they send out deals all the time that reduce your cost if you order from them. However, you have just the brands they sell and if you would like to use your own coffee, you can't do it. With the old k-cup brewers, you could use a refillable generic pod and put your own grind into it and get good coffee at a lot less cost than 50-cents per cup. But the new 2.0 brewers want you to use the Keurig branded pods and the bigger carafe pods are just a bigger expense for you to fork out more dough for coffee that is mostly okay but not that great for the cost.So, I was recently offered the opportunity to try one of these new devices that somehow bypass the Keurig security scan in exchange for an honest review. "Heck Yes!" I said. So, I have had a few days to play around with this thing and here are my observations.- First, you get 2 of these in a package. So, that is great as you always have a clean one ready to use.- The lid clips on and off so the filter is easy to clean. The plastic body of the filter is pretty sturdy and feels like it will last a long time.- The screen mesh is very fine. However, when you grind your coffee beans, you will have to experiment with how fine you make the grind. Too fine and you will have a lot of powdery coffee at the bottom of your cup. So, you will have to play around with the amount of grinding to get the flavor and strength you like without leaving grounds in your cup.- The filter pod fits perfectly in the 2.0 series 450 brewer that I have. As soon as you close the lid, the brewer screen pops up that lets you choose how many cups you want to make and it thinks you have one of their mighty pods sitting there for use with the Keurig Carafe. So, A+ for fooling the machine and letting me use my own coffee. I picked up some Kona coffee and tried it out with the new filter and it worked great and made the wife and I two cups of tasty coffee to go with breakfast.- The filter pod can only be inserted one way into the brewer. The end with the hinge for the lid faces down. It slides right in and the lid of the brewer closes easily like there was a Carafe pod sitting there.One interesting addition to my box of filters was a plastic bag with a little plastic doo-dad that had me scratching my head. A small paper in with the device called it a  "Clever Clip" and the diagram showed where you could install it in the upper lid of the Keurig brewer to allow you to use a generic standard k-cup to make single cups of coffee. When I did a search on Amazon for a "clever Clip" there was no hit, but what did show up was the Fador "Freedom Clip" which looked exactly the same as my clever clip. I popped the clever clip in my brewer and closed the lid and it thought there was a k-cup pod in the brewer. So, this device does fool the brewer into thinking a k-cup is sitting there and you can pick the cup size you want and go to town. I didn't have a pod in there because I don't have any generics around the house. But I am thinking that you could use a generic single cup refillable pod with this device clipped in the lid of the K-450 brewer.My clever clip is a different color than the freedom clip that is sold on Amazon, but it looks exactly the same. Mine is rather flimsy and does not fit tight on the brewer. It wanted to fall off it's spot a few times and if it gets loose, the brewer lid won't close or gives you resistance. I see the Freedom Clip sells for over $8.00 and I am hoping it is more substantial than the Clever Clip that I had in my filter box for free. The clever clip I got in the filter box looks to be worth about 50-cents and it does not look like it will hold up very well as it is pretty thin and flexible enough not to clip solidly in place where it is supposed to sit. Since I don't have a Freedom Clip to compare to my Clever Clip, I can't say they are the same quality device. I would be disappointed to pay $8 for one of these things if it was exactly the same as the Freedom Clip. However, it was a freebee in the box, so I can't complain and I will use it.The filter is a great device, works as advertised, and opens my world of coffee making to using better grades of coffee that I can buy anywhere.

I like spicy food. I am a Tabasco fan, but I am always looking for something new to spice up my food. One of my friends asked me if I had ever tried Harissa, and I had to admit I never had. It sounded interesting so I looked around the always amazing Amazon store and ran across this paste. Seeing it had pretty good reviews, I decided to give it a try and purchased a tube.Here is the list of ingredients: Re-hydrated chili (52%), water, modified corn starch, salt, garlic, coriander, caraway, citric acid.The taste is great. There is good heat but it doesn't overpower the food you put it in. You still get the taste of the food with an extra zing. I like hot, so I can take hot more than some people. I can put some of this on my finger and stick it in my mouth and get a nice flavorful tingle and my wussy wife will holler that it is too hot. I think it adds a great peppery flavor without overpowering the food. I squeeze it into soup and add it to my tacos. I add it to some ketchup for a dip for french fries or to put on hamburgers. A little goes a long ways, but it really adds flavor to whatever you are eating. This is great stuff and I will be a regular customer.

I have a problem with plantar fasciitis. It has been killing me for a while. I am also retired, so I don't have to wear dress shoes. I pretty much live in tennis shoes, wear a pedometer, and average 14,000 steps per day as an active senior. So, this plantar fasciitis thing is cramping my lifestyle. My feet also have high arches and none of my tennis shoes have high enough support to help me out with this malady when I am walking.I looked around for inserts that were more solid than just a piece of foam. I wanted something that was solid to support my arches. So, after looking through all the different versions and brands out there, I picked this one to try. I wear a size 11.5 D (US) shoe. So, here are my observations:- This product fits my size 11-1/2 Nike Dual Fusion Lite tennis shoes perfectly.The fit is tight and no trimming was required.- This insert is flexible up by the toes so when you are walking, it bends with your toes and the shoe and you don't know it is there.- The heel and arch part of this insert is rigid and does not bend. It provides perfect support for my heel and arches.- This insert is very comfortable for my size foot. I am able to walk without hobbling as long as the insert is in my shoe.- I bowl a couple nights a week. When I get to the bowling alley, I remove the inserts from my tennis shoes and slip them into my bowling shoes. They also fit my size 11-1/2 bowling shoes perfectly - nice and tight so they don't slip around.Cons: I don't have any cons.I can't say how comfortable they would be if you had flat feet, but for someone like me with high arches, they are a perfect marriage between my feet and my shoes.

For years I had problems with gerd, acid reflux, and heartburn. Some nights I would wake up choking on acid reflux and I would be hoarse for days. I do not like taking antacids and the like because I know that these kind of things are masking the real problem and cause more problems of their own. After a lot of research, I determined that I had the wrong kind of gut bacteria or what the scientific community calls microflora - the kind that are not good. I learned that replacing the bad bacteria with the good bacteria might help my problems. And it turned out to be true. I started taking probiotics and my stomach problems lessened quite a bit. I tried several different brands and they all worked to some extent, but I would still have occasional bouts with heartburn. At least the acid reflux was almost contained and I can deal with a little heartburn now and then.I was offered the opportunity to try this brand of probiotics in return for an honest review. Since I haven't found the perfect probiotic, I decided to give this a try. and see how it worked. One problem I have found when trying to compare different brands is that most brands have what they call proprietary formulations of all these different kinds of bacteria that you can't spell or even pronounce.And the numbers are mind-numbing and hard to understand for the average person like me. For instance, our gut microflora contains tens of trillions of microorganisms, including at least 1000 different species of known bacteria with more than 3 million genes.  One third of our gut microflora is common to most people, while two thirds are specific to each one of us. In other words, the microflora in your intestine is like an individual identity card. That might explain why some brands of probiotics work fine for some people and not others. Each one of us has a different body makeup and what works for me might not work for you. This usually means hunting around for the one that works with your particular body composition.The bottle says to take 1-2 capsules a day. Personally, I like to go with the minimum when it comes to dosages and if that doesn't work, I will add more as required. The results after taking this probiotic for about 30 days at the 1 tablet a day level? Great! I have had not a single issue of heartburn, acid reflux or gerd. This particular formula appears to be just right for my gut which is sending me happy signals. So, at least for my body makeup, this formulation appears to be the perfect formulation to keep my gut pumping out happy vibes.

I am big on probiotics for gut health. I take a probiotic every day to make sure my gut is populated with lots of good bacteria. Probiotics have saved me from past issues of acid reflux, gerd, and heartburn. There are so many different kinds of bacteria that is living in your body - some good and some bad. If you have enough of the good ones, the bad ones are crowded out and you will have better health.I have never seen a product that is formulated for your immune system. While my issues with Gerd, acid reflux, and heartburn have been largely solved by the gut friendly probiotic I take, I have still had issues with getting a yearly sinus infection when fall rolls around. Usually it starts with a stopped up nose and then I get fluid behind my ears which causes me to have problems hearing and makes my head feel like a balloon. I usually go see the doc and he gives me an a pill (I think it was Cipro) and I just wait it out - usually a month or so. One year, he lanced my eardrum to let it drain. Yuck! I don't want to go through that again.So now that Fall is here again, I started to get that familiar stuffed nose/sinus feeling. At the same time, I got an offer to try this new probiotic for the immune system in exchange for an honest review. What a deal and coming at the right time of the year. I do not want to have to go back to the doc and be lanced again or take Cipro, so this looked like a positive thing to try. So, here are my observations.- Besides the "Proprietary Probiotic Blend" that is in the tablets, it has vitamin c, zinc, and echinasea which are all good supporters of your immune system- My ears started plugging up in their usual manner about a day before I received this "colds suck" product. So, it already had me and it looked like I was too late to save myself from grief. I started taking 2 tablets as soon as the bottle arrived. After about 5 days, I noticed that the pressure behind my eardrums was a lot less and I could hear again. I could feel the liquid rolling around in there, but it seemed to be going away. After a couple more days, my hearing was back to normal - Great! No trip to the doctor required this time. This formula seemed to zap my normal sinus infection, so I am a fan.- About a week after I started taking this, my wife started coughing a lot. Seems like she picked up a bug of some kind. She complained of a scratchy throat and the coughing was terrible. It kept me awake at night so that I would slip up to the spare bedroom in order to sleep. It occurred to me that this formula might help her, so I gave her a couple of my colds suck tablets and tried to get her to take them every morning when she got up. Well after 2 days, her cough was almost gone and after 3 days, it was gone. And her scratchy throat disappeared. It seems like 3 days is kind of a short time to get results like this, but I am not complaining.So, the bottom line is that it appears that this probiotic formula indeed does what is advertised, at least in our household. I am keeping a bottle on my vitamin shelf from now on.

I have a problem with plantar faciitis. My doctor said to get a plastic soda bottle, fill it with water, and put it in the freezer and then roll it with my foot. This sounded kind of messy to me so I looked for something else that would be similar and not so much trouble. So, I ran across this device and thought I would give it a try. Here are my observations.Pros:This thing is pretty heavy - 1.1 pounds. It appears to be high quality construction.The bottom is made of rubber. The combination of rubber bottom and heavier weight means this massager does not move around when you are running your foot over the top.The steel balls are almost an inch in diameter, so they feel substantial when you are running your feet over the top. They rotate in their sockets.My issue with plantar fasciitis is mainly in my heel. That is where I have the most pain. This massager is perfect for working on my heel pain. I start with a light rub and then press more deeply as my foot gets used to the pressure. I keep it under my computer table and am actually using it as I write this review.As a massager, it feels good on my arches and up under my toes. I found sore spots up there I didn't realize I had.You can put this in the freezer and get those steel balls really cold. They stay cold for a good 20 minutes of use. I would suggest you wear socks if using it after coming out of the freezer. Or be a he-man/gal and plop your bare footsie right on top of those icy metal balls and grit your teeth for a bit.This is easy to throw in your luggage and take on a trip somewhere. No mess or fuss and can be used whenever you are sitting - on a plane, bus, library, restaurant, etc.Cons:I really can't come up with any cons. This is a great item to help you work on your plantar fasciitis issues.

The wife and I are retired and travel quite a bit. We each have various ways we pack things in our luggage. I was offered the opportunity to try out these luggage organizers in return for an honest review and it looked like just the thing I needed. After using these for a couple trips, here are my observations.Pros:These organizers look bigger in the Amazon seller page than they really are. They are, in fact, the perfect size for your luggage. They are all about 3" deep when packed with "stuff" but when empty, they are pretty flat for easy storage - less than half an inch. The large one is only 14 x 11 x 3, the medium is 12.2 x 8.7 x 3, the small is 11 x 6.3 x 3. In the picture below, I am showing the 3 organizers with common items - socks, toothpaste, deodorant - so you can see the scale of these organizers which will fit easily in even a small piece of luggage.These are made of nylon and feel like they should hold up pretty well. The stitching is good and the zippers seem to be good. They have traveled well so far for me.There is a nice mesh window on the top, so you can see what is inside each bag.The large bag will keep 4-5 days of socks and underwear separate from your other clothes. The others are good for toiletries and other small items to keep them from getting lost in the rest of what you have in your luggage. The middle size I have used to carry books that I take along on trips. It is more than adequate for several paperbacks and small hardback books and helps to keep them from getting scrunched in your luggage while traveling.Cons:I really don't have any cons to speak of.The cleaning instructions say to wipe with a damp cloth. Do not put in the washer or dryer. Do not iron and do not bleach. They do clean up easily with a damp paper towel.Bottom Line: I like these bags a lot and we are getting good use in our travels. They make good organizers for a lot of different things you would put in your luggage and they are just the right size for even a carry-on bag at the airport.

I have an issue with plantar faciitis and was looking for some support like this. This one seemed to have the best reviews, so I bought one. You only get one in the package, not one for each foot. I am only giving it 3 stars for the following reasons.....Pros: It is comfortable as it stretches a lot.Cons: The size chart. I am 6'-2" tall, weigh 210 pounds and wear a size 11.5 D shoe. I am not a small person. So, I ordered the large. The large is too loose to provide the support I need. It slips on fine because it stretches a lot. But it's stretchiness means that there is not a lot of support under my arch like I would have liked. I think the medium would have worked better for me. It is not worth the trouble to send it back, so I am living with my mistake. I don't know how much smaller the medium would be, but as much as this thing stretches, it would probably fit my size 11.5 D foot fine and provide better support.The sleeve has "BracePal" across the top in white letters. When I took the sleeve out of the package, several of the letters were peeling off. I pulled them right off. The appear to be rubberized letters with some stickum on the back. The letters will come off the first time you wash them. This doesn't say much for product quality.The Amazon page says this is for men and women and only gives 3 size choices - Small, medium, large. I would say that the large size would definitely not fit a woman who wears large in women's sizes, since their sizing is different than men's. The large size is even too big for me, so take that into consideration if you purchase this sleeve.I would not buy this again.

First of all, I was offered this handbag in exchange for an honest review.And second, My wife loves this handbag!This handbag comes in several colors and my wife picked the purple version. She is 5'-1" tall, kind of short for my 6'-2" frame, but I guess it works since we have been married for 46 years - ha..ha.. So, she has carried it around for a few days and these are her observations....Pros:- She loves the purple colored version- The stitching is first rate. Some of the purses she has have crappy stitching and they come apart after a little use.- The zipper is metal and looks/feels like it will last for a while. Many purses out there use plastic zippers that break easily. This one uses a substantial metal zipper that should hold up well.- Inside are pockets that hold her sunglasses and her rather large smartphone with ease. I know for a fact how important the ease of access is for her smartphone. Many times when I am in the passenger seat of our car and she is driving, I will hear her phone ringing in her purse. Her old purse was packed with "crap" and her phone was always in the middle of it. So, I would unzip her purse and poke around the junk trying to find the phone. Most of the time, it would quit ringing by the time I found it and she would have to deal with voice mail. But with this purse, the pocket the phone sits in is readily accessible, and I can zip open the the purse and see the phone sitting there for easy access. She can pack all her junk around it and the phone still sits out in the open so I/she can find it quickly. Same for the sunglasses which can drop right in the other pocket and are ready for quick access.- The strap is adjustable and she can size it for her small frame. It rests comfortably on her shoulder.- The purse is not large, but still holds a lot of stuff. It has an inside zippered compartment that is easy to get to where she puts her checkbook and pen. This pocket also holds a lot of "stuff."- It has drawn attention while out in public. Several people have commented on the purse. Our married daughter saw it the other day when we met her for lunch. It was the first thing she saw when we got to her door to pick her up. She said she loved it and wanted to know where we got it. So, it looks like I will be ordering one of these for a Christmas present.- The purse is well made and sturdy. The nylon material is thick and feels substantial. It gives you the feeling that it will last a long time.Cons:My wife has had this purse for about 5 days. She can find nothing to complain about.Bottom Line: Happy wife - happy life! Of all my wife's purses, this one has risen to the top and is the one she carries around most of the time, now. The price is very reasonable for the quality you get. My wife loves this purse and so does my daughter. I will be ordering one for a Christmas present for my daughter.

Well, I don't like to really talk about my feet because they are not pretty, but I have to make an exception in regards to this particular product. I have one foot that has a toenail fungus problem. I have had it for years and have tried many remedies and they just don't work. A couple of my toenails with the fungus under them are raised and rounded and almost impossible to cut with regular clippers. The problem I have with clippers is that they do not open wide enough to enable the sharp clipper part to get over my ugly nails to cut them. I have tried several different brands and sizes and not one has worked for me. I end up whacking away at the corners of my toenails and getting parts of them done, but the end results are jagged and unsatisfactory.When I was given the opportunity to try out these particular clippers for free in exchange for an honest review, I jumped at the chance when I looked at the pictures. It seemed to be different enough that it just might work for me.As soon as I opened the box, I knew these would work on my toes. The space between the 2 cutting edges was about twice as wide as any clipper I have ever owned. I couldn't wait to get my shoes and socks off, get out on the deck, and start clipping.Pros:- These are heavy duty stainless steel and feel substantial while you are using them.- The two cutting pieces are 1/8 inch apart. This is a bigger gap than any clippers I own and make it very easy to cut my misshaped toenails due to a fungus under a few of my toenails.- The holes in the handles make them easier to grip so they don't flip out of your hand while you are cutting tough nails like I have. Other clippers I have owned, if you get them onto tough toenails, the handle parts tend to slip sideways when they are squeezed and make the clippers flip out of my hand. These clippers are rock solid and don't move on you.- Also, the clipper handles are a lot further apart than the typical clippers, so if you have big hands like mine, this also adds to the stability and gives you better leverage to cut really tough nails.- The cutting head actually rotates on the frame so if you don't like straight-on cutting, you can cut sideways. This is not important to me, but may be for someone else. This makes it a versatile tool. I have actually used it in a pinch to cut small wires in a home electronic project I was working on. It was able to get into a tighter spot than my normal wire cutters could get. It didn't seem to affect the cutting edge but it is not something I would do on a regular basis and risk dulling the blade for its intended purpose down the road. But it did work great on a task it was not intended to be used for.- The clippers come with a nice heavy duty storage bag with a drawstring. This makes it easier to store in a drawer and be able to find it when you want to use it or to take it on a trip, it won't get lost in your suitcase.Cons:- I can find no fault with these clippers.Bottom Line:For years I have suffered with the task of cutting my toenails because a fungus under the nails has made my toenails thick and misshapen. These clippers have solved a big problem for me making it very easy to cut my toenails. They work better than any clippers I ever had.

Compared to the price of cases you can purchase for this phone at the Verizon store, this is a bargain. My Droid Ballistic Nylon Turbo works great with the case on.
