To me, the majority of the manual is worthless. A small section that tells you how to work it and what the display means is all you need. With all the data in the manual, you would think it would give you the range of oxygen levels you want to see - like what is a normal range for humans. But it doesn't. So, I have to knock this device for not providing adequate information about the use of the device and what the readings mean. I had to google for the info. So, basically, normal blood oxygen levels in humans are considered 95-100 percent. You can be 90-94% and not be in any trouble, but lower than 90% means you should see the doc.So, how does this unit work? I think it is great! I give the unit itself 5-stars for the following reasons:1) It is small, 2-1/4" x 1-1/2" x 3/4"2) Nice nylon carrying/storage case3) It has a rubber cover to protect the device4) It comes with 2, aaa batteries5) The digital display is easy to read and you can adjust the display for different viewing angles and how the numbers display - like upside down, wide left and right, and narrow top to bottom plus make the numbers bigger. The different views are done by pressing the power/options button repeatedly to change the display.6) It appears to be pretty fast and picking up your pulse and reading the oxygen levels in your blood.7) The readings agree with what I saw at the hospital when I was in the OR for my procedures. So, I believe it is accurate.8) The device is very simple to use. It only has one button that takes care of everything. You can figure it out without trying to wade through the manual. I just wish the manual would tell you what your results mean.9) The gadget powers down after about 13 seconds after you take your finger out. The power button does not turn it off but it does turn it on when you want to use it.Cons:The manual that comes with this device has a huge amount of technical jargon and warnings and blah..blah.. that will make you want to take a snooze. You can keep it around if you are a scientist and want to read all the science behind oxygen levels and how this thing works, but I would guess that 99% of the population would be glassy-eyed in a minute or so. There should be a small slip of paper with the very easy instructions to operate the device and a chart showing what normal oxygen levels are. You shouldn't have to google for the info you need.Bottom Line - This is a great tool. My oxygen levels are 98% and my pulse rate hangs around 60 bpm which agrees with what the hospital measured when I was in the OR. I give the tool 5-stars for a great piece of technology but the manual gets only 3 stars. The average is 4-stars. With a different manual/operating guide, it would be a 5-star product.

The wife and I are retired and travel quite a bit.  I have a laptop I like to take with me to handle e-mail, browse the web, upload pictures to facebook, etc. I have a large computer carrying briefcase kind of thing with wheels and an extendable handle. It has its own pockets for things. I like to use it as a carry-on to airplanes, so I have lots of other stuff in it for a trip - snacks, change of clothes and a toothbrush in case my luggage is lost. My laptop goes in there too and all my cords, mouse, USB jump drives, power cords, smartphone charger, etc. are stuck in various pockets. I have so many pockets in this thing that I actually thought I had lost my power cord to my laptop on one trip and so after my battery ran down, I was dead for most of the trip. I found it later tucked into a hidden pocket of my briefcase.So, I looked for something that would hold all my laptop/techie accessories in one place where it was all accessible at once. This item does a great job. It even holds my laptop's power supply and cord. It has all kinds of pockets, some zippered, to hold things of various sizes. It will hold everything I have that is associated with my laptop and smartphones. It folds up nicely but can get bulky for folding when you have a power supply module, AC cords, and a mouse in the pockets. But it has a strap that wraps around the organizer with a clip on each end that is adjustable. So, you can wrap the cord around and clip it so the organizer is "roundish/lumpy" but the cord keeps the organizer from falling open and nothing will fall out. Throw it in your briefcase or suitcase, and everything you need to be tech boy/girl is at your fingertips whenever you need it. The organizer appears to be well built and sturdy, so I do not anticipate any problems over time when using it. For my purposes, this is a great travel companion.

First of all, this is the smallest device battery pack I have seen on the market. The usual external charging battery devices out there are similar in size and weight to a smartphone. This battery pack is much smaller with dimensions of 3.5" x 1.1" x 0.78" and the one that I obtained is a cool blue. I have a small scale that measures in ounces, and this unit came in at 2.2 ounces. So, this is small enough to throw in a handbag or drop in your pocket and you hardly know you have it.I noticed some reviewers said that the USB cord that came with their battery pack was a flat cord, but mine came with a round cord that is 13.5 inches long from the end of the standard USB connector at one end to the end of the mini-USB connector at the other end.This battery pack is very easy to use. First you have to charge it. To do that, you plug the mini-USB connector of the accompanying cable to the battery pack and the other end to a computer or to an AC, USB charging module that comes with most smartphones. This battery pack does NOT come with an AC-DC module for charging it. I have a motorola Droid RAZR and the AC charging module that I use to charge my RAZR was used to charge this battery pack. Just unplug your normal charging cable for your phone and use the cable that comes with this battery pack instead. One end of the battery pack has a couple LED lights which glow red while it is charging and when the charge is done, they turn blue. My battery pack took about an hour and a half to charge out of the box.When it is charged, you can use it to charge your smartphone or any device that has a mini-USB connector. So, to use as a charger, you turn around the USB cable that comes with the battery pack and plug the standard USB connector end into the battery pack and plug the mini-USB end of the cable into your cell phone or similar device. No lights will show on the battery pack, but your device will show that it is charging. This battery pack has labels under each USB connector (very small to read) that show which is the input (for charging the battery pack) and which is the output (for the battery pack charging other devices).To test it, I took my Droid RAZR phone, whose battery was at 50%, and plugged the battery pack into it and set it down to charge. I did not use my RAZR during the charging period. It took about an hour and a half to recharge my smartphone to 100%.I like to wear cargo shorts during the Summer. My smartphone goes with me everywhere and I drop it in one of my pockets. My Droid RAZR does not have the best battery around and it likes to run down before the day is over. Many times I am not where I can plug it into an AC outlet since I am out running around, so having a battery pack like this in my pocket to keep it going is pretty nice. The cord and battery do not add much weight when plugged into my phone and everything fits fine in my cargo pants pocket.So, this battery pack has a lot going for it.- It is small in size (3.5" x 1.1" x 0.78")- It is light weight (2.2 oz.) so it is easy to throw in your bag or pocket and not weigh you down.- It charged my droid RAZR (down to 50% battery) in about an hour and a half. That's about the same time as it takes to charge my phone with the AC adapter that came with my phone. So, it is comparable.- It is cool looking. The cord color matches the color of the unit itself. My cord was round, not flat like some others have stated they received. I like round, so it is fine with me.I like this battery pack a lot. It goes with me everywhere my smartphone goes.I received a complimentary battery pack in exchange for testing it and giving it a review - positive or negative. This turned out to be one of those great products out there that I can really use and that work great. I really like it.

I do not have a giant grill. We like to BBQ, but my grill is pretty basic with 2 burners.We are retired with just the wife and I around the house most of the time, so I don't really need a big, fancy grill. When we have guests, my BBQ grill is fine for cooking hotdogs and hamburgers. I don't like steak, so we rarely cook steaks. My BBQ utensils are also basic and were given to us by family over the years. So, there is nothing fancy there.When I was offered the opportunity to test out these tongs, I jumped at the chance as the ones I have are kind of "crappy" to say the least. Thin construction and anything of size is hard to pick up and turn over with my old ones.Pros:- These tongs are made of stainless steel. They have no hinges to catch your hand in when using. They are made from one continuous piece of stainless steel and offer just enough resistance when picking up.turning items, that is it not difficult to use, but still they spring back to their original form.- I would call these heavier duty - at least compared to what I had.- I love the teeth at the end which help to pick up items on the grill so they don't fall off when you are turning them.- The handles are aluminum but are insulated so that they don't get hot when you are using them. They look nice and are very functional.- These are easy to clean. No hidden areas to collect grease/crap and you could just throw them in the dishwasher.- I can throw these in the kitchen utensil drawer when not in use.Cons:If there was a con, some might think that these are maybe 2 inches too short. In my case, my basic grill is just the right size at 26" x 14". I don't have an issue with heat getting to my hands when I am outside cooking. A bigger grill might present a problem to some. But at 13.5 inches long, these tongs are fine for my use. I do not use these in the house - just with my grill outside on the deck. So, if you have a giant grill, you might not like the length of these tongs.Bottom line - I gave my old tongs to a neighbor who didn't have any. These tongs are now my only tongs for grilling. I love these tongs!

Okay - I am really big on products that don't contain crap ingredients. What sold me on this particular soap are items like:"DOES NOT CONTAIN: Hydrogenated tallow acid (animal fat), Butylated hydroxytoluene (commercial preservative), Triclocarban or triclosa (commonly used antibacterial), Petroleum or GMO (genetically modified organisms)""Colorants are herbs - preservatives are plant extracts. Never any parabens, alcohol, petroleum, artificial/synthetic dyes or fragrances"So many skin and hair products on the market today contain parabens and other nasty things that are hard to pronounce.  This coconut oil soap has ingredients that make me feel good.I have problems with highly scented products - they make my eyes water and it is difficult to even be around them. So, I am always looking for lightly or non-scented personal products. This coconut oil soap fits my requirements perfectly.I have dry skin. As a guy, I hate adding oils and hydrating products to my skin like my wife does. I don't like the feeling of that garp on my skin. So, I live with dry skin. I hate the normal soaps on the market because they just dry out my skin more, plus their scents drive me crazy. When I was offered the opportunity to try this soap in return for an honest review, I jumped at the chance because our household already uses coconut oil for cooking and I really like it for its health benefits.So, for me, this looks like an ideal bath soap. After using it a few times, here are my observations...Pros:- This soap lathers quite well. When showering, you get a good load of suds which makes you feel clean in the end.- The slight coconut scent is great. Nothing overpowering here. It is just a slight, clean, coconut fragrance which is very pleasant. There is nothing here to make my eyes water.- After just a couple showers, I can see the skin on my legs and arms are already not so dry looking. So, this soap seems to be somewhat hydrating.- This list of ingredients hit my hot buttons for "not-crap" and the soap is certified organic ingredients.Cons:I do not think this soap will last long. The way its suds and with my wife using it too - I can see it not lasting a long time. Oh, the pain - I will have to order another bar sooner than later - ha..ha..Bottom Line - This is on my list for reordering and using on a regular basis. I love this soap!

I am a big fan of vitamin C. I know you can get it from drinking fruit juices, but juices are just too high in sugars for me. Even the 100% juices are too high in sugars. So, I like to take a supplement to make sure I get an adequate amount of C. When I ran across this brand of C, I saw their ads that say this brand is non-gmo. It is non-gmo because, the brand uses non GMO corn from Scotland as a source for the product. So, there is a plus. The other thing that I like about these capsules are the citrus bioflavonoids and rose hips which are added to enhance the bioavailability of vitamin C. These components help the body to absorb the C better.I also like the price which is reasonable for what you are getting. I have had a recent problem with a Viva Labs product (not C) I purchased, and I gave the product a bad rating because the oil-based tablets came melted/stuck together and could not be removed from the bottle. Viva Labs reached out and sent me a new bottle which was just fine. So, they stepped up to make a customer happy. I am a fan of Viva Labs products because they use non-GMO ingredients and have good prices. And they listen to customer complaints and try to fix things.Both the wife and I take this Vitamin C and believe it has helped us to stay sick-free for 2014.

Okay - my use of this bag is a little different that its intended use.I live out in the boonies and I have fruit trees and berry bushes that produce lots of great tasting fruits that also make great flavored liqueurs. I like to turn ripe fruit into liqueurs that I then use for mixing interesting cocktails for friends and family who come to visit.Typically, you pick your fruit and put it into a jar and then cover with your booze of choice - like vodka or brandy - let is sit for some time, and then strain the fruity muck through cheesecloth or coffee filters to get a clear end product. I have problems with coffee filters in that it takes forever to filter the fruit from the booze as the pulpy fruit blocks passage of the booze into the end result bottle. Cheesecloth works a little better but passes smaller particles of fruit to the booze so it is thicker and not clear.When I saw the nut bags on Amazon, I got to thinking that this product may solve my problem for good.So, here is my setup.- I have a gallon glass tea container with a spigot at the bottom.- I pour a 1 liter bottle of vodka into the jar.- Pick a gob of ripe blackberries from my patch and fill the nut bag about 3/4 full.- Drop the filled nut bag into the top of the jar, spread the open top of the nut bag over the jar top and screw the lid over the top of the jar/nutbag top so that the nutbag is suspended in the vodka.- Shake and set the jar in a cool dark place - like the basement.- Every couple of days, shake the jar.- After a week or two, take the lid off the jar, pull the nutbag our and squeeze the bag back into the jar to get any juices left in the bag into the liquid gold in the jar.What you have left in the nut bag are the seeds and garp you don't want in your liqueur. Add sugar to the jar and taste via a shot glass under the spigot. When you get your desired sweetness, use the spigot on the jar to fill empty bottles to store in your bar.This turned out to be a very sturdy strainer. I squeezed as hard as I could with my hands (messy but kinda fun) and the bag held up just fine.  When done, I just turned the bag inside out to dump the fruit garp into the garbage. It does leave a dark stain on the bag which fades quite a bit when you just wash it under cold water. I tried putting some bleach in the sink with cold water and letting the nutbag sit for a while and then helped lighten the stain, but not get rid of it completely. I just look at it as battle scars and a reminder of the tasty contents the bag held when fulfilling its purpose of producing liquid gold for my liqueur cabinet.It also worked fine for fresh peaches and making a peach liqueur. So, you can add this capability as another use for this terrific product.

I bought this fitbit zip for my daughter so she could be my and her mother's friend on the fitbit tracker website. So, now we can help urge each other on to get max steps per day. My wife and I have had our fitbits for a while now and what we like about these is that:1) they are small and easily fit in your pocket, on a belt loop, on my wife's bra strap, etc. They come with a jacket that has the clip on it. You can take the fitbit out of the jacket to replace the battery which is a flat type watch battery that is readily available everywhere.2) The fitbit zip comes with a USB dongle that plugs into a PC USB port. You just leave it there and any time your fitbit is close to your PC while it is on, it will automatically upload your step data and chart it for you on the fitbit dashboard you have on the fitbit webite. You just log into the fitbit website and all your stats are there - daily, weekly, monthly, yearly - in graphs and charts. It is easy to keep track of your progress over time.3) Fitbit will give you medals for reaching certain milestones - like 100 miles, 250 miles, 1000 miles, etc. So, this is an incentive to keep you going. I am currently at my 3,000 mile mark. That is a nice medal to have.4) You can add buddies to your fitbit friends list. We have our daughter added to our list. Every week we get a fitbit e-mail showing how each of us ranks in steps for the last 7 days. Usually our daughter is around 135,000 steps, I am at 90,000 (god for an old retired guy like me), and my wife is usually around 70,000. So, the fitbit makes us look at each day tomake sure we get at least our 10,000 steps per day.5) Fitbit comes in all kind of colors so you can get one to match your personality.6) The zip battery lasts about 6-months. Not bad. I have found replacement batteries on Amazon for only a few dollars, so they are easy to find. Most grocery stores sell the flat battery required in their battery section.The fitbit team cares about their customers. My wife recently had a problem with her fitbit jacket and I e-mailed fitbit and they sent her a new one. I had mistakenly told them she had a fitbit one unit which is a different size so they sent the wrong jacket. I thanked them for their support and told them they didn't have to send me another one of the correct size, since it was my mistake and I didn't feel right asking them to send another. I said I would just live with the problem. But they turned right around and are sending me the correct one anyway at no charge. I am giving the incorrect jacket to a local school who has students that use the fitbit.So, this is outstanding customer support. We love our fitbits, they work great and keep us motivated to not be couch potatoes, and customer service is superb. You can bet that other family members will find fitbits in their Christmas stockings this Christmas.

I am a health minded individual, so I am pretty up to date with the issues involving weight loss and diets. I am not one to think there are magic bullets out there that allow one to just pop a pill and get amazing results. I grow a lot of my own veggies organically, and I always try to buy organic at the store. I stay away from sugar and artificial sweeteners, coloring, flavors, etc and always look at labels when I buy anything. I am pretty savvy when it comes to nutrition.I also wear a pedometer and average 14,000 steps per day, so I try to stay active. I am older (67) so my metabolism is not what it used to be. Fat likes to collect around my middle and love handles are very hard for me to get rid of. I was skinny as a rail in high school weighing 150 pounds at 6'-2" tall, and I still had love handles. So, some parts of your body are just not fixable and you are stuck with the genes you have.I am a gourmet cook and we have lots of guests visit us because we live in a lake community and there is lots to do up here. So, I am cooking more fattening, though healthy, meals to please guests. When I got to 220 pounds, I decided I needed to cut back, so I consciously cut back on the cocktails (which I am famous for), and cut back on carbs in general. I got down to 200 pounds slowly in a 6-month period and hit a wall. My goal was 190 for my 6'-2" frame. People say I look skinny, but it is my middle-stomach area that I don't like. I decided to try some supplements to see if they could get me the last 10 pounds I wanted and get me over the wall I had hit.I have tried Garcinia Cambogia and Raspberry Ketones with no results. So, I am now trying the Forskolin before going to a completely low carb diet, which I know works for me, but which is not the pleasantest way to eat. Once I get to 190, I will just continue to stay away from low fiber, high fat foods, drink water instead of cocktails most of the time but enjoy my cocktail creations only a day or two a week, and eat mostly complex carbs. My guests will still get their fix, but I will just stay away from the kinds of things I am serving them or keep servings to a lot smaller amounts.I have dropped to 193 using the forskolin, so this is working for me. I am about half way through my second bottle. It took most of the first bottle to get a crack in "The Wall" but after that, I could really feel the difference in my pants and the way they fit. It got me past my wall, which is what I wanted. I imagine that when this bottle is done, I will be where I want and I can just quit the supplement and watch what I eat/drink a lot closer. My pedometer keeps me active as I compete with my 41 year old daughter who creams me most of the time when it comes to steps/day, but I stay ahead of my wife of 45 years so there is some incentive there to not let her beat me too - ha..ha..So, for me, this product is a short term fix which got me over my wall for my weight loss goal. I will stick with more fresh veggies, fruits, healthy fats, like olive and coconut oils, and stay away from most grains (I have to eat my organic oats now and then). GMO foods have been banned from our house for some time. We rely on organic foods from my own garden and local farmer friends who we know do not spray or use GMO seeds and we can our own salsas, green beans, tomato sauce, etc. so we have access to them during the Winter. Overall, this product got me over my hump when other products did nothing. So, for my body, this has been a great buy. Your body may be different and react differently, but it worked for me.

I am a fan of Viva Labs products and have several different kinds of their supplements. I have rated them highly in the past. I ordered their Astaxanthin for the first time and was very disappointed. The tabs were all stuck together in the bottle in a big glob. I couldn't get them out of the bottle as the bottle narrows at the lid and the whole thing was just a globby mess. I ended up cutting the top of the bottle off with a bandsaw so I could get the glob out so I could try to separate the tabs. No deal - some were leaking and got red stuff all over my hands. I got a few unstuck, but it was making such a mess on the counter, I gave up.I sent an e-mail to the company but never got a response back. So, this glob went in the trash. I ruined the bottle trying to get them out, so I don't feel right going back to Amazon for a refund. Money wasted. I will not buy another Viva Labs product.

Okay - So, here is the scoop. I am not using this wrist wrap for weight lifting. It actually makes a really good support for bowling.I am not a weight lifter, but when I saw the form of this wrap, and looked at what you get for your money, I had to give it a try. Bowlers have a lot of different hand/wrist aids, some that cover the whole hand and half the arm, down to just a wrap that goes around the wrist to help support the weight of a bowling ball. Their costs range from about $12-$90 depending on what form you like and how much you are willing to spend. They all have their pluses and minuses. I happen to be a minimalist and I have tried the basic bowling support that just wraps around the wrist and I didn't like it because it tends to slide down my wrist while in use unless I wrap it so tight that it cuts off my circulation. They are also typically about 2-inches wide. I like a little more support than that on my wrist.What I like about this wrist support is that it it has a nylon loop attached to one end that you can slide over your thumb before you wrap it around your wrist This keeps the support in place so you don't have to wrap it so tight, making it a lot more comfortable. The strap is 3-inches wide and 12-inches long plus about 4-inches for a velcro strip on one end that secures the wrap when you get it comfortably wrapped on your wrist. With 12-inches of wrap, I can get it around my wrist almost twice, so that makes it easy to adjust where you put it and also gives you a chance to get a wider support base where it overlaps. The wrap is padded very well and that adds to the comfort.The support is very comfy and easy to adjust as you bowl - looser or tighter in a flash. What you get in the bag are 2 supports - one for the right hand and one for the left. I am right handed but I have found that by wrapping the support in the opposite direction around my wrist, I can use the left handed support on my right wrist. The only real difference is how the thumb loop is attached and that is why you have to wrap it in the opposite direction. The thumb loop is comfy and does not get in the way of holding the ball. You forget it is even there and the support stays solid where you want it on your wrist. So, really, you are getting 2 wrist supports for the price of one. The price is already reasonable - even less expensive than the typical single bowling wrist support that is similar in form - plus you get 2. What is not to like?With bowling season coming up, this support will be in my bag for the entire season for the 3 leagues that I bowl in. I am glad I ran across this product and decided to try it as a bowling aid. It works great for me!

This is a sleek looking thermometer that tells time also. It works well and the curved design is modern and attractive. However, I have to agree with the others that the batteries especially the harder to find button battery should have been included. Otherwise it's a nice functional piece.

This is a basic dish cloth that works for washing dishes. However, the manufacturer is selling them as all around cloths that are suitable for washing and drying dishes. They are not good for drying dishes because they are not absorbent nor are they large enough. If you want a simple cloth to use for washing dishes these will work. If you are looking to dry - look elsewhere.
Yum! Packaged beautifully and so delicious! This is a lovely assortment of pralines. Sooooo tasty!

This product went on nice and smooth and blended easily into my skin. I like the feel of it and how absorbent it is. Many eye creams irritate my skin and make my eyes tear up but this one does not.  I look forward to seeing how it works on wrinkles over time.

I first discovered wipes like these while on vacation. I usually use a liquid cleanser but these made washing and refreshing the face easy. They are not exfoliating but are just plain and simple makeup/ dirt removal wipes. They get the job done nicely. The way they are packaged keeps them fresh and from drying out if you close the flap. Overall I like them a lot and find them very handy.

This is a really lovely watch. I was impressed as I pulled it out of the box by the look. I love the gray face...it is soft and takes on a different shade depending on the angle. It is very unusual.This watch is bold. It has a large face and makes a statement. The band clasp links easily and is sized to fit a large wrist. You will have to get it adjusted if you have small wrists or move it up your arm.The one drawback is the small dials that show time of day etc. are so small I have trouble reading them. I think if they were brighter it would be better..Over all this is a lovely watch if you are looking for a dramatic yet classy time piece.

I thought these were very nice sunglasses. The frame is medium so it works well for both men and women. The case it comes with is sturdy and nice. The style is pretty simple and will look good on many face shapes.

This monthly planner offers a lot to keep you organized. It is too large for most pocketbooks but a nice size to keep on your desk or table. It is spiral bound and opens flat. The planner has a lot going on boasting a distinct creamy shade to each page, fancy fonts and quotes. It is definitely on the feminine side. If you are looking for a plain vanilla planner this is not for you. If you want something with a little flair and style this could be it.

These are generously sized bottles of shower gel and the design is easy to use. They nicely dispense the contents within. This pack contains a variety to try. I personally found the scents to strong especially the rose one. It was over powering to me, cloying and artificial smelling. The other two scents were fine however, Overall, I prefer natural light body washes that do not interfere with my perfume but if you like a distinct smell these are a good value for the money.

I really like this soft microfiber blanket. The size is good and it easily fits in the travel pouch. It is large enough for several adults but compact to make it easy for travel. The color is a soft blue not a bright blue as stated in item description. The travel pouch is super handy and can hold a few other items as well. It also works well as a throw blanket. A nice choice.

These are sturdy paper towels that are handy for a variety of tasks from wiping up spills to cleaning. Durable and lasting they get the job done. Each box has a generous supply so they will last the average household a long time.

My husband enjoys Axe products and this one is no exception. Light scent without being over powering, works nicely to clean and condition hair. Now as far as the Axe 2 in 1 shampoo ad copy that says you will experience "extreme female attraction" when you use it, ummm probably not, but at least you will have groomed hair.

I really enjoy the taste of the chocolate chunk Zone bars. They are soft and chewy with enough chocolate to satisfy a craving. Though I did not find the bars to be as filling as the Zone meal bars, the 10 grams of protein does make for a satisfactory snack. They are a better choice to reach for then a traditional sugar laden treat. Plus they are handy for on the go as they are individually wrapped and easy to eat!

Keep it simple with this little frother. Works as well as a messy self frothing unit and is easier to clean. The stand keeps it from getting bent. This is a nice buy if you like form with your hot drinks.
I thought these were pretty but more geared to a petite woman or teen due to the smaller size. They have a definite rose color to them and will work to dress up or down.

These are fun cards for your feminine friends. Handy to have on hand to save a trip to the store to hunt down a card. I like them a lot. However cost wise they work out to about 5 bucks a pop...for that price you can also send a digital gift card for a cup of coffee. So it boils down to weather you think the recipient would like sentiment or a hot cup of joe.

This is a nice assortment of cards that works out to about three dollars each. They are general and will serve a range of ages. If you want to save yourself some time in the card aisle this is a nice selection.

This is a variety pack of hot cocoa. My order included an assortment of Charleston Chew, Tootsie Roll, Junior Mints and Sugar Babies. Personally I feel you are better off buying cocoa and using hot water or milk and adding boiling water over using a Keurig. You will get a richer flavor and pay less. One of my big disappointments with these was the lack of nutritional information. I did not see a list of ingredients. So I don't know what they contained in terms of artificial sugar or how many calories they had. I looked up one of them on a nutrition app, the Tootsie Roll flavored cocoa, and it had 70 calories. So if you are watching your calories be sure to check before drinking.

This is a nice product but I did not find it as effective or moisturizing as Aquaphor. It is in a tube that is wider than a lip balm tube for cheek dispersal but can also be used on lips. I think the price point should be less also. I do like Burt's Bees but this is not a fave.

I love Cetaphil products and this lotion is no exception. Gentle on the skin and absorbs nicely. It includes a sunscreen (essential) and does not clog pores. Though this is marketed to men, it could just as easily be used by women. Great product...highly recommend!
I had this as part of my breakfast. I found it to be very thin without a lot of flavor. After munching on it I was still hungry. There are better bars out there from KIND and from other companies.

This is a heavy duty tape measure. Instead of retracting like many tape measures do, it stays put when you pull it out and you have to push the button to retract it. It also has a handy clip to hook on your belt. The yellow  measure section makes it easy to read and the silver is attractive and professional looking.I keep a small, lightweight tape measure in my purse for measuring furniture etc. when I am out and this one is great at home as it is heavier.All in all a sturdy tape measure at a good price point.

This is a pair to nice quality scissors that cut thru a variety of media. I like the comfort grip handles and the pointed tip for ease and accuracy. Overall this is a good pair of scissors if you are looking for a versatile, affordable pair of shears.

I agree with other reviewers that this tape does a good job of sticking things together but...I do not care for the tacky sides of it. I also found the smell of it very chemical when I first pulled it from the box. Overall, I use other brands for shipping and I have never had any issues with them working well and with them having an odor or being tacky on the sides as you touch it.

I like having soft, smooth hands but I want to smell of my favorite perfume not my hand lotion. Unfortunately, the scent of this hand lotion is over powering and I just used a dab. I found it very cloying. In addition any fragrance can be both irritating to the skin and drying. I am not sure why they overloaded this product which is rubbed all over your hands with it. I prefer unscented or very lightly scented moisturizers.After use I was not enjoying smoother hands but wanting to wash away the smell. I would not purchase this.

This is a nice color assortment of 8 pens. I am pleased with how easily they write. They also have a nice feel to them. They have a soft click when you push them on and off. The colors are pretty. They are a little more than some other pen assortments but still moderately priced so it won't break the bank if you lose one. Overall a nice buy.

This little heart chain necklace is pretty for a young girl, teen or very petite adult. It's to small for an average size woman in my opinion. The heart is about the size of a dime. The chain is thin but has a nice sparkle to it. The heart is also pretty but I was hoping the flakes encapsulated in the crystal would float - they don't.Packaging is a real disappointment. The outer box was torn in two places. When I opened it, the chain itself was caught under the back of the box so I actually had to tear the box apart to remove the necklace.Overall, it is pretty but not something I would purchase for myself.

This is a really nice heavy duty, kink resistant hose. Water flows through it smoothly and it doesn't bunch up. It has a good feel in the hand. We are very pleased with it.Top quality, great performance - this is a good buy if you are looking for a durable hose!

This is a nice quality, basic computer. Some of the features are: A6-Series APU A6-6310 (1.80GHz), 4GB DDR3 1TB HDDAMD Radeon R4 and Windows 8.1 with Bing.Though the price point is moderate, at the website it is listed for $100 less, though it is not available to purchase online at this time. A check of other merchants found one offering it for the same price here but including a wireless hard drive (a $159 value) with purchase.I work online and run a lot of programs, so for me the memory of 4GB is not sufficient but it can be upgraded to a max of 16GB.The computer comes with a keyboard and an optical mouse but lacks a monitor. It also includes Acer's special BYOC or Build Your Own Cloud. Mine included a 6 month subscription to McAfee Live.One aspect I really like about the computer is it is Green Compliant.Overall, if you are tight on budget, this may be a good start and you can expand on it later. If you have the funds, you may want to purchase something with more bells and whistles from the get go.

Light, fragrant and delicious, I really enjoy the smell of the product. It is not over done, not head ache inducing...just fragrant with a masculine overtone...Makes you want to get closer to that someone special wearing it :)

I bought my first Zumba workout back in the day when it was on VHS. There were little flowers floating around the screen as the dancers danced. Over the years I have purchased the Exhilarate set, Total Body Transformation and the workouts for Wii. All of the sets are nice quality and offer a good variety. The Zumba Fitness Incredible Results System is no exception. The set includes well thought out dance sets, dancers who are having a blast and a nutrition booklet.The step that comes with the set takes the place of a traditional step. It's nubby for traction yet gentle enough you could go barefoot (though that is not recommended). One complaint is of all the discs in the set only one uses the step. Why not have at least two workouts with the step instead of just one. However, you can use the step for extra exercise in general. I plan to use it to dance to my favorite music.Overall, if you like Zumba, I think you will really enjoy this set. It's a great way to have fun and get in shape!

This is a nice simple blender at an affordable price point. I have a Vita-Mix which is top of the line but it is also several hundred dollars. This puppy can get the job done and you'll have money left over to buy groceries! Now how long it will hold up, I don't know. Some of the parts have an inexpensive feel.I like that it is small making it easy to fit under counters and is BPA Free.Overall an affordable blender for basic everyday use.

This is a super nice quality pot holder. It is very flexible and does an excellent job at protecting your hands from hot surfaces. It can also be used as a trivet for hot plates. The gray color blends is neutral enough to blend with almost any decor. I usually wear a mitt, but this makes a nice change and will work for any size hand. Nice choice for cooking!

These are tasty little snacks. Handy for a quick treat or on the go or fast snack. Are there better choices? Certainly - with only 2 grams of protein, 9 grams of sugar and 27 grams of carbs they are not exactly a health food. But with 5 grams of fiber there are a lot worse choices out there.

I have always liked Curel products and this anti itch lotion is super nice. It goes on thicker than some lotions but it has a nice consistency to it. Once applied to the skin, my skin felt smooth and very soft.I love the hygienic pump bottle. And I am super pleased that it is fragrance free. For the price point and size the value is there.Overall, lovely lotion!

Woot! I totally love this fabulous resource Sherry Snider has pulled together. It must have entailed a massive amount of work as not only does she have lists of sites but she also includes screen shots!Sherry has links for press release sites, book listing services, Facebook sites and more. And I love how she has included the PR (page rank) for the book promotion sites. These are organized in alphabetical order.I would love to see more book listing sites included in the next edition. I can think of a number of other sites that could have been added but she has a really nice start here. And I appreciate how she includes a sign up so you can get updates to the book as links change, new sites are added etc.My tip - to use the book fire up Amazon's Kindle for your computer. Then just start at the beginning of the book promo list and click thru to each site to view it and see if it is a viable option for your book.Overall, nice work Sherry and nice resource to help compile sites all in one place.

The Belly Burn Plan is a comprehensive weight loss plan. It is obvious the author put a lot of work into it. There are in depth sections on the science behind the plan, recipes, day by day menu plans, exercise and more.And naturally this diet is not a diet but according to the author it is a lifestyle plan that you go on for life.The author categorizes everyone by one of four body shape and you are to eat according to your shape. She lists cravings for the types, menu plans and foods to avoid. To me this seemed gimmicky. Let's face it, no matter what shape you are if you eat less you will lose weight unless there is a medical issue. She also uses "Jenny" as an example of someone who can't lose weight but does thru this plan throughout the book. This gets old and boring. Bring on the real people and show the before and afters please.Note - She also suggests using agave nectar instead of sugar...recent studies I've read have shown agave nectar is much worse than sugar.I do think the diet can work but I did not find it that much different than other eat clean diets with exercise.So why the three stars? I personally think the eating and exercise plan would be very hard for most people to stick to. And to make it even more difficult it begins with a 3 day cleanse.Anyone that can stick to this is probably in decent shape to begin with. But that is just my opinion on it. If you want to jump directly into a restrictive step by step eating plan with high intensity exercise included this could be right for you.

This is a nice pan that does what it says. It cooks evenly and cleans up quickly. But to my surprise instead of being uniformly round, the pan I received had a noticeable dip in it. In fact when my husband glanced at it for the first time his comment was "is it supposed to be bent"? It was like a factory error but sent out as a first quality pan. I am also not fond of the speckled look of the pan. So for efficiency I give it high rankings but for appearance I deduct a star.

This is a gentle baby wash that is free of many irritants. It is hypoallergenic and just a small dollop goes a long way. It dispenses easily from the bottle. It does have a soft, gentle fragrance and I would have preferred it be fragrance free, so I am deducting one star. It's a good choice for baby or sensitive skin.

This is certainly a quality sunscreen that goes on smoothly, covers easily and does what it is supposed to do - protect your skin from the sun.I deducted a star though because I really prefer fragrance free products. I would rather smell like myself or my choice of cologne than some chemicals in my sunscreen. And for the price point a lotion is more affordable but then the ease of applying this may make the price differential worth it.

This is a super nourishing baby oil that's not just for babies. It is perfect for adults with dry skin also. The soothing oil is hypoallergenic and mineral oil free. A little goes a long way. I made the mistake of squirting a lot in my hands the first time I opened the bottle when a small squeeze would have been enough. A little dab goes a long way.After putting it on my hands they were moisturized and felt soft and smooth. Nice product at a good price point!

I like this product. It absorbs easily, has no greasy feel, contains an SPF 15 for sun protection, lightens and brightens the skin, pumps easily from the bottle and is fragrance free. What more could you want? Well more in the bottle. At around $20 it is 1.7 ounces which is 1.2 ounces less than what I normally use but it is twice as expensive.It is a nice product though and I look forward to seeing more even skin tone as promised in a few weeks.

I'm impressed with this the SKLZ parachute. It is easy to use and lightweight. I was surprised at how effective it is for the weight. The belt rotates 360degrees allowing for a full range of motion.The chute is designed to increase acceleration and performance at top speeds. So for it to be effective you really have to run at a fast pace to get that resistance. I  like that it has a carry bag to keep it contained and organized. The company also makes a pro version that has two chutes. Overall a nice quality product for training.

These are a tasty intense coffee treat. They fit nicely in the espresso machine and brew up a lovely cup of coffee.Packaging is attractive and I love seeing the coffee thru the base.  Price point is a little less than regular Nespresso.Recommend!

This is a nice tasty tea but I feel it would be better if it was able to steep longer. Also the price point is high. I would rather just use a bag and make a cup as that is better on my budget.The pods come 10 to a package and are in a foil wrapper. I am thinking also of brewing the tea and trying it as a flavoring over ice and in other drinks.Quality product but pricey.

This is a nice quality vacuum. I was impressed by the overall feel of this appliance. It has great suction and is lightweight. I love that it is bagless and has a see thru canister so not only do you save money on bags but you can see the dirt as it is sucked up. It also features automatic cord retraction for quick and handy cord winding.That said I prefer to vacuum with an upright and use a smaller separate canister for upholstry etc. This definitely can do the job, I just find it was a bit awkward to use vs a smaller canister.Unlike other reviewers I did not find it any nosier than other machines and I also felt the construction was sturdy.If you are looking for an all in one canister this certainly fits the job.

I really like this handy little scrubber. The handle is easy to grip and the pad does a nice job of removing grit. I have to give it 4 stars though because replacement pads are not readily available. I could not find them on Amazon. It is a new product however, so perhaps they will be easier to find in future.I think using this is much nicer than trying to grip a sponge pad and it is easier on the hands.Nice one Oxo!

This is my 3rd George Foreman grill. The plates on my last one lasted a number of years but finally became very tired, so it was time for a new one. So I was super excited to see this as a selection in Vine.The grill arrived securely packaged. A strong box, and then the actual appliance box within another box. I pulled it out and was impressed with the sleek design and the quality of the ceramic plates.After washing the plates and clicking them in place, I decided to fix a gooey, cheesy sandwich. My other George Foreman had knobs to adjust the temperature, this has an easy touch panel. After clicking power on the grill it began to heat to the temperature I had selected. Within minutes I had a melt in your mouth cheese, turkey and pita sandwich. Mouth watering, fast and oh so good. According to the instruction booklet you should not use spray on the trays so I figured I would have a gooey mess to clean. But to my surprise once I lifted off the food the ceramic looked barely touched.The appliance adjusts so you can drip fat off of greasy food or use it flat for sandwiches and veggies. It's a nice size but does not have a super large foot print. It comes with waffle plates, two ceramic plates, a drip tray and a non scratch utensil to use on it. It also comes with instructions. The instructions include directions on how to care for and heat the grill. Directions on how long to cook different meats are also included. Alas there were only 3 skimpy recipes in the booklet. But oh well.On a side note, I noticed the website for the product had specialty plates for the grill as does Amazon including muffin, bake dish, griddle and others. And if you Google George Foreman grill weight loss, you can find weight loss recipes, success stories and a weight loss challenge for the grill.Overall, a super nice quality appliance that can help you "knock out the fat" and simplify kitchen cooking and clean up!

I have an epilator I purchased some years ago and it hurts. I was hoping that time would result in a no pain epilation tool but alas when you yank hair out from the root - it hurts! This tool tries to minimize the pain with a variety of head attachments including one for sensitive areas and an exfoliation brush to help prepare the area. All very nice but it still hurts.It's well made, feels good in the hand and can be used wet or dry. It also has LED light to make it easier to see what you are working on. This is a nice quality tool for epilation.One big drawback is it does not feature a shaver head. It's nice to have that additional feature so you have another hair removal option and keeping it in one tool saves space and money.

I have a Keurig coffee maker and as much as I love the convenience, the cost of buying k-cups daily is expensive and the coffee is not always as strong as in a coffee maker. So I was super happy to try this product.I love the stainless steel carafe. Stainless steel keeps the coffee hotter, makes the coffee taste better and is less worrisome than having an easy to break glass pot. The big advantage of a glass pot is seeing how much coffee you have left, Mr. Coffee solves this problem with this stainless steel carafe by including what they call "light bar technology" so you can tell how much they have left. This carafe holds about 12 cups of coffee.The coffee maker also boasts a method of saturating the grounds so the coffee tastes better but I did not notice a big difference in taste. The features are easy to use and the machine is sleek and attractive. Looks great on the counter!Overall its a nice machine for a delicious cuppa!

I really enjoyed Marie Kondo's book, "The Life Changing Magic of Tidying Up." I have read a number of books on clearing your clutter and Marie takes a different approach. Instead of going room by room as most books advise she suggests you organize by categories. She even gives you the order to go in to make it easier.But as much as I enjoyed the book I can't overlook her wastefulness. She constantly advises on to throw out what you don't need with only the occasional or donate it. She goes so far as to say she rips pages out of books so she can keep certain sections. Defacing an entire book for a few words when someone else could enjoy it, just doesn't feel right.She talks about how she cleaned her room and hauled out bags of trash and from how she writes I get the impression she is young. Her tips focus more on books and clothes over household items etc.Overall I really like the book, but I cringe when I read her recommendation to throw it out. I do believe this book can help get you organized top to bottom so I recommend it highly but I wish Marie would touch more on repurposing, gifting, donating, and even selling what you can't use to buy something you need instead of throwing it out.

I had an expensive bread making machine a few years ago and despite my efforts the bread did not come out well most of the time and the clean up was a pain. Recently, I decided to try eating more natural foods i.e. foods without preservatives etc. And if you read the bread label, it is hard to find a healthy loaf. I decided to try the Oster based on the reviews and price point.The machine comes with very detailed directions on how to make bread and a number of recipes. And it is ultra easy to use. I made a country white, basic white, banana bread and pizza dough. All of them came out perfectly. I was stunned at how high the pizza dough rose and how delicious it tasted. Banana bread was super simple and tasty and the white loaves were delicious.Clean up is a breeze. The loaves slipped out of the machine easily and the pan washed up with little effort.One drawback to the machine is the height. It is fairly tall and I could not store it in my kitchen cabinets. But it is easy to lift as opposed to some of the machines that are longer. It makes a horizontal loaf and you can choose from a number of settings.Overall I rate this 5 stars for ease and yumminess!

This embroidery machine is amazing. I love the way it makes intricate designs with ease. It's a great way to personalize items. It can be used for towels, tablecloths, baby bibs, sweaters, etc. Personalized items add a nice touch to your home and are perfect to give as gifts. It comes with 55 designs built in including borders and letters. You can download more from your computer and even make your own. Designs include flowers, animals, sports, transportation and much more.Despite all that it does, it is compact and the handle makes it easy to carry. It comes with accessories including two hoops so you can match the size to the design like using the small one for baby onesies. It also comes with instructions, and I also found it very helpful to watch the video on the Singer sewing machine site. It has a number of nice features include a backlit touch screen and a language option for different languages.Despite my limited sewing skill, I was able to whip up things that looked like they took hours of time. This is a super nice machine for embroidery!

I have dry skin but have never liked applying lotion after a shower. I have to wait for it to absorb before getting dressed, it seems to take a long time, and never seems to last anyway. As a result, I don't do it and my skin is dry.When I saw the Nivea Body in Shower Lotion, I was curious if it could work. But it does. It leaves a light layer on your body of skin smoothing ingredients, so your skin feels soft and supple after use. It should be combined with a body wash as it does not wash the skin it moisturizes it.It glides on the skin easily and is so easy to use in the shower instead of after.One drawback is it does contain scents. The scent is not heavy, but I would prefer a product fragrance free. Hopefully, they will come out with this next.Overall fab product for smooth, touchable skin!
This is a super nice quality trimmer. It stays charged for close to 4 hours, has a good hand feel and gets the job done. Overall a quality product at a good price point!

Resistance bands can give a nice workout but I did find the material on this one to be sticky. The loops are interesting as you can use your hands in different positions but I thought the band was a bit short. Overall I think it needs some work.

I felt this was a nice product but I find it easier to use powder shadow for eyelining with a thin tipped brush. Also I felt it was pricey at $20. All in all it works fine I just prefer other eyelining methods. This would be handy to slip in the purse for quick touch ups or take on vacation.

This pillow does not offer the "play" that many memory foam pillows do. It is rigid and does not conform as much to the head. If you like a firmer pillow you may like this but if you prefer medium you will find it hard to sleep on. I had trouble sleeping on it and had to revert to my softer pillow.

This is a really cute apron. I love the black and white print - it is cute and classy. The apron is a nice quality material, fits well and looks great. I enjoy having things that are functional and well designed and this fits the bill. Does the job nicely and at an affordable price point!

This smells divine and works nicely in a variety of recipes. For an organic cacao powder the price point is excellent, especially when you compare it to processed powders. It is securely packaged also.I have other Viva Labs products and have found them to be top notch. This is a nice company with quality products!I received a complimentary sample of this product for my honest feedback.

"A year from now, you will wish you started today."  With those words Mimi Spencer kicks off "The Fast Beach Diet" inviting you to super charge your intermittent fasting program.  In this new book Mimi shares a 6 week plan to get you ready for the beach, a wedding, class reunion or just to super charge your weight loss efforts. Intermittent fasting has been life changing for many. I am on a number of forums where members share their stories and the results are incredible. Many say it is the easiest method they have ever used to lose weight. I personally have lost weight, lowered my blood pressure and improved my blood work results with a combination of intermittent fasting and calorie counting.The book starts out by revisiting "the FastDiet" book by Dr. Michael Mosley and Mimi Spencer. It condenses "the FastDiet" to give a core view of the program and its benefits. In a nutshell to lose weight on the plan, women eat 500 calories per day and men 600 per day two days a week. On the days off eat normally. The Fast Beach Diet then proceeds to scale the basic program for accelerated fat and weight loss.To super charge weight loss, the book gives tips on what foods to eat, what to buy at the grocery store, how to get in the right mindset and more. You can pick and choose from this section on what you feel will be doable for your lifestyle. Though many of the tips have been shared before, I like the fresh way Mimi presents them. For example, most of us know to select as many natural foods as possible. Mimi shares this by saying, to look for food products that have as little packaging as possible. The less wrappers, boxes, cellophane etc. the fresher it probably is. I hadn't thought of it that way. So she gives new ways of looking at old tips.This section also includes how to tweak the fasting. Here she gives an overview of alternate day fasting, 24 hour fasts etc. Many people find that with intermittent fasting they can eat what they want on non fast days and lose weight. However, others (like me) have found that combining it with calorie counting can result in even greater success. And counting calories along with fasting is one technique Mimi shares can help you accelerate your results. The key take away from this section is little things add up. Choose what works for you and make the adjustments for long term, big results. And if you are aiming for super fast results try to really tighten up everything you are doing i.e. cut alcohol etc. for at least the 6 week duration.The latest research on exercise is covered in the book. Mimi shares a summary of Dr. Mosley's book "FastExercise: The Simple Secret of High-Intensity Training" which indicates that high intensity training (HIT) for just a few minutes can be far more effective than hours of steady state cardio. Sample plans for running, swimming and other activities are included. Just to note there are some awesome free apps that will walk you thru short HIT programs. I personally use a countdown timer app and combine it with a free interval walking program I found on the net.The book includes a list of snacks for fast days, a shopping list and easy grab and go menus. It also includes recipes including Oat Berry Smoothie, Italian Seafood Salad and more. I felt some of the recipes were pretty simplistic i.e. there is one for scrambled eggs and another for boiled eggs. It is not a book I would buy for the recipes but what was included was nice.The back of the book includes a step by step 6 week plan on what to eat on fast days if you are having breakfast and dinner or dinner only. This can be adjusted if you are having lunch. You can opt to follow the program menu or use your own menus. And since this is the FastBeach diet, Mimi even included tips on the type of swimwear to buy to look your best!And of course my very favorite section is the inspirational stories at the back of the book where those who have done the FastDiet and lost share their success. I love this section, I just wish photos were included.If you are debating between buying this book or "the FastDiet" book, I would suggest this one if you want a step by step plan and tons of tips and the original book if you are looking for the science behind it. If you already own "the FastDiet" this is a nice supplement with ideas to accelerate your progress.On a side note - I purchased the Kindle version and the formatting is very good. The back of the book includes charts you can fill in. These are available for free download on the author's website. In addition, there are free apps available to help you with your goals. There is a free Fast Beach Diet app you can download (information on the FastBeach website) And if you want to combine it with calorie counting there a number of free online sites and apps. I personally use MyFitnessPal to track.Overall, this is a great way to kick start the intermittent fasting plan or accelerate your efforts. My biggest tip for others would be to join Facebook groups and visit the author's Fast Diet site for tips, support and inspiration. There is nothing like seeing someone's before and after photos!

I am a big fan of Tide, however, I am spoiled by Tide Free.Tide Plus a Touch of Downy detergent has a scent. And it is not as gentle on clothing as a result sensitive skin may feel itchy from clothes washed in this product. Yes it does a good job washing clothes and cleaning them but I prefer not to smell like detergent or itch thank you. I greatly prefer the Tide Free variation.

CeraVe products were recommended to me by a dermatologist years ago. The companies products are known for being effective using ingredients that do not cause skin problems.The CeraVe Baby Lotion has a silky feel that goes on smooth. Unlike other popular baby lotions, it does not have a strong "baby" scent. According to the website the product contains vitamins and 3 essential ceramides that helps "protect a baby's delicate skin barrier".  CeraVe Baby Lotion is paraben and phthalate free.One of the things I love about CeraVe is the products are non-comedogenic and non-irritating.I compared the CeraVe Baby Lotion to a bottle of the regular CeraVe Lotion I had at home. Though the ingredients were slightly different they both glided on my skin and gave a softer result.Overall, this is a very nice product for moisturizing baby and adult skin.

Mmmmm the smell of Hills Bros Coffee as you open the package is delicious. A scent you enjoy because the pods are packaged in mesh Kcup style instead of plastic kcups. My guess is this is to save money and not use the patent Keurig has on the plastic style Kcup. Regardless of the reason, the aroma is enjoyable and I found the pods work just as well as the plastic kind.The taste is good. It is a medium quality roast with a mild flavor. Not the tastiest cup I have had but certainly a good cup of coffee.At the price point, I would probably jump up to a different premium brand at a buck or so more.

Whether the Smart Weigh GEM20 is right for you depends on what you are weighing. Yes it can weigh small coins and jewelry BUT the bowl is limited in what it can hold. It makes more sense to get a scale with a flat, larger platform if you are weighing gems etc. The bowl on the GEM20 is to small for large coins and larger jewelry pieces.If you are weighing powder supplements or very small items such as diamonds than it may suit your needs.I love the appearance of the scale. It is palm sized with a plastic cover. Two tiny weights fit on it for easy storage (one in the bowl and one on top of the scale). A pair of fine pointed tweezers and 2AAA batteries are included.I compared the weight of this scale to another jewelry scale I own and they were right in sync with one another.

I received a sample of this product to review along with the companies fruit acid peel and cleanser. The moisturizer is a nice finish to the peel process. The peel removes dry skin revitalizing it and the moisturizer is a nice soother to use right after. Alternatively you could use a Vitamin C serum or other product. Because the peel bares the skin it is receptive to treatments such as this moisturizer.I love the hyaluronic ingredient in this product. I feel it works well to soothe rough skin. Overall, a nice product at a decent price point.

I was given the cleanser, peel and moisturizer by this company to review and ooh la...I was delighted how soft and smooth my skin felt after the first treatment using the products.After washing my face with the cleanser and patting dry, I carefully applied the peel. I have tried other peels in the past and my skin felt nothing, but years ago I used a peel that wrecked havoc on my skin so I always use caution. I felt an initial tingling with this peel and I kept an eye on my skin for any changes. After the time was up (the company recommends 1-3 minutes depending on your skin) I rinsed it off. My skin had a slight pink glow and I applied the moisturizer.My skin felt baby soft and smooth - love it!  I would recommend this product if you want a softer feel fast!

I recently was provided with several products to review by this company and over all I really like them especially the fruit acid peel. This product was no exception. It cleanses nicely and gently. However, I marked it down for two reasons. I found it a bit thick to come out of the bottle. And I feel at 4 ounces at the current price of $18.00 it is pricey. There are other cleansers that claim to balance the PH of your skin that are much pricier, but there are also quality products like Eucerin and Cetaphil that are gentle on the skin and could be used to prepare the skin for a peel that give you more ounces for your dollars.Overall, this is a nice indulgence and works well with the fruit acid peel and moisturizer made by the same company but you could also use another quality cleanser instead as your prep for the peel and moisturizer.

It's always nice to have an edge when you are playing golf and the GolfBuddy GB-WT3 can do that. The GolfBuddy GB-WT3 is loaded with data to help you get a feel for a course so you can track distances, estimate shots, know where the hazards are and much more.The watch comes pre-loaded with 36,000 courses and you can track your game with the digital scorecard noting your strong and weak points.So yes this golf watch offers a lot of features. However, it is not super intuitive to use with a myriad of choices. It's complicated and will take some getting used to. It is also very large, this is good in that it makes it easy to read but it can feel bulky on the wrist when swinging. Overall I feel there are better choices out there especially at the price point.

I recently decided to try the Vitamin C Serum from Day By Day Beauty. It comes in a 1oz bottle which seems small but a little goes a long way. The bottle is tightly capped and a pump dispenser is included to switch too after opening. I liked this as it makes it more hygenic.The serum has a nice "slip" to it. It does not feel greasy at all. It absorbs quickly into the skin. After first use my skin felt softer.A few years ago I used a scrubbing tool on my neck. Though the tool was designed for the skin, it roughed up my skin and it has never been the same. I tried a variety of lotions and creams on it including alpha hydroxy acids but nothing worked. To my surprise this has smoothed the area down more than anything else. It is not gone but it is much better.I have not noticed a reduction in wrinkles, but I have only used it a short time, perhaps that will come in the future. I think this would be an excellent product to use after a skin procedure also when the skin can absorb it fully.It is also clear from the Q&A on this product that the owners care about what they are selling and servicing it. Really nice to see that.Overall, a super nice product at a good price point. I look forward to seeing more results as I use it longer.

I've recently had to do multiple TV wall mounts, and this one would have been great had it not been missing one detail.  Usually these mounts come with four side arms that stick out from the plate, so that you can connect a television regardless of where the TV's mounting holes are located.  In fact, the mounting plate on this one has holes that appear ready to connect such arms, but there were none in the box (and the box didn't have room for any).If your TV can use the center plate as-is, the parts are sturdy and the installation instructions make sense.  It comes with mounting hardware for a standard wall (you want to use a stud) or concrete (you get sinkers to help the wall bolts stay in).  It's just a shame it won't connect to a VESA TV like my Toshiba Regza 40" LCD (40XV648U).

I bought this specific bottle because I had one of these and my daughter liked it so much she ran off with mine.  She uses hers every day, lugging it with her to school to stay hydrated.  For me, I bought this because it fits perfectly in the bottle cage on my bike, but I also found myself taking it with me every day to the gym.It seems silly focusing on a water bottle, but this one is different in ways that I like:- the tapered bottom makes it fit in any cup holder- the slim profile fits perfectly in the cage on my bike- the black ring above the lid is perfect for grabbing, carrying, or (in my daughter's case) clipping it to a backpack- the sip straw doesn't easily pop out from where it folds down, and it does keep a good seal- the straw also has a tab sticking out at the base to make it easy to flip open with a fingertip- the "Super Durable Tritan Material" (plastic) appears pretty strong:  it's been dropped on concrete, at speed one time, and hasn't cracked or leakedIf you need a durable bottle that keeps a good seal and is easy to use, I think this is probably one of the better ones.

I've had a lot of SanDisk memory cards over the years and they do the job well.  This one is no exception:  I put it in my Nokia Lumia 1520 phone, which has a pretty high-resolution 20MP main camera.  This Class 10 Ultra works very well for speed and I use it a lot because it's where I've loaded music, pictures and video.I tend to pick SanDisk for my digital cameras too, so like the other products of theirs I've bought, this one doesn't disappoint.

The short summary:  I had the earlier iteration of Netgear's USB AC WiFi adapter and the frustrating sticking-point for me was that at the time they only made it in USB 2.0.  Both this model and the earlier one were good about connecting at high speeds and staying stable, but the USB 3.0 doesn't have the bottleneck of USB 2.0's slower bus.The full review:This is the high-speed USB wireless adapter we need:  it's USB 3.0, for starters.  The USB plug swivels to allow plugging into a laptop at an odd angle.  It comes with a USB cable and base to make it easier to put in a different position from the device you're plugging it into--a feature desktop users will probably appreciate because it means you don't have this thing sticking out from your PC.  As an added bonus, the top part of the adapter is a high gain antenna that you can swivel out to improve the signal if you need to.If you're in a place that uses WPS, the button to toggle a WPS connection is easy to see on the side.  Last, the unit has a light that flickers to show you connection status, just like an Ethernet cable would.The software that comes with the Netgear AC1200 is the Netgear Genie.  I didn't care for Netgear's Genie in the early days, but it's gotten a lot better:  not only is the installation very simple, but the Genie software lets you do all sorts of work with your network, from tracking who's connected and how to pulling down updates for your adapter or logging into your router to work with it (I think this last feature *might* require you to own a Netgear router).I used this device on both a Windows 8.1 Professional 64-bit laptop and a Windows 7 Professional desktop.  In both cases, I installed the software before connecting the device.  I have Netgear ac wireless equipment and I get good connection speeds from the adapter.If you want a high-gain WiFi adapter, this one is your best bet.  It offers a lot of small extras.

I bought two of these to help my father bridge an RCA audio connection off of his TV.  MediaBridge make good stuff and I've bought more than one of their products because I like the way they are built.  The added ferrite core in the middle wasn't necessary, but it is a nice extra touch to give you an assist with signal quality.These are a bit of overkill:  they come packaged in a box, not a baggie, mine were shipped in a bigger box to protect them,I like MediaBridge:  the plugs are well made and easy to use, so this cable did just fine for me.

This GearIt 10-pack of Ethernet cables was more than I needed but a great deal as a bundle.  The cables are Cat6 and they work fine for me and appear to be built well.  My only complaint--and I've seen other brands do this too--is the boot that sits atop the plastic release tab on the connector:  its ridiculously tough to push down on.  When unplugging a cable already means that you're probably trying to slip your fingers into a tight spot, it becomes impossible to release the connector without damaging something.  I've resorted to slipping a flathead screwdriver in and using that instead.Apart from that, these cables work just fine and the price and the fact that I can choose colors were a nice bonus.

The Tripp-Lite ULTRABLOK is a chunk--it sticks out from the wall by quite a bit.  The hardware inside is designed to protect your equipment, and although I have electrical storms where I live, I haven't taken a hard enough hit to tell you how well it works.  What I can tell you is that you have a light to indicate stable power, one for if there's a problem, and one to indicate the unit is protecting your equipment.  Thus far, it seems to work just fine.A minor detail that will work if you have the right kind of outlets is that the ULTRABLOK has a metal "L" bracket to secure it to the wall.  This can be important because if you plan on plugging and unplugging things from this a lot, it's going to be tedious--you'll have to hold the entire thing with one hand to keep it from coming right out of the wall.  The bracket slides into rails on the top and a single screw can be used to secure it to the wall.  I have large outlet plates and can't try this feature for myself.

I bought this Whole Room Air Circulator for my workplace--I sit near a window, I work out in the company gym, and there are going to be times I just need cool air to help me cope.  It works very well:  you can easily tilt the fan and it makes a clicking sound as you adjust it.  The switch is on the top back of the unit and has three speeds.  The shape of the switch makes it very easy to tell which position it is in when you reach for it.Most importantly though, this fan brings the airflow.  It's bigger than I'd expected, but I can't complain because the blades really push a decent amount of pressure, even at low speeds.  The higher speeds are a bit noisier than I'd like, but the lowest does the job without annoying my co-workers.I wouldn't call this a "Whole Room" fan as the name implies, but if you need a desk fan or other way to circulate air close to you, the Honeywell Whole Room Air Circulator delivers.  I don't care for the noise on the upper two speeds but the lowest speed strikes a good balance of sound and airflow.

This is far from the best mouse I've ever owned, but that's not the point of it.  The beauty of this mouse lies in its simplicity and its portability.  I bought this to tote with my Surface Pro 2 because my Orochi, lovely though it was, was too big of a wart in the tiny slipcase I carry the Surface Pro 2 in.  The Arc Touch Bluetooth mouse works just fine for general computing but you wouldn't find it comfortable for long periods of time, especially if you're gaming or doing fine-coordinated graphics work.The way the Arc Touch works is:  when it's flat, it's turned off.  Gently bend the body, and it clicks into the arc position you see in the picture and turns itself on--a very clever design.  Click it flat again, and it turns off until the next time you need it.  The top half where the buttons are is a bit thicker because that's where you have to install the two AAA batteries that power it.Because the Arc Touch is Bluetooth, there's no USB dongle to install--perfect for tablet users.  I had to add the device in the Control Panel like any other Bluetooth device, but once I did, it was ready to go and works fine for basic mousing.The "Touch" part of the name is more about the way the middle buttons work: instead of a scroll wheel, you just slide your finger up and down along the middle strip to scroll.  It makes a faint clicking sound which you can also feel under your fingertip.  I don't care for the clicking sensation of the scrolling but otherwise that feature works fine.If you need a compact, portable mouse for Windows, the Arc Touch does a very good job.  The design is clever and the functionality is very good.

I bought the Cosmos Black household patch board/AC adapter box because I'm doing up a new home office and I want to be neat about it.  I have a number of obnoxious little AC adapters with big heads on them--the kind you see for a charger or a USB hub or a cable TV box.I already have a large number of power strips of various sizes that I've accumulated over the years.  This box fit none of them.  It's too tiny.  It has a great idea in that there are slots on either end for cords to stick out, but the clunky adapters that are the reason you buy this won't really fit well.  I ended up having to stick some older multi-port AC cords in the box, carefully lay each power block in like Tetris-pieces, then force the lid to close.I have really nice hardwood floors.  This is hard plastic with no rubber feet.  I had to add some felt ones to keep from scratching things up.If this were bigger, or even came with a small power strip of some sort, and had even cheap feet on it, it would be a good idea.  But because of its size, it's really not been the help that I thought it would be.

I bought these for my daughter after her second pair of Polk Audio headphones also broke.  She's athletic and likes the behind-the-head style.  This pair was a great price and sounds really good.  The fit is as comfortable as behind-the-head headphones get and they stick tight when she's out and about.  If you're really big on sound quality...most of the 5 stars here have to do with price.  The sound quality isn't at all poor, it's just not golden-ear pindrop-perfect--you trade portability and durability and still get a pretty good-sounding set of headphones for this price.

I recently read "Rock Candy", Scott Robinson's trivia book on The Beatles.
