** I received this product for free in exchange for testing and review **I've had this camera for awhile now, and honestly after the first week of messing with it I became frustrated and set it in a corner until I had more time and patience to deal with it.I'm decently proficient at setting up electronic hardware, I've set up two other wifi cameras, and multitudes of other wireless systems including network hard drives and printers. I'm no expert, but I can usually wade through poorly written manuals and make things work. This one had me baffled and frustrated for a good while.My main issue is with the remote login setup, which requires a dizzying array of logins and passwords. The icons used are not easily understood, I still have a few that are a complete mystery.The company does provide installation and setup videos, but they really don't help that much. If you're wanting to view and control the camera via laptop or remote desktop, expect to spend quite awhile getting things going.On the plus side, the smartphone app is easy and super simple to set up and use. I like it much better than the paid Logitech Alert app I use to access their camera system.The picture quality is very good, I'm especially impressed with how well it works in low light.

** I received this product for free in exchange for testing and review **These are a decent inexpensive Bluetooth headset. Sound is okay, not great, but not horrible. Music sounds a bit flat but not muddy or with any annoying crackle like I've had with other Bluetooth sets.These pair quickly to my phone, and stay connected most of the time without any dropout issues. The only time I have issues is when the battery gets a little low which usually happens for me after about 3 straight hours of use.They are adequately comfortable and stay put even when I'm at my most active. The ear pieces do interfere with my glasses a bit, but all over-the-ear headphones have this issue so I won't mark them down on that account.

** I received this product for free in exchange for testing and review **It's always difficult to quantify sound quality, everyone seems to have a different idea as to what "perfect" is, so all I can say is that to me, these sound a bit muffled in the mid tones, the music doesn't sound as full or three-dimensional as it does with my Klipsch headphones. But considering the price difference, these are really quite good for the cost.The build quality is very nice, they fit my ears well and are comfortable for long use.

I'll admit to using cheap polarizers on my moderately priced lenses because I really hate spending more than necessary for something I consider more of a lens protector than an actual photo enhancer. Then I got a good deal on a B+W for my zoom lens and I learned the error of my ways. The difference in raw images is amazing, even on clear days with little haze, the B+W polarizer made things crisper and more vibrant. The best thing is that they only cause about a 1 stop loss, which is so much better than the cheap polarizers I had been using which would drop things down at least 3 stops.The other great thing about the Kaesemann polarizer is that it has the Multi-Resistant Coating, meaning it's more scratch resistant than glass, and is sealed against dust and moisture.I do a ton of motorsports photography, which means I'm working in dusty conditions and need to be able to shoot at the fastest speeds possible, this polarizer not only gives me speedier shots than a cheaper unit, it also creates a stronger barrier between my lens and the elements.

We have a Cat Mate Pet Fountain which has worked well to entice our older cats to drink more water. The pump gave out a few weeks ago and although I as able to get it running again I thought it would be a good idea to have a second fountain in case one of them quit while we were away for the weekend.The Cat Mate fountain sells for about the same price as this Oster, so I was interested to see which one I liked better (and if the cats had any preference).First, assembly is easy with either fountain. The general designs are the same with a tiny submersible recirculating pump, a charcoal filter, and a well the cats drink from. Aside from these similarities, there are some differences:1. "Waterfall" feature. The Cat Mate has a 3" tall channel that the water flows down, the Oster has a small bubbler that the water flows up out of (like a drinking fountain) which can be increased or decreased in volume - higher volumes cause some splashing. Our cats seem to like both styles equally well.2. Water reservoir. The Cat Mate doesn't have any additional reservoir, you fill it and will need to add water every few days. The Oster has a reservoir which adds water whenever the level in the bowl gets below a certain point. I really like the reservoir idea and think it's a better setup.3. Pump. The Cat Mate pump is slightly larger and can be set at various volume settings. The Oster has a volume setting on the external dial. Both are relatively quiet, you will be able to hear their slight hum in a completely quiet room, but they are normally not noticeable.4. Filters. The Cat Mate filter is a single unit that is about twice the size of the Oster. Replacements for the Cat Mate are available online for about $2.50 each and they last about a month. The Oster filters are two part, a cell-type foam in front, then a charcoal pad in back. I haven't found a source for replacements, which is a concern.5. Cleaning. All of these fountains get slimy after about a week of running, so easy cleaning is important. I've found scrubbing with a mix of baking soda and dish soap works well. The Cat Mate can be completely disassembled for easy cleaning (but requires a small bottle brush), the pump also has a small cover that is removable. The Oster fountain also comes apart and is easier to clean but the reservoir needs an angled large bottle brush to clean fully.6. Cat happiness. Our two cats are equally happy drinking from either fountain, but do prefer the running fountain to a still bowl of water.I think both fountains are about equally matched in ease of use and cleaning, I can't speak for the Oster's longevity yet, but our Cat Mate has been going strong for a year now. If the price is the same, I'd choose the Cat Mate because the filters are available and I know it has good longevity. If the Oster filters come online and the price is cheaper than the Cat Mate versions, that would tip the scales towards Oster.

This is the second Mk550 keyboard and mouse I've owned, the other set lasted many years through thousands of pages of typing but I finally had to replace them when the keyboard started having trouble connecting to the computer.This new version is even better, the keyboard touch feels smooth, is very quiet, and response is super fast. The mouse is also quick and precise. You can't beat them for the price.

**I received this product in exchange for testing and review**I've used this hair mask twice now and I'm really impressed with how soft, sleek and shiny it leaves my hair. I have a weird combination of fine, straight blonde hair and coarse, kinky gray hair so it's tough to get the gray to settle down without making the blonde look flat and greasy, but this product actually makes it all work together and look and feel great.It's quick and easy to use, it smells wonderful, and the results are fantastic for me. Definitely recommended!

**I received this product in exchange for my testing and review**I lose and break sunglasses all the time, so I really hate spending a lot on a pair, but I also hate having really cheap sunglasses that cause distortion and don't offer decent protection.I have been very impressed with the comfort and fit of these glasses, and the high quality case they come in makes them seem even nicer. Honestly, the case is like something I'd get with expensive sunglasses, I was very surprised at how nice it is.These glasses are lightweight and have a cheap feeling hinge, but they do the job and are comfortable to wear for extended periods.

** Received product in exchange for testing and review **These are nice basic headphones that tuck comfortably into my ears without any weird flanges that can cause irritation. They are lightweight and don't cause ear fatigue like some heavier headphones do. I like this style of completely in-ear headphone when I'm wearing knit caps in the winter and also when I'm listening to audiobooks as I fall asleep.The sound is decent for the price, not too heavy on bass with no high hiss, spoken word is crisp and clear, music sounds slightly flat but not awful. Phone calls are okay, the person on the receiving end says my voice sounds somewhat muffled but not awful.Volume is not very loud, even at full throttle, these are probably a good 20% quieter than my regular headphones. They do offer some exterior noise cancellation due to the in-ear design, but it's still easy to hear what is going on around you with both headphones in, so the reduction is probably around 10 dB.

I've been dealing with dry skin on my elbows and legs for a few months now, I've tried a few different lotions but they all make me feel itchy after awhile and I hate their heavy feeling when it's hot outside so I switched to pure coconut oil. Unfortunately it leaves an oily residue on my body which gets on clothes so I can only do that at night before bed and although it seems to be helping my legs my elbows are still dry and flaky.I was happy to try this Eucerin lotion because I usually don't have an allergic reaction to their products, and it seemed like the in-shower version might work even better.After using this for 3 days my elbows are noticeably softer and feel so much better, the itch is gone! My legs and arms feel better too, and I can put on clothes right afterward without worrying about staining.The only downside is that I feel like it's sort of wasteful to apply the lotion then basically rinse most of it off, but it somehow still does the job so there's really nothing to complain about. It's a great product, I just wish the cost was a little lower.

I have fair skin that is sometimes hard to match with single-color cosmetics, I'm in my 50's (with wrinkles and age spots), and I still have an oily t-zone so I was hoping these would do a nice job of color matching my tone and take care of oiliness while helping to cover my blemishes. Unfortunately, the regular powder seemed to make my pores more noticeable and the powder seemed to sink into my wrinkles as the day wore on and make them look more prominent, especially my laugh lines.I was able to get a very nice match using 3 of the 4 different colors of the translucent powder Shade 10, but it requires some fussy blending with a smaller brush - a regular large powder brush just grabs all 4 colors at once, and applying powder with a smaller blush brush isn't usually as effective. If these were in separate interior containers I could remove the one that I don't use and more effectively grab just the colors I need to mix the right blend, but realistically the only thing that works is a sweep of all 4.That brings me to the next issue - the packaging is very flimsy, these honestly feel more like samples than something I would purchase at a store. I'm not expecting gold-plated metal or anything, but I think I'd be willing to pay a little more if they put each color in its own removable inner cup with a sturdier outer shell.The blush #20 works really well for me, I loved the color options, and was able to create a light and soft look for day, and a brighter tone for a more formal look. The bronzer #30 is too dark for me, but would work on anyone with normal to darker skin tones.Overall I feel Neutrogena has a good basic idea here, there's just some minor tweaks they could do to make this a really great product. 1: Powder needs to be reformulated to not settle in wrinkles. 2: Smaller trays for each color inside large tray so it's easier to use one you decide what blend works best for you.

I can imagine the author touring Miramont castle and developing this story as she toured the place, it's the kind of location with a backstory that makes you wonder about what really happened there, and what people's lives were like.This story flowed well and kept me interested until the end, it wasn't a happy story and definitely not something I'd want to read if I were dealing with anything negative in my own life at the time, but it was perfect for a wintery fall day.
These seem diluted, the scent isn't very strong and it doesn't last long at all. I guess it's a case of getting what I paid for, I shouldn't expect $60 oils with a $20 price tag.

We have a wifi camera that keeps an eye on our cats when we're away from home, because of this I like to leave a light on so we can check on them after dark. I've been using a simple dial timer but thought it would be nice to have a bit more control over when it turned off and on. Also, something that's a bit more random will make the place appear more lived-in.I was surprised to see a relatively fat instruction booklet with this device, but quickly realized the size was due to lots of languages and instructions for multiple setup applications. Once I got to the pertinent page for my setup (Manual setup with Android device) it's 5 short pages with illustrations. The entire setup took less than 5 minutes and it works perfectly.  I'm going to purchase another one of these and install it out in our shop where our wifi signal is weak - it's great to have a booster that also doubles as a power control switch.

**I received this product for free in exchange for testing and review**These are nicely made sleeves that effectively manage quite a few cables within a single sleeve, so 5 sleeves can corral quite a few cables. They are easy to use and quick to open and close.Unfortunately, the use of a zipper rather than Velcro fastening means that they can only be used on cables 19" or longer, this limits their effectiveness in many applications, especially for cables going to your monitor, speakers, and other tabletop peripherals that need to exit the sleeve at various points. The other negative is their weight, neoprene is relatively heavy, so the use of one of these sleeves can drag lighter weight items off of tables.Of final note is that these do have a strong neoprene odor when the package is first opened, this scent has dissipated and is no longer noticeable after a week's worth of use.

**Received this item for free in exchange for testing and review**I have a set of relatively expensive space saver bags that have never really lived up to the manufacturers claims, so I was very skeptical that these inexpensive bags would be able to do any better. After they arrived I had even less trust in them because they felt so lightweight. I figured the best way to test them would be to put two puffy down jackets in one bag, and a fluffy pillow in another and see how long they held a seal.While squeezing the air out of the bag with the jackets in it, the plastic slider flew off the end of the bag. Had it already broken? No the slider is actually designed to come off, so take it off after zipping the bag mostly shut, then squeeze out the air, use your finger to close the bag completely then put the slider back on and zip the bag again to be sure it's fully sealed.I actually started a stopwatch thinking the coats and pillow would start swelling back up in a few minutes or hours, but at bedtime the things were still flat as a pancake. 3 days later they're still flat and not leaking air. I'm VERY impressed.

**I received this item for free in exchange for testing and review**I wasn't really expecting much from this money belt, it's quite a bit cheaper than the others I looked at, but all I really need is something small and basic that will fit my passport and a few extra things. I was pleasantly surprised when this arrived, it's well made, has nicely laid out compartments, the belt is stretchy and easy to put on and take off, and it stays in place. It's relatively comfortable under my clothes even when I'm sitting down. The zippers work smoothly and are easy to access even when I'm wearing the belt.I think all these belts work best on a taller person (I'm short and round), but this one is much more comfortable that my old money belt that had squared-off corners that would poke into my sides when I leaned over or sat in certain positions.The only thing I would change about the belt is the color, the gray shows through lighter colored shirts, I think a light tan would not be as visible.The credit card sleeves are a cute added feature, and it's nice to have a place to stow my credit card without worrying about RFID skimmers, but I don't think they add huge value to the money belt.

Initially I was surprised at how large this 1X shirt was, the fit was more like a generous 2x, but I have had other gauze shirts in the past that "sized down" after washing according to directions so I took a chance and washed it and now it fits exactly as expected. This is still an oversize design, but hangs nicely and isn't at all clingy. The fabric has nice weight and swing to it, the only issue is that it isn't completely opaque and so I think it looks better with a tank top underneath.It's a great option for travel, they pack well and can be hand washed and hung dry overnight without needing ironing.

My typical weekend around-the-house bra is the Just My Size Pure Comfort Seamless Wirefree Bra, Style 1263. They offer adequate support, and are as comfortable as an old pair of sweats. They usually cost around ten bucks apiece at our local big-box store, so I was hoping to save a little money with these Vogue of Eden 3-pack bras. Unfortunately, the Vogue of Eden bras just don't have the heavy-duty elasticity that I need, although they feel fine when I first put one on, they stretch out and don't really offer any support after a few minutes. I think they'd probably be fine for smaller gals up to a C cup, but they're just not sturdy enough for larger breasted women.They also are sized smaller in the cup area than I expected, however that could be due to the weird sizing on this item, as the size chart doesn't equate at all to the actual bra sizing (chart shows what inch measurements equate to in cup size, but bras are sold in s,m,l,xl,etc. with no information on what cup size equates to in their s,m,l sizing).** I received this product for free in exchange for testing and review **

** I received this item for free in exchange for testing and review **I loan out USB drives to clients all the time, and it's hard to make sure I get them back, so I usually look for units that are easily identifiable and have some way to attach a fob so I can clip an ID tag to them. Even with these precautions, some of the drives disappear. I thought this Captain America drive might just be obnoxious (and fun) enough that my clients wouldn't lose it.First, I was surprised with the heft, the front case is metal and about 1.25" in diameter, it weighs in at just under an ounce on my postal scale.The looks are basically what you'd expect from a novelty product, with the slide action of the USB plug a little cheap feeling and the key ring quite flimsy (the reasons I'm knocking it down a star). Outer packaging was for Iron Man 3 rather than the Avengers/Captain America, but that doesn't really detract from the product.I wasn't expecting much when I plugged this in for some speed testing. It did require formatting before it was recognized on my desktop running Win8. For the test I grabbed a file full of 1.22GB worth of RAW images and sent them to this drive. Transfer took 4:02:84 minutes. Next I grabbed my go-to inexpensive 16GB USB drive (the Kingston DTSE9 Kingston Digital DataTraveler SE9 32GB USB 2.0 Flash Drive (DTSE9H/32GBZET)) and dragged the same 1.22GB file to be transferred. A sluggish 5:50:76 minutes later, the transfer was finally complete.Color me gobsmacked, this funny little novelty Captain America drive IS faster than my stylish brand-name Kingston.Now, hopefully my clients will laugh at the looks and remember where the heck they put the thing when I ask for it back!

** I received this item for free in exchange for product testing and review **What a nice quality cord! I never really expect much from these inexpensive imports, but my expectations were most definitely exceeded with this very well made and near-perfectly designed charging cord.The cord itself is flat with a rubberized exterior that is flexible without feeling flimsy. The connectors are reinforced and the plugs also have a rubberized feel to them, making it easy to grasp and unplug. The two-headed Micro A/B design is brilliant and so simple to use. My only minor complaint is that the end caps provided aren't attached in some way and are easy to lose, then again, my other cords don't have end caps so it's not really an issue.The color is more red than the salmon tone you see in the picture, actually the red and gray together along with the sleek styling remind me of something Ferrari would use as a promo item.

** I received this item for free in exchange for product testing and review **These are so neat! I initially thought of a few things I would be able to use them with, but now that I have them I'm using them for everything from clipping coupons together in my purse to color coding client files that need my attention (red for today, yellow for this week). Of course they're perfect for their intended use as a craft item, it's great to be able to trace outlines without having to tape things to my workspace, and they hold watercolor paper so much better than glue or tape.These are well made and have nice snappy clip action. Each gripping surface has a few nubs in the plastic to help it grip uneven surfaces. The jaws will work effectively on items up to 5/8" thick, yet still hold strong on just one or two pieces of paper or thin fabric. The tiny size means that it requires a bit more strength to open them than the alligator-style clip with the longer folding arms, but anyone with average hand strength and dexterity will have no issues using these.The jar container is clear and fits inside my desk for easy access. I really can't think of anything I dislike about these, other than the fact that my husband just stole a handful to use out in the shop and now I'll probably end up having to buy more.

** I received this item for free in exchange for product testing and review **I do quite a bit of eBay shipping and use the Costco 10-gallon wastebasket liners when shipping large items. I am always looking for a way to save a few pennies on everything we sells so I was happy to test a bag that I could get through Amazon for the same or less than the big-box store version - especially since it would save me a trip across town to the store to buy them.These bags are a bit higher quality than my regular ones, they average about 3" longer and are the same diameter. Puncture resistance is slightly better, stretch resistance is the same. The colors make them look more like something that was designed as packing material rather than the clear Costco bags that look like garbage bags.The only downside is that these don't come in a box that doubles as a dispenser, and they tear apart at perforations which is a two-handed operation (the Costco bags are separated and don't require tearing apart).

Our local stores stopped carrying Lip Therapy so I was thrilled when I found it on Amazon, and CHEAPER than our local big-box store. After all these years, this is still my favorite everyday lip balm. No extra scent or tint, just basic petroleum jelly in a travel-ready tube.

You know those "World's Finest Chocolate" bars that you buy from kids who are doing some sort of school fundraiser? These are basically the same quality, good chunky milk chocolate with nice big almonds throughout. It's not "fine" chocolate by today's standards, but it's better than the regular waxy Hershey's bar. Unfortunately, the price is a little steep for what you get. At $5 a bar you're in the price range of high quality imported 80% cacao bars. I'm willing to pay $5 a bar to the neighbor kid who is trying to raise baseball uniform money, but not directly to Hershey's for a bar that is just a bit better than their regular "king size" bar that sells for less than $1.50 at the local convenience store.

This foot cream does nice things to my cracked and calloused feet, so why am I giving it only 3 stars? Two reasons, first, the scent is somewhat off-putting, a bit sulfuric with some menthol undertones and an old-fashioned rose scent covering it all. Second reason is the main problem, I was very surprised that there was no ingredient list on the container, since I have issues with lanolin I need to be sure it's not in the lotions I use. I did find the list on their website and was happy to see this contained no lanolin, but it does contain Triclosan which the FDA is currently re-evaluating.I'm not some granola crunching earthy gal who doesn't believe in the wonders of our modern chemical age, but I do think there are some chemicals that are being over-used for no real purpose, Triclosan is one of them. It is used to prevent bacterial contamination and as an anti-bacterial agent in certain goods, but its being reviewed by the FDA because of emerging safety issues of bacterial resistance and endocrine disruption.Aside from that, I've found that AHAVA's Tea Tree Oil Foot Cream does a better job of softening and smoothing my skin, and doesn't contain Triclosan.

Initially I liked this shirt, it hung nicely and the color was good. I washed it exactly following instructions: Machine wash cold on delicate setting and drip dry, and the shirt shrunk about 2 sizes.Thank goodness for Amazon's great return policy, still, I really wish the shirt hadn't shrunk, I really liked the style and fit.

The fit and quality of this shirt are very nice, unfortunately I just didn't like the style once I tried it on. The buttons down the back made it uncomfortable when sitting in a hard backed chair, something I hadn't thought of until I actually put it on.

So far these have been longer lasting than the Wasabi Power batteries I have, and I usually am very pleased with Wasabi so I was leery of switching to Vivitar, but the reviews were right, these are really good batteries at a great price!

This is our third Beltronics detector, we owned two V955 units previously and loved how well they worked. They've saved us quite a few times.I really love the upgrades they've made to the Pro200 compared to the 955, first off, the all-black is much nicer than the black and silver of the 955. The aluminum center strip on the 955 would reflect off the windshield and could be distracting at times. Second, the sounds and speaker on the Pro200 are easier to hear over the stereo, but aren't annoying in a quiet car.Detection is better with the Pro200, especially for Laser. It's false-positives are also reduced, even when set on Highway mode.I think the best upgrade with this new unit though is the charging cord which includes a light showing the unit is on, and also has a mute button. These both are so smart and necessary, especially since the readout is sometimes hard to see in broad daylight. And having the mute button so close at hand rather having to reach way up to the front of the windshield to quiet things when you're driving past the local grocery store is just brilliant.I think Beltronics makes the best for the best price on the market today, do your research and read online reviews and you'll see what the experts think of this unit. I'm very pleased with the performance for the price, definitely recommended!

***I received this product for free in exchange for my unbiased review***We spend a lot of time outdoors in the heat of summer, so I have a few different cooling towels and neck coolers, unfortunately all of them are a bit of a hassle when we're traveling because if I'm not wearing them they're difficult to store (the neck coolers can get moldy, the Frogg Toggs get stiff and hard to pack). This cooling towel is basically a microfiber polyester mesh that dries quickly and cools you as the water evaporates. Like all evaporative cooling devices, it will work better in less humid conditions.The great thing about these is that they do dry quickly, so once you're done using it, you can hand wash it to remove the sweat, then hang it up and it'll be dry in less than an hour. It stays soft and packs small so it's great for hiking or camping.These also are machine washable and dryer friendly, so they're super easy to keep clean.The only downside is that it does dry out relatively quickly during use, so unless your activity is less than 2 hours long, you'll need a water supply handy to re-wet the towel. This isn't a big deal for me since I carry water with us, but could be an issue if you're recreating somewhere without easy access to a water supply.

My feet are really in bad shape after a summer of barefoot action. I put lotion on them every night, but it doesn't seem to make much of a difference. I got this AHAVA foot cream yesterday, applied it last night, and wow! Woke up this morning to softer and more comfortable skin. Amazingly results that lasted even after I had showered.I love the scent, very subtle. This is a very heavy cream and definitely sits on top of the skin longer than a regular lotion. I don't like the feel of it for daytime use, but it's perfect at night.I'm looking forward to seeing what this can do after a few week's use, and will update my review at that point, but for now this lotion is my new best friend.

Great board shorts for us bigger gals, love the length and the fit is comfortable with just slight elastic in the back. These are much better than the Land's End version that has elastic all the way around which creates a really puffy look.

I love the light weight and comfort of this pack. It sits well even when fully loaded, and the various pockets are easy to access. My only complaint is that there's no dedicated compartment for my Camelbak is awkward and the hose access is in the wrong place. Other than that minor issue, this is an amazingly well made pack that easily switches from the office to the hiking trail and doesn't look out of place anywhere. It's subdued color and design aren't eye catching, but that is part of the beauty of the thing since it blends well with whatever you're wearing and wherever you are.

I have a heck of a time finding good hiking shorts, it doesn't help that I'm a chunky size 16, so most of the usual brands that REI and other outfitters carry don't come in my size. I was excited to see these Dickies capris, since their basic Relaxed Cargo pant is my favorite for cool weather hiking.First, I'll say I'm totally impressed with the quality of these, the knees are reinforced, the stitching is all heavy-duty, and the pockets are generous and easy to access. They are everything I want in a rugged short and nothing I don't. Well, except for their slightly-too-slim fit. Other Dickies pants in a size 16 fit me perfectly, they stay put around my waist, but give me room to move everywhere else, these are not horribly tight, but they don't have that comfortable lived-in feeling of my other Dickies pants. They feel like I need to lose about 5 lbs. Which, to be honest, I probably do. Still, if you're looking for a relaxed fit and comfort, I'd consider ordering these in a size larger than normal.

** I received this item in exchange for my honest review **When I get a migraine any light at all is uncomfortable so a good sleep mask is really important to me. I've used a Lewis N. Clark comfort sleep mask for years, and have been relatively happy with it, except it has a hard plastic clip on the side that can be uncomfortable if I lay on it wrong.This new mask looked like the perfect solution, lighter and with no hard plastic parts, unfortunately even when it's perfectly positioned it lets light in around my nose. It also is easily dislodged when I turn on my side. The Lewis N. Clark version stays in place and blocks all light no matter what my sleep position, so I'm going to have to stick with it.I think this would probably work just fine for back sleepers who aren't needing absolute 100% light blocking capabilities, and would be perfect for ladies who want to take a nap but want to avoid smudging their makeup.The included ear plugs are good quality and come in a nice little plastic carrying container.

I use a ton of regular Big Tab dividers in our work binders which house order catalogs and product info sheets. I also usually have a few pocket pages in the same binders for small instruction booklets and other things that don't fit a typical 3 hole punch setup. Having both of these things together in a stronger divider is a great idea. These are well made and sturdier than the regular Big Tabs, the pockets are brightly colored but still allow you to see what's inside. The frosted plastic is easier to work with than the clear shiny stuff, and they don't seem to develop static cling like some of the shiny plastic dividers I've used in the past.I will definitely be buying more of these!

** I received this item for free in exchanged for an unbiased review **Although this is cushion cover is somewhat different than I expected, it's fun and fits well with the decor in the room I'm using it in. Described as "Durable cotton blend linen Pillowcases" this is exactly like unbleached coated canvas, although it does smell somewhat like linen, it looks and feels like midweight cotton canvas.The print is well done and the colors work well with the oatmeal shades of the fabric, stitching, especially in the hidden zipper area, is exceptionally nice.I washed it and it did require ironing but came out looking the same as when it went in, which was a concern since there's no washing instructions other than "Safe to machine wash". Sizing is just right for an 18" square throw pillow.I've attached some photos to show the nice hidden zipper and also show color a little better (white paper included to show color correction).

** Review of a free item **I have a relatively expensive travel umbrella I bought years ago that has been rolling around in the trunk of my car forever, it's a little worse for wear and is getting difficult to close. I don't need an umbrella often, but when I do it needs to work well so I was happy to get a new umbrella to replace the old one. I wasn't expecting much from this inexpensive unit, but figured it was worth testing out, and I'm glad I did.This looks and feels like a quality item, the action is smooth and works properly every time. Since we're in the middle of summer here in the desert, I had to get creative and use the hose to test its waterproofing, the umbrella performed exactly as expected, with water easily beading up and rolling off the outer surface, a quick shake and the fabric is mostly dry before folding back up. I also took it out and opened it up during a very windy afternoon and it held up with no problems. I had no problems opening and closing it while out in the breeze, although I did make sure to have it facing into the wind.My only question at this point will be longevity, or any issues caused by the more complex self-closure design, but the umbrella seems very well built and I don't anticipate any issues.

** I received this product in exchange for providing an unbiased review.**It appears I may have received a defective set of these earbuds, as there are quite a few glowing reviews for these things but mine were junk. Sound quality was awful when used with my iPhone, another smartphone, or plugged into a computer. Wiggling the connection made a bit of a difference, changing the sound from some weird pop and squeal to very faint musical tones if you wiggled just right.I have owned many sets of cheap headphones over the years, and most in the $20 range usually have decent sound and last for 6 months to a year of hard use, I'd recommend paying a little more and grabbing something from Phillips or any of the dozens of other name brands in that price range.

I really like these Five Star notebooks, I've got a couple of them, plus a few of their three-ring binders. The only problem I have with their design is that the covers aren't rigid. With their 3-ring styles it's easy to just add a piece of cardboard to the back to give it some structure, but that's not possible with the spiral bound designs like this one.These are perfect if you work at a desk, but if you're using binders out in the field these aren't as easy to deal with as the Mead ones with their heavy cardboard back cover.

These aren't bad tasting, but for the amount of sugar and calories here I would want something that had more substance and rich flavor.Usually I like to take snacks like this hiking, but these just didn't hit the spot. Although they don't melt, they're still somewhat messy to eat because of the peanut butter glaze. The deal killer for me is that they're so dry that they make me thirsty every time I eat a few, which isn't really what I'm looking for when we're hiking on a hot day and I'm more likely to go for snacks that make me feel quenched rather than parched.I think these could work much better if they'd do a gooey peanut butter center, but in their current form I won't be getting them again.

* I received this item for free in exchange for my unbiased review *These are very nice shears, actually excellent for the price, but they're not quite as good as my mom's old sewing scissors.The pair I received had a small burr in the middle of both blades, once that was carefully removed with the use of a deburring blade and emery cloth, I was very impressed with the sharpness and smoothness of their cut. Action is good, with a very slight catch in some spots rather than the smooth resistance you feel with really high quality scissors - way better than most in this price range though!I love the heft and solidity of these old-fashioned type scissors when I'm cutting heavier material. They keep my cuts straighter and just seem like they do a better job than my modern lightweight units.I used these to cut out some canvas for a project I'm working on and they performed perfectly. My only question is how long these will hold their edge. I noted the steel is relatively soft when I was deburring and sanding with the emery cloth, so that may mean they need more frequent sharpening, which isn't really much of a hassle.

I really like this TV, especially for the price.  Comparing it to other TVs in this price range (at the time of my review and in recent months), it is usually priced very competitively.  It has a pretty good picture and a lot of great smart TV features.My TV suffers from some dark corners.  I am probably the only one who will ever notice it, but when the image is bright and all one color, you can notice that the corners are darker than the rest of the image.  It's not a deal-breaker.  I didn't return the TV to try another one.  For the price I paid, I just accepted it as a trade-off.The smart TV apps work really well for me.  I have a fast internet connection and my apps like Amazon Instant Video will take 10 seconds or so to open, and a movie will start within seconds.  There are a great variety of apps, like Amazon Instant Video, Netflix, Pandora, YouTube, Spotify, and Hulu Plus (among others).  You can also browse DLNA devices on your network like your computers for pictures, music, and video.I'm pretty happy with this TV, mostly because of the great deal I got on it, but know there is a chance that you may also have some slightly dark corners on your TV.

I really like this USB hub.  It looks nice and it is super fast.  It comes with a separate power supply for ensuring you have enough power to power everything properly.  I didn't have any issues when plugging in multiple devices, including external hard drives.  All devices were seen on my computer and accessible.A sample was provided for testing and evaluation.

I am blown away by this remote.  It is amazing, especially how well it integrates with my Hue lights and my SmartThings home automation hub.SETUPYou can set the remote up using a PC/Mac program or an app on your Android or iOS device.  I found both methods to be just as easy, but the app did crash a couple of times so in the end I finished my work in the PC program and synced my changes from there.Setup is easy.  Things are laid out nicely and it is easy to understand how things work, even for someone who has never owned a Harmony before like myself.I have an LG TV, a Denon A/V receiver, a Dish Network Hopper DVR, Philips Hue lights with the V2 bridge, and a SmartThings V2 home automation hub.  I also have an Amazon Fire TV stick but I haven't set that up yet.HARDWAREThe remote feels great in your hand.  The screen is a good size and thankfully there are plenty of physical buttons for the most important features, like menu navigation, volume control, channel up/down, DVR, Guide, menu, back, mute, etc.  However, channel numbers can only be accessed on the touchscreen (or you can use your channel favorites on the touchscreen).You can also use gestures on the touchscreen, like swiping up and down to change the volume, or left and right to rewind and fast forward your DVR.The screen turns on when you pick up or move the remote, and automatically shuts off after a few seconds of inactivity.There is a main hub and two IR blasters (included) that plug into the back of it.  You can position the two blasters in front of devices that need to be controlled, which can include devices behind cabinets.The remote has a dock that it stands up in and recharges in.PHILIPS HUE (tested with a Hue version 2 bridge)I almost wanted to cry when I saw how well Hue is integrated into the Harmony.  You can control your Philips Hue lights with the remote directly using the dedicated lighting buttons on the bottom of the remote, or you can change lights and scenes using the touchscreen.  It downloads your scenes from your Hue bridge and even shows the scene pictures and names on the touchscreen so you know what each scene is.  It is amazing how quickly the lights respond to the remote... it's just about instantaneous.You can also integrate your lights into your activities, like if you have an activity called "Watch a movie" you can set up how your lights should respond when the activity is launched (turning on your TV, switching to your Blu-Ray input, and dim the lights or change the colors, etc).You can control each light individually, and adjust the brightness by swiping left and right.  Or you can group lights into rooms like you can with most Hue apps.The Hue integration is definitely not an afterthought here... it is really well designed and works great.SMARTTHINGS (tested with a V2 hub)The Harmony can control your SmartThings switches just as well as the Hue lights.  It picks up the names of the switches you have in SmartThings so you can do things like start the popcorn maker when the "Watch a movie" activity is started.  Each switch in SmartThings can either be assigned to be a light or an appliance in Harmony (they can behave differently).You can also view the status of all of your SmartThings sensors, so you can see which windows and doors are open and closed, and which motion detectors are detecting motion.SUMMARYThe remote is much cooler than I thought it was going to be.  It integrates with everything so well, and all of my devices respond very quickly to the remote.  The price is a bit intimidating, but after using this remote for a bit I can tell you that it is a great value if you have devices other than just A/V devices that you want to control (like lights and home automation products).  A+ all the way.

I love these remotes so much.  They work great with SmartThings V1 and V2 hubs and I use them primarily to turn my Philips Hue light bulbs on and off.  But they are convenient for so many other things since they can control just about anything on your Z-Wave network.  They are priced great, especially when you can get them under $20.  I wish they would just stick with these instead of the V2 remotes that don't have numeric buttons and cost twice as much.  Thanks, Aeon Labs for such a great product and at such a great price.

I am using this speaker to replace the center speaker on my Energy 5.1 Take Classic Home Theater System set, paired with a Sony STRDN860 7.2 Channel Hi-Res WiFi Network AV Receiver (Black).  The sound is substantially better.  I've tried music and movies that I have heard a number of times so I would be able to tell the difference right away.  And I definitely could tell there was a big difference.  Things just sound clearer and more powerful.This speaker is much larger than I expected it would be at 8.8 x 18.8 x 7.9 inches.  I didn't measure it out ahead of time, but it fit into my setup fine.  The cabinet feels solid and well-made.  The grill on the front is removable.I'll be enjoying my music and movies a lot more going forward, and will consider the ELAC brand when it comes time to upgrade the rest of my speakers.

The perfect paper for my Polaroid Snap Instant Digital Camera (White) with ZINK Zero Ink Printing Technology.  Photos look great and you have the bonus of being able to remove the backing to expose a sticky back.  Good stuff.A sample was provided for testing and evaluation​.

This little camera is quite fun, especially for kids.  My 5-year old niece was enthralled with this camera.  But it's not just for kids.  There's a 10-megapixel camera and SD card slot in there so you can take great photos even without printing them.There were no instructions included, just a few diagrams.  No paper was included either, so make sure you pick up something like this: Polaroid 2x3 inch Premium ZINK Photo Paper TWIN PACK (20 Sheets).Unfortunately for this camera, there is no setting for turning the printing on or off.  If there is paper loaded, it will automatically print the photos you take.  You can take the paper out and then it will save to the SD card but a switch to turn the auto-print on or off would have been ideal.There are three photo modes:  full color, black and white, and a vintage sepia mode.  You can also turn on the traditional white border like the old Polaroid photos used to have.The printed, smudge-proof photos look okay for their size.  They only take a few seconds to print and you can keep taking more photos while a photo is still printing.At a price under $100, this is a fantastic little 10MP instant camera.  The only reason I gave it four stars and not five was because I wish there was a switch for turning the automatic printing on and off instead of having to remove the paper to prevent it from printing.A sample was provided for testing and evaluation.

While I am still mastering the art of breadmaking, this product and the accompanying manual is helping me learn a lot.This machine has 19 different programs:  Basic bread, French bread, Quick bread, Sweet bread, Whole-Wheat bread, Rice bread, Gluten-free bread, Dessert, Mix, Dough, Knead, Cake, Jam, Yogurt, Bake, Sticky Rice, Rice Wine, Defrost, and Stir Fry.I've tried French Bread twice now and the first time did not turn out well.  I think my water was too warm and it killed the yeast.  I didn't realize how exact everything has to be, including the water temperatures.  I paid more attention to the details and the second time turned out great.The machine itself is easy to use and clean.  The updated manual (which was sent to me in PDF format) provides recipies for many of the above programs, as well as tips, tricks, and troubleshooting steps.This is a quality machine and I'm happy to have had the opportunity to test and evaluate it in exchange for a review.

I grabbed one of these discounted under $25 from Amazon Warehouse Deals because it had a slight defect.  Even if it were in perfect condition, I think the max price should be $20.  As cute as it is, it is quite small.  If you are okay with the price and the small size, go for it!  It looks great in person.

This camera is excellent quality.  First, both the still images and the video are high resolution and very clear.  Night viewing works well too.  Images are pretty clear, albeit black and white of course.  Images can have a timestamp as well as the temperature on them.The build is all plastic, but it is well protected from the elements, with rubber seals on everything that opens and closes.  It has a built-in LCD screen and a remote control for configuration and testing.  It is powered by "4 or 8 AA batteries", with the manual warning that 4 will provide less power.  I assume that means less detection range, lesser quality images, less time it can run on standby.The camera requires a micro-SD card (preferably Class 10 so it can write 1080p video without studdering).  The manual also says that you can insert a SIM card and have it e-mail you pictures (and I'm not sure if it works for video too).  It has a detachable antennae for this purpose.You can hook the unit up to your computer via USB or you can view video on your TV using the included component cables.All-in-all, an excellent camera.  If I ever have any issues with it in the future, I will be back to update.(A sample was provided for testing and evaluation.)
The scent is okay I guess, but there's a hint of "grandfather" smell to it.  Maybe I'm just too immature for it.  :)  I can see why some people would like it, but it's just not for me.

This z-wave smart switch works great with both the SmartThings V1 and V2 hubs.  Both hubs found the device immediately.The dimmable function works well, as long as you have a dimmable bulb.  Many LED bulbs are non-dimmable and they will not work well with the dimming function on this device.I also had no problem removing the unit from my network and re-adding it.  Again, it was simply a matter of pressing the button on the unit when issuing the "remove" command from the SmartThings app.I have a number of Enerwave brand Z-wave products now and they all work well.(A discounted sample was provided for testing and evaluation.)

This z-wave smart switch works great with both the SmartThings V1 and V2 hubs.  Both hubs found the device immediately upon pressing the button on the unit.There are two outlets on the unit.  The right side is on the z-wave network and the left one is a pass-through, always-on outlet.  The dimmable function works well, as long as you have a dimmable bulb.  Many LED bulbs are non-dimmable and they will not work well with the dimming function on this device.I also had no problem removing the unit from my network and re-adding it.  Again, it was simply a matter of pressing the button on the unit when issuing the "remove" command from the SmartThings app.I have a number of Enerwave brand Z-wave products now and they all work well.(A discounted sample was provided for testing and evaluation.)

This receiver provides great video and sound with my TV and Energy Take Classic 5.1 speakers.  Setup was easy, especially since it has WPS for connecting to your network router, so it was a matter of pressing the WPS button on my router to connect to my Wi-Fi network instead of manually entering my long password using the remote and an on-screen keyboard.Using banana plugs on your speakers is the easiest way to connect them to this receiver, but you can twist and insert your wires and clamp them down, too.  An audio return channel (ARC) allows you to use your smart TV's functions and have the sound be returned to the receiver so the sound comes out of your speakers.A software update was available and took quite awhile to finish, so I left it alone until it was done.  The on-screen menus are easy to navigate and respond quickly to remote button presses, which is a huge plus in my book.  There's nothing worse than a receiver that takes several seconds to respond to each button press.  Sometimes it will take a second or two for a menu to show at first, but navigation is quick.  Switching inputs is pretty fast, too.Sound and video is perfect.  I tested a bunch of inputs, like my Dish HD, Blu-ray discs, and streaming video from my Amazon Fire TV stick.  Everything looked and sounded great.  I just don't have any 4K hardware to try.I love that this receiver has Google Cast for casting music from my phone to the receiver.  Any Google Cast-able audio app will work with this receiver.  You can also stream audio using Bluetooth, or use the built-in Spotify.  You can also play audio from FM radio, a USB stick, or from a network resource like a DLNA server.This is a great receiver, but at the time of my review it may be a little overpriced at $450.  I'm sure the price will come down with time.  If you have any questions, let me know and I will do my best to answer them.

There is absolutely nothing to complain about with this dock.  It works as expected, and with its USB 3.0 speed it is much faster than my older USB 2.0 dock.  It works well with Windows 10 and my SSD.  It comes with a USB cable and a power adapter.  The dock is weighted a bit so it won't tip over easily.Be sure to properly disconnect the drive from Windows if you are going to disconnect the drive before shutting down the computer.  The manual includes instructions on how to do this if you are unfamiliar with it, but you will want to right-click on the USB icon in the system tray next to the clock and "Eject" the device before you can safely remove it.At a price under $30 at the time of my review, this is a great, speedy dock.  I'll be back to update if I ever have any issues with it.(A sample was provided for testing and evaluation.)

This camera was easy to set up and the image quality is really good.  You can use the app to set it up, or you can connect to it directly on your network by going to the camera's IP address and set it up without the app.  So far, I've only been able to use the camera's browser viewer and the downloadable client to view the video.  I wanted to use this camera with the free software iSpy so I can integrate it with other cameras, but there is no information that I can find about the URLs for the camera's video feeds, which are required for setting up in third-party software.  Since it was not advertised as being compatible with third-party software, I did not ding the rating.Whether viewing at daytime or night, the image is clear.  There is also two-way audio for listening using the camera's mic or sending audio through the camera's speaker.  The pan and tilt works really well too.If I had one complaint, it would be all of the lights on the front.  There are quite a few bright, flashing lights and I don't see any way to turn them off in the settings.This is a highly recommended HD camera, especially at under $70 at the time of my review.(A sample was provided for testing and evaluation.)

This z-wave smart switch works great with both the SmartThings V1 and V2 hubs.  Both hubs found the device immediately upon pressing the button on the unit.  Since this reports energy usage back to the z-wave network, you can trigger tasks based on energy usage like when the usage hits a certain level or when the total usage has exceeded a certain amount in a day.There are two outlets on the unit.  The right side is on the z-wave network and the left one is a pass-through, always-on outlet.  The dimmable function works well, as long as you have a dimmable bulb.  Many LED bulbs are non-dimmable and they will not work well with the dimming function on this device.I also had no problem removing the unit from my network and re-adding it.  Again, it was simply a matter of pressing the button on the unit when issuing the "remove" command from the SmartThings app.I have a number of Enerwave brand Z-wave products now and they all work well.(A discounted sample was provided for testing and evaluation.)

This z-wave smart switch works great with both the SmartThings V1 and V2 hubs.  Both hubs found the device immediately upon pressing the button on the unit.There are two outlets on the unit.  The right side is on the z-wave network and the left one is a pass-through, always-on outlet.I also had no problem removing the unit from my network and re-adding it.  Again, it was simply a matter of pressing the button on the unit when issuing the "remove" command from the SmartThings app.I have a number of Enerwave brand Z-wave products and they all work well.(A discounted sample was provided for testing and evaluation.)

This siren works great with SmartThings V2 for notifying me in case of movement outside or my windows opening in the middle of the night.  I recently had someone trying to get into my house one night and now I am set up to be alerted in numerous ways of any activity outside or at my windows and doors.  This siren completes the project.In SmartThings, you can choose from 5 different alarm sounds and 3 volume levels on this siren.  The loudest setting is quite loud.  But even at the lowest volume setting, it was still a little loud for my dogs so I put masking tape over the speaker and now it is the best volume for my needs.  There are also bright flashing LEDs when the siren is triggered.This siren is exactly what I needed and it works great.  Can't ask for anything more.

Two years ago I moved into a new home whose front yard was neglected by the previous occupants.  The front yard (as well as the back) was in bad shape.  I had someone come and kill all of the weeds and then I covered the yard with this seed, then had someone come and aerate, and then I covered the yard with the seed again.  With enough water and time, and several more applications and aerations, I now have a fairly decent lawn in the front.  During the summer, the front yard gets a lot of shade and the summers are hot, and as long as I water enough the grass never gets brown.  In the spring and fall, when the leaves are not on the tree, the grass still holds up well.  I do wish the lawn was a bit thicker though.  I've repeatedly added more seed each time I aerate and I can't get the grass as thick as I can in the back yard with full sun.

The Klutz Lego Crazy Action Contraptions Kit is a great starting point to getting movement in your Lego Creations.  The book comes complete with all the pieces required to make small moving toys, utilizing wheels, rubber bands, and of course Legos!  The projects are simple to follow, and most kids will be able to do the projects themselves with minimal help.I found this book very helpful as it got my kids thinking and adding the moving components to larger Lego sculptures they were building.  Because these are Legos, this set is compatible obviously with Lego, but also Megablok and generic Legos.  The pieces fit snugly together, and when added to slightly bigger sculptures, the kids can have some pretty neat moving toys.Overall, my kids really loved this set - we liked it enough to gift this to Lego enthusiast kid friend with great success.  While this set is definitely isn't as exciting as getting a character based 100 piece Lego boxed set, the replay value of this book is much greater, and a great way to foster creativity in your kids.

I think I've found the perfect lights for both Christmas decor and for the long summer nights decor - these is probably the only lights you can hang up year round without feeling a pang of guilt for not taking down!  The Heartybay Solar Led Multi Colored Starfish String Lights is such a fun light string to have in your home - inside or out!  There are multiple light settings (gradient chasing, fast gradient chasing, dim to bright alternating, red/yellow only to green/purple only, fast/slow flashing, steady on, fast only flashing, whole string slow fade on and off) and each bulb is very large solidly made.  The starfish are surprisingly flatter than I expected - the photo looks as if the starfish are flat on one side and raised on the other, but they are as textured as they look.  Each starfish is a little less than 1/2" thick at the thickest point in the center of the starfish.The lights are attached on a black wire so they blend into foliage easily, each bulb is perfectly clear and take on the color of each LED light, and light's power and various modes can be operated via the small solar panel box. As long as the panel gets light, the string will turn on once the lights go out.  The color combination is exactly as seen in the photo - red, yellow, light green, and purple.There is a small sheet included that give information on the lights, instructions on how to place the solar panel, and warnings not to replace the bulbs should they go out. It was noted that there are over 20000 hours guaranteed for bulb operation. It takes anywhere between 4-8 hours to charge these lights, depending on if it's cloudy or not, and the lights stay on for anywhere between 8-15 hours depending on if you have the light flashing or steady.  I'm not sure what would happen if one bulb burns out, but it looks like I'll have quite a while before I find out. I left the lights in the "on" position and found they would turn off during the day to charge, and light up by the time the sun was setting.  The lights stayed on longer than I could stay up to monitor them.  Overall, I'm very pleased with these lights. These are a great "set it and forget it" set of lights that are a fun addition to any home or garden.FYI - I was selected for this opportunity to review this item free of charge. The content and opinions expressed here are all my own.

I got the ETSYG 32" silk scarf in the Black Floral Pink pattern, and I must say that it's an absolutely lovely scarf.  It's exactly 32"x32" square, very well printed, and very soft.  My neck usually gets very cold, even in warm weather, and I like to wear a scarf at most times.  Because wool and cotton scarves are often too hot to wear in warm weather, these silk scarves are a good option to lightly cover my neck and keep it warm.  It's light enough to simply toss into my bag should I get too hot, and stylish enough to tie on my bag for fun.  The scarf does wash very well, and it didn't fade after a wash.  I do hang my clothes on a rack to dry, so I can say how a dryer would affect the fabric.Unfortunately, at 32" square, it's not big enough for me to tie and wear as a shirt or a coverup on the beach, so if you're looking to make a nice quick vest or top out a scarf, you're going to have to look elsewhere.  Overall, I'm very pleased with the quality and color of the fabric and love the print.  I would certainly purchase this again.FYI - I was selected for this opportunity to review this item free of charge. The content and opinions expressed here are all my own.

Prior to getting the Conair Cuisinart 2 lb Bread Maker, I had a Zojirushi BBCC-V20 Home Bakery Traditional Breadmaker.  In comparison to the Zo, this unit has it beat in every aspect possible.  I tossed my old Zo years ago and swore off bread machines until I received one as a gift from family.  I could go on and on about how bad the Zo was from the start (burnt bottoms and raw bread tops, poor mixing, etc) and how it seemed to go from bad to worse.  I'm so pleased to report that the Cuisinart has restored my faith in a good bread machine.  This bread machine is easy to use, easily mixes and kneads dough, and bakes up a very evenly colored loaf.The unit is very easy to use - simply select a mode, loaf size, and crust color.  After setting everything, put your ingredients in the bread maker and push start.  There are multiple modes to choose from, including white, wheat, french, sweet, gluten free, packaged mix, and cake settings.  There are also settings for simply making dough, pasta dough, jam, and even a bake only setting for those who like kneading their dough by hand.  For those who want to have a fresh baked loaf in the morning without having to get up early, there is also a delayed start option.  I tried out a delayed start for a plain white loaf the other night with great results.  I put everything in (liquids on bottom, flour in middle, and yeast on top) and woke up 8 hours later to a beautifully browned loaf.In comparison to my old machine, the machine bakes up a surprisingly even and lovely colored loaf.  I've had so many failed loaves from my old Zo and didn't have high expectations for this machine.  The loaves that come out of this machine are soft, tender, and so evenly colored!  For rolls and filled bao, I've used the dough only option and had perfectly kneaded dough with little work.  The dough doesn't stick to the inner pan, and the single large paddle seems to get everything mixed very well.Overall, while I still enjoy making a loaf using my Kitchenaid or by hand, this bread machine definitely earned its spot in my kitchen for a fast convenient bread.  I can't highly recommend it enough, and am very pleased with the overall ease of operation and product that comes from it.

The USA Toys Paradise Adult Coloring Book is a fantastic gift for the aspiring artist in your life.  Coloring is very soothing and relaxing, and it's really enjoyable to kick back and color in a coloring book.  Unlike children's coloring books, these books are highly detailed and can only be well colored utilizing fine tipped colored pencils.  The pages are high quality and thick for easy coloring, and each illustration is beautiful and very detailed.Unlike most adult coloring books I've seen in our local craft stores, this book has illustrations on both sides of each page.  Many of the adult coloring books I've seen feature art only on one side (presumably to rip out and display once compete) which really cuts down the amount you can color.  In addition, these pages are full page illustrations.  With little to no "dead space", this offers much more opportunity to color, although less opportunity for you to sketch anything in.  There are a few opportunities to free sketch, but on the whole, most of the book is filled in with tiny detailed areas for you to color.  The book has a good thick cover, and all the pages are printed on heavy weigh paper.  This is very helpful as the paper is less likely to tear unlike traditional coloring books.  The illustrations inside are focused on tropical theme - you will see plenty of flamingos, hummingbirds, peacocks, butterflies, fish, and flowers in this book.Included with this coloring book is a 24 pack of Staedler Triangle Barrel Colored Pencils.  By themselves, these pencils cost around $17 on Amazon (Staedtler Mars Triangular EZ Grip Colored Pencil Assorted (24 Color) (1))  If you buy this coloring book set, you're pretty much paying $3 for the addition of the coloring book, which compared to other coloring books is a bargain.  The pencils are high quality, color in easily, and are very vibrant and bright.  There is a good variety of colors, and the colors can be blended nicely.  Having triangle barrels also keep the pencils from rolling around and off the table, should you spread all your pencils out.The book and colored pencil set would make an easy and wonderful gift for a friend - or for yourself!  Coloring the pages is greatly relaxing and is a fun way to slow down a little during your day.FYI - I was selected for this opportunity to review this item free of charge. The content and opinions expressed here are all my own.

The MAKE Cosmetics Dual Phase Eye Makeup Remover may be pricey, but it works and works fantastically.  While I love using coconut oil to remove my makeup normally, coconut oil does feel incredibly greasy and doesn't always work well on some cosmetics, particularly those "Everlasting Lipsticks".  The MAKE makeup remover melts eye make up away without irritating my eyes and can easily lift off those stubborn lipsticks.  To use, simply shake the bottle, put some onto a small cotton ball, then wipe the makeup off.After using this remover, I didn't have any ill side effects or skin breakouts.  The remover is gentle on the skin, doesn't have a strong scent, and works very well.  This is a remover I would purchase again.

I recently purchased a stainless steel gull wing style clothes drying rack (Stainless Steel Clothes Drying Rack - Premium Quality) and wanted a second rack to dry more clothes on.  In an effort to reduce our family's carbon footprint while lowering our electricity bill, I finally got around to getting the second drying rack.  The Household Essentials folding X-Frame clothes drying rack works fantastically at drying smaller clothing items.  The unit folds up and down very smoothly and easily, and it can hold a fair amount of small clothing items such as children's shirts, hand towels, underwear, and socks.  Since it is stainless steel, the unit is not prone to rust.  In addition, the unit folds down very compactly (you can easily stow this under the bed/couch).While this rack is good for drying smaller items, the biggest issue I have with this rack is that it's impossible to dry larger items without having fabric overlap.  Because the bars are situated so they are not staggered, if you were to hang a standard bath towel over the first top bar, the middle and bottom bar will be completely covered by the towel, thus rendering them useless to dry things.  With that in mind, this rack is good, but limited in use.  If you are planning to use this to dry smaller items like cloth diapers, this is a great unit to have.  Also, if you are short on space, this rack is nice to have as it has a very small footprint.Overall, would I trade my gull wing rack for this one? No.  Gull wing racks simply hold more, can accommodate hangers to dry shirts and dresses, and work better when drying larger items like sheets.  However, the X-Frame rack is perfect for drying diapers, socks, small hand towels, and underwear.  Its compact size is good for smaller items, and honestly, any drying rack is better than no drying rack.

The husband recently received the Poweradd Pilot as a gift, and I have to say that this is a really great portable charger to have with you.  First off, the unit is very sleek, compact, and lightweight.  At 264 g (9.3 oz), it's not too heavy to carry around, and in terms of size it's about the size of most smartphones out there.  The charger comes with two available USB charging ports, so both my husband and I can charge our phones at the same time, should we choose to.This is definitely a great product to have when traveling, or simply to carry in your bag in case your phone is low on battery and you don't have time to sit at a coffee shop to charge your phone all the way.  It's lightweight, easy to use, and great to have when on the go.

My cockatiel can be quite a picky eater.  I admit, this is not his favorite food (that would be seeds or those fruit flavored pellets), but a cockatiel cannot live by treats alone, and pellets are a good option for his dietary needs.  Harrison's Adult Lifetime Fine at first may seem expensive, but it is definitely healthier than an all seed diet for my little bird, and the waste caused by seed throwing has dropped significantly - any pellet that is dropped will later be picked up by my bird and eaten.  The pellets are easy for my bird to "crack" and swallow or swallow whole, and he was much more receptive to these pellets than other brands plain pellets.To help transition my bird from seed to a full pelleted diet, I mixed the seeds with pellets then started lowering the ratio of seed to pellet.  The breeder whom I got my bird from also supplemented the diet with Zupreem Fruit blend, and I noticed those fruit pellets were the first my bird would go for, so I kept it in his diet for some variety (which he loves).  My bird definitely has responded well to this food and his looks very healthy.  A single pound bag lasts my cockatiel quite a while, and to keep things fresh, I put the mix in a large mason jar and keep it on a cool shelf.  Overall, he's be doing very well on Harrison's and looks and acts very healthy.  I will definitely be purchasing this again for him.

For those of you who collect Peanuts ornaments, this ornament may look vaguely familiar.  Well, rest assured, it's not you - this 50th Anniversary ornament is a revamped version of the 2004 "Love to Dance" ornament that originally featured only Schroeder and Snoopy (Love to Dance Peanuts Snoopy 2004 hallmark ornament).  While this ornament has one thing I wanted on the original 2004 ornament - Lucy - I think I prefer the original over the newer model.My biggest issue with this version of the ornament is that Snoopy is no longer dancing up and down, but instead swings side to side.  Visually, this doesn't bother me much (although Snoopy does bounce up and down when he dances normally), however the clicking sound that Snoopy makes does.  Each time Snoopy turns, you can hear a distinctive "clickclickclick" as he moves.  This is distracting as you can hear the clicking over the music.The noise aside, this ornament is very cute.  I personally would have liked to see an ornament that featured Charlie Brown with Snoopy and the gang around the "upgraded poor tree" for the 50th Anniversary Ornament, but hey - beggars can't be choosers.  This is still quite a cute ornament to add to any Peanuts fan's collection.

I admit it!  The first week of November is not even done and I already started purchasing Christmas Ornaments.  The Hallmark's "A Snoopy for Christmas" is simply an adorable ornament.  Charlie Brown and Snoopy are very well detailed, the colors are bright and cheerful, and the ornament really captures the absolute joy of getting the perfect gift - a hug from your best little buddy!  This ornament is great for any Peanuts fan!

For years, my family and I have been collecting various Peanuts ornaments for Christmas.  The Peanuts Flying Ace ornament is quite possibly my favorite ornament to date - Snoopy isn't on his signature dog house, but totally rocking one awesome biplane!  The ornament features the sound of Snoopy flying through the air and bullets firing (similar to the sound of the dogfight scene from It's the Great Pumpkin Charlie Brown) as well as a short "Flight of the Valkyries" fanfare near the end.  The sound comes out clearly, the ornament is highly detailed, and the whole thing looks adorable.  This is definitely a great ornament to get any Peanuts fan.

The TSSS Wireless LED Solar Security Light is very easy to install, charges using sun power, and is very bright.  I needed a small light in my backyard to encourage my dog to go further back in the yard to take care of his business.  I ended up mounting the light on the fence in direct sunlight, and by evening the light turned on by itself and illuminated a good around in the backyard.  The light is bright, charges easily, and literally takes care of itself - I don't need to worry about flipping any switches!  Overall, great light to have - definitely going to consider buying more to help illuminate the small pathway on the side of the house!FYI - I was selected for this opportunity to review this item free of charge. The content and opinions expressed here are all my own.

The AOKDA screen protector is very simple to apply and feels very durable on the phone.  When using it, the touch sensitivity on my iPhone is not compromised, and with exception of the raised edge around my Home button, I cannot tell it's there.  The AOKDA protector can be repositioned if you place it on incorrectly the first time, and does a fine job of protecting my iPhone screen. The protector was much simpler to apply than those bendable plastic screens - the air bubbles come out very quickly and easily, and you really just need to drop this protector on and it sticks nicely.While I haven't dropped my phone to breaking point again, the screen protector is much thicker than my previous plastic protector. Despite being thicker, I'm able to use my phone as normal, and can access the home button just fine (although there is a little ridge there that takes getting used to). I've had a few minor drops with the screen protector in place, and it seems to be holding up just fine. When dropped, it didn't scratch easily and seemed to do it's job.Overall, I'm very pleased with this screen protector. It's easy to install, feels thick and durable, and once applied you can barely tell it's there. Definitely a good way to protect your iPhone screen.FYI - I was selected for this opportunity to review this item free of charge. The content and opinions expressed here are all my own.

This book is structured like a journey. You will be introduced to Paul, his background, witness his conversion, follow him along his 1st, 2nd and 3rd missionary journeys. The chapters are entitled, 1.) Called to Follow Christ, 2.) Called to Go, 3.) Called to Suffer, 4.) Called to Love, 5.) Called to Give, and 6.) Called to Be Faithful. To give it more context and meaning, there are many pictures, maps and timelines that accompany the text.Mr. Hamilton draws many parallels in the book including how Paul and Jonah were used by good to calm the storm and deliver their shipmates. For those who are of traditional upbringing in faith this may be heresy as Mr. Hamilton mentions, "Many have been taught that people who do not personally receive Jesus Christ as their Lord and Savior will spend eternity in hell. Paul's writings and theology are more nuanced that that and seem to leave room for alternative answers to the eternal fate of nonbelievers." Along with that there are many comparisons and speculations and estimations. "At most my fitness bracelet registered fifteen thousand steps walked in a day, but Paul routinely walked more than thirty thousand steps while carrying his accommodations on his back." What I do about this book is how he traces the steps of Paul and has pictures of all the traditional spots. There are questions brought that I never thought of as a "mature Christian" who's grown up in the Church. Questions like how, the Book of Acts abruptly ends. He also discuss authorship debates that are more along the lines of Christianity studies you might encounter in a university level study. Also mentioned are the apocryphal Acts of Paul as he cites 1 Clement 5:5-7. (Clement is among the list of Rejected books, not considered part of the New Testament Canon.) He also includes the graphic tradition/legend that says Paul's head bounced three times upon striking the ground, and in each place that his head bounced, a spring or fountain came up from the ground.This might be recommended for the more mature Christian but I would not recommend this to new Christians starting off in their faith.

The kid needed new flip flops for swim class, and these were perfect - they are inexpensive, comfortable, and run true to size.  The kid noted that he likes the print, and that even with wet feet in the flip flops that he didn't slip or slide around.  Overall, decent pair of flip flops for under $5.  Totally would buy again.

The Petsafe Current Pet Fountain isn't quite what I would call a fountain as much as a "filtering system".  It's a vibrantly colored water bowl that operates quietly, filters effectively, but ultimately wasn't for my dog.The Papillon Prince was drank from the Petsafe Fountain with little complaint, but when his original water fountain dish returned a week later and was poised near this dish, he made a definite beeline for the cascading water.  I don't know if it's because the water truly tasted better, but he seemed to enjoy the splashing and "drinking fountain" style water dish much more.  While my dog didn't go back to this dish, this may differ for your pet.
