These Baby Alive dolls are kind of creepy to me. But, my granddaughters love them and that's all that matters. This doll has a nice full head of long brown hair that my granddaughter brushes and styles and braids. She loves playing with their hair. You get a little hair extension to put in her hair. And some other hair accessories, a plastic brush and a cute little hair dryer.She's wearing an outfit that looks like a little cheerleader outfit. I always thought the Baby Alive dolls were more like infants that need to be bottle fed. I guess they are growing up. This doll is a well made doll. Not a cheap plastic doll at all. She has a nice feel to her and will last a little girl a good long time. My granddaughter couldn't be happier with her.

Cute little dog frame Christmas ornament/magnet. It's well made and cute. Allows you to place a picture of your dog in the frame and hang it on your Christmas tree. It also has a magnet on the back so you could stick it on your refrigerator if you wanted too. I would be afraid it would get knocked off and break, though. I am putting it on my Christmas tree. The glazing is done well with red, white and green, and a touch of gold accents. I wish I could only knock half of a star off. The only problem with it is that the word dog is not easily detectable. You really have to look at it hard to read it if you don't now what it's supposed to say. Other than that, I really like it.

These bags are really nice for cooking meats in. It keeps all the juices inside the bag and also prevents it from leaking onto your pan for easy cleanup. These are big enough to cook up to 8 lbs of meat in and are oven safe to 400 degrees. Each box has the box tops for education coupons that helps schools. These will be saved for my granddaughter who collects them. We use oven bags a lot, so I was very happy to get these and give a review for them. The7y are great bags and they make cooking whole chickens and other meats so much easier.

I really like these appetizer plates by Lenox. They are very minimalistic in design and can be used at any time of the year. Not just Christmas. The plates are white stoneware with black designs and are 6 inches across. I really don't know what else I can say about plates other than to comment on the glazing of the stoneware. It is even and well done. They are just really cute appetizer plates and they are microwave and dishwaasher safe. They do look nicer in person than the pictures show.

These girls polo shirts have been the only garment by this company that I have not been 110% happy with. They are cute and they are made well. They also fit well and are comfortable, but the fabric is way too thin for girls I find it interesting that the fabric on the boys polo shirts seems to be of a heavier weight. If this shirt weren't so thin I would like it a lot. But as it is, I can't recommend it for girls. Upgrade the fabric on these please.

Very cute little Polo jumper dress uniform. This is a rather plain looking outfit, but I decided to do some machine embroidery and applique on it to spruce it up a bit. My granddaughters don't wear a uniform at their school, but this little outfit is something that they can wear, regardless.It is 55% cotton and 45% polyester it should wash well with minimal, if any, shrinkage. It is well made, so that gives me a great base to start with. The fit was good and fit as expected. Looks very cute on and is comfortable. I love the contrasting little belt that it comes with. It adds just a slight pop of color to an otherwise boring color.

I love these for the fridge! The shelves in my fridge are glass and I'm always afraid they are going to get broken. I put these liners no the shelves and now the shelves are protected from getting broken by offering some cushioning between them and heavy glass jars and bowls and keeps my shelves from getting dirty. I plan to get some more for my cabinets where I put all of my glassware. Very handy and I really like them.

My 18-year-old nephew was heavy into gaming and played his X-Box all day long every day. We were starting to worry about him not living life or working towards some kind of career. Finally, one day he just stopped. Got up off the couch and completely changed his life around. Now he is heavy into working out and taking better care of himself.When I saw this book, I immediately thought of him and decided to get it. He's really enjoying the book and says that he's learned a lot from it.Some of the things touched on in the book include: Carbs, Protien and fats, calorie cycling,what to eat,nutrition for muscle building,  and more. It also includes some good recipes for high protein foods and smoothies. There is also a section that gives you examples of a daily diet plan and in the back of the book there are some exercises for you to do. At the very back of the book there are several pages of blank weekly menu plans so you can map out your own diet plan. It's a great book for anyone who wants to get healthier.

Baby Genius books are cute, soft activity books with textures, mirrors, and 5 different sounds. These books are very soft and babies love looking at them. They are soft cloth, so you don't have to worry about torn pages. It has bright and fun colors to really grab your child's attention, plus several activities that your child interacts with throughout the book. A fun little book for the young ones that teaches through repetition. We really enjoy these Baby Genius books.

Baby Genius books are cute, soft activity books with textures, mirrors, and 5 different  sounds. These books are very soft and babies love looking at them. They are soft cloth, so you don't have to worry about torn pages. It has bright and fun colors to really grab your child's attention, plus several activities that your child interacts with throughout the book. A fun little book for the young ones that teaches through repetition. We really enjoy these Baby Genius books.

This is a cute interactive learning toy in the form of a puzzle. It is made of wood. The pieces are all wood with a little peg on top for children to easily grasp. It plays 7 different sounds for the pieces when they are lifted up and put back in place. Teaches babies  hand/eye coordination, problem-solving and more. It is well made and because it is would it should last a long time.Although the puzzle or shape sorter, is nice, the sound effects didn't work so well, nor did they coincide with the pieces. Needs some improvement.

This is my first time with Skullcandy earbuds. These are great earbuds with very good sound and they include a built-in mic as well. They are lightweight and very comfortable to wear. They have an around the neck flexible collar that is removable if you prefer to do without it.They were very easy to pair up with my phone via Bluetooth. I had no problem setting them up at all. I wish they came with a case similar to the Soundpeats I've reviewed, but it's not a deal breaker. These earbuds are very nice quality, I love the way they look and I love that they are white instead of the same old black ones. The sound is very good and they don't bother my ears at all when I wear then. I am very happy with the sound and quality of these earbuds.

This is a very nice warm jacket for little boys. I love the camo print. This jacket is lined with a warm sherpa lining. The outside of the jacket is a nice and heavy 100% cotton duck fabric and it has a  heavy-duty brass zipper.Dickies consistently puts out quality clothing and this little jacket is no different. The fit is spot on, too. It fits my 8-year-old grandson perfectly. It is definitely worth the $40.99 asking price. I highly recommend it.

This is quite fun to play with even for a 52-year-old. My 8-year-old granddaughter and I played with it and had a lot of fun. She likes it and she wrapped two of her pencils and a headband and she liked the way they came out. It's a little bit fiddly when you want to change the thread color but not too bad. My granddaughter likes it enough that she says she would play with it again.  I'm of the opinion that this is one of those toys that gets thrown in the back of the closet once the thread and markers run out. But it sure is fun at first.

Cute shorts and well made. I love the print and the color. They fit my grandson perfectly and he likes them. They are 100% cotton and soft and comfortable. They do get softer after being washed a couple of times. I like the length on them as well. There are pockets everywhere. There are two regular type pockets, two back pockets and 2 cargo type pockets on the thighs. The quality is good and the construction is good. I could find no irregularities or problems with the seaming. We are happy with them,

This is a nice sewing kit and very handy to have while traveling in case of emergencies. It includes pretty much everything you might need. It has 18 spools of thread in different colors, safety pins, a seam ripper, straight pins, a pack of different sizes of needles, a needle threader, buttons, a thimble, a dressmaker's tape, a dressmaker's pencil, scissors, a plastic tapestry type large needle, and even a crochet hook and a magnifier.It comes in a nice zippered faux leather case that keeps everything organized and easy to get to. We take a sewing kit with us when we go camping and fishing or anywhere there might not be a store handy if we needed to mend something. It's a complete set of everything you might need all wrapped up in a portable case. I'm very happy with it.Sample provided in exchange for an honest review.

My daughter's birthstone is Garnet so I'm going to give this to her. This cross necklace is very pretty. The garnets are nice and clear and the metal is Rhodium plated sterling silver. The rhodium plating keeps it from tarnishing and gives it a high shine. The cross is very delicate and not chunky at all. It's made well and looks really nice on. I know my daughter is going to love it.

This is my first time trying Carhartt jeans, but it won't be the last. These jeans are very good quality jeans. They are denim with just enough stretch to make them very comfortable. The fit is just what it should be according to the size chart. The denim is nice and soft and not stiff at all. They fit just below the waist which is another reason they are so comfortable. Jeans that are higher up on the waist are painful to me and I can't wear them. I can wear these just fine and I don't feel like they are cutting me in half.I have chicken legs so the slim fit prevents these pants from being baggy in the rear and legs like some pants I have tried. I really like these pants and the price isn't bad either.

These are very soft cloths with mesh on one side to help with scrubbing and very soft microfiber on the other side. They are great for cleaning windows and mirrors. They are also nice for washing dishes. The mesh side is good for getting the stuck on parts off your dishes, though it won't get really stubborn stuff off. I like them a lot.I see there are reviewers talking about them bleeding. I haven't washed mine yet so I don't have a comment on that. But I think I am going to throw mine in some hot water with vinegar and try to set the dye better just to be on the safe side. Other than the possibility that they might bleed, they are nice cleaning cloths and the size is nice too.

I do a lot of crafts that require me to wear gloves. These Ammex gloves are just what I needed. They save my hands from getting dyes or caustic chemicals on them. I especially like how thin these are. They are like a second skin and in no way get in the way of my creativity.These work great for dying fabric and yarns and for wearing when I am etching metals. But they are thin, so I don't think they would hold up well to any type of strenuous work. But if you need to protect your hands, yet maintain good function in your hands and fingers, then these gloves are perfect. I'm very happy with them.

Let me start by saying I am a Big SOA fan and was thrilled to get this game! It definitely didn’t disappoint and I would not hesitate to spend the money on it. There are a lot of rules and may be difficult form some to understand but thankfully for those, there are YouTube videos that explain the game. Keep in mind this is not a game for children so if you’re looking for a “family night” game this is NOT it! Otherwise I most definitely recommend this product.

These flea and tick drops seem to be working as well as Frontline and I haven't seen any adverse effects from it in any of my dogs.It is quite a bit less expensive than Frontline and has the same active ingredient although the PetArmor has a bit less of the active ingredient than Frontline. I haven't seen any fleas or ticks on my dogs so I am assuming it is working. If I later discover differently I will edit my review to reflect that. But so far it seems okay.

I simply love V-Tech toys. Their educational value is priceless and the children are always happy with them. This one in particular was perfect for my grandson. He absolutely loves trains, and even more so, loves attaching and detaching them over and over. He gets frustrated when things do not go together easily and this train set easily comes apart and goes back together! The best part is that with this train he is rewarded with music and more when he puts it together. You simply can’t beat this price for the product!

This little guy is incredibly adorable! The music is great and doesn’t get too annoying as with other musical toys. This toy does have some difficulty crawling over plush carpet but works great on hardwood floors! The bear works best with a baby that is already to move forward. Before baby can crawl, mom and dad will need to be on the floor pushing the button for baby. Overall, this is a great little educational toy that is very decently priced.

I'm a doodler, so I really like this desktop calendar. I'm also terrible about remembering Dr. appointments, so having this calendar right in front of me on the desk is a great way for me to remember. It has nice large boxes around the days that are roomy enough to write appointments and birthdays and such.There are two holes in the top of the calendar, so if you prefer, you can hang it on the wall as well. It has two protective corner on the bottom corners. It's big and it's roomy and I am very happy with it.

These washcloths are great. I absolutely love the yellow and they look beautiful in my kitchen. Aside from the looks, they work well for their intended purpose. I especially love to clean my oven with it as it really picks up the crumbs and such great. To be honest, I was initially shocked at the price but considering the fact they are homemade, look great and work great I wouldn’t mind spending the money if I ever need more.

If you want to have a Disney themed party, this book has a lot of ideas. It is heavily illustrated with both photography and Disney character drawings. It comes with fun recipes for cakes, cookies, cupcakes and more. Make your own princess brown. There are different party themes in the book. Aladdin, Cinderella, Captain Hook and more. This is a fun book and it is a very nice book as well. The pages are nice and loaded with glossy photos and illustrations. It's a paperback book, but it's heavy because they paper they used it good quality and heavy duty.

I do a lot of crafts that require me to wear gloves. These Ammex gloves are just what I needed. They save my hands from getting dyes or caustic chemicals on them. I especially like how thin these are. They are like a second skin and in no way get in the way of my creativity.These work great for dying fabric and yarns and for wearing when I am etching metals. But they are thin, so I don't think they would hold up well to any type of strenuous work. But if you need to protect your hands, yet maintain good function in your hands and fingers, then these gloves are perfect. I'm very happy with them.

This is a nice and well-made carrier for an older baby who can sit up and hold their heads up well. It's a bit bulky which makes it a pain to travel with because it takes up so much space and you can break it down to a more reasonable size.Everything looks good on it. The fabric is heavy duty and so are the straps. I have fibromyalgia and it was a little bit uncomfortable to me, but not intolerable. It's lightweight so it doesn't add too much weight on your shoulders and back in addition to the baby. The frame seems to be very sturdy. It would be perfect if it was more portable.

This game is basically a truth or dare game. I'm not sure why anyone would want to pay for a game that can easily be played at any time without purchasing this game. And, the questions wouldn't be so offensive and stupid. I don't know about anyone else, but I have no need to know what my friends and relatives do with their anus, or where they are when they masturbate. It's a raunchy game that I wouldn't recommend unless you and your friends don't mind sharing intimate details of their lives.

These little cars are absolutely adorable. They are very well made and just the right size for chubby little hands. These cute little cars are bright  and fun colors, and they all have eyes painted on to make them especially cute. The launcher is fun and works great. My grandson loves these little cars and I made  him a special carrier just for him to keep his cars in and carry them around with him. We're happy with them.

I'm still loving these Mega Bloks sets. This SpongeBob SquarePants set is very cute. It was a lot of fun watching and helping my grandson put it together. You get both SpongeBob and Squidward's houses in this set. And you get the SpongeBob, Squidward and Plankton figures.The pieces go together very well and easily and stay together until you take them apart. There is a working paddy launcher, but it doesn't really work as well as I think it should. That's the only reason I docked it one star. I would only take half a star I was able. My grandchildren are really enjoying the Mega Bloks sets. They would make a great Christmas gift for boys or girls. Always happy​ with the Mega Bloks.

We recently rescued a little pomeranian. She had lost most of her hair somehow, with only a some of her outer coat. Her undercoat was pretty much gone. You could look at her and see her skin perfectly through the wispy outer coat that she had. We took her to the vet to make sure there were no foxtails in her ears. There wasn't, but she did have an ear infection that we are treating. Once she's over that, she is getting a dental appointment to have her teeth cleaned.The Vet pegs her at about age 8 to 10. When she came to us, she was full of foxtails. I even had to pull a bloody one from between two of her teeth. Her breath could knock you over it is so bad, so I bought this along with some toothpaste and a toothbrush for dogs. I had hoped that would help until we get her in for the dental appointment. I gave some to all of the dogs, and only one of them actually likes it. But the little Pom hates it.It does freshen her breath, but only for a few minutes until the mint wears off. Hopefully, her dental appointment will fix the bad breath, or at the very least improve it a bit. I am happy to say that her undercoat is now growing in and you can't see her skin through her coat anymore. I am anxious to see how fluffy she gets. I love her to death, bad breath and all.

This book is chock full of fun activities for children. Build a fairy house, make edible butterflies for a cake, make your own snow globe out of an empty jar and much more. This book is loaded with colorful photos on just about every single page. It will amaze your daughter, there's no doubt about that. The crafts are fun and imaginative and if you have a daughter who loves to make art or crafts, she will love this book. This book offers a great way to spend some quality time with your daughter. I got the one for boys too, and I really love these books. They are very well done.

This is a nice little waist pack. It comes with a pocket for your cell phone, plus a larger pocket for anything else you need. It also comes with a bottle for your water and a small gel flask. There is only one bottle for water and it's not very big. The nylon belt is nice and sturdy and the construction is very well done. The buckle is easy to use for quick and easy on and off. It's a nice running pack.

This stuff tastes nasty! I can't drink it, but I gave it to my nephew who is into working out and getting all buffed up. And he loves it. He says it gives him great energy and keeps him from getting dehydrated. I also have a beef about the use of Stevia in this product. I stay away from all sugar substitutes including high fructose corn syrup. They all make me ill and if you have IBS or IBD you should definitely keep away from this stuff.  This is supposed to be a health food for people who work out. Put some fruit juice or real cane sugar in it to sweeten it up. It'll be worked off during the workout. Sugar has a bad rap. It's not that bad for you, especially if you eat it raw and unprocessed.

If you allow your child to play with your phone, this Stroll & Go Tether is a great way to keep your phones safe from drops, bites, and slobber. You attach it to your stroller or car seat, put your phone in it and, hopefully, your baby will be occupied for long enough for you to get your shopping or other errands finished. It's made well and big enough to fit most phones. And it sure beats having to pay to repair or replace your phone.Having said all that, I don't think it's a good idea to allow your baby to play with your phone because it exposes them to radio frequency waves which are a form of electromagnetic energy. Whether it is harmful or not, I don't think I would want to risk it.

Out of the mouth of my 7-year-old grandson. "This is the best toy, ever!" Who am I to argue? I'll be honest, I wasn't expecting this to be as nice as it is. I was expecting a cheap flimsy toy that isn't worth the money. I was wrong. This is a well made, good quality toy. It was very easy to put together and it stays together well.This toy comes with 4 NHL players, but you can purchase more if you want a bigger team. It also comes with decals for all of the NHL teams, so you can turn your players into your favorite team. It's a lot of fun and it isn't just for boys. My granddaughters love it too.

After learning that this has Belladonna in it, I have decided not to use it. Belladonna is a plant that also goes by the name of Deadly Nightshade. There is no way I'm giving this to one of my babies.

I was enticed to watch this film based on the two top notch actors (Jon Voight and Dermot Mulroney), but unfortunately the plot didn't really come together to allow them to show off their acting chops. Filmed in Anchorage, Alaska, the film stars Jon Voight as a veteran police detective, nearing retirement, but not ready to be out of the game. He specializes in cases involving missing children, though we never really know why until the end of the film. When the 7 year old niece of his boss (played by Dermot Mulroney) is kidnapped, Voight starts methodically working the case, but soon finds his case complicated by a locally famous radio psychic who claims that a "spirit" is putting him into contact with the lost child. The dramatic scenes where the psychic has flashes into another world are confusing and unexplained. Though highly skeptical at first Voight eventually starts to recognize that the psychic has some inexplicable ability to flash back and foretell events.The climactic scene at the end where Voight confronts the perpetrator ties up the plot with a neat bow; however there simply wasn't enough lead up to the climax to make it believable. The stark, beautiful wintry landscape of Anchorage, Alaska is one of the best features of the film, particularly the scenes of Voight flying over the mountains in his small plane, and certainly makes it different than other kidnapping / police procedural films.

I purchased the "Secret Garden" hardcover journal because of the attractive gold-embossed cover, lined pages, elastic closure and ribbon book mark. When on an International trip, I always keep a daily journal of activities, places visited, observations and things to follow up when I'm back home. The details fade away so quickly after a trip, particularly if it was a busy extended journey of 2 or 3 weeks, and I enjoy referring back to the journal to remind me of the wonderful places we've experienced. This sturdy journal was filled with the activities of a terrific two week trip to Scotland, and will remain on my bookshelves for many years to come.The lined pages of this 8"x6" journal make it easy to write quickly, the bookmark lets me quickly access the last page written, and the elastic band allows me to fold other papers, tickets and small memorabilia into the journal and keep it all in place. The journal is small enough to fit in my day pack so that I can record notes throughout the day or when on the bus between excursions.

The Keratin shampoo and conditioner leaves hair smooth and shiny. It has a pleasant rather neutral scent so won't interfere with perfumes or lotions. The elegant bottles allow you to dispense just one or two pumps which is all you need for short hair. It doesn't lather as lusciously as some  shampoos I've used, but it doesn't really take a lot to get my hair squeaky clean. I received a discounted sample for use and review and will report the same issue that I had with other Luseta products. The bottles are identical and when I'm in the shower I can barely read the tiny "shampoo" and "conditioner" labels; since the products each have the same consistency and appearance, it's easy to confuse one with the other.

The Omron replacement Long Life Pads are identical to the set of original pads received with my Omron TENS unit. Though the original pads were still working for me, they weren't quite as sticky as when new and my husband was having trouble getting them to work at all. After ordering the replacement pads, I read further and discovered that the pads could be washed, so I rinsed off the original pair and they now work much better. Rinsing them off (you're not supposed to use soap), gets rid of much of the accumulated debris, oils, hairs, dead skin, etc. and allows the pads to make good contact with your skin. We have had the original set for more than a year of sporadic use (probably well over 100 separate treatments), so I expect the replacements to be around a long time too.

The OOSilk pillowcase arrives in an elegant embossed gift carton along with a tiny sample of a cocoon in a net bag with satin drawstring. It's a nice touch that makes it suitable for gift giving. The ivory color will allow the pillowcase to blend with any bedding. The silk is smooth and wrinkle free, and feels wonderful against the skin of my face. I had previously reviewed the 1-sided pillowcase (with cotton on the other side), which works fine on my memory foam pillow since it is only meant to be used with one side up. This 2-sided pillowcase allows me to install it either way, thus ensuring a long wear life for the pillowcase. I can also turn it around mid-week between laundry cycles if the other side gets soiled. I never awake with pillow wrinkles on my face, and my hair stays neater during the night - very little "bed head". I received a complimentary sample for trial and review and am now 100% converted to the advantages of using a silk pillowcase. I will never go back to cotton!

The Erayco MicroPlane Zester-Grater is extremely sharp and gets the job done quickly and with ease, whether you're grating cheese or zesting citrus fruit. This kitchen tool is quite light weight, with a comfortable rubber handle and a shiny stainless steel blade. The blades are so sharp that I had to use it quite gently to avoid digging too far into the lemon rind. If you want just the exterior of the lemon peel with no pith, you need a light touch. I was able to grate enough sharp cheddar for a quesadilla with just a few swipes of the blade, and it's equally efficient with very hard aged parmigiana cheese. The tool includes a plastic sheath for the blade which will ensure that it is stored safely in the drawer and that you do not accidentally scrape your knuckles on it when it's not in use. The blade is solidly embedded in the handle and does not wobble or bend during use. This has become an essential tool in my kitchen. I received a discounted sample for my evaluation and review.

This attractive set of 6" stoneware appetizer plates is designed to complement the "Around the Table" dinnerware set by Lenox, but the crisp and modern black and white design will blend easily with almost any dinnerware set. Though the name Lenox usually connotes formal china, these are not fine china and do not need to be put away in the china hutch only to be brought out for holidays. Keep them in the kitchen cupboard with your everyday dinnerware, because they are sure to see constant use. I have another set of appetizer plates, and find that I use them constantly, not only for crackers and cheese or other hor d'oeuvres, but for other small meals or snacks, such as a sliced apple or a small bunch of grapes, or even a small serving of left-overs. These Lenox plates are microwave and dishwasher safe and do not need to be coddled. They are attractively boxed and would also make a nice shower gift or hostess gift. I have included a photograph with snack food on the plates for provide scale.

This is a fun set of clip-on lenses which will allow you to increase the functionality of your smartphone camera and provide some interesting effects. I had tried another set of clip-on lenses from another supplier, but the clip wasn't long enough to position the lens over the camera's lens. The rubberized clip in this VicTsing lens set is long enough for my HTC One Remix smartphone and even fits over the case, so that I don't have to peel it off before using the lenses. Two clips are included, so that you can install the fisheye lens on one clip and the macro & wide angle lens on the other clip. The lenses can slide inside the clip-on bracket so that you can position them precisely over the camera lens.Though these are by no means professional quality lenses, I did not find that they degraded the image quality at all. The macro worked quite well in that it allowed you to focus on very close subjects - something the camera's built-in lens can't do. The wide angle lens just widened the field of view a little bit; but the fish-eye lens allowed a nearly 180 degree view, with only a little curvature around the edges. There was no vignetting at all with any of the lenses.I have included several example images below:1) close-up with camera's standard lens - it doesn't focus well on very close subjects2) close-up with clip-on macro lens - it focused very sharply - you could even see dust motes3) my office wall with standard camera lens4) my office wall with clip-on wide angle lens5) my office wall with fisheye lensI received a discounted sample for my evaluation and review, and can recommend this lens kit if you are interested in expanding the functionality of your smartphone camera.

President Reagan made notations in his diary every single day of his presidency, except perhaps for those days when he was hospitalized after being shot. He used writing to organize his thoughts and even wrote or edited most of his speeches. His true nature is revealed through his diary entries. He was not an intellectual giant, but he was a charismatic leader and a great orator. He brought people together and worked toward compromises and agreements. For instance, he will always be associated with tearing down the Berlin Wall.The book is quite long - nearly 800 pages in the printed version, and requiring more than 10 hours to read in the Kindle version. Brinkley, the editor, painstakingly retained Reagan's original words, spelling errors and all, though chose to summarize a significant portion of the diary (probably 50%), rather than include a word-for-word rendition. The summarized info is shown in italics. Classified info has also been redacted (shown with square brackets in the text). I started off carefully reading every word, but by about half way through the book, I thought I'd never finish so decided to just skim the italicized text.This is not an autobiography. There is no historical analysis, no retelling of historic events, no summarization of the issues of the day. For instance, though the Iran-Contra affair is mentioned many, many times, you won't be able to piece together what actually happened by reading the diary entries. Perhaps Reagan was not a deep or introspective thinker, or perhaps he just knew that his diaries would become public at some point, and didn't want to get too personal.Here are some of my observations from the diary:He had a modest ego. Even the "Tear Down This Wall" speech in Berlin in 1987 is somewhat downplayed, though he did mention that the speech was warmly received.He had little respect for the press and believed they manipulated situations and chose what news to present; there are quite a few negative comments about Sam Donaldson in particular.He had a contentious relationship with Tip O'Neill.His devotion to Nancy was legendary and he mentioned her absence with longing every time she had to be away from him. He was proud of her work on the "Just Say No" campaign.He hobnobbed with the rich and famous, particularly Hollywood types.He loved to watch movies, even the oldies but goodies. He didn't care for R rated or smutty movies though.He didn't use swear words. He writes d--n and h--l in his diary, and never a mention of the F word at all.He was sensitive and touched by many of the people that he met with hardships, frequently commenting that he "puddled up".He made friends with some of the most important global figures of the day - Gorbachev, Margaret Thatcher, Mother Theresa.His main form of recreation was horseback riding and cutting down trees.He was inordinately proud of his physical condition, always reporting that he got a good report from his many physical exams. In Chapter 4 he wrote "I'm so healthy I had a hard time not acting smug."He was very concerned about his approval rating, and mentioned it frequently; though he wasn't always rated highly, his final polls in office gave him the highest rating of any president ever.He was photographed thousands of times while in office; "photo op" is probably the most commonly recurring appointment on his calendarHe never did learn how to spell Gadaffi (leader of Libya); Quadhafy, Quadafy, Kadhafy, Qaddafi, Quadaffi, Quadafi were some of his attempts.He made history for 8 years, and strolling through his diary is a great reminder of the world changing events of the 1980's. On his last night in office he wrote "Tomorrow I stop being President." There's no way to know from his diary whether he was sad, excited or relieved at the end of his historic term in office. However, reading his diaries motivates me to look for a biography to fill in where his diary leaves off.

My husband inserted these sturdy insoles into the slip-on loafers that he wears most often and reported that they are comfy and offer a nice layer of cushioning, particularly on days when he is walking or standing more than normal. The insoles fit snugly into his size 10-1/2 shoe with no trimming; therefore I assume that they would need alteration to fit into a smaller size. It seems a rather bold claim that they can fit such a wide range of sizes, and would probably slip around loosely in a size 13 or 14 shoe.

Enter the magical world of music as envisioned by Mitch Albom in "The Magic Strings of Frankie Presto". The voice of "Music" narrates the tale throughout most of this charming novel. It starts with the sentence "I have come to claim my prize" as we meet Music at Frankie Presto's funeral, where Music has come to claim back the gift of music that was loaned to Frankie throughout his life. Thus we know that Frankie was endowed with a prodigious talent, and how he uses that talent will unfold over the next 465 pages of this enthralling tale.Frankie learned to play the guitar from The Maestro, a blind musician in the small town in Spain in which Frankie was raised until he was put on a boat to travel to America alone, where he survived by his wits and his music. Though he was trained primarily in classical music, he learned rock, R&B, jazz and could switch between all genres at ease. He played and travelled with many well known artists through the 50's and 60's.The story is told is a somewhat linear fashion, though occasional flashbacks and flash-forwards can make it a bit confusing at times. The voices of other musical executives and musical talents also address the reader in a few chapters, including Darlene Love, Burt Bacharach, Tony Bennett, Wynton Marsalis and others. Albom actually collaborated with these musical talents and states in the Acknowledgements "they trusted me to write in their voices."Albom, a musician himself, demonstrates his considerable knowledge of the music business and several musical genres. He writes that "everyone joins a band in this life. One way or another, the band breaks up."  The band is a simile for the human connections and communities that we surround ourselves with. Though much of Frankie's journey through life was troubled and lonely, he formed some very important bands, in particular the love of his life, Aurora, who he met when she was just a girl.Though Frankie makes some important connections, he is always plagued by the thought that he was abandoned as a child and did not know his real family. His quest for that knowledge is the underlying theme of the novel.Albom has a wonderful ability to create character through dialogue that is sometimes spare and concise, sometimes eloquent but always interesting and full of meaning. The unique device of "Music" as the main narrator is unusual and somewhat odd at first, so it took me a bit to get into the rhythm of the novel, but once I got the hang of it, I couldn't put it down. It's a marvellously creative and entertaining novel which I highly recommend.

I've been using the Smithsonian Engagement Calendars for several years, and find that they fit my retirement life style just fine. Though I use an on-line calendar that I view and update on my smartphone and get appointment reminders real-time, I like to keep the Smithsonian calendar on my desk to note other daily activities. I use it as a sort of brief journal to note what I did on a particular day, and to record a few "to-dos" for the upcoming days. From time to time, I also refer back to journals from past years, so I keep them stored on my bookshelf.The calendar includes one page per week with the opposite page featuring a beautiful full color photograph of an item from the Smithsonian collections. Each photograph is accompanied by a brief description of the genesis and significance of the item. There is no unifying theme to the images, so it's sort of like wandering through the nation's attic to see what is stored there.If you decide to use the calendar as your primary calendar to note all appointments and obligations, it is small enough to carry in a handbag and weighs only 10 ounces. It's nearly the same size as my IPad.

These small pruning shears are just the right size for small jobs in the garden, particularly cutting or deadheading roses. I also used them to trim the camellia bushes, cut back some overgrown herbs and trim the tomato bushes which surprisingly are still bearing tomatoes in early November! The blades are very sharp and give a nice clean cut, leaving no jagged edges on the stems. The padded handles make them comfortable to use and the light weight eliminates hand fatigue. The small clip between the handles locks the blades safely together. I received a complimentary / discounted sample for my evaluation and review.

I have several Barefoot Contessa cookbooks and enjoy using each one. Though Barefoot in Paris is an older book (published in 2004), I purchased it recently after a 3 week river cruise in France during which we enjoyed fabulous French food. I wanted to incorporate more French cuisine into my repertoire, and knew that Ina Garten's recipes are always well written, well tested and easy to replicate at home. Some of the recipes aren't particularly French, but rather an American adaptation, but that's fine with me. Some of the recipes are repeated from her other cookbooks, such as Lentil Sausage Soup, which I highly recommend. Other predictable French favorites are included, such as Boeuf Bourgignon, Creme Brlée and Brioche loaves.The cookbook is printed on large glossy pages with generous use of beautiful photography throughout. There is plenty of white space on the page for your own notes, and helpful notes. You can plan a entire meal from the included sections: To Start, Lunch, Soup and Salad, Dinner, Vegetables and Dessert. Or you can browse through and just select one recipe for your menu.The recipes are achievable by a cook with a modest amount of skill in the kitchen, as long as you carefully follow the steps in sequence and make sure you have on hand the necessary ingredients and tools. I like the fact that nearly every recipe is accompanied by a photograph to help you graze with your eyes but also to help with plating and serving ideas.Whether you're looking for a new book to add to your collection, or one to gift, "Barefoot in Paris" would be a great choice.

I received a small free sample bottle from the manufacturer for trial and review and tested it out immediately. It arrives with a small section of light colored wood flooring with 2 white scratches so that you can try it out first before putting it on your flooring if you are at all skeptical. It did work just fine to darken the white scratches on the sample, so I applied it to a scratch on my living room floor that has been there for years. Oddly enough, the product is clear in color and has no dyes. It is rather thick and sticky, but easy enough to rub into the scratch. It does not have a strong or overwhelming scent. It took several hours to dry completely, after which I buffed off the remaining residue with the soft included cloth. The scratch is no longer white. Now it is a similar golden brown as the rest of the flooring, though upon close inspection I can still see the scratch. You should note that this is not recommended for dark wood, only light woods.

I have been taking the recommended dosage of 2 caplets each evening about 30-60 minutes before bedtime for about 2 weeks now. They do make me feel a bit more sleepy. Normally I need to read my Kindle for 30 minutes or more to drop off, but with these caplets I can only read for about 15 minutes. I haven't noticed any appreciable difference in joint pain, but I don't really have a lot of aches and pains to begin with.However, during these weeks that I have been taking the caplets I have been having some really weird and disturbing dreams which actually result in sleep disturbance and awake times throughout the night. Therefore, I've decided to stop taking the supplements before finishing the bottle of 80 pills. The little bit of extra sleep that I gain in falling asleep more quickly isn't worth the strange dreams later on !

Though this film reveals a lot about Hoover's tactics and underhanded techniques, it fails as a pure documentary since it is so one-sided and does not give Hoover credit for any of the good things that happened to the FBI and in law enforcement during his years in the Bureau. J. Edgar Hoover reigned over the FBI for 48 years, and is famous for transforming the formerly small Bureau of Investigation into a huge, powerful and far-reaching organization by the time of his death in 1972. His power and connections ensured that he was not removed from his position when new presidents were elected.Hoover remains somewhat of an enigma in that his overbearing personality, underhanded techniques and abuse of civil liberties were rampant, and yet his personal life was so clouded and secretive. This was not covered in the documentary at all. If you are a student of history and are interested in learning more about Hoover, this film might be a resource; however it is by no means fair or unbiased and should be regarded as only one part of the story of Hoover.

The bags are identical in size and thickness to another brand that I've been using; however I really like the sliding zip tab mechanism as it is so much easier to use. Frequently with the other type of bag in which you have to press the 2 sides together to get a seal, it takes multiple attempts to seal them shut. Sometimes I think I have a seal, then pick up the bag and have all the contents fall out on the kitchen floor... I also like the fact that there is a small white area on which you can write the contents and date with an ink pen.

The Luseta Coconut Milk Shampoo and Conditioner are nicely packaged in matching brown dispensers. Unfortunately, the fact that the containers are identical except for the word "Shampoo" on one and "Conditioner" on the other makes it difficult to distinguish one from the other when I'm in the shower without my eyeglasses on. To exacerbate the problem, the product in both bottles is the same scent and cream color. A suggestion to the manufacturer would be to make the "Shampoo" and "Conditioner" labels much larger or in a different color ink.I always pay special attention to product details when evaluating a complimentary sample such as this one. I really like the fresh organic scent of this product. The coconut scent is subtle, not as strong as sunscreen, and it doesn't leave a strong scent after your hair is rinsed. One squirt of the  shampoo is enough to work up a generous lather in my short hair. I try to minimize the amount of shampoo used so that I don't spend a long time rinsing it out (to conserve water during the drought). The shampoo is quickly rinsed out, leaving my hair squeaky clean. One small squirt of the conditioner is all I need, and it rinses out quickly with no oily residue; however this conditioner leaves my hair too soft and fly-away with no enough texture to hold the style. I prefer the Luseta Tea Tree & Argan Oil Shampoo & Conditioner in terms of the results on my hair.

I agreed to accept a complimentary sample for my evaluation and review because I've become a convert to the benefits of Vitamin C to renew skin and reduce dark spots. This toner has a pleasant scent, and dries quickly; however, I don't really like spraying anything on my face. It's too easy to get it in your eyes, you can't control the application to make sure all of your skin is covered, and there's always overspray that lands on the countertop or floor. Nevertheless, it's easy to spritz a quick spray on the face mid-day after my makeup has already been applied since it won't mess up the makeup, so I will continue to use it from time to time for that reason. I am using the InstaNatural Vitamin C serum which I prefer since it is dispensed with an eyedropper.

I've been using this product for more than a month after receiving a complimentary sample for trial and review. I know that the combination of Vitamin C and Hyaluronic Acid works to reduce pigmentation as I have had nice results with another InstaNatural Vitamin C serum as well as other brands of serums. This cream features the addition of Retinol to fill in wrinkles. Retinol can irritate skin which is apparently the reason for quite a few of the 1 and 2-star reviews. I did not experience any unpleasant side effects from the ingredients - no rashes or bumps or pimples; therefore I will continue to use it until the bottle is depleted. The cream has a pleasant benign scent and non-greasy texture which is quickly absorbed into the skin. I haven't yet seen any reduction in the appearance of wrinkles, though I definitely have fewer dark spots.The cream leaves my skin feeling slightly sticky, and my skin still feels a bit stretched and dry after the cream is absorbed, so I end up having to use a dollop of my usual moisturizer over top of this cream. However, I do have very dry skin and others with less dry skin probably won't have this same experience.What I don't like about the product is the pump type dispenser which emits the cream from the top of the nozzle. This makes it a bit messy, and you end up with cream smeared around the top of the dispenser and inside the cap. I also don't like product packaging in which you can't see how much product is left, and you can't open it up to squeeze out every last bit.

The Famili digital kitchen scale is sleek, attractive and accurate. I weighed several objects on both this new scale and my older Salter scale and they were nearly identical - for instance, just a fraction of an ounce difference on a 5 lb. bag of flour. Two buttons located at the front of the scale allow you to change from pounds and ounces to grams, and to zero it out - a feature I use frequently since I usually put a plate or bowl on the scale and then fill it with the food to be weighed. The scale will weigh up to ~11 lbs. so is adequate for virtually any kitchen weighing chore.The top is shiny glass and is easy to keep clean. The scale is supplied with 2 AAA batteries which are easy to install. I received a complementary sample for my use and review, and find it very useful. It will be used frequently in my kitchen.

The ECOHIP bags weigh just 1.7 ounces each and can be stuffed into a pocket or purse or backpack so that you're never caught at a store without a bag to tote your purchases home. I have been using cloth grocery bags for years, and many communities in California have now outlawed the use of plastic bags. That leaves paper bags as your only choice and stores are now required to charge for bags, in order to encourage customers to bring reusable bags. Therefore, I keep a stock of cloth bags in the trunk of my car and also in my home for those times when I walk to the market. However, I usually forget to bring a bag when I go to the mall or a department store. These net bags, since they fit in my purse, will ensure that I never arrive at a store without a bag. The bags stretch considerably to hold a lot more than you would guess at first glance, and the woven handles make it easy to carry a load. My only complaint is that items can get caught in the netting and require some tugging to get them in or out. But that issue is easily outweighed by the weight and portability of the bags.I received a complementary sample for my use and review.

I'm really enjoying using the complementary sample bottle of Moisturizing Body Oil that was provided to me by Luseta for trial and review. The clear plastic bottle filled with gleaming yellow oil is quite pretty. The scent is fresh and appealing. I'm using it as a hand lotion, and a small drop goes a long way. It takes just a moment to smooth it onto my hands and cuticles, and the oil is quickly absorbed, leaving no oily residue. I wash my hands and re-apply lotion many times throughout the day, and the Luseta Oil has the added advantage of not leaving a gunky residue on my rings. I expect the 4 ounce bottle to last a long time, since I only apply a drop each time.

Opening a delivery of Cailler L'Art du Brut chocolate is almost as delightful as the first bite into this sumptuous treat. The carton is labeled "Certified Frustration Free Packaging" and includes a manufacture date and an expiration date. The carton lid folds back to reveal two large 6.87 ounce bars of chocolate, each encased in an elegant red and brown paper sleeve with gold embossed print. Inside is a thick scarlet red paper wrapper imprinted with a brief history of the Cailler family brand, and inside that a thin silver foil covering the chocolate bar. By the time you start to peel back the foil and get the first whiff of rich dark chocolate you will be salivating!The chocolate is a dark, smooth brown with whole almonds peeking through the top layer of chocolate which has been drizzled over the nuts and cranberries. The bar easily separates into 5 rows, each with 4 individual bites for a total of 20 servings in a bar. The rich flavor of the dark chocolate, nuts and cranberries explodes in your mouth at first bite, though you will chew slowly to savor the experience. The chocolate is just slightly bitter, and definitely not overly sweetened. Each bite is so satisfying that you will want to make the bar last as long as possible, rationing out the individual chunks slowly and hiding the rest from your spouse (he still doesn't know where I keep my stash).This would make an excellent gift, but I would suggest gift wrapping the box immediately upon receipt so that you are not tempted to open the chocolates...

Though the advertising clearly states that the lens set will work with Android and many Smartphones (The GoGo Photo iPhone Lens Kit is compatible with iPhone 6, iPhone 6 plus, iPhone 5, iPhone 5s, iPhone 5c, iPhone 4s, iPhone 4, Android, Samsung and many moreÉ even with the case on!), it doesn't work properly on my HTC One Remix (an Android phone), even when I remove the case from the phone. The clip isn't long enough to allow me to center the GoGo lens over the phone's built-in lens. The result is that one side of my images is obscured with a black circle.The back of the carton even states "The GoGo Photo works perfectly with every smartphone, case or not..." The manufacturer should test their device with every currently available smartphone if they are going to make such a definitive statement.Nevertheless, I completed my tests of the lens set, though I knew that I was never going to be able to use it for my HTC Smartphone. As you can see in the attached images, the fisheye lens opens up the field of view considerably, though the entire image, and especially the edges, is quite a bit blurrier than without the add-on lens. The macro lens didn't work at all - the camera simply wouldn't focus on a close-up item. The wide angle adapter only expanded the scene a few degrees as compared to the camera's native lens - and made the edges of the image quite blurry. Using the camera's flash also leaves a black edge on the images, so you have to turn off the flash altogether.The lens set arrive nicely packaged in a small carton and also includes a small velvet draw-string pouch so that you can store the clip and lenses. I received a complementary sample for my evaluation and review.I am passing the lens set along to my daughter who owns an iPhone 6 and will update my review when possible based on the usefulness with an iPhone.

The Apple certified cable works perfectly with both the iPad and IPhone 6. The best feature for my application is the fact that it's so long. I can plug the AC adapter into a wall socket, then run this 10 foot cable behind the furniture, leaving just the small end resting on top of the cabinet for when the devices need to be charged. The black cable is almost invisible on top of the dark stained furniture.

1:11 Mins Don't let the bright colors, plastic sheath and light weight of these Komachi knives fool you into thinking they are cheap throw-away items. They are well made, extremely sharp and a pleasure to use. I put the knives to use immediately after I received my complementary set, and was pleased at how efficient they made my kitchen chores. Best of all, they are incredibly easy to clean, unlike my butcher block full of stainless steel knives with their stained and splitting wooden handles. I'm sure these knives will be in constant use while the older wood-handled knives stay in storage.

My review is for the audio CD narrated by Peter Giles who is the same voice used throughout all of the Mickey Haller series. Hearing his voice helps to get me right back into the world inhabited by Mickey Haller, the Lincoln Lawyer. Mickey has been representing a long string of clients in their foreclosure proceedings following the collapse of the housing market in 2008-2009. He has become so busy that he has taken on a young recently graduated associate to keep track of all the filings associated with such cases. One of his clients, Lisa Trammel, has become very vocal about her case, staging frequent protests aimed at the bank, until the bank took out a restraining order against her. When an officer of the bank is found murdered in the building's garage, she is immediately identified as the prime suspect. Haller continues to represent her, and as is normal with most defense attorneys, he doesn't question whether she is guilty of the crime. He begins to build a case that she was framed and intends to convince the jury that there is reasonable doubt based on the thin evidence.As is the case in all Connelly novels, there are also subplots woven throughout; in this story, the on-again, off-again relationship of Mickey and his ex-wife Maggie occupies most of Mickey's time when he is not in court or preparing his case.I enjoyed the detailed rendition of the trial and the maneuverings of both Haller and the prosecutor, as well as the judge. The courtroom drama is interesting and engaging. But the trial, and the narrative, just sort of ends with a whimper, not with a bang, and the eventual conclusion of the novel is somewhat anti-climactic and a bit predictable. Nevertheless, I was entertained for many days while commuting and running errands, and found 95% of the novel to be very interesting. I will soon be looking for my next Connelly audio CD novel, since they always help to fill my otherwise idle drive time.

The Little Tikes shopping cart is already a huge hit with my 10 month old granddaughter who just started to walk. She just loved standing up, toddling along and pushing her cart all over the family room and dining room. It worked better on the carpet than the wood floor, because the carpet slowed her down a bit. She still needs to be accompanied on her cart excursions to make sure she doesn't go too fast and fall down, but it won't be long until she's zooming around on her own. Since she is still quite wobbly, we needed to make the cart heavier, so filled the basket with two 5 lb. bags of flour. When mom and dad take the cart back home with them, they will put sand in the bottom to make it more stable and heavy. Baby loves throwing her toys out of the cart, but we are hopeful that she will also learn, with much encouragement, to put her toys IN the cart. When my girls were toddlers so many years ago, we had a grocery cart and would play the "pick up" game every evening before bath/bed time, zooming around to gather up all the loose toys and put them back in the toy basket. Good habits start young! I'm sure this cart will also come in quite handy in the years to come.

0:38 Mins I received the Kitbest tablet stand at a discount for my trial and review and put it to the test immediately upon receipt. The Kitbest stand is very light weight, just under 3 ounces, but holds the IPad securely in place at a comfortable angle on my kitchen counter so that I can read recipes online. The notches in the two legs that rest on the counter ensure that the IPad2 won't slide off of the stand, and the backrest is adjustable so you can find the best angle for viewing the screen. Best of all, it folds into a very compact form so that I can store it away in a drawer. This small, simple stand will see frequent use in my kitchen and will improve the usefulness of my IPad as well.

I needed a new USB flash drive to move files between computers at a site at which I volunteer as a computer teacher; so when I received the offer to receive a complementary "Thor's Hammer" drive for evaluation and review, I quickly jumped at the chance. I like the fact that the drive case is fairly substantial in size, distinctive in design, shiny and a bit heavy. It means that I will be less likely to leave it behind in the computer when I leave the site, and that I will be able to find it readily in my handbag or computer bag. The 16 GB drive itself is a bit stiff to push out of the case, but locks into position when exposed so that you can easily insert it into the USB drive slot on the computer. However, if the USB slots are already occupied by other devices, such as the dongle for my fitbit and the bluetooth receiver for my wireless mouse, you will probably need to remove one or more of them to make room for the head of the hammer. Copying files to the drive is quick and easy - just drag and drop to this external drive. I used it on my Windows 10 computer with no issues at all.In Norse mythology,is the hammer of Thor, a major Norse god associated with thunder. Mjölnir is depicted in Norse mythology as one of the most fearsome weapons, capable of leveling mountains. I don't expect to use my tiny metal hammer to level mountains, but it's definitely a tool with the ability to move large files easily!

I have had a bottle of this Old English scratch cover polish for years. A little goes a long way. I bought it originally for the top of my cherry wood dining table. One of the cats chased another across the top of the table and dug in her claws to try to get a grip on the slippery shiny surface, leaving a good sized gouge in the surface where lighter toned wood was exposed. The polish filled in the obvious scratch very effectively. In addition, to filling scratches, nicks and dings, Old English also cleans and polishes the furniture to a high shine. More recently I have used the stain/polish on my cherry wood cabinets in the bathrooms. The cabinetry had a few nicks and worn spots, particularly around the handles where your fingernails bump into the wood constantly. The stain makes the scratched and nicked areas much less noticeable, and the cabinets now look almost as good as new.Be sure to shake the bottle thoroughly before using, use an old cloth that you can throw away, and be careful not to spill the liquid on carpets or your clothing. It will definitely leave a stain.

As others have noted, the Hefty cups aren't exactly "hefty"; they're made of rather thin plastic that definitely has a lot of flexibility in your hand. They are not as sturdy or as large as the ubiquitous red Solo cups used at parties and sporting events. On the other hand, since they're single use cups, perhaps you won't feel as bad about contributing to the waste stream. The bright logo and trademark orange and blue colors make them a fun addition to any gathering of the Gators fans. My son-in-law is an alum, still follows the team maniacally and will love dispensing some of his home brew into these fun and colorful party cups!

The 3 tri-pronged "bones" in the package can be snapped apart into 3 treats, for a total of 9 treats. Since the Boston Terrier is a medium sized dog (~25 lbs.), I decided that the full treat was too big for him and broke it into 3 sections. He loves to chew, and settled down with the bone treat for a nice chewing session. He seemed to like the flavor and texture, but he's not at all a picky eater and scarfs up everything you toss at him. The treat isn't as hard as the plastic nylabones I've purchased in the past, so didn't take him long to demolish. The treats do somewhat resemble meat in texture and odor, though the resemblance to filet mignon requires a very active imagination! It's impossible to determine whether the relatively short chewing session helped clean his teeth at all. My only reservation about the treat is the cost. At >$1 per serving, it's too costly to be anything other than an occasional treat, particularly since the teeth-cleaning claim can't be validated.

I obtained the package of Huggies Little Snugglers (size 2) for use by my granddaughter when she visits. I haven't purchased diapers in years, and all I can say, is "wow, how the technology has changed!". The elastic waist and legbands keep the messes in, the material is as soft and pliable as fabric, and the indicator tells you when to change so you don't have to stick your fingers in there and get a surprise, like we had to do in the good old days of the 1980's! The diapers are compact, yet sturdy and effective. And they're cute too with the little designs, though I'm sure baby doesn't care a bit about that! The case of 186 diapers is divided into 3 plastic shrink-wrapped bags of 62 diapers, each probably about enough for up to 10 days depending on how messy your little darling is. So, one case should last a month. And of course, with Amazon shipping times and automatic replenishment you should never run out and be heading to the convenience store late at night or at an inconvenient time...

Other than the typical complaint that the ink cartridges don't last forever, I have found the Brother cartridges to be well made, easy to install and they provide nice even color. We replace the black cartridge far more often than the color. We really like our Brother printer and use it frequently, but indeed over the lifetime of the printer we will probably spend much more in ink than the value of the printer. It's a good business model for the printer/cartridge manufacturers !

I received a complementary sample several months ago for trial and review, but deferred posting my review until I had used the product for a significant amount of time. Having tried other Vitamin C serums in the past year, I can now say that I'm hooked on Vitamin C and Hyaluronic Acid. This one has a higher concentration of Vitamin C (25%) and Hyaluronic Acid (20%) than other serums I've used. The eye dropper applicator and brown glass bottle are similar to the delivery system used in other products. Apparently the brown glass bottle is needed to protect the serum from light intrusion which can diminish the effectiveness of Vitamin C.What is quite different about this serum is the bright orange tint and refreshing citrus scent. The orange tone allows you to see where you're spreading the serum, but it absorbs quickly and doesn't leave any colored residue. I didn't notice any residual tint or stickiness as others have reported, nor did I have any breakouts or rashes. It has little or no moisturizing effect, so you need to apply your normal moisturizer as soon as the serum dries.The good news is that the serum really works to lighten pigmented spots on the skin. I had several sun spots on my cheeks which have almost completely disappeared! Those spots are a hallmark of old age, and eliminating them makes me happier to look in the mirror, though I wouldn't say that I look years younger...I noted that quite a few of the low-star reviews are for people who used the product for only a week before reporting or those that had some reaction to the ingredients. Of course, if you experience a rash or reaction of any kind, you should stop using the product immediately; otherwise, don't give up too soon. It took a long time for the sun spots to develop, and will take time for them to fade. At least finish the 1 oz. bottle before deciding if this product will become a permanent addition to your daily skin maintenance regimen.

I started using the brush immediately after receipt, and when I remarked how great it felt against my scalp my husband had to try it out too. The curved, large surface with rubber tips on the bristles gives you a very pleasant head massage, and in the process also detangles and smooths the hair. So I give it 5 stars for brushing and massaging.As a styling brush when used with my blow dryer, I felt that it was just too large and rather unwieldy. I sort of turned it on an angle and used only a portion of the brush to catch the hair where the stream of hot air is aimed. As a styling brush, I would rate it only 3 or 4 stars, though I do believe that for long hair it would be much more effective than for my short hair.I received a complementary sample for my evaluation and review, and I heartily recommend it for the brushing/scalp massaging feature. I'm really enjoying using it several times a day.

I placed the coiled string of lights and solar panel outdoors immediately after receipt to allow the sun to charge the battery. Unfortunately, the sky has been rather gray for a few days so I haven't been able to fully charge it. By the second day I was able to turn on the lights and test the various modes, blinking and steady. The light bulbs are quite small, but emit a pleasant golden twinkling light. The strung itself is sturdy and doesn't tangle easily. We have strung the lights along the top of a fence with the charger resting on top of a fence post to get the best light. 40 feet is a generous length which allowed us to run the string the entire length of the patio, hooking it to small nails. We're really enjoying seeing the lights come on automatically at dusk and stay on until well after dark. A well made, useful decorative product which I received at a discount in exchange for my evaluation and review.

Though the weekly wall planner is a fantastic idea, I ordered this set to use each piece ( 8 in total ) each for a different purposes. These sheets are a nice size and I can use each one for different fun crafty purposes and make SO many things from them. These arrived to my home quickly, undamaged or bent. They are a nice quality and I am able to use all of my chalk and chalk pens on them easily. They stick to the wall nicely and remove nicely---no paint or wall damage of any kind. I am very pleased with my order and am considering ordering another pack for more projects! They are so fun and useful!I received this product at no cost to me and have provided my honest and unbiased review in return.

This package of 12 winter white berry sprays is one of the best deals I have seen on amazon in a long time! These are a VERY great value and you definitely could not find them for the price anywhere else! These arrived to my home quickly and in great condition---no issues AT ALL unlike some of the other reviews state, so I was very pleased. These are super beautiful---they look like elegant pearls and add such a look of chic elegance to both areas I have used them in. First I stuck several in my white tree and it looks absolutely stunning and next I put them in a white vase in my livingroom and they look so chic and so elegant...I can't get over how much they add to the area! Super beautiful! I am SO pleased with this order and would recommend these to anyone with confidence!I received this product at no cost to me and have provided my honest and unbiased review in return.

I am always looking for fun ways to package all of my DIY Christmas gifts that I give out during the Holidays and thought these ceramic topped jars with chalkboard labels would be perfect! These jars arrived to my home quickly, nicely packaged and in perfect, undamaged condition---no chips or anything of that nature. These ceramic toppers are absolutely adorable and have a very warm christmas/winter vibe that will be perfect for filling with hot cocoa or brownie ingredients and gifting to my relatives with the names written with chalk labels on each jar. I think this is a great idea, because not only is it a beautiful gift, but the recipient is able to erase the chalk marker on the label and reuse these jars for years and years to come---which they definitely should be able to do, as these jars are a very nice quality. I love them and cant wait to see the looks on my surprised relatives faces once they receive them.I received this product at no cost to me and have provided my honest and unbiased review in return.

My Grandmother really loves decorating her home for all of the seasons and is always hunting for new fun themed sets. I thought this set would be perfect for her and boy was I right! This set arrived to my home quickly and in nice condition. The only issue I had with this set is that the back of the make flaked quite a bit of white dusty type stuff onto my clothing and floor when I first opened the package. I did take it outside and gave it a good shake and all issues were resolved. There is NOTHING wrong with the mat and the coating for non slip is perfectly intact, I guess it just had a little extra left on from being manufactured. The print on this set is very beautiful. It is very beautiful for the christmas/winter season and looks super lovely in her kitchen. All of the items included in this set are nice quality and well made---no loose stitching or anything of that nature. She was super thrilled with this gift and suggested that it would be a great gift for other family members!I received this product at no cost to me and have provided my honest and unbiased review in return.

I love ornaments that are not only fillable but that have a vintage feel and vibe to them and these fit into both categories! These are absolutely beautiful, very shiny and mirrored and not only have a large hook so that you can hang them with thick beautiful ribbon, but have hooks that allow you to hang them together if you so choose---allowing you to achieve a very unique look! These spherical ornaments are very unique and have a very stunningly beautiful look that I love. I love making diorama scenes using dollhouse items and these will definitely be perfect for that! These are thick, sturdy nice quality ornaments and I am very pleased with my order.I received this product at no cost to me and have provided my honest and unbiased review in return.

I am a huge fan of burlap and have been looking for a tree skirt for my rustic themed living room and this one truly fits the bill! It arrived quickly to my home and I was surprised at how beautiful it is in person! The burlap is not only thick and high quality, but it shimmers beautifully with gold made into the burlap! This skirt is VERY large--50" and works perfectly with my beautiful rustic themed decor. These photos here do not do it justice at all---this tree skirt really adds a sparkle and pop to your tree and is so amazingly well made! I am in love with this skirt and plan on using it for years and years to come!I received this product at no cost to me and have provided my honest and unbiased review in return.

I am always looking for rustic home decor as well as props and signs to use in my photography...with this I got both! This burlap banner two pack arrived quickly to my home and even lovelier than I was expecting! This is very nice THICK burlap stung up on jute twine, which looks so rustic and stunning! These are perfect for so many things and this pleases me so much! I am using one as decor in my living room and the other in my photography---simply leaving it blank and editing in desired text after the photos are taken. This works SO well for my needs and though the price might seem a little high, I think it is appropriate for the quality and fact that you are getting TWO of these banners. I love them and would definitely order more if needed in the future!I received this product at no cost to me and have provided my honest and unbiased review in return.

This 65" long autumn garland was just what I was looking for to cover the top area of my tv and decorate for fall. It arrived quickly to my home and was in perfect non-damaged condition. This garland is bright/vibrant, cheerful and absolutely screams fall! It is a nice quality garland and I didn't experience ANY piece breaking or falling off when hanging it up or any after unlike other reviews state...not even one. This piece looks stunning and adds an extra POP to my livingroom while still remaining simple and elegant. I really love this garland and would love another strand to place on my bookshelf as well! It's THAT beautiful! Love it!I received this product at no cost to me and have provided my honest and unbiased review in return.

My Grandmother looooves roses and rustic type decor so I thought that this metal distressed sign would be perfect for her.
