They have a lot of fabric to stretch and move with but Im not sure if they'd fit anyone taller....but who knows :)The only drawback, and this will happen with any version of harem pant because of their fit, is that they make your legs look very short and your torso very long. This in no way impedes the cute design and comfortable factor, its just an observation.Fun, versatile pants for those with a different kind of style.

This is my second adult coloring book (the first one I bought I loved and found to be quiet relaxing and fun so I got another by a different designer/ artist) and I was a little disappointed with it.Let me start off with the good: the pages are thick paper that soak up color (if you are going to use anything other than colored pencils (I use Prismacolor Colored Pencils) or crayons than a piece of paper between pages will be necessary), some of the Mandala and Henna inspired artwork is fun and challenging to color and there is a lot of variation when it comes to design.The bad: the Paisley designs are so intricate that it is very hard to get anything in between the lines medium wise. Ive found I have to sharpen my colored pencil to the sharpest tip just to get in between the lines. Using a fine tip Sharpie would work as well but anything with a thicker tip will not work. And then many of the other designs are overly simplistic and I easily got bored of them. These simplistic designs aren't very pretty nor are they interesting to decorate so I found myself skipping pages and wondering why they put these designs in in the first place. Lastly, some of the Mandalas are also so intricate that its very hard to color them. When the image leaves that little space for color the end result is barely recognizable- you can hardly see the colors you put in. Using the medium I do, it takes a lot of the colored pencil to fill in the big, repetitive patterns. Unfortunately there are a lot of these large, repetitive patterns so I ended up skipping half the book. One I even started inserting design of my own just to break up the monotony.So, for those who like the bigger, repetitive designs or very very intricate ones I suggest this. For those who like detailed yet accessible enough designs for multiple colors as well as plenty of patterns that keep the eye interested, I don't think this is the book for you. There are a few pages that I found really pretty and will have fun coloring, but the majority of this coloring book is a bore.

I wanted a meditative hobby that I could be creative with while simultaneously letting my mind drift. After a bit of searching I found a few adult coloring books on Amazon and thought I would give them a try. Ive always enjoyed coloring intricate patterns and pictures so this book was the perfect fit!I use Prismacolor Colored Pencils but you could use fine tip Sharpies or any other coloring utensil with a fine tip. The patterns are so intricate that its best, from what I found, to have a pencil or pen that has a very fine tip. The pages are just thick enough that, when using these pencils, the color doesn't bleed through or indent the next page. If I were to use pens, though, Id definitely put a sheet of paper between so no bleeding occurs.The patterns are beautiful: ranging from larger and flowing to very detailed and small. Many of the designs look like paisley or Henna inspired.This is my first coloring book for adults and I am so glad I got it. Its fun and relaxing to color and has just enough complexity to the designs that you stay interested in finishing the page but not so much that you can't use multiple different colors.

The title is misleading. Let me first start off by saying that. But let me digress first; I bought this book for a class about the female psyche. Since it was required I didn't investigate what the whole book was about. I knew it had to do with Greek mythology, the Goddesses therein and how those archetypes present in society (in women but these archetypes supposedly can be used for men as well).I won't go into why I think this book is completely off for the class because this is a review of the literature, not the class, but it is safe to say that I don't agree with its premise or that these Goddesses personality traits present themselves in women today. This book is based off of ONE culture, one set of beliefs, one time period, etc. And that's just the beginning. Every single one of these "Goddesses" (excluding Hera and the Virginal Goddesses) was raped, used, abused and forced. These myths were written by men. Men that thought women were property. It is evident in their personalities, what happens to them and their place in the Greek world. Basing all womens' personalities on myths from a culture thousands of years old and male dominated makes zero sense to me. I see that each Goddess has certain personality traits, but what I fail to see is how this helps any woman understand herself thoroughly and the use for "activating" other Goddesses in herself. Why? What would be the point? Its much easier to recognize personality traits in yourself that you find lacking and find ways of growing from them, not activating a male-conceived idea of a fictional person whose sole purpose, in one way or another, is to care for, heal from or grow with her male "companion." The whole premise of this book is flawed in my opinion.I did give it three stars because there is valid, in depth research, thoughtful analysis and a comprehensive understanding of Greek mythology. I see where the author was going, trying to make these Goddesses more approachable, more relevant to the age we are in. I just found no reason to do it.I would recommend this book to someone interested in Greek mythology, specifically the Goddesses of Greek mythology. I would NOT recommend it to someone trying to "find" themselves as you cannot find yourself in another person. Especially not one that never existed, was thought up by a male dominated society and was abused to the point of ridiculousness.

This is a really cute dress with a couple of issues that make it less flattering than other PattyBoutik dresses Ive purchased.First off, let me say this dress, like the others, is well made with soft, durable fabric. Like one other dress I bought its a tad too long and I will have to take it in (I am 5'1" and wear a small). The slit is not too high, on one side of the dress and very cute.But...I found the shirring detail on the hips to be a tad too much. It makes your hips (or mine rather) look wider than they are and the fabric in between hangs in a funny way that isn't as flattering to the tummy area. When I looked at the picture I thought it would be a lighter detail, but the shirring is quite "bunchy" and draws a lot of attention to the hips and butt. Now, if you are comfortable with that, by all means rock it and be merry but I found it to be a little too bottom heavy.Like I said, for short people this dress may be a little long. Ill have it taken in. One thing I did notice, though, is the shirring detail bunches and lifts the hem of the dress higher so its not as long. When it does this there is more fabric gathered in your hip area creating the effect I mentioned above.All in all its a pretty dress. The neckline is lovely and the basic design of it pretty. I personally just think the shirring detail is a bit too much. Will that stop me from wearing it...no way! Its pretty and different.Shipping was ok. I got it in a week and its shipped from the states. No issues there.

What beautiful looking (and smelling) beads! When they got to me in the mail (it took a couple weeks, no big deal though for coming all the way from China) I was curious if the tassel at the end would be so long that I couldn't wear it around my wrist comfortably. Luckily its not and it looks really cute either around the wrist or neck. The sandalwood smell is amazing. When I wear this necklace its almost like I have perfume on. The beads are beautiful and the charm is cute.Great Prayer Beads that will be used for  a long time!

I hadn't bought shorts for awhile so it did a lot of hunting around before choosing these. I personally don't like the new fad of having half your bottom hanging out of the back of your shorts while they top comes up to your rib cage. I don't feel comfortable showing off that much skin and regular shorts are short enough, not to mention that look (in my opinion just looks cheap).Anyway, Volcom is a great brand so I knew I would get a well made short, which I did. I got a size 3 (Im 5'1" and 105 lbs) and it fits perfectly both around the waist portion and length wise. Like I said, they are well made and really cute shorts.They got here very quickly with Amazon Prime.So if you are looking for shorts that are cute, well made and don't show too much in the back, these are the shorts for you.

What a unique shirt/ dress!I will begin by saying the top is great- its so different and fun. I have a unique style so this dress/ shirt fits right into  my wardrobe.I started by asking ladies who had already bought this if a small or medium would fit (I am 5'1" and 105 lbs). I got great advice from other people who bought it who recommended that, even though its short, to get a small because the top geometric portion would be too big and look sloppy. They were right! I got the small and it fits just like it does on the model (give or take :) ).I can see some of the stitching on all of the little pieces that make up the geometric top portion, but other than that the lining, zipper and rest of the dress all are well sewn. Its a tad stretchy which is nice as well (around the chest area). Women with larger breasts would probably have a harder time with the dress as it doesn't give a lot of room up top for more than a B cup (which I guess would vary upon what size you bought).Lastly, the length; it is very short. You definitely wouldn't want to bend over in it. Im going to wear it with black leggings or fun, thicker tights to solve that problem.Coming from China, it took a couple weeks to get to me, but got here before the date scheduled.Im very happy with this. Its cute, different and a fun addition to any wardrobe.

First off let me say I love these boots. They remind me fashion in the 60's and they are adorable. The suede is soft and the boot is made well, especially for such a low price (to get something like this for less than 20 bucks is a steal!). I have small feet, never wearing above a 6 in any type of shoe. These fit perfectly with plenty of room for socks and leggings/jeans to be tucked in the top. I also really like that they are versatile- you can either wear them over the knee or fold them down and have a different look.The ONLY reason I gave these 4 stars instead of 5 is because they do tend to fall down a bit. I noticed that I had to keep pulling them up to keep that above-the-knee look. What Im going to do (and suggest to others wanting to buy these boots) is buy a really thick pair of socks that will help hold them up around my leg, then the slipping down wont happen.I got them really fast thanks to Amazon Prime and am really happy I got them.

I was hesitant to buy any kind of jewelry on here as I didnt know the quality, what it was made of, etc. I took a gamble on this body piece because I figured it would look really cute in the summer either with my bathing suit or shorts and a shorter shirt. Im really glad I did.The chain is strong, well made and sort of sparkles. I worried that it might kink up a lot but it hasnt yet and Ive laid it down a few times in different places. I was especially worried about the middle chains kinking but that hasnt happened either. It actually looks really cute on and I can't wait to wear it this summer. It took a little while to get to me, but it came from China so thats to be expected.All in all Im a very happy customer with a neat and unique piece of body jewelry.

This is a pretty kimono. It feels good against the skin and all the tassels were unkinked and free from knots. I got a small as I am a small person but wish it was a little larger. Its probably best, though, because the tassels hang pretty low so with a medium they would be scrapping the floor. Overall this seems to be a well made garment, maybe not the best fabric but definitely passable and cute as a bathing suit cover up or light cover. The pattern is pretty and vibrant too.It took a little while to get here, but this is standard for something coming from China. I am glad I bought this and would recommend it. If you want a more flowy look, get a size up from your regular size. Ill post a couple pictures so you see what I mean.

Adorable, almost old fashioned type dress.I am 5'1" and 105 lbs and wanted a small but they only had a medium available. The top is a little loose, but not horribly so, and the length is actually perfect. Its a short dress, but can be worn without leggings. The material is smooth and silky feeling and seems to be well made. The print is really cute and the belt is just a chord, but looks cute with the style of the dress.We got it quickly, as it was in the US (though the others were in China).Love this dress- cute print, nice make and great details.

This dress looks adorable in the pictures and, when I received it, it looked just like the picture of the one hanging up. Then I tried it on.Let me start off by saying Im 5'1" and 105 lbs. I am pretty small all around and it was hard getting this dress over my head. Once it was on it fit correctly, but it wouldn't fit anyone bigger than me. It is incredibly short so theres so way you could wear it out without leggings or pants. The model in the picture must be 95 lbs because thats the only way this dress will fit someone like it does in the picture.Anyway, the skirt poofs at really strange angles too- in the front making you look way bigger than you are, rather than the back (like it does in the picture). It would take a ton of styling and messing with the top grey layer to make it look like it does in the picture of the back where it has 3 tiers.It took a good amount of time to get here but thats because it came from China so Im not complaining about that.Overall I would NOT recommend this dress. I only have it 3 stars because, if worn with the right leggings or pants and adjusted, it could look cute and it is what is in the picture. Its a one size fits all dress but that size is very tiny so unless you are very tiny, probably not a good buy.

We get the Frontline for our English Bulldog (a very muscular mid sized dog) instead of the alternative due to price. It is so darn expensive to get the Advantage and, we've found, that Frontline works just as well for him. We'll find maybe one flea on him and he hardly scratches. So we're happy with the product.Shipping took about a week, which we found strange because it came from the US, but thats no big deal. The product is what it is and we got it. That makes us happy customers.

Love the juxtaposition of lace and sparkle on this dress. Its both made well and fits like a regular US Small would. I am 5'1" and 105 lbs and the small fits perfectly. Ive found with Allegra K dresses and shirts that I usually dont have to buy a size up unless I want something to look baggier. About 80% of the time the dress or shirt is well made and fits perfectly, but I have gotten a couple of dresses that were less than flattering.The dress: fits like it does on the model. Not too short, fits well in the bust area for whatever size you get and the sequined overlay coupled with the lace top is really really cute. I love this dress.It took a couple weeks to get here, coming from China, so I was happy when I got here before the estimated date.I am a happy customer and would recommend this dress.

This is a cute dress but it takes a lot of tweaking and adjusting to get it to sit the right way on top.First off, let me say I am 5'1" and 105 lbs and the Small fits perfectly. Ive found that Uxcell garments generally run by US sizes if you are smaller. Not sure if this is the case with bigger people.Secondly: the dress. It doesnt come to a neat little V at the top but is very open and kinda big up top. You have to wear a bandeau bra or tank underneath and thats as long as you tie the dress right. I havent tried wearing it out yet, but I could already tell from wearing it around the house that Id have to fix it regularly. Once you get everything fixed and adjusted, it does look cute. Its a tad short so leggings or thicker tights would be good. The fabric is a cheaper wool type but the sewing and condition of the dress seems to be in order. If it wasnt for the strange top section this would actually be very cute.What Im going to do is take it in and have the top stitched closed a bit so I dont have to spend so much time tying it perfectly and then having to retie it every time I move.Taken all these issues into account, I am a little disappointed that I didnt get another plaid dress, but Ill make this one work. Not impressed but its not a total loss either.

This was my first purchase from Sheinside, so I was a little hesitant about sizes. Many times why buying from China its best to get one size up from your regular size, but Ive had experiences with some companies where I got my regular size (a small) and the dress fit perfectly. It all depends on the company. So I poured over the few reviews I could and decided to take other shoppers advice: that this dress runs small and to get a size up. I am 5'1" and 105 lbs and usually wear a Small but got a Medium. Im so glad that I did. The Medium fits like a small would.Onto the dress: it is well made, soft and really cute on. Last night I wore it with leggings and loved the look of it. As shown in the picture, its a little short but not horribly so. During the summer it wont be a big deal. True, I wont be able to bend over in it (more like that sideways crouch down...lol) but it'll look adorable with sandals. This dress also shapes your body very well and is very flattering.I got it very quickly due to Amazon Prime and am very happy. Happy I listened to the other buyers and got the size I did and happy about the dress.

Very happy. I lost my cord for my printer/ scanner in a move and we looked up the type and bought this one. Its different than the one I had in that it doesnt have the power box attached to the cord, but it works just fine and I just got done printing a paper for class. It also got here pretty quickly since the seller is the in the US. Happy Customer :)

These were my first experience buying and wearing Jeggings. Honestly I thought they would be more of a cloth material with a jean element but they're actually just really stretchy jeans. Im not sure if all jeggings are like this, but this brand is. Im 5'1" and 105 lbs and wear a size 2 and that fits perfectly. I was a little wary of the whole jegging fad, thinking they were some kind of spandex pant made to look like jeans but they are not- they're simply just stretchy jeans. The button and zipper work just like with any other, heavier pair of jeans. They got to me very quickly with Amazon Prime, which is always nice. So if you are curious about this kind of pant Id say go for it. Get your regular, US size. As long as this is what all jeggings are like, Ill probably buy another pair : )

This dress has a lot to recommend it and just a few things Im not as eager about; its made well, with a very soft fabric and looks on the body exactly (well, almost exactly) as shown in the picture. It is very short, but when you pull it down its not that bad. Any movement, though, and it rides right back up. The other issue I have are the shoulders. It folds over nicely but you have to keep adjusting it in order to get it to stay in the right place and folded over. I might just take it in and have it sewn down. I havent tried this on with leggings yet, but I think Ill feel most comfortable in those. I used Amazon Prime so it got here quickly. All in all its a cute dress just very short, but the picture shows that so you should know what youre getting yourself into...or rather, I did :)

The best word to describe this film is "strange." Without giving the plot away or too many details, this bottom feeder of a human being (if you can call him that) who preys on others to survive ends up filming the horrid stuff people do to sell to the news. Hes evil, crafty and utterly insane. But the story meanders and in the middle you find yourself wondering what the point is.....if there is one. The only part of this movie I found astounding, and the real reason I rented it was to see Gyllenhaal's amazing transformation- down about 40 pounds or so. It reminded me the Machinist with Christian Bale- amazing what actors do to their bodies for a role, but that role and the story has to be worth it. Not so sure this one was worth it.

Really nice, loose tunic shirt. My husband loves this brand and has gotten a ton of shirts from them so I decided to look at their stuff for women and I wasnt disappointed. I love the strangely placed pocket and, sizing wise, its true to American sizes. Im 5'1" and 105 lbs and the Small fits just like the picture. Its a comfortable, fun addition that looks great with leggings and boots. Because of Amazon Prime it got here fast as well. No complaints here!

After looking at the sizing (it said that a M was like a US Small) I got the medium, trusting the sizing instructions. Well, that didnt work out. The medium was way too big on me but Amazon (and Tom's Ware I think) immediately sent me the postage to return it and, the day I put it in the mail, they put the money back in my account. So I immediately went back on and got a S or US XSmall. It got here very quickly (Amazon Prime), which is always a good thing. Ive never had anything but good experiences dealing with Amazon.So, onto the garment. I am 5'1" and 105 lbs and the S/ US XSmall fits perfectly. This item, from my experience, did run a tad big. The fabric is soft but heavy enough that its very warm. One of my favorite features of this jacket is that it can be worn open for one look or zipped up for a completely different look. It is now one of my favorite jackets and I wore it all last night and was warm and comfortable. The only issues I found (and they really arent that big of a deal) are that the wrists are pretty tight and the bottom of the jacket is as well. Not sure why this is, but Im hoping the wrists will stretch out with wear. Other than that I am more than happy with both the customer service and the garment itself. If youre looking for a cute, unique jacket/ hoodie (by the way, the hood is the perfect size and fits really well) that has 2 neat looks, look no further. Great buy!

Very nice vest; well made and attractive on. The only reason this was given 4 stars as opposed to 5 is because it looks nothing on like it does in the picture. The vest goes up way higher on the chest instead of the deep V shown in the picture. Either way it looks very stylish and nice on. My husband did have to get 2 sizes up from his usual size (he usually wears a Large but had to get a XXL and its still a bit tight) so that would be another issue he had with the garment. Other than these two issues this vest is an attractive find. He did get this article very quickly and it came from China- less than 2 weeks. Overall pleased with the garment though its different than advertised.

Another win for the Doublju brand! My husband really likes this vest/ scarf combination. He got a size up (and XL whereas he usually wears a Large) due to the difference in Chinese sizing and it fits him perfectly. The vest is made very well and has a great look to it with the slanting buttons. He loves this brands unique clothes for men. All are a little different in one way or another as well as very well made, making them a great buy. The scarf section can hang to the sides or go around the neck which is a nice touch. Its a soft material, which is different than the vest which is regular vest material (not sure what kind that is. Smoother, etc.). Due to Amazon Prime we got this item quickly. He definitely recommends this to anyone with a unique sense of style who likes well made clothes.

This is my husband's favorite shirt. It fits exactly as shown in the picture and has a really neat paint splatter effect on both the front and back of the shirt. As usual, he got a size up from his usual size (he usually wears a size Large but got an XL due the difference in Chinese sizes), and it fits perfectly. He now wants the black on black one and the black on grey versions. These are well made shirts with soft material and strong stitching. We also got it really quick because of Amazon Prime. He'd wear this every day if he could (hence buying the other kinds...lol). Very happy customer.
Great show. Heartbreaking at times and definitely not for kids, but good to watch people heal past scars.
Great show. Heartbreaking at times and definitely not for kids, but good to watch people heal past scars.

Im really glad I got this. The length shown in the picture is the length it actually is. I read the reviews first which mostly said it ran a tad big so I got an XS when I usually where I Small. It fits perfectly and has a heavy, well made feel. It looks great with leggings and boots. Fast shipping too. Happy to have this shirt!

My 3 year old son adores Thomas and got this whistle in his stocking. Im not sure why they show 2 in the picture because what you get is the one standing up straight. Anyway, it makes a very authentic train whistle noise that he loves. We like that its made out of wood too. Great toy, fast shipping.

Great toy for kids that love spinning things. My one year old does. He loves it. The only problem I have with it is that it doesn't stick very well to most surfaces. It has to be a really really flat surface, like tile, and then it doesn't stay stuck for that long because, as hes flipping it around like its supposed to do, it comes unstuck. Thats a little disappointing, but as long as we hold and it down and eventually teach him to use one hand to hold it, its fun for him. Shipping was fast as well.

So happy with this purchase. I liked this one over one of the others they had because of the pockets in the arm. Thats a really cute touch. This light weight jacket is well made, very warm (we went for a walk on Christmas night and I wore it and wasn't cold a bit) and fits true to regular U.S. sizing. Theres the double button portion up top, a couple buttons on the inside and buttons on the bottom. The only thing I wish this coat had was a zipper inside so I could zip it up and choose whether or not to button certain portions. I am going to reinforce the buttons on the front, just because they feel a tad loose and Id rather not lose one. Shipping was super fast. Great find, great purchase.

My son loves this toy. He is one so he doesn't totally get the sound portion but he loves watching it spin (I didnt know the whole thing spun around- very cute feature) and making it do so. The sounds it makes aren't harsh or annoying but actually really pretty. Both our boys have a ton of B. toys and this is another we are so glad we got for them.

I bought this for my husband and he loves it. I read all the reviews about the sizing differences between China and here so I got him an XL instead of his usual Large. It fits perfectly. Its a thinner shirt, more form fitting, so it goes really well under sweaters or jackets. It got here for quickly; in time for him to get it for Christmas. He loves it.

So darn cute. We bought this for our 1 year old son to grow with. Our almost 3 year old had a lion one- almost exactly the same only didn't bounce- and he loved it as he grew and was able to walk and then push things around. That toy was retired due to excess wear so we wanted one for our youngest son. We like the handle that he can hold when sitting on it and scooting along. Right now hes too little to do much but sit on it but Im excited for when he'll be able to push it around the house, etc. Only problem we have with it; when we put the handle up (it does stow nicely underneath), its wobbly. We've tried tightening it, making sure pieces werent missing, etc. but I think thats just how its made. When you're pushing it with the handle the handle wobbles back and forth quite a bit. Other than that we can't wait for our youngest to enjoy this. Great shipping speed too.

Got this for my husband for Christmas and Id say we like it but can tell its not the best quality. He has a pretty normal size wrist and its large-ish on him. The buttons do look cool when you turn them on, though. You have to push the button to have the numbers come up though, so when you don't it just looks like a black bracelete which is also kinda neat. Shipping took a month and I had to contact the seller a couple times to ask where this was because he didn't provide a tracking number. He was very courteous but couldn't give me much information...lol. Luckily, though, it got here Christmas eve. Hopefully it stands the test of time!

I really wanted to like this little all in one unit.Setup is not as easy as they make it seem and if you ( or rather when) you run into a problem the instructions don't even give you a hint of what to look for. I read online somewhere that if your router has an B/G protection and its enabled, you can't connect this to you router with any kind of password protection. I found the setup to be odd, you plug in this security system and it creates its own wifi ssid. You install the app onto your phone and connect it to the ssid of the security system and set up your account, before it's even connected to your home wifi.Once you're lucky enough to get it set up, the video is adequate at 640 x 480. The sensor is cmos, but not HD. You can take still shots thru the app, but not video. The plastic triangle top that covers the camera and 9 night vision lights is removable, but it doesn't make a big difference either way. The manual does say not to point the camera toward a window or light source, it greatly affects how well the motion sensor works ( which isn't that great to begin with).It doesn't have the ability to tilt, so you have to set it up high enough to get the view you want. I have three dog and a cat, they never set it off, even without using the pet function. It's pretty good at sending email notifications, but I never got the other notifications to work at all. The siren is VERY loud, and there are several settings for how long it sounds, which is great if you want to scare off intruders before they take anything. There is no zoom, even digital.It supports a 32gb sd and overwrites the oldest recordings when it gets full. The app gives you the option to arm, make all the settings and even shows how much free space the SD had.It says there is two way communication and I can see what I believe is a mic, but I haven't been able to figure out how to activate communication, or set the audio detection.

The handheld unit is small, about the size of a deck of cards. It has 4 contacts, but comes with 2 large, double pads. Each pad uses 2 contacts, but you can purchase different contacts. The type of pulse depended on the setting you choose, 6 in all. When you select an option, it shows you how long that session lasts, 20 minutes or 30 minutes, then it shuts off automatically. You can intensify the strength of the pulse to what ever your most comfortable with. I used it on my lower back, which was really sore from lifting and moving heavy boxes. I went thru two 20 minute sessions, and it did help a lot.I've read that many people use this for bad knees and even to expedite healing of broken bones.I did see the same device with the same contents, for sell on costco dot com for about $70.The gel backed pads are reusable and can be wiped with cool wet cloth to clean the gel when it gets full of body oil or dust.

It's a mini scale model Harley radio controlled. I got the regular packaging and it's beautiful for gift giving. The bike is about a foot long, but it looks bigger than I was expecting it to. My 8 year old just about jumped into my arms when he saw it. It stands on it's own even when it's not in motion. It's pretty easy to control, even for an 8 year old. This is a toy boys of all ages can enjoy... and I mean all ages. My boys 25 year old tutor got nearly as excited when he saw it and the two of them played with it for over an hour.It is well made and seems like it would hold up pretty well. It does require a lot of batteries, 4 AA for the bike and 2 more for the controller. I don't know how hard it is on batteries because we only used it for about an hour, but it could burn up a lot, so I'd suggest rechargeable.

cuter than I was expecting. It's easy to put together, the 4 posts on the shade roof snap into place, the fences snap together. The accessories are really cute, a saddle, blanket, bridle, a couple jump posts which consist of two X shaped ends and a post that rests on them. It even comes with food, carrots and hay. Of course there is this beautiful horse and a rider.Good old fashion play, like I use to have as a child. And it's beautiful just setup on display.A great play set that doesn't make any noise or need batteries, just good old fashioned imagination.

I connected it to a Windows 8.1 desktop via USB cable that I already had, as it doesn't come with one, which is one reason why I didn't give it 5 stars, no digital read out the other. Connection was easy to do. I filled the tanks with the provided ink. The ink containers on the printer are color coded so it's simple to figure out which goes where. There is a fill line, but it took the entire contents of the provided bottles. I don't see any reason you couldn't use 3rd party ink, but the ink lasts so long I would use recommended inks.I was able to connect my note 4 to the Epson connect and print from my phone, yay.Summary :USB cable not includedIncludes the equivalent  of 20 sets of Ink cartridges at $12 or so $240 just in ink savings. No digital read out Epson connect for using printer with phone and tablets One touch scanning to computer or cloud account Easy clean setup Excellent photo printing Very good document printing WiFi and/or USB connection

I have very sensitive skin, so I was a little concerned about some of the reviews I read about burning. I'm also highly allergic to perfumes and have a pretty keen sense of smell.When I but this on my freshly washed face, it did sort of have a very slight "burning" sensation on the areas of my face that had sores, especially around my nose. But I wouldn't say it burned, just that I could slightly feel it working.As for it smelling bad, I couldn't smell anything but an extremely slight scent of mud.Even using it as suggested, liberally, there are far more than 3 or 4 uses. I didn't but a dent in the 3.4 oz tube I got. I consider it to be average size with an average amount of contents. Maybe others got different size tubes than I got, I don't know.It did leave my skin feeling a little dry, but I've always thought you were supposed to follow a mask with a light moisturizer, which I've always done.The ingredients only lists Dead Sea mud and minerals. I didn't follow up by looking it up on the website.After a couple uses, I did notice smaller pores. Though my face did breakout a little at first, I guess from bringing all that junk to the surface, it stared clearing up and is noticeably better than it was before I started using it.I think All skin products are too expensive, this no more so than most of the other general store brands, and a lot less than some some specialty brands. So I feel it's in line with other, similar products.The part I like the best is that you only have to keep it on for two minutes before rinsing. I don't think it's the best product I've ever used, but it certainly isn't bad, in my opinion. I like Ahava products in general, so I'll probably continue to use this as well.

I must admit I'm surprised this really long cable actually works with my older i9900 cannon printer. I have two desktop computers, one running windows 7 and the other 8.1. I never could get this wide inkjet printer to work with my windows 8.1 computer, but the printer is so large I have no where to put it near the other computer. So when I was offered a chance to try this long cable, I thought I'd give it a try. Most printers suggest using a 10' or less cable, so I never really thought this would work. I'm not sure how or why it does, but I'm really pleased that it does. It's a well made, heavy cable, a little thicker than most of my other USB 2.0 cables. The connectors are nice and snug so I'm not worried about loose connection. It's so long I was able to run it along the wall from one room into the next and even wrap it around the door opening so it's completely out of the way. If it works with this older printer, I can't imagine it wouldn't work with just about any USB device. It's a great piece of hardware!

I'm sure everyone's read about the games, earning coins for the wheel to unlock more games, but the part my kids loved was winning stickers for decorating and being able to take selfies with the characters.I like that the playing cards are also stored in the game so if they get lost the kids can still play the game. I find the graphics to be really good, and I can connect the leap pad to my computer to print out the selfies. The 5 and 6 year olds really loved the game and the ability to use the camera with the game, but the learning part is great for preschoolers.Because of the combination of actives (games, learning, selfies, decorating), and the challenges get harder the better you get, I think this is a great game for preschool through 2nd grade.
Junk, squished, cheap, doesn't work well in any nerf blaster. Waste of money. Wish I'd spent more and gotten a usable product.

The picture looks like the mist is thick and low, but I see a cone shape mist that widens as it gets higher. It's a fine mist, but is clearly visible. I use distilled water so I don't get crusty buildup that needs to be cleaned. I also only plan to use it during those really dry nights when my 8 yr old is uncomfortable sleeping. You can hear it, but it's a steady, soft sound that I actually find soothing. It comes with two risers, you can use one or connect them and raise the mist about two feet. The night light is quite bright but can be turned off. The changing color numbers on the front can be annoying, but I taped a small piece of colored tape over the display. I can still read the display but it dims the light.There is a water tank that lifts off the back and a cap that unscrews from the bottom for filling. I recommend removing the tank after each use to let everything dry completely. The manual also recommends cleaning the small hole in the base to keep it clear.My only complaint is that the warm mist doesn't really seem warm. It feels the same as the cold mist to me. Otherwise, it hasn't leaked and has worked as promised. I've only had a chance to use it in testing, so during winter use, if I find any issues, I'll update this post.

Super cute, but 1 yr old needs help coordinating the go button and steering. It's pretty small, so even a big 3 yr old looks a little big on it, but it says it will hold up to 40 pounds.Most of it is pretty simple to put together, but don't get over confident and not pay attention, as I did. Taking a wrongly placed wheel off is not as easy as putting it on.I let the kids help with the stickers, so they aren't on exactly as pictured.... Or even close. So if you care about that, better put them on yourself because once on, that's it.It seems very sturdy and well built, and once the battery is fully charged it lasts as long or longer than the attention span of the child. Ours was actually working the next morning for about 10 minutes or so.I've never seen a little battery operated vehicle for kids so young, it's great to watch the little ones trying to keep up with bigger brother. I'd say the perfect age for this bike is about 2, but the little one yr old sure gets a kick out of it.Worth every penny.

As a parent  I love this game for a few reasons, kids think they are playing while they are actually learning, the games get the kids up and twirling, waving and watching themselves on TV with the characters from frozen.I found setup to be simple, I did by pass the wifi part, and the games were 100% usable.I agree that it feels like a Wii for little kids but this sensor has a camera that puts the kids right on screen and in the game.The math starts out really simple, recognizing numbers, then putting them in order and finally equations. If you have 2 battery operated controllers 2 kids together.I found the on screen motions to be pretty good, quick response and accurate. The pointer controller took longer for my little one to master, but did.The 5 games are all completely different and the kids get rewarded with interactive play.I thought the product is great for per schoolers, especially when the weather won't permit outdoor play. The game teaches math, shapes but also coordination and logic.

I feel this is a great kit for an apt or smaller family room, not really a larger room as the sound just isn't full enough for a large room. The tower speakers are in three parts, the base, riser and speaker. It's all color coded, do connecting all the speakers is easy to do. Besides the basic speakers, there is a center speaker and sub woofer.no rear wireless speakers.There is only one hdmi out and one aux, right and left rca, connectors.To connect to the Internet  It has to be hard wired to your router, or you need a special wireless adapter, that doesn't come with this kit, to connect to the Internet. The remote has a Netflix button, which is really convenient for jumping right to your next flux account, if you have one, once you get the DVD connected to the Internet. It does have built in blue tooth and NFC to pass music and photos right from your phone to the DVD. It will play all standard media, but there is a log list of media it won't play, like music on DVDs or images on cd.I've listed some of the important specs:PLAYABLE DISCSBD-ROMFULL HD 3D/ BD-Video yesBD-RE/ BD-RE DL (Ver.3)JPEG/ MPO yesBD-R/ BD-R DL (Ver.2)DVDDVD-Video yesDVD-R*1/ DVD-R DL*1/ DVD-RW*1DVD-Video/ DVD Video Recording yesFLAC/ WAV/ WMA/ AAC/ MP3 yes (DVD-R/ DVD-R DL)JPEG/ MPO yes (DVD-R/ DVD-R DL)+R*1/ +R DL*1/ +RW*1Video/ AVCHD yesCD, CD-R/ -RWCD-DA yesFLAC/ WAV/ WMA/ AAC/ MP3 yes (CD-R/ -RW)JPEG/ MPO yes (CD-R/ -RW)AUDIO SYSTEMOutput Channel 5.1chDolby Digital yesDolby® Digital Plus/ Dolby TrueHD yesDolby® Pro Logic II yesDTS-HD™ Master Audio Essential/ DTS-HD™ High Resolution Audio yesPower Output - Home Theater Mode (RMS)Total Power 1000WFront 167W/ch (1kHz, 4ohms, 30% THD)Center 167W (1kHz, 4ohms, 30% THD)Surround 167W/ch (1kHz, 4ohms, 30% THD)Subwoofer 167W (55Hz, 4ohms, 30% THD)USBSlot yesFront For PlaybackRear -USB Standard USB 2.0 High SpeedPlaybackFLAC/ WAV/ WMA/ AAC/ MP3 yesJPEG/ MPO yesHIGH QUALITY PICTURE4K Up-scaling N/AFull HD Up Sampling yes1080/24p Playback yes*21080p Up-Conversion with HDMI yesHIGH QUALITY SOUND3D Cinema Surround N/ADigital Music Connection for iPod®/ iPhone® N/APowerful Bass-reflex Subwoofer yesH.Bass N/AEQ/ Center Focus/ Subwoofer Level yesEASY OPERATIONSmartphone Remote Control yes*4*5 (*Available from the end of May, 2014 (Under study))Multi-User Mode/ Stylish GUI/ Wallpaper yesSelectable Speaker Layout N/AARC (Audio Return Channel) yes*6Easy Settings yesNETWORKINGInternet Apps yes (Simple)Panasonic Music Streaming App yesBluetooth® Wireless Technology yesNFC (One-Touch Connection) yesWireless LAN System Capable with Optional Adaptor*9Network Drive Access -External HDD Playback yes*10BD-Live™ yes*11SPEAKER SYSTEMFrontConfiguration 2-way 2 speakers, Bass-reflexSpeaker Unit [Approx.] Full Range: 2-1/2" (6.5 cm) Cone TypeSpeaker Unit [Approx.] Super Tweeter: Piezo TypeCenterConfiguration 2-way 3 speakers, Bass-reflexSpeaker Unit [Approx.] Full Range: 2-1/2" (6.5 cm) Cone TypeSpeaker Unit [Approx.] Super Tweeter: Piezo Type x 2SurroundConfiguration 2-way 2 speakers, Bass-reflexSpeaker Unit [Approx.] Full Range: 2-1/2" (6.5 cm) Cone TypeSpeaker Unit [Approx.] Super Tweeter: Piezo TypeSubwooferConfiguration 1-way 1 speaker, Bass-reflexSpeaker Unit [Approx.] Woofer: 6-1/2" (16 cm) Cone TypeTERMINALHDMI Output yesDigital Audio Input yesMusic Port -LAN (Ethernet) Terminal yes (for BD-Live™*11, Internet Apps (Simple)*7 and Firmware Update)Analog Audio Input (AUX)Pin Jack yesOTHERSPower Supply AC 120V, 60HzBand/ Station Presets FM/ 30

Soft, good size, not to heavy or thick so nice for a cool summer night. It's not what I would consider gift boxed as the description states, but it is folded with a purple bow and placed in a zip lock baggy. might make a nice blanket for a baby shower.

My 8 year old has developed an interest in science, and has always been an aggressive and successful Lego builder. He was excited to get this project. He cleared off his work table and layer out all the pieces with the instructions in front of him. He realized he put two pieces together before inserting one of the rubber bands, so he had to remove a piece. Well, it broke. It was the main shaft, so that means he can't build any of the projects. He is really upset with himself, and it's not a piece I can "fix".This kit is definitely meant for a little older kids or kids and parents together. My problem is, my 8 yr old likes to try to do this type of thing himself. He doesn't want help. He was sure it looked easy enough. Now he's disappointed, and I feel bad for him.

This blanket is a lot thicker, heavier and softer than I expected. The animal print side is slightly fuzzy, and really soft, like a bathrobe, or my cat. The underside is soft but smoother, like PJs. I'm 5'4" and I can curl up on the sofa and blanket myself from neck to toe. The color is just like the picture and goes with everything in my family room because of it's subtle print and neutral color. I have other throws, but we all like this one better because it's so soft, not scratchy. It's just big enough for my 8 year old to cuddle up under it with me. It came packaged in one of those heavy plastic zipper bags, perfect for gift giving. I happen to have a recliner the same color as the chair in the photo and I dropped the blanket over the back. It looks beautiful, much richer looking than in the photo.

My fussy 8 year old loves these jeans. He's on the slender size so the waist sizing ability makes all the difference. He's average height and these rest just on the top of his foot, perfect. They are slender through the leg to the knee, but not "skinny", then straight to the foot. There is just enough room to slide over his cowboy boots. They fit nicely through the tush too, These are well made and perfect for this very active 8 yr old with school starting next week. I feel lucky to have gotten the opportunity to try them.

I think a serious horse shoe player would enjoy this more than the average backyard sports enthusiast. First, it's really heavy, the colors of the horse shoes is really pale, you have to be right on top of them to tell the difference. It is really well made and fancy. It looks expensive, which is good because it is expensive. It is not something I'd want to carry from place to place. One reviewer mentioned that it can be challenging to pack away. You do have to get everything into the box just right to get the box closed.For the right person, you can't beat the quality and it might be worth the expense. For the average person, I think there might be more practical options.

The perfect blaster for younger zombie hunters. The other blaster that he has that uses these larger darts is so big he can hardly hold it up for accurate blasting. This is smaller, easier to hold and easy to recycle or pump for the next round. He didn't have any jams, and is able to fire very quickly. It holds more darts than any other large dart blaster I've seen. Of the 6 blasters we have, this was one of their favorites. For me, no batteries! Love this blaster

we had a nerf blaster battle yesterday and my 8 year old went through all his 6 blasters and finally decided he liked this one better than all the others. When everyone else was out of darts, he kept going. These darts shot the farthest and fastest. When one chamber is out, he just cranks over a full one. The size is perfect for him. He could carry it and run and fire at the same time. The cock action is easy and it didn't jam a single time in over an hour of rough play. I wish I could upload a video of the battle, I had so much fun just watching them.The green darts this comes with are the same size as the blue ones, but it's nice to have the two colors when two kids are using different shooters so they can keep track of whose darts are whose.I should mention, he doesn't have any trouble firing or rotating the chambers. Even his little 8 year old hands fit nicely on the trigger and kind of trigger pump. He didn't need any instructions to figure out how it works.It is by far the most fun blaster he has, and no batteries, so it doesn't die half way through a battle. It's a great blaster!

These fit my tall kitchen trash can perfectly. They have an elastic opening, but it isn't like the opening is smaller than usual, just stretchy. I still pull the handles in and tie the handles to make the opening smaller so it stretches around the top of my trash can. It does stay put much better than other bags of similar size. I notice a ver slight scent, but it's a clean rather than perfume scent. The most improved thing I notice is that, when I pull the full bag out of the trash can, it seems to come out much easier and doesn't get hung up or tear. Considering I use it in my recycling trash can, with bottles, cans, and other large, heavier items, that's impressive. The handles are secured to the bag better too. They don't tear off as my 8 year old is taking out the trash.Because these bags are so stretchy I can add a lot of stuff after I pull the bag out of the trash can. It seems pretty empty once it's out of the metal can. So I save my milk bottles, and other large items, to go into the bag after other bags I've considered to be full.When I use these bag on my bag holder under my sink, they stay on the rack much better than other bags because of the stretchy opening. When that bag gets too full to fit under the sink, there's enough room in the bag for me to collect all the trash from all my waste baskets. I can really cram all that stuff in. Once I tie the bag closed, there's no odor....These bags might measure slightly smaller and/or thinner, but I find I can get as much or more in them, and they are nicer and easier to use.Oh, and another plus, 4 educational box tops on each box.

The elastic waist sizer is great. The pants fit my well built, but slender guy. He didn't want to take them off. They look so nice on him, dressy. They are a little long for my average height guy, but we can tack them up if they don't shrink during washing. Really great slacks for school or dressier events. These are the first slacks he's really loved, but he is a really finicky 8 yr old.Great heavy duty, well made, knee reinforced. Boys pants at a great price.

First, it says there are 30 possible combinations... We didn't see it, unless you buy other kits. There aren't really any directions to make all these combinations. My 8 year old put the scope on, the barrel extension, the shoulder rest and the grip, loaded the magazine, but in 4 AA batteries and took it out to try it. The back of the box shows lots of parts that didn't come in the box, so I'm assuming the are add on pieces.Are the darts supposed to whistle? These white darts didn't. And like another reviewer said, it jams a lot. Still my little guy loves it. It's big, but not so big it's hard for him to carry around. He has one bigger that has larger darts, thicker darts. It's not his favorite nerd gun, but it won't go to waste. Just wish it didn't jam so often.

This is a lot bigger and heavier than I expected. I'm assuming because it's industrial strength, what ever that means. There are not really any instructions. There is more information on the amazon site. It comes with a plastic plate about the same width and several inches longer, there are groves that match the pegs on the bottom of the charger. They fit together, so I put the plate on the bottom, but I'm not sure why. There is a tiny light on the front, but I couldn't tell it was on, maybe because it's so small. But if I look through the side of the charger I can see a light, so I know it's plugged in correctly.. When I plugged in my iPod and android phones, they lite up right away and stared charging.I like that the ports are "smart", so they provide the amount of power needed by each if the devices. And it says all devices charge at the same time, instead one after the other.But I have a small 10 port USB charger that I have all my devices plugged into, and it was less than $50. I understand this Belkin unit is commercial grade, but there's no information explaining what justifies the expense of this charger.

We were invited to a bar b q and I brought this kit as my hostess gift. I was surprised to see the young adults were as excited by it as the kids were. One of the suggested heating methods suggested for a bar b q is to put the ingredients together, for the s'mores and wrap them in aluminum foil and set them on the grill for about 4 minutes, after the grill has cooled a bit. Each of us stacked and wrapped our own s'more. The kids were great, the "big kids" we're trying to find new ways to make s'mores. By having everything wrapped in the foil there's no mess on the grill, cool. And it worked beautifully, the marshmallow and chocolate melted just right. If your grill is still hot from freshly cooking meat, 4 minutes might be too long. Even though we didn't get to roast the marshmallows, it was fun and delicious. All the kids, big and little, were licking the foil after eating their smore. It was a great gift to bring to a bar b q, different and something everyone got to participate in. It was fun.

The vacuum works really well, one of the best I've used. I prefer bags because I can't stand cleaning messy bagless containers. The low setting is quiet, and still does a decent job in situations where you might be concerned about the noise. The high setting, though not as loud as many, still is noisier than I expected.It has a short cord attached to the vacuum and comes with a standard, 35' three prong extension cord. The cord wraps and stores just like any cord on a vacuum. But you can replace this extension cord with a lighter, shorter cord if you want.The part I was most disappointed with, having three dogs and lots of hair, is that you have to remove five screws to get the brush out for cleaning.There are angled little brushes on both sides of the base to get the dirt right up against a wall. It doesn't come with any attachments or any place to put attachments, so you still need a small canister vac for all those other areas that need vacuuming, like baseboards.But for a school or commercial vacuuming, it is heavy duty, easy to move around with handles in several places.

My slender 8 year old likes his jeans tight at the waist, even with the elastic waist sizer pulled and buttoned on the tightest notch, it's still a bit too wide. The length is just perfect, just below the ankle, so if your boy is on the taller side, it might be a tad short. It says it's pre shrunk, so I'm going to wash it a couple times to soften it up. The denim is heavy and very well made, a definite plus for an active boy. The price is great. The only thing that worries me is the metal button waist is really tight and hard for him to get buttoned. But I'm sure, after a few washes and wears it will loosen up and get easier to button. So far it's the best Jean I've found for my 8 yr old, at a very reasonable price.

Great for some, not so great for others.It does fit in a bike water bottle holder, but it doesn't fit under my keurig. My other thermal mug hold the same amount and also fits in the car cup holder, but fits under my keurig, with the overflow base removed.16oz really fills this mug to the very limit. The button you push to drink is pretty sturdy and requires a strong push the entire time you're drinking. It doesn't lock open. When you stop pushing it stops flowing.There is no air hole, so it can be a little tricky to drink hot coffee without getting burned.It's a nice looking mug, the exterior is textured, and because it's so small around it's easy to hold in my small hand.I can't really drink from the hole, I have to let the coffee fill into the extended ridge and drink from the lip. I think with a little practice I could get use to it.It does seem to be leak proof, which is a plus, especially since it's so tall and narrow.It won't be my number one mug, but on those special occasions where this shape makes the difference, it's a good choice.

I really wanted to like this mop. First, you have to be sure to screw the handles together all the way. Even then, this isn't a scrub mop, I found I had to be a little careful how much pressure I used while mopping. Carrying the bucket around, with one side full of water and one side pretty much empty, is awkward. Then, to spin the mop you have to manually get all the little mop pieces in the spinner, or you wind up with a hug mess everywhere. Also, you're supposed to be able to remove the mop from the plastic head to launder, but getting it out isn't easy. I was afraid I'd either break the mop handle or pull the mop pieces apart. I think it's too expensive and doesn't work as smoothly or as well as I'd hoped.

I ordered 4 of these cables to extend the run on my hd digital security cameras, and compatible couplers. It was important that the cables be the best quality I could get without breaking the bank. After everything was hooked up, the camera pictures on those longer runs were every bit as good as the others. Unbeatable price for great cables. And I got a single email from the company with contact information in case I needed help.

These batting gloves are worthy of the quality associated with the name "Franklin" as you might expect. The workmanship is excellent with detailed  stitching and workmanship that is evident as soon as you open the package. The "digitally-etched" leather on the palm is very soft and supple (and really until they are in full use,I cannot comment on wear and tear), and because Franklin uses two kinds of leather and neoprene to make these comfortable and practical to use. The leather for the fingers have small punches to allow your skin to breath and reduce sweating. There is a small deodorizer pack in the retail bag that you may want to store with your gloves after use.

The canvas print looks great in person and very high quality in the framing and ink. For FB fans, Aaron Rodgers is being compared to Michael Jorden and Rodgers' performance this year so far for the Packers is phenomenal. Looking forward to having this action shot on the wall well before the Superbowl. Great gift for Packers and football fans in general.

A light oil that absorbs in the skin especially formulated for menopausal (or post) dry facial skin and out really is very light and absorbing with no oily our greasy feel. But I really dislike the fragrance to the point that I don't want to continually smell it after applying. It's not strong but some kind of floral, herbal, grassy mix that reminds me of mosquito spray. Soooo a bit disappointing.

I'm pleased to say that this watch is even better in person than in the pictures. The sparkle is just right and it's very substantial when worn. I am petite with a small wrist/hand and despite the larger size it still looks very nice, a definite good impression. The watch is packaged in a bright yellow leather-look box inside another logo stamped, yellow box. It would make a very nice gift presentation. It comes with all warrantee paperwork and sticker arrows on the band showing where to remove the pins to resize the band. Love this!

These earrings are a classic design in sterling without alot of gold plate added. I was, however, underwhelmed when I saw these in person because the sparkle I expected (and that appears to some degree in the pics) was barely there. Although there are diamonds (not really a pave) around the intertwined knots, they are basically small chips. Overall the earrings measure 1 1/8" tall and 5/8" wide. They are molded and assembled and marked with the maker and "Made in China." I would consider these for a night out for a business event, but definitely not enough for wedding earrings or something more formal. The highly discounted price is the most I would pay for these.

This rug doctor cleaner does a good job at cleaning with a machine, but I also used it in a spray bottle at twice the concentration to pretreat spots on my rug. Works great. Just pretreat, I let it sit 15-20 minutes then continue as usual.

This rolling base is the ticket for making your life easier in the shop. It's made of steel construction, except for the hard plastic wheels (with bearings) and will definitely hold the 1,500 lbs claimed. Assembly was straightforward and easy -- took about 10 minutes tops. The biggest problem was getting the table saw aligned on the corners (it weighs about 300 pounds) but once that was on, it moved around easily, even thru the sawdust.  Makes life alot easier in the shop keeping things organized and handy for projects. Two thumbs up!

This laser alignment tool is worth the money for at-home construction jobs and in most cases functions as well as a level and also as a plumb bob. I wish I has this tool when re-siding the house! The only job I can't seeing it working for is for installing a dropped ceiling but otherwise it comes in handy.

This shaver really has everything you want in a travel shaver: compact, wet/dry, a lock, simple to use, no recharging (avoid last minute problems, like incompatible electric sockets overseas) and easy to buy anywhere AA battery power. I love the idea, but unfortunately for me it did NOT shave dry worth a darn. Not my upper lip of (yes) lady mustache, not my short leg stubble or the peach fuzz on my cheek. Is there something I'm missing? Not sure, but I'll try again with a wet shave and update...

Great! Worked perfectly through security and overseas. We used on 3 suitcases for 3 weeks travel and no problems. Also great to keep bags locked on the hotel room as a precaution. The reset procedure is easy, and also easy if you forget your combination. TOTALLY worth it for such a Reasonable price.

I never thought in my life that I would be interested in this topic of the Supreme Court and Dissent, but I think in light of recent events and the role of the Supreme Court decisions in the Obama Administration, I knew I needed to learn more. This is a long, detailed book and so I've been reading small sections at a time so I can focus on Mr. Urofsky's thorough discourse without distraction.In particular, I found his overview of each Supreme Court Justices and dissents very good and informative. The opening to Chapter 12 "CODA" includes some harsh criticism of the Supreme Court and its members stated (surprisingly) by the very same Members in their dissents. Antonin Scalia's dissent in the recent Court decisions on Same Sex Marriage received a lot of attention in the press, and Chief Justice John Roberts' dissent led to a Montana man to file for a marriage license to his second wife as he felt the Justice's comments on plural marriage rights encouraging.I have no direct comments about the results of this Supreme Court decision and dissents, but reading this book at the time all these historical decisions were at the forefront was very helpful and interesting to say the least. We as American citizens SHOULD endeavor and make an effort to understand aspects of all branches of our government and how they work beyond what we've long forgotten in HS American Government class.

I am constantly looking for ways to organize notebooks and folders.These will work great for my 5-ring binders (I use them to organize my recipes printed offline). Although my older son is already eyeing them for fall (despite the flashy geometrics). I like these since the hole punches will hold up vs manila or cardstock versions. My only complaint is the price. I think $3.22 each is high for this type of item, esp. being plastic.

Until now I used a small manual juicer and couldn't imagine this Kenwood juicer being much better -- but it is wonderful. I juiced a bag of fresh lemons in minutes and the results were fast and thorough (see pics). The rinds were clean as a whistle and I got a good amount of juice from  about 6 medium lemons. The metal tray kept the seeds out perfectly and the whole set-up is in three easy-to-assemble and rinse/clean pieces. It's great for juicing a bunch of oranges or grapefruit, too. For those who need to juice other fruits/veggies this isn't the right product, but it is excellent for citrus.NOTE: Kenwood provided me with a complimentary citrus press for my honest review.

I almost didn't order this iron because I had a so-so experience with another type of brush/iron that tangled in my hair and didn't work for my 3B natural curly hair. All I can say now is InStyler -- WOW. I have a sedo flat iron that I paid over $150 for and is a workhorse. But I have to heat the heck out of it and then squeeze it as hard as possible to get as straight as possible. It was hard to do a whole head of hair (lots of it) by myself.The InStyler heats up great (it's HOT and fast) and the combo of an iron and a brush to smooth and straighten the (dry) hair as you go down is perfect. No heavy pressure needed and it's alot like slowly brushing through your hair. I still need to comb out or detangle before straightening, but once that's done I do a section at a time. No fuss.I decided to try to keep the straight hair over a few days and see how maintenance will work out. It's been so EASY! I just work on the sections that frizzed or curled--like underneath near my neck where I sweat--and in a few minutes my hair is refreshed and straight. I can't say enough! The extra wide comb with picks to section your  hair and the mat included to place the iron on when using it are helpful too.LOVE LOVE LOVE~!

The gentlemen in the household gave it a thumbs up, but it's not as good in quality or results as a similar Remington razor we have (it is more expensive though). I like the idea of a cleaner to keep the blades clean and make them last longer. In fact, the cleaner makes this a better razor because after a cleaning, it shaves closer and smoother, so it does add value. The question is that is the cleaner necessary to get a closer/better shave -- for this shaver I say yes. However, you may find another similar type razor does as well or better without a gadget and $$ refills.The cleaning station itself is MUCH larger than the razor (unlike in the photo) and takes up more than normal counter space. You insert the razor upside down (it will charge this way too) and then press a button. I had trouble fitting the razor into the station until I figured out that you press/release the top and it pops open wider. You do not need to squeeze the razor in place. In the end, I like this razor but still the (considerably more expensive) Remington XR1340 does a better job.

I've used a similar product in the past, and really needed something as a reminder not to chew my nails, which I tend to do at work. The Probelle goes on like any clear product and dried in 2-3 minutes enough to not worry about. It has a lot of shine which looks nice. The taste is bitter, and unpleasant Day 1, almost too much, because I found if I ate something with my hands, I had a lingering bitter taste in my mouth. Also it covers some of the cuticle so no chewing them either. It does the job! Day 2 it still tastes very bitter, so use utensils and it won't take too many times and you won't want your fingers anywhere near your mouth.

This peeler comes in a gift-quality box with extra pamphlets and information tucked in. It actually requires "unboxing" and very sturdy and professional in appearance. All my paring knives (Chicago and Wusthof) have a narrow and straight blade. But the Kitchen Aid has an extended curve close to the handle. This helps cut through rounded fruits and vegetables as well as cutting through in a downward or curving downward motion. I find my straight-bladed knives are short so I have to recut the other side or somehow adjust the knife to cut through, not just peel. The warranty is a limited warranty only for defects in workmanship, not from daily use or breakage. All in all a very nice knife, good enough for a special gift.

The plan is to use this cover for a welder instead of a generator which works too. The fabric is lined in a nice rubbery texture yet it's pliable and not sticky or stiff. The picture doesn't show the grommets and laces provided to tie up the bottom so the cover doesn't blow away in any wind. I don't know how well it'll clean up over time but time will tell.

These are good, overall kitchen towels. The size can work for both a towel for drying or as a wet dish cloth (on the larger size for this purpose). I go thru a lot of kitchen towels because I cook and bake often. I'm hard in my towels and I wash in warm with bleach. The instructions say wash in cold, but I plan to wash them like I do normally. The cotton feels a bit rough, however, I expect than to soften with use and after a few washes.

“The Wild Inside” promises suspense and mystery and Christine Carbo does something a lot of debut authors wish for--her first book really delivers and fulfills every expectation.  I really enjoy her writing style—it feels modern and fresh with a lot of thought-provoking information packed into the story without slowing the reader down.I am very familiar with the area of Montana close to Glacier National Park and have been in the park often. There have been several really high profile crimes and attacks that grabbed the headlines in the last 5 years and Ms. Carbo fills in with answers to questions on how these investigations work and how all these government agencies work together in complicated situations in a remote part of the country.The bear attack images reminded me of a recent “Dateline” that covered a father and daughter grizzly attack in Glacier – it’s frightening and very realistic when you realize this can happen to anyone in the wrong place at the wrong time. I personally witnessed a grizzly bear in Glacier one year when we took a group of students to the Logan Pass visitor’s center and walked the trail behind it. It’s thrilling but scary even at a distance.For those of you who are fascinated with Glacier National Park, grizzlies, mysteries and a good investigative thriller, “The Wild Inside” is for you.NOTE: I received a free copy of the book from the Publisher in return for my honest review.

This could have been a good match for me, as Ms. Slater and I have a few things in common: I grew up in Massachusetts, I spent a lot of time in "Southie" when it was still an Irish, blue-collar section of Boston and we've both spent time in Japan. But because of my background I'm afraid this book was not the right match.I have a degree in Japanese Language and Lit and lived in Japan for two years. I started in HS hosting Japanese students over three years, then went to Okinawa as a junior. After college, I was the only American in a prestigious girls' private school with over 1,500 students and over 100 Japanese staff (about 50/50 men and women) with a Principal and Vice Principal who were Japanese NUNS. I came back to the US and spent two summers teaching Japanese college students from Nagasaki English (boys and girls).:: Stop here if you do not want to read spoilers! ::As a memoir, I cannot say anything to invalidate Ms. Slater's experience in Japan, of course, as we all experience life through our own eyes and it's an individual's POV. However, I take exception to the book's implication that Japan is place so alien and unreachable (and somehow less than society and culture in the US) that Ms. Slater's experience and POV is a common one any American would experience. In fact, I found the first 148 pages of her not even trying the least bit to communicate, making assumptions about the Japanese people and culture based on American thought and refusing to do anything to learn the smallest thing about Japan except through her husband disingenuous.This is someone who is highly educated, teaches graduate students at a top Boston university and lived a life of upper class privilege (although she claimed at some point in the book to be "middle class") who can't navigate the simplest thing (shopping, eating out, basic phrases, walking in the neighborhood) in a different country where the people bend over backwards to help you and graciously ignore any faux pas or rudeness you cause. At the same time, she had very high expectations for Toru, her future husband, to fit into life in Boston complete with speaking English at a higher level than he could manage and being social with her friends. I don't get this double-standard.I'm concerned about her assumptions and stereotypes about Japan giving readers in the US an incorrect view of the people and culture. I get that from a writing standpoint there needs to be a story arc or character arc, but this goes beyond building a story board where the main character make a complete change by the end.For example, Japanese women being subservient to their husbands and having to stay home instead of being independent. It's not always the case at all. I worked with dozens of Japanese women who taught full-time (6 days a week in Japan) with families, some were still working at over 50. My landlady ran a large boarding house and taught part-time with kids going into college and one entering high school. My Japanese best friend and her fiancé clearly had a relationship where he worked but she called ALL the shots and he accommodated her fully much like Toru did for Ms. Slater. This was the case for several other Japanese women I knew. The biggest reason someone needs to be home in Japan is that the education system is so demanding that a parent (99% mothers) has to manage their child's educational career from pre-school on. The mother takes care of every need and these kids study 12-14 hours a day.She includes "cute" anecdotes that are supposed to show how alien and quirky Japanese people are, for example, otaku: "Toru explained that Japan bred otaku of every stripe, fanatics passionate about one phenomenon or another: manga, anime, even cosplay, where adults dress up and walk around as characters from video games, movies, and comic books." Um, we have that in the US... Hasn't Ms. Slater (or her big publisher's editor) ever heard of Comicon? Or watched the Big Bang Theory? Or heard of geeks or nerds (I am a proud one!) It's 2005 in the book, but readers may think that it's referring to today. Many, many US teens love anime, manga and graphic novels that are the fodder of otaku pursuits in the US, too.Finally, after page 148 where she realizes she can't communicate the slightest bit with her new future in-laws, clearly causing social situations that are difficult to tolerate and maneuver for Toru and his family, Ms. Slater decides to learn some Japanese. I felt this was a more realistic direction although she is self-serving to the bitter end of the book.  And it's the only reason I gave this book "three stars" instead of two.I could go on, but I think it's up to the reader to see the incongruity and discrepancies and to read knowing that this person's experience is not a true education on Japan and Japanese society. If you are interested in reading some (fictional) books that include insight to the Japanese mind and experience I highly recommend Ruth Ozeki's "A Tale for the Time Being" A Tale for the Time Being: A Novel which through the story and footnotes, she conveys a lot of Japanese culture in a compelling story about a non-mainstream Japanese teen. Also I enjoyed the fictionalized "American Fuji" by college professor, Sarah Backer, who writes about her experience teaching in Shizuoka, Japan.American Fuji

I wasn't sure how this hair color would be any better than every other hair color on the market,but so far I really love it! I don't have alot of gray (and  it's only semi-permanent) but I used this as a kind of root touch-up to color around my face and a couple spots in my hairline that are getting more gray hairs. I normally use whatever is on sale (often just a root touch up product) and some kind of medium to dark ash brown. I mixed half of the containers in a small plastic tray I saved and applied with a left over Root Touchup Kit brush. I saved the leftovers for applying next time I need some color (they say not to do this but I have for sometime now with no problem!)The dye is a creamy, orangey colored mixture with NO odor at all. My eyes didn't sting and my scalp didn't either. No ammonia smell in my bathroom and that made coloring a pleasant experience. I followed regular directions to leave it on-- and hoped for a rich brown without orange/red brassyness. And that's exactly what I got. It blended covered the gray and blended with the other shades in my hair wonderfully. I can't see the chocolate tone indoors but I do see alot of shine. Outside it's a nice rich chocolatey color. What's even better is NO HELMET HEAD solid dark color that looks unnatural (have you seen John Travolta lately?). This color's terrific and I would absolutely continue to use it.

My son is a young teen and suddenly his skin is having alot of bumps and also some acne on his back, legs and upper arms. This Proactiv bar soap is ideal for the shower (with careful instructions to keep it dry and last longer). I can only speak after a single use, but it has a pleasant, herbal  fragrance and rinses off well. My son has sensitive skin, so I will watch closely to make sure this cleansing bar isn't causing issues rather than helping to clear his skin. The cost is worth it if it works long term.For those interested in ingredients, the active ingredient is Salicylic Acid 1% and inactive ingredients are:sodium cocoyl isethionate, fragrance, cocamidopropyl hydrosultaine, sodium chloride, galactoarabinan, polyethylene, disodium EDTA, pentasodium pentatate, titanium dioxideYou can call the manufacturer if you have any questions: 1-800950-4695

Hasn't the price for nuts gone nuts lately? Haha! I have 3 of Yotam Ottolenghi's cookbooks (if you haven't tried them, run to find one!) and his recipes call for pistachios often. That's where these guys are heading.... I planned to hoard them. But naturally they called to me and I had to eat some. Having them shelled is fantastic for recipes but for eating there's nothing to slow you down! As I expected, these are Diamond quality with good flavor and texture. Not a bad one in the bag  and hard to stop eating. If you need these for a recipe, hide them!

Neutrogena's signature clear, low key packaging that set it apart as "natural," for sensitive skin and good quality with their original products, although this gel is most definitely not a natural product. It had a light lather and rinsed off easily. I found the fragrance on the strong side (flowery) in the bottle but it was ok after a shower.
