These Scotch-Brite No Scratch Scouring Pads are not only great for cleaning non-stick pans, they are also great for cleaning calcium buildup and hard water stains from around faucets and for cleaning soap scum off of shower stalls and bathtubs. Here's how:For cleaning faucets, just dip an appropriate length of coiled cotton in vinegar and then place it around the faucet on top of the buildup. If there is calcium buildup and/or hard water stains in the sink as well, soak paper towels in vinegar and place those in layers over the buildup. Let the soaked cotton and/or paper towels set for at least two hours, but the longer the better. The vinegar loosens and breaks up the buildup. Later,  remove the cotton and/or paper towels and take a Scotch-Brite No Scratch Scouring Pad and use it to remove the loosened buildup. Then just wipe the faucet and/or sink clean with a wet paper towel and dry it with a dry one.For cleaning shower stalls and bathtubs, I first spray on some Kaboom Shower Tub & Tile Cleaner and leave it on for 1 to 3 minutes and although the product directions say "wipe and rinse" and repeat as necessary, instead of wiping it I always go over it with a Scotch-Brite No Scratch scouring pad which usually takes the soap scum off easily after only one application. Then I just rinse it all clean. Works like a charm!I always wear latex gloves and cover my mouth and nose when I use Kaboom Shower Tub & Tile Cleaner because it contains Glycolic Acid as a cleaning agent (as well as citric acid). These acidic properties are needed to break up the soap scum but can be irritating to the nose and throat, and also the skin.

This Intrinsics Coiled Cotton is not only great for use with hair perms, but it is also great for cleaning calcium buildup and hard water stains around faucets and toilet bowls.For cleaning faucets, you just dip an appropriate length of coiled cotton in vinegar and then place it around the faucet on top of the buildup. If there is calcium buildup and/or hard water stains in the sink as well, soak paper towels in vinegar and place those in layers over the buildup. Let the soaked  cotton and/or paper towels set for at least two hours, but the longer the better. The vinegar loosens and breaks up the buildup. Later, remove the cotton and/or paper towels and take a Scotch-Brite  No Scratch Scouring Pad and use it to remove the loosened buildup. Then just wipe the faucet and/or sink clean with a wet paper towel and dry it with a dry one.For cleaning toilet bowls, you first need to remove the water from the toilet bowl. If your toilet has a tank, you do this by quickly pouring a bucket filled with about 2 gallons of water into the toilet bowl. This accomplishes the same thing as pulling the lever to flush, except that the bowl is not refilled afterwards.If you have a tankless toilet, wearing latex gloves, you will have to manually dip the water from the bowl with a disposable cup into a bucket to be emptied outside.When you have the bowl emptied, still wearing your latex gloves, you should soak an appropriate length of coiled cotton in vinegar and place it on top of the ring of buildup around the bowl that occurs at the water level. Vinegar soaked paper towels should be placed in layers over buildup that covers larger areas.Let this set for at least two hours, but the longer it sets the better. The vinegar helps to dissolve and break up the buildup.Later, again wearing your latex gloves, remove the coiled cotton and /or paper towels, and using a piece of 180 grit sanding screen that has been cut 2" long, begin sanding away the loosened calcium buildup and hard water stains. When you are done, flush the toilet.It works like a charm.

This Forney 180 grit sanding screen is not only great for sanding drywall, but is also great for cleaning calcium buildup and hard water stains off of toilet bowls.First you need to remove the water from the toilet bowl. If your toilet has a tank, you do this by quickly pouring a bucket filled with about 2 gallons of water into the toilet bowl. This accomplishes the same thing as pulling the lever to flush, except that the bowl is not refilled afterwards.If you have a tankless toilet, wearing latex gloves, you will have to manually dip the water from the bowl with a disposable cup into a bucket to be emptied outside.Now that you have the bowl emptied, still wearing your latex gloves, you should soak an appropriate length of coiled cotton in vinegar and place it on top of the ring of buildup around the bowl that occurs at the water level. Vinegar soaked paper towels should be placed in layers over buildup that covers larger areas.Let this set for at least two hours, but the longer it sets the better. The vinegar helps to dissolve and break up the buildup.Later, again wearing your latex gloves, remove the coiled cotton and /or paper towels, and using a piece of the 180 grit sanding screen that has been cut 2" long, begin sanding away the loosened calcium buildup and hard water stains. When you are done, flush the toilet.It works like a charm.

My husband and I love McCormick Salad Toppins,  Crunchy and Flavorful.  For us, a salad is not complete without it. It tastes great and has healthy and colorful ingredients like sunflower seeds, soybeans, onions, carrots, red and green bell peppers, and parsley. And we really like that it compliments any salad dressing flavor and also goes well with any other combination of salad toppings.We are very happy to find it on Amazon as it is almost always sold out at our local store.If you are looking for a crunchy, great tasting salad topping, My husband and I highly recommend this one.ADDITIONAL INFORMATION FROM THE PRODUCT LABEL THAT YOU MIGHT FIND USEFUL:INGREDIENTS: SUNFLOWER SEEDS, SOYBEANS, TEXTURED SOY FLOUR, RICE, ONION, CARROTS, CANOLA OIL, RED AND GREEN BELL PEPPERS, SALT, SUGAR, PARSLEY, BARLEY MALT EXTRACT, CARAMEL COLOR, NATURAL AND ARTIFICIAL FLAVOR, LACTIC ACID, YEAST EXTRACT, DISODIUM INOSINATE AND DISODIUM GUANYLATE (FLAVOR ENHANCERS), AND FD&C RED #3.SERVING SIZE: 1 1/3 tbsp. (7g)NUTRITIONAL INFORMATION:(amount per serving)Total Calories: 35Fat: 1.5 gCholesterol: 0 mgSodium: 70 mgCarbohydrates: 3 gFiber: 0 gSugar: less than 1 g

I love this InterDesign Kitchen Storage Egg Holder and have two of them side by side on the middle shelf of my refrigerator. They are very sturdy and are made of thick PET (a.k.a. polyethylene terephthalate, a plastic resin that is transparent, strong, shatter-resistant, recyclable and SAFE for food storage) that does not contain BPA (a.k.a. Bisphenol A, a synthetic compound used to make certain plastics and epoxy resins that has been proven to cause negative health effects in animal studies). Many food and beverage products are packaged in containers made of PET.It holds 21 eggs. I use mine to store extra large store bought eggs, but they will accommodate Jumbo size eggs, too.The lid on the container is great because you can store things on top of them, unlike the paper or styrofoam cartons from the store. I keep a tub of margarine and some bologna or bacon in a zip lock bag on top of one of my containers so I can just slide the whole thing out and have everything I need for breakfast in the morning. And the handle on the front of the container makes it easy to grab the container and slide it out when needed.HERE IS SOME ADDITIONAL INFORMATION AND TIPS THAT YOU MIGHT FIND USEFUL WITH THIS EGG STORAGE CONTAINER:1) Remember to clean the InterDesign egg storage container (in a sink of warm water and dish detergent to which you can add a teaspoon of bleach to sanitize the container) each time you empty it before refilling it with fresh eggs, or you might contaminate the new eggs. Eggshells are washed and sanitized before being packed in the paper or styrofoam carton that they come packaged in at the supermarket. You should discard any eggs that have become unclean, cracked, broken or are leaking.2) Eggs should be stored in the InterDesign egg storage container with the small end down to keep the air cell stable and also because the eggs are easier to remove from the container when stored this way. What is an air cell? After an egg is laid an air cell forms in the larger end of the egg as the egg cools. As the egg ages, evaporation through the pores of the eggshell causes this air cell to grow larger. In a fresh egg, the air cell is small, not more than 1/8 inch deep. Because of this, when placed intact in a bowl of water, fresh eggs will lay on their sides at the bottom. Once an egg is about a week old it will sit at the bottom of a bowl of water with the larger end bobbing slightly. At about three weeks old, an egg will stand on its small end in the bottom of a bowl of water with its larger end reaching for the top. When an egg floats on the surface of the water it is bad and should not be consumed. Also, when you crack open a bad egg the yolk will be flatter and the egg white will appear runny, almost like water, and you might notice an odor or discoloration.3) Remember to save the expiration date from the original paper or styrofoam egg carton. You can snip it off with a pair of scissors and place it inside the InterDesign egg storage container, or just write the date on a small piece of paper and place that inside the container to give you an idea of the eggs' freshness.4) Store eggs in the main section of the refrigerator to keep them at a steady 35F to 40F; Temperatures in the door of the refrigerator tend to be warmer and eggs should not be stored there. If collected and stored properly, eggs can have a shelf life of about four weeks.5) Never store eggs near or with materials that have an odor (fish, onions, etc.) because eggshells are porous and can absorb odors (and also liquids) and it can affect the taste and smell of the eggs when cooked.6) Eggs should not stand for more than 20 minutes at room temperature before cooking.

This mini measuring cup is made in the USA (by Anchor Hocking in Lancaster Ohio), which I always appreciate, and its size and measurement markings make it great for use in making mixed drinks.My only qualm is that the markings will come off the glass without special care. The glass even comes with a sticker on the bottom that reads "Dishwasher Safe, some detergents may remove the decoration and result in etching of the glass".I have NEVER put mine through the dishwasher because other reviewers say it drastically shortens the life of the markings and in some cases the markings have been washed away completely after one cycle through the dishwasher. For this reason I only hand wash mine with a mild dish detergent and then rinse it under the kitchen faucet and leave it on a dish towel or in the dish drainer to dry, which is fairly quick and easy to do, BUT I still wish that Anchor Hocking Company would have applied the measurement markings to this glass in the same manner as they do on their regular size measuring cups. I have owned several of those for years and have never had to worry about any special care in order to keep the markings from coming off the glass.This mini measuring cup measures in the following increments:ml: 15, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, 80, 90, 100, 110, 120, 135, 150Tbsp: 1 through 10Tsp/cup: 3, 6, 9,  cup, 15, 18, 21, ½ cup, 27, 30oz.:  .5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 3.5, 4, 4.5, 5I will share with you a few of my favorite single serving drink recipes that I use this Mini Measuring cup for that taste great and also won't break the bank.PERFECT MARGARITA1 oz el Jimador Tequila Blanco (100% agave)½ oz Bols Triple Sec½ oz regular Budweiser Beer¾ oz Frozen Limeade Concentrate (thawed)¼ oz Orange Juice1 ¼ oz waterPour over ice, crushed ice, or shaved ice in a margarita glass and garnish with a lime wedge if desired. Also, if you are serving guests, you can make a larger batch by changing the oz in the recipe to cup and using a regular sized measuring cup.PINK POTAMUS2 oz Svedka Vodka3 oz Dekuyper Peachtree Peach Schnapps3 oz Cranberry Juice CocktailAdd ingredients to an ice filled cocktail shaker, shake, strain and pour. This cocktail fits perfectly in a Libbey Vina 12 oz Martini Glass and can be garnished with a lime wedge if desired.

These Libbey Vina 13 oz Margarita Glasses have just the right amount of weight and thickness of glass to be both durable and elegant. They are 7 and 5/8 inches tall, 4 and 6/8 inches across at the top and 3 and 1/8 inches across at the base.The glass is crystal clear with no bubbles or other imperfections that I can find in them, and although it seems that some reviewers do run them through their dishwashers, I have not. I hand wash and dry mine so that there are no spots left on them.The glasses are a great value, they are MADE IN THE USA (which I always appreciate), and I am very pleased with my purchase.Here is my favorite Margarita recipe for you to try. It makes a small batch:PERFECT MARGARITAOne 12 oz can of frozen Limeade (thawed)2 cups el Jimador Blanco Tequila (100% Agave)1 cup Bols Triple Sec2 ½  cups water1 cup regular Budweiser Beer½ cup orange juiceMix above ingredients in a pitcher. Serve over ice, crushed ice, or shaved ice. Can be garnished with a lime wedge if desired.

These Libbey Vina 12 oz Martini Glasses have just the right amount of weight and thickness of glass to be both durable and elegant. They are 7 and 3/8 inches tall, 4 and 7/8 inches across at the top and 3 and 1/8 inches across at the base.The glass is crystal clear with no bubbles or other imperfections that I can find in them, and although it seems that some reviewers do run them through their dishwashers, I have not. I hand wash and dry mine so that there are no spots left on them.The glasses are a great value, they are MADE IN THE USA (which I always appreciate), and I am very pleased with my purchase.Here is one of my favorite cocktail recipes that fits perfectly in a Libbey 12 oz Martini glass:PINK POTAMUS2 oz Svedka Vodka3 oz Dekuyper Peachtree Peach Schnapps3 oz Cranberry Juice CocktailAdd ingredients to an ice filled cocktail shaker, shake, strain and pour. This cocktail can be garnished with a lime wedge if desired.

Metrokane Flip Top Cocktail Shakers are wonderful. I have several in different sizes, including this one, and I love the flip top straining lid and have had no issues with it becoming stuck or leaking (just make sure you don't turn the shaker upside down when shaking).Fill the stainless steel cup with as much ice as you like (I usually fill mine half full) and then add the ingredients for your cocktail, (making sure the straining side is in the down/closed position), shake (with container kept upright),  and then push to flip the lid so that the straining side is up/opened and pour the contents into your cocktail glass.I really love that clean-up is as easy as rinsing the lid and stainless cup under a running kitchen or bar faucet and then leaving them on a clean dish towel or in a kitchen drainer to dry.Here is one of my favorite cocktail recipes that I make with this shaker:PINK POTAMUS1 oz Svedka Vodka1 ½ oz Dekuyper Peachtree Peach Schnapps1 ½ oz Cranberry Juice CocktailThis cocktail can be garnished with a lime wedge if desired.I usually double the above recipe and it fits perfectly in a Libbey Vina 12 oz Martini Glass.

Metrokane Flip Top Cocktail Shakers are wonderful. I have several in different sizes, including this one, and I love the flip top straining lid and have had no issues with it becoming stuck or leaking (just make sure you don't turn the shaker upside down when shaking).Fill the stainless steel cup with as much ice as you like (I usually fill mine half full) and then add the ingredients for your cocktail, (making sure the straining side is in the down/closed position), shake (with container kept upright),  and then push to flip the lid so that the straining side is up/opened and pour the contents into your cocktail glass.I really love that clean-up is as easy as rinsing the lid and stainless cup under a running kitchen or bar faucet and then leaving them on a clean dish towel or in a kitchen drainer to dry.Here is one of my favorite cocktail recipes that I make with this shaker:PINK POTAMUS1 oz Svedka Vodka1 ½ oz Dekuyper Peachtree Peach Schnapps1 ½ oz Cranberry Juice CocktailThis cocktail can be garnished with a lime wedge if desired.I usually double the above recipe and it fits perfectly in a Libbey Vina 12 oz Martini Glass.

Moore's Marinade is a family favorite on steaks, hamburgers, and pork tenderloins/chops. The hickory smoke flavor tastes great not only when grilling meat outdoors, but it also makes meat cooked in a skillet indoors taste like it was cooked on the grill outdoors. I love it. AND it contains no MSG (monosodium glutamate; a flavor preservative that many people have or develop allergies to).If time allows, I will marinate meats for 10-30 minutes before cooking, but in a pinch I have just poured some marinade in a shallow bowl and dipped the meats in it saturating both sides and then cooked it. It always tastes great either way.I really appreciate that Moore's Marinade is MADE IN THE USA (by C&M Food Distributing, Inc. in Birmingham, Alabama). It was introduced in Alabama over 40 years ago.TIPS TO GRILL THE PERFECT STEAK USING MOORE'S MARINADE:1) Marinate beef in Moore's Marinade 30 minutes to 1 hour prior to grilling. A zip-lock bag works great to ensure even coating.2) Allow ¾ to 1lb. per person for bone-in steak or ½ lb. per person for boneless steak.3) Choose steaks that are at least 1 inch thick.4) Trim off fat to 1/8 inch and score the edges to keep them from curling on the grill.5) Flip steak when the juices start to bubble on the top (uncooked side).6) The second side of the steak needs less grilling time than the first.7) Baste steak with Moore's Marinade during cooking to enhance flavor even more.COOKTIME BASED ON THICKNESS OF STEAK IN INCHES:*RARE: 1" - 15 to 20 minutes; 1 ½" - 20 to 25 minutes; 2" - 30 to 35 minutes*MEDIUM: 1" - 20 to 25 minutes; 1 ½" - 20 to 25 minutes; 2" - 20 to 25 minutes*WELL DONE: 1" - 25 minutesADDITIONAL INFORMATION (FROM THE PRODUCT LABEL) THAT YOU MIGHT FIND USEFUL:INGREDIENTS: Water, Soy Sauce, Vinegar, Salt, High Fructose Corn Syrup, Dehydrated Garlic, Caramel Color, Citric Acid, Yeast ExtractNUTRITIONAL FACTS:Serving Size - 1 TbsServings Per Container - 32Amount Per Serving:Calories - 10 (0 from fat)Total Fat - 0 GSodium - 700 MgTotal Carbohydrate - 1 GSugars - 0 GProtein - 1 G

McCormick California Garlic Pepper seasoning is one of those "must have" items that I keep stocked in my pantry. I and my family absolutely love this product AND it contains NO MSG (monosodium glutamate; a flavor preservative that many people have or develop allergies to) like many seasonings do.You can use it on hamburgers, pastas, rice and vegetables, HOWEVER, my absolute favorite use for it is for seasoning tilapia fish filets.I just sprinkle it on both sides of the tilapia filets generously and cook them in a skillet with a little olive oil and Voila! Magnific! Family and friends love it and always ask what seasonings I used.I am sure that McCormick has acquired many new customers due to those tilapia filets!

This mini measuring glass is perfect for use as a jigger for mixed drinks. Mine did not come with the Sunleaves logo on it like the picture shows, but instead reads Mini Measure. It measures in teaspoons (1 to 6), Tablespoons (½, 1, 1½, 2), Ounces (¼, ½, ¾, 1) and milliliter (5, 10, 15, 20, 25, 30). It has bold, thick, red lettering that doesn't wash off when hand washed and rinsed. I have not and won't put mine through the dishwasher although it seems that other reviewers have and it hasn't been an issue for them. I personally would rather not take the chance when I can so quickly and easily wash/rinse it under the kitchen faucet.Here are a few of my favorite single serving drink recipes that I use this Mini Measuring cup for that taste great but don't break the bank.PERFECT MARGARITA1 oz el Jimador Tequila Blanco (100% agave)½ oz Bols Triple Sec½ oz regular Budweiser Beer¾ oz Frozen Limeade Concentrate (thawed)¼ oz Orange Juice1 ¼ oz waterPour over ice, crushed ice, or shaved ice in a margarita glass and garnish with a lime wedge if desired. Also, if you are serving guests, you can make a larger batch by changing the oz in the recipe to cup and using a regular sized measuring cup.PINK POTAMUS2 oz Svedka Vodka3 oz Dekuyper Peachtree Peach Schnapps3 oz Cranberry Juice CocktailAdd ingredients to an ice filled cocktail shaker, shake, strain and pour. This cocktail fits perfectly in a Libbey Vina 12 oz Martini Glass and can be garnished with a lime wedge if desired.

Regular use of flea and tick preventatives is extremely important for dogs and other pets and especially for those with flea allergies, like my Dachshund.Preventative measures for my dogs include treating my yard with these ORTHO Bug-B-Gon MAX Insect Killer for Lawns, granules, in the spring. One treatment lasts throughout the spring and summer months for me (I live in South East USA). Just follow the product directions for pet owners. Spray the yard heavily with a garden hose to soak the granules in and then allow the yard to dry completely before letting your pets on it. This means keeping them off the treated areas for at least a day.I also give my dogs Capstar (Nitenpyram) after they have been anywhere away from home (the park, etc.) to kill any fleas which they might have picked up.
